verses.sanskrit: अग्निं नरो दीधितिभिररण्योर्हस्तच्युती जनयन्त परशस्तम दूरेद्र्शं गर्हपतिमथर्युम |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ naro dīdhitibhiraraṇyorhastacyutī janayanta praśastam dūredṛśaṃ ghṛhapatimatharyum

translations.griffith: THE men from fire-sticks, with their hands' swift movement, have, in deep thought, engendered glorious Agni,  Far-seen, with pointed flame, Lord of the homestead.

verses.sanskrit: तमग्निमस्ते वसवो नय रण्वन सुप्रतिचक्षमवसे कुतश्चित दक्षाय्यो यो दम आस नित्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tamaghnimaste vasavo ny ṛṇvan supraticakṣamavase kutaścit dakṣāyyo yo dama āsa nityaḥ

translations.griffith: The Vasus set that Agni in the dwelling, fair to behold, for help from every quarter:  Who, in the home for ever, must be honoured.

verses.sanskrit: परेद्धो अग्ने दीदिहि पुरो नो.अजस्रया सूर्म्या यविष्ठ तवां शश्वन्त उप यन्ति वाजाः |||
verses.transliteration: preddho aghne dīdihi puro no.ajasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha tvāṃ śaśvanta upa yanti vājāḥ

translations.griffith: Shine thou before us, Agni, well-enkindled, with flame, Most Youthful God, that never fadeth.  To thee come all our sacrificial viands.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते अग्नयो.अग्निभ्यो वरं निः सुवीरासः शोशुचन्त दयुमन्तः यत्रा नरः समासते सुजाताः |||
verses.transliteration: pra te aghnayo.aghnibhyo varaṃ niḥ suvīrāsaḥ śośucanta dyumantaḥ yatrā naraḥ samāsate sujātāḥ

translations.griffith: Among all fires these fires have shone most brightly, splendid with light, begirt by noble heroes,  Where men of lofty birth sit down together.

verses.sanskrit: दा नो अग्ने धिया रयिं सुवीरं सवपत्यं सहस्य परशस्तम न यं यावा तरति यातुमावान |||
verses.transliteration: dā no aghne dhiyā rayiṃ suvīraṃ svapatyaṃ sahasya praśastam na yaṃ yāvā tarati yātumāvān

translations.griffith: Victorious Agni, grant us wealth with wisdom, wealth with brave sons, famous and independent,  Which not a foe who deals in magic conquers.

verses.sanskrit: उप यमेति युवतिः सुदक्षं दोषा वस्तोर्हविष्मती घर्ताची उप सवैनमरमतिर्वसूयुः |||
verses.transliteration: upa yameti yuvatiḥ sudakṣaṃ doṣā vastorhaviṣmatī ghṛtācī upa svainamaramatirvasūyuḥ

translations.griffith: To whom, the Strong, at morn and eve comes, maid-like, the ladle dropping oil, with its oblation.  Wealth-seeking comes to him his own devotion.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वा अग्ने.अप दहारातीर्येभिस्तपोभिरदहो जरूथम पर निस्वरं चातयस्वामीवाम |||
verses.transliteration: viśvā aghne.apa dahārātīryebhistapobhiradaho jarūtham pra nisvaraṃ cātayasvāmīvām

translations.griffith: Burn up all malice with those flames, O Agni, wherewith of old thou burntest up Jarutha,  And drive away in silence pain and sickness.

verses.sanskrit: आ यस्ते अग्न इधते अनीकं वसिष्ठ शुक्र दीदिवः पावक उतो न एभि सतवथैरिह सयाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yaste aghna idhate anīkaṃ vasiṣṭha śukra dīdivaḥ pāvaka uto na ebhi stavathairiha syāḥ

translations.griffith: With him who lighteth up thy splendour, Agni, excellent, pure, refulgent, Purifier,  Be present, and with us through these our praises.

verses.sanskrit: वि ये ते अग्ने भेजिरे अनीकं मर्ता नरः पित्र्यासः पुरुत्रा उतो न एभिः सुमना इह सयाः |||
verses.transliteration: vi ye te aghne bhejire anīkaṃ martā naraḥ pitryāsaḥ purutrā uto na ebhiḥ sumanā iha syāḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, the patriarchal men, the mortals who have in many places spread thy lustre,—  Be gracious to us here for their sake also.

verses.sanskrit: इमे नरो वर्त्रहत्येषु शूरा विश्वा अदेवीरभि सन्तु मायाः ये मे धियं पनयन्त परशस्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: ime naro vṛtrahatyeṣu śūrā viśvā adevīrabhi santu māyāḥ ye me dhiyaṃ panayanta praśastām

translations.griffith: Let these men, heroes in the fight with foemen, prevail against all godless arts of 4magic,—  These who ipprove the noble song I sing thee.

verses.sanskrit: मा शूने अग्ने नि षदाम नर्णां माशेषसो.अवीरता परित्वा परजावतीषु दुर्यासु दुर्य |||
verses.transliteration: mā śūne aghne ni ṣadāma nṛṇāṃ māśeṣaso.avīratā paritvā prajāvatīṣu duryāsu durya

translations.griffith: Let us not sit in want of men, O Agni, without descendants, heroleu, about thee:  But, O House-Friend, in houses full of children.

verses.sanskrit: यमश्वी नित्यमुपयाति यज्ञं परजावन्तं सवपत्यं कषयं नः सवजन्मना शेषसा वाव्र्धानम |||
verses.transliteration: yamaśvī nityamupayāti yajñaṃ prajāvantaṃ svapatyaṃ kṣayaṃ naḥ svajanmanā śeṣasā vāvṛdhānam

translations.griffith: By sacrifice which the Steeds' Lord ever visits, there make our dwelling rich in seed and offspring,  Increasing still with lineal successors.

verses.sanskrit: पाहि नो अग्ने रक्षसो अजुष्टात पाहि धूर्तेरररुषो अघायोः तवा युजा पर्तनायून्रभि षयाम |||
verses.transliteration: pāhi no aghne rakṣaso ajuṣṭāt pāhi dhūrterararuṣo aghāyoḥ tvā yujā pṛtanāyūnrabhi ṣyām

translations.griffith: Guard us, O Agni, from the hated demon, guard us from malice of the churlish sinner:  Allied with thee may I subdue assailants.

verses.sanskrit: सेदग्निरग्नीन्रत्यस्त्वन्यान यत्र वाजी तनयो वीळुपाणिः सहस्रपाथा अक्षरा समेति |||
verses.transliteration: sedaghniraghnīnratyastvanyān yatra vājī tanayo vīḷupāṇiḥ sahasrapāthā akṣarā sameti

translations.griffith: May this same fire of mine surpass all others, this fire where offspring, vigorous and firm-handed,  Wins, on a thousand paths, what ne’er shall perish.

verses.sanskrit: सेदग्निर्यो वनुष्यतो निपाति समेद्धारमंहस उरुष्यात सुजातासः परि चरन्ति वीराः |||
verses.transliteration: sedaghniryo vanuṣyato nipāti sameddhāramaṃhasa uruṣyāt sujātāsaḥ pari caranti vīrāḥ

translations.griffith: This is that Agni, saviour from the foeman, who guards the kindler of the flame from sorrow:  Heroes of noble lineage serve and tend him.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सो अग्निराहुतः पुरुत्रा यमीशानः समिदिन्धेहविष्मान परि यमेत्यध्वरेषु होता |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ so aghnirāhutaḥ purutrā yamīśānaḥ samidindhehaviṣmān pari yametyadhvareṣu hotā

translations.griffith: This is that Agni, served in many places, whom the rich lord who brings oblation kindles,  And round him goes the priest at sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: तवे अग्न आहवनानि भूरीशानास आ जुहुयाम नित्या उभा कर्ण्वन्तो वहतू मियेधे |||
verses.transliteration: tve aghna āhavanāni bhūrīśānāsa ā juhuyāma nityā ubhā kṛṇvanto vahatū miyedhe

translations.griffith: Agni, may we with riches in possession bring thee continual ofierings in abundance,  Using both means to draw thee to our worship.

verses.sanskrit: इमो अग्ने वीततमानि हव्याजस्रो वक्षि देवतातिमछ परतिन ईं सुरभीणि वयन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: imo aghne vītatamāni havyājasro vakṣi devatātimacha pratina īṃ surabhīṇi vyantu

translations.griffith: Agni, bear thou, Eternal, these most welcome oblations to the Deities' assembly:  Let them enjoy our very fragrant presents.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो अग्ने.अवीरते परा दा दुर्वाससे.अमतये मा नो अस्यै मा नः कषुधे मा रक्षस रतावो मा नो दमे मा वन आ जुहूर्थाः |||
verses.transliteration: mā no aghne.avīrate parā dā durvāsase.amataye mā no asyai mā naḥ kṣudhe mā rakṣasa ṛtāvo mā no dame mā vana ā juhūrthāḥ

translations.griffith: Give us not up, Agni, to want of heroes, to wretched clothes, to need, to destitution.  Yield us not, Holy One, to fiend or hunger; injure us not at home or in the forest.

verses.sanskrit: नू मे बरह्माण्यग्न उच्छशाधि तवं देव मघवद्भ्यः सुषूदः रातौ सयामोभयास आ ते यूयं पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: nū me brahmāṇyaghna ucchaśādhi tvaṃ deva maghavadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ rātau syāmobhayāsa ā te yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: Give strength and power to these my prayers, O Agni; O God, pour blessings on our chiefs and nobles.  Grant that both we and they may share thy bounty. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने सुहवो रण्वसन्द्र्क सुदीती सूनो सहसो दिदीहि मा तवे सचा तनये नित्य आ धं मा वीरो अस्मन नर्यो वि दासीत |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne suhavo raṇvasandṛk sudītī sūno sahaso didīhi mā tve sacā tanaye nitya ā dhaṃ mā vīro asman naryo vi dāsīt

translations.griffith: Thou Agni, swift to hear, art fair of aspect: beam forth, O Son of Strength, in full effulgence.  Let me not want, with thee, a son for ever: let not a manly hero ever fail us.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो अग्ने दुर्भ्र्तये सचैषु देवेद्धेष्वग्निषु पर वोचः मा ते अस्मान दुर्मतयो भर्माच्चिद देवस्य सूनो सहसो नशन्त |||
verses.transliteration: mā no aghne durbhṛtaye sacaiṣu deveddheṣvaghniṣu pra vocaḥ mā te asmān durmatayo bhṛmāccid devasya sūno sahaso naśanta

translations.griffith: Condemn us not to indigence, O Agni, beside these flaming fires which Gods have kindled;  Nor, even after fault, let thy displeasure, thine as a God, O Son of Strength, o’ertake us.

verses.sanskrit: स मर्तो अग्ने सवनीक रेवानमर्त्ये य आजुहोति हव्यम सदेवता वसुवनिं दधाति यं सूरिरर्थी पर्छमान एति |||
verses.transliteration: sa marto aghne svanīka revānamartye ya ājuhoti havyam sadevatā vasuvaniṃ dadhāti yaṃ sūrirarthī pṛchamāna eti

translations.griffith: O Agni, fair of face, the wealthy mortal who to the Immortal offers his oblation.  Hath him who wins him treasure by his Godhead, to whom the prince, in need, goes supplicating.

verses.sanskrit: महो नो अग्ने सुवितस्य विद्वान रयिं सूरिभ्य आ वहा बर्हन्तम येन वयं सहसावन मदेमाविक्षितास आयुषा सुवीराः |||
verses.transliteration: maho no aghne suvitasya vidvān rayiṃ sūribhya ā vahā bṛhantam yena vayaṃ sahasāvan mademāvikṣitāsa āyuṣā suvīrāḥ

translations.griffith: Knowing our chief felicity, O Agni, bring hither ample riches to our nobles,  Wherewith we may enjoy ourselves, O Victor, with undiminished life and hero children.

verses.sanskrit: नू मे बरह्माण्यग्न ... ||
verses.transliteration: nū me brahmāṇyaghna ...

translations.griffith: Give strength and power to these my prayers, O Agni; O God, pour blessings on bur chiefs and nobles.  Grant that both we and they may share thy bounty. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: जुषस्व नः समिधमग्ने अद्य शोचा बर्हद यजतं धूमम्र्ण्वन उप सप्र्श दिव्यं सानु सतूपैः सं रश्मिभिस्ततनः सूर्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: juṣasva naḥ samidhamaghne adya śocā bṛhad yajataṃ dhūmamṛṇvan upa spṛśa divyaṃ sānu stūpaiḥ saṃ raśmibhistatanaḥ sūryasya

translations.griffith: GLADLY accept, this day, our fuel, Agni: send up thy sacred smoke and shine sublimely.  Touch the celestial summits with thy columns, and overspread thee with the rays of Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: नराशंसस्य महिमानमेषामुप सतोषाम यजतस्य यज्ञैः ये सुक्रतवः शुचयो धियन्धाः सवदन्ति देवा उभयानि हव्या |||
verses.transliteration: narāśaṃsasya mahimānameṣāmupa stoṣāma yajatasya yajñaiḥ ye sukratavaḥ śucayo dhiyandhāḥ svadanti devā ubhayāni havyā

translations.griffith: With sacrifice to these we men will honour the majesty of holy Narāśaṁsa-  To these the pure, most wise, the thought. inspirers, Gods who enjoy both sorts of our oblations.

verses.sanskrit: ईळेन्यं वो असुरं सुदक्षमन्तर्दूतं रोदसी सत्यवाचम मनुष्वदग्निं मनुना समिद्धं समध्वराय सदमिन महेम |||
verses.transliteration: īḷenyaṃ vo asuraṃ sudakṣamantardūtaṃ rodasī satyavācam manuṣvadaghniṃ manunā samiddhaṃ samadhvarāya sadamin mahema

translations.griffith: We will extol at sacrifice for ever, as men may do, Agni whom Manu kindled,  Your very skilful Asura, meet for worship, envoy between both worlds, the truthful speaker.

verses.sanskrit: सपर्यवो भरमाणा अभिज्ञु पर वर्ञ्जते नमसा बर्हिरग्नौ आजुह्वाना घर्तप्र्ष्ठं पर्षद्वदध्वर्यवो हविषा मर्जयध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: saparyavo bharamāṇā abhijñu pra vṛñjate namasā barhiraghnau ājuhvānā ghṛtapṛṣṭhaṃ pṛṣadvadadhvaryavo haviṣā marjayadhvam

translations.griffith: Bearing the sacred grass, the men who serve him strew it with reverence, on their knees, by Agni.  Calling him to the spotted grass, oil-sprinkled, adorn him, ye Adhvaryus, with oblation.

verses.sanskrit: सवाध्यो वि दुरो देवयन्तो.अशिश्रयू रथयुर्देवताता पूर्वी शिशुं न मातरा रिहाणे समग्रुवो न समनेष्वञ्जन |||
verses.transliteration: svādhyo vi duro devayanto.aśiśrayū rathayurdevatātā pūrvī śiśuṃ na mātarā rihāṇe samaghruvo na samaneṣvañjan

translations.griffith: With holy thoughts the pious have thrown open Doors fain for chariots in the Gods’ assembly.  Like two full mother cows who lick their youngling, like maidens for the gathering, they adorn them.

verses.sanskrit: उत योषणे दिव्ये मही न उषासानक्ता सुदुघेव धेनुः बर्हिषदा पुरुहूते मघोनी आ यज्ञिये सुविताय शरयेताम |||
verses.transliteration: uta yoṣaṇe divye mahī na uṣāsānaktā sudugheva dhenuḥ barhiṣadā puruhūte maghonī ā yajñiye suvitāya śrayetām

translations.griffith: And let the two exalted Heavenly Ladies, Morning and Night, like a cow good at milking,  Come, much-invoked, and on our grass be seated ' wealthy, deserving worship, for our welfare.

verses.sanskrit: विप्रा यज्ञेषु मानुषेषु कारू मन्ये वां जातवेदसा यजध्यै ऊर्ध्वं नो अध्वरं कर्तं हवेषु ता देवेषु वनथो वार्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: viprā yajñeṣu mānuṣeṣu kārū manye vāṃ jātavedasā yajadhyai ūrdhvaṃ no adhvaraṃ kṛtaṃ haveṣu tā deveṣu vanatho vāryāṇi

translations.griffith: You, Bards and Singers at men's sacrifices, both filled with wisdom, I incline to worship.  Send up our offerings when we call upon you, and so among the Gods obtain us treasures.

verses.sanskrit: आ भारती भारतीभिः ... ||
verses.transliteration: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ ...

translations.griffith: May Bhāratī with all her Sisters, Iḷā accordant with the Gods, with mortals Agni,  Sarasvatī with all her kindred Rivers, come to this grass, Three Goddesses, and seat them.

verses.sanskrit: तन नस्तुरीपं ... ||
verses.transliteration: tan nasturīpaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Well pleased with us do thou, O God, O Tvaṣṭar, give ready issue to our procreant vigour,  Whence springs the hero, powerful, skilled in action, lover of Gods, adjuster of the press-stones.

verses.sanskrit: वनस्पते.अव ... ||
verses.transliteration: vanaspate.ava ...

translations.griffith: Send to the Gods the oblation, Lord of Forests, and let the Immolator, Agni, dress it.  He as the truer Priest shall offer worship, for the God'sgenerations well he knoweth.

verses.sanskrit: आ याह्यग्ने ... ||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhyaghne ...

translations.griffith: Come thou to us, O Agni, duly kindled, together with the potent Gods and Indra.  On this our grass sit Aditi, happy Mother, and let our Hail! delight the Gods Immortal.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं वो देवमग्निभिः सजोषा यजिष्ठं दूतमध्वरेक्र्णुध्वम यो मर्त्येषु निध्रुविरतावा तपुर्मूर्धा घर्तान्नः पावकः |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ vo devamaghnibhiḥ sajoṣā yajiṣṭhaṃ dūtamadhvarekṛṇudhvam yo martyeṣu nidhruvirtāvā tapurmūrdhā ghṛtānnaḥ pāvakaḥ

translations.griffith: ASSOCIATE with fires, make your God Agni envoy at sacrifice, best skilled in worship,  Established firm among mankind, the Holy, flame-crowned and fed with oil, the Purifier.

verses.sanskrit: परोथदश्वो न यवसे.अविष्यन यदा महः संवरणाद वयस्थात आदस्य वातो अनु वाति शोचिरध सम ते वरजनं कर्ष्णमस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: prothadaśvo na yavase.aviṣyan yadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇād vyasthāt ādasya vāto anu vāti śociradha sma te vrajanaṃ kṛṣṇamasti

translations.griffith: Like a steed neighing eager for the pasture, when he hath stepped forth from the great enclosure:  Then the wind following blows upon his splendour, and, straight, the path is black which thou hast travelled.

verses.sanskrit: उद यस्य ते नवजातस्य वर्ष्णो.अग्ने चरन्त्यजरा इधानाः अछा दयामरुषो धूम एति सं दूतो अग्न ईयसे हि देवान |||
verses.transliteration: ud yasya te navajātasya vṛṣṇo.aghne carantyajarā idhānāḥ achā dyāmaruṣo dhūma eti saṃ dūto aghna īyase hi devān

translations.griffith: From thee a Bull but newly born, O Agni, the kindled everlasting flames rise upward.  Aloft to heaven thy ruddy smoke ascendeth: Agni, thou speedest to the Gods as envoy.

verses.sanskrit: वि यस्य ते पर्थिव्यां पाजो अश्रेत तर्षु यदन्ना समव्र्क्तजम्भैः सेनेव सर्ष्टा परसितिष ट एति यवं न दस्म जुह्वा विवेक्षि |||
verses.transliteration: vi yasya te pṛthivyāṃ pājo aśret tṛṣu yadannā samavṛktajambhaiḥ seneva sṛṣṭā prasitiṣ ṭa eti yavaṃ na dasma juhvā vivekṣi

translations.griffith: Thou whose fresh lustre o’er the earth advanceth when greedily with thy jaws thy food thou eatest.  Like a host hurried onward comes thy lasso: fierce, with thy tongue thou piercest, as ’twere barley.

verses.sanskrit: तमिद दोषा तमुषसि यविष्ठमग्निमत्यं न मर्जयन्त नरः निशिशाना अतिथिमस्य योनौ दीदाय शोचिराहुतस्य वर्ष्णः |||
verses.transliteration: tamid doṣā tamuṣasi yaviṣṭhamaghnimatyaṃ na marjayanta naraḥ niśiśānā atithimasya yonau dīdāya śocirāhutasya vṛṣṇaḥ

translations.griffith: The men have decked him both at eve and morning, Most Youthful Agni, as they tend a courser.  They kindle him, a guest within his dwelling: bright shines the splendour of the worshipped Hero.

verses.sanskrit: सुसन्द्र्क ते सवनीक परतीकं वि यद रुक्मो न रोचस उपाके दिवो न ते तन्यतुरेति शुष्मश्चित्रो न सूरः परति चक्षि भानुम |||
verses.transliteration: susandṛk te svanīka pratīkaṃ vi yad rukmo na rocasa upāke divo na te tanyatureti śuṣmaścitro na sūraḥ prati cakṣi bhānum

translations.griffith: O fair of face, beautiful is thine aspect when, very near at hand, like gold thou gleamest,  Like Heaven's thundering roar thy might approaches, and like the wondrous Sun thy light thou showest.

verses.sanskrit: यथा वः सवाहाग्नये दाशेम परीळाभिर्घ्र्तवद्भिश्च हव्यैः तेभिर्नो अग्ने अमितैर्महोभिः शतं पूर्भिरायसीभिर्नि पाहि |||
verses.transliteration: yathā vaḥ svāhāghnaye dāśema parīḷābhirghṛtavadbhiśca havyaiḥ tebhirno aghne amitairmahobhiḥ śataṃ pūrbhirāyasībhirni pāhi

translations.griffith: That we may worship, with your Hail to Agni! with sacrificial cakes and fat oblations,  Guard us, O Agni, with those boundless glories as with a hundred fortresses of iron.

verses.sanskrit: या वा ते सन्ति दाशुषे अध्र्ष्टा गिरो वा याभिर्न्र्वतीरुरुष्याः ताभिर्नः सूनो सहसो नि पाहि समत सूरीञ जरितॄञ जातवेदः |||
verses.transliteration: yā vā te santi dāśuṣe adhṛṣṭā ghiro vā yābhirnṛvatīruruṣyāḥ tābhirnaḥ sūno sahaso ni pāhi smat sūrīñ jaritṝñ jātavedaḥ

translations.griffith: Thine are resistless songs for him who offers, and hero-giving hymns wherewith thou savest;  With these, O Son of Strength, O Jātavedas, guard us, preserve these princes and the singers.

verses.sanskrit: निर्यत पूतेव सवधितिः शुचिर्गात सवया कर्पा तन्वा रोचमानः आ यो मात्रोरुशेन्यो जनिष्ट देवयज्याय सुक्रतुः पावकः |||
verses.transliteration: niryat pūteva svadhitiḥ śucirghāt svayā kṛpā tanvā rocamānaḥ ā yo mātroruśenyo janiṣṭa devayajyāya sukratuḥ pāvakaḥ

translations.griffith: When forth he cometh, like an axe new-sharpened, pure in his form, resplendent in his body,  Sprung, sought with eager longing, from his Parents, for the Gods’ worship, Sage and Purifier:

verses.sanskrit: एता नो अग्ने सौभगा दिदीह्यपि करतुं सुचेतसं वतेम विश्वा सतोत्र्भ्यो गर्णते च सन्तु यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: etā no aghne saubhaghā didīhyapi kratuṃ sucetasaṃ vatema viśvā stotṛbhyo ghṛṇate ca santu yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Shine this felicity on us, O Agni: may we attain to perfect understanding.  All happiness be theirs who sing and praise thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर वः शुक्राय भानवे भरध्वं हव्यं मतिं चाग्नये सुपूतम यो दैव्यानि मानुषा जनूंष्यन्तर्विश्वानि विद्मना जिगाति |||
verses.transliteration: pra vaḥ śukrāya bhānave bharadhvaṃ havyaṃ matiṃ cāghnaye supūtam yo daivyāni mānuṣā janūṃṣyantarviśvāni vidmanā jighāti

translations.griffith: BRING forth your gifts to his refulgent splendour, your hymn as purest offering to Agni,  To him who goes as messenger with knowledge between all songs of men and Gods in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: स गर्त्सो अग्निस्तरुणश्चिदस्तु यतो यविष्ठो अजनिष्ट मातुः सं यो वना युवते शुचिदन भूरि चिदन्ना समिदत्ति सद्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghṛtso aghnistaruṇaścidastu yato yaviṣṭho ajaniṣṭa mātuḥ saṃ yo vanā yuvate śucidan bhūri cidannā samidatti sadyaḥ

translations.griffith: Wise must this Agni be, though young and tender, since he was born, Most Youthful, of his Mother;  He who with bright teeth seizeth fast the forests, and eats his food, though plenteous, in a moment.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य देवस्य संसद्यनीके यं मर्तासः शयेतं जग्र्भ्रे नि यो गर्भं पौरुषेयीमुवोच दुरोकमग्निरायवे शुशोच |||
verses.transliteration: asya devasya saṃsadyanīke yaṃ martāsaḥ śyetaṃ jaghṛbhre ni yo ghṛbhaṃ pauruṣeyīmuvoca durokamaghnirāyave śuśoca

translations.griffith: Before his presence must we all assemble, this God's whom men have seized in his white splendour.  This Agni who hath brooked that men should seize him hath shone for man with glow insufferable.

verses.sanskrit: अयं कविरकविषु परचेता मर्तेष्वग्निरम्र्तो नि धायि स मा नो अत्र जुहुरः सहस्वः सदा तवे सुमनसः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ kavirakaviṣu pracetā marteṣvaghniramṛto ni dhāyi sa mā no atra juhuraḥ sahasvaḥ sadā tve sumanasaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: Far-seeing hath this Agni been established, deathless mid mortals, wise among the foolish.  Here, O victorious God, forbear to harm us: may weforever share thy gracious favour.

verses.sanskrit: आ यो योनिं देवक्र्तं ससाद करत्वा हयग्निरम्र्तानतारीत तमोषधीश्च वनिनश्च गर्भं भूमिश्च विश्वधायसं बिभर्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ā yo yoniṃ devakṛtaṃ sasāda kratvā hyaghniramṛtānatārīt tamoṣadhīśca vaninaśca gharbhaṃ bhūmiśca viśvadhāyasaṃ bibharti

translations.griffith: He who hath occupied his God-made dwelling, Agni, in wisdom hath surpassed Immortals.  A Babe unborn, the plants and trees support him, and the earth beareth him the All-sustainer.

verses.sanskrit: ईशे हयग्निरम्र्तस्य भूरेरीशे रायः सुवीर्यस्य दातोः मा तवा वयं सहसावन्नवीरा माप्सवः परि षदाम मादुवः |||
verses.transliteration: īśe hyaghniramṛtasya bhūrerīśe rāyaḥ suvīryasya dātoḥ mā tvā vayaṃ sahasāvannavīrā māpsavaḥ pari ṣadāma māduvaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni is Lord of Amṛta. in abundance, Lord of the gift of wealth and hero valour,  Victorious God, let us not sit about thee like men devoid of strength, beauty, and worship.

verses.sanskrit: परिषद्यं हयरणस्य रेक्णो नित्यस्य रायः पतयः सयाम न शेषो अग्ने अन्यजातमस्त्यचेतानस्य मा पथो वि दुक्षः |||
verses.transliteration: pariṣadyaṃ hyaraṇasya rekṇo nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma na śeṣo aghne anyajātamastyacetānasya mā patho vi dukṣaḥ

translations.griffith: The foeman's treasure may be won with labour: may we be masters of our own possessions.  Agni, no son is he who springs from others: lengthen not out the pathways of the foolish.

verses.sanskrit: नहि गरभायारणः सुशेवो.अन्योदर्यो मनसा मन्तवा उ अधा चिदोकः पुनरित स एत्या नो वाज्यभीषाळ एतु नव्यः |||
verses.transliteration: nahi ghrabhāyāraṇaḥ suśevo.anyodaryo manasā mantavā u adhā cidokaḥ punarit sa etyā no vājyabhīṣāḷ etu navyaḥ

translations.griffith: Unwelcome for adoption is the stranger, one to be thought of as another's offipring,  Though grown familiar by continual presence. May our strong hero come, freshly triumphant.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने वनुष्यतो ... ||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne vanuṣyato ...

translations.griffith: Guard us from him who would assail us, Agni; preserve us O thou Victor, from dishonour.  Here let the place of darkening come upon thee: may wealth be ours, desirable, in thousands.

verses.sanskrit: एता नो अग्ने सौभगा ... ||
verses.transliteration: etā no aghne saubhaghā ...

translations.griffith: Shine this felicity on us, O Agni: may we attain to perfect understanding.  All happiness be theirs who sing and praise thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पराग्नये तवसे भरध्वं गिरं दिवो अरतये पर्थिव्याः यो विश्वेषामम्र्तानामुपस्थे वैश्वानरो वाव्र्धे जाग्र्वद्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: prāghnaye tavase bharadhvaṃ ghiraṃ divo arataye pṛthivyāḥ yo viśveṣāmamṛtānāmupasthe vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhe jāghṛvadbhiḥ

translations.griffith: BRING forth your song of praise to mighty Agni, the speedy messenger of earth and heaven,  Vaiśvānara, who, with those who wake, hath waxen great in the lap of all the Gods Immortal.

verses.sanskrit: पर्ष्टो दिवि धाय्यग्निः पर्थिव्यां नेता सिन्धूनां वर्षभ सतियानाम स मानुषीरभि विशो वि भाति वैश्वानरो वाव्र्धानो वरेण |||
verses.transliteration: pṛṣṭo divi dhāyyaghniḥ pṛthivyāṃ netā sindhūnāṃ vṛṣabha stiyānām sa mānuṣīrabhi viśo vi bhāti vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhāno vareṇa

translations.griffith: Sought in the heavens, on earth is Agni stablished, leader of rivers, Bull of standing waters.  Vaiśvānara when he hath grown in glory, shines on the tribes of men with light and treasure.

verses.sanskrit: तवद भिया विश आयन्नसिक्नीरसमना जहतीर्भोजनानि वैश्वानर पूरवे शोशुचानः पुरो यदग्ने दरयन्नदीदेः |||
verses.transliteration: tvad bhiyā viśa āyannasiknīrasamanā jahatīrbhojanāni vaiśvānara pūrave śośucānaḥ puro yadaghne darayannadīdeḥ

translations.griffith: For fear of thee forth fled the dark-hued races, scattered abroad, deserting their possessions,  When, glowing, O Vaiśvānara, for Pūru, thou Agni didst light up and rend their castles.

verses.sanskrit: तव तरिधातु पर्थिवी उत दयौर्वैश्वानर वरतमग्ने सचन्त तवं भासा रोदसी आ ततन्थाजस्रेण शोचिषा शोशुचानः |||
verses.transliteration: tava tridhātu pṛthivī uta dyaurvaiśvānara vratamaghne sacanta tvaṃ bhāsā rodasī ā tatanthājasreṇa śociṣā śośucānaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni Vaiśvānara, both Earth and Heaven submit them to thy threefold jurisdiction.  Refulgent in thine undecaying lustre thou hast invested both the worlds with splendour.

verses.sanskrit: तवामग्ने हरितो वावशाना गिरः सचन्ते धुनयो घर्ताचीः पतिं कर्ष्टीनां रथ्यं रयीणां वैश्वानरमुषसां केतुमह्नाम |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmaghne harito vāvaśānā ghiraḥ sacante dhunayo ghṛtācīḥ patiṃ kṛṣṭīnāṃ rathyaṃ rayīṇāṃ vaiśvānaramuṣasāṃ ketumahnām

translations.griffith: Agni, the tawny horses, loudly neighing our resonant hymns that drop with oil, attend thee;  Lord of the tribes, our Charioteer of riches, Ensign of days, Vaiśvānara of mornings.

verses.sanskrit: तवे असुर्यं वसवो नय रण्वन करतुं हि ते मित्रमहो जुषन्त तवं दस्यून्रोकसो अग्न आज उरु जयोतिर्जनयन्नार्याय |||
verses.transliteration: tve asuryaṃ vasavo ny ṛṇvan kratuṃ hi te mitramaho juṣanta tvaṃ dasyūnrokaso aghna āja uru jyotirjanayannāryāya

translations.griffith: In thee, O bright as Mitra, Vasus seated the might of Aduras, for they loved thy spirit.  Thou dravest Dasyus from their home, O Agni, and broughtest forth broad light to light the Ārya.

verses.sanskrit: स जायमानः परमे वयोमन वायुर्न पाथः परि पासि सद्यः तवं भुवना जनयन्नभि करन्नपत्याय जातवेदो दशस्यन |||
verses.transliteration: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyoman vāyurna pāthaḥ pari pāsi sadyaḥ tvaṃ bhuvanā janayannabhi krannapatyāya jātavedo daśasyan

translations.griffith: Born in the loftiest heaven thou in a moment reachest, like wind, the place where Gods inhabit.  Thou, favouring thine offspring, roaredst loudly when giving life to creatures, Jātavedas.

verses.sanskrit: तामग्ने अस्मे इषमेरयस्व वैश्वानर दयुमतीं जातवेदः यया राधः पिन्वसि विश्ववार पर्थु शरवो दाशुषे मर्त्याय |||
verses.transliteration: tāmaghne asme iṣamerayasva vaiśvānara dyumatīṃ jātavedaḥ yayā rādhaḥ pinvasi viśvavāra pṛthu śravo dāśuṣe martyāya

translations.griffith: Send us that strength, Vaiśvānara, send it, Agni, that strength, O Jātavedas, full of splendour,  Wherewith, all-bounteous God, thou pourest riches, as fame wide-spreading, on the man who offers.

verses.sanskrit: तं नो अग्ने मघवद्भ्यः पुरुक्षुं रयिं नि वाजं शरुत्यं युवस्व वैश्वानर महि नः शर्म यछ रुद्रेभिरग्ने वसुभिः सजोषाः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ no aghne maghavadbhyaḥ purukṣuṃ rayiṃ ni vājaṃ śrutyaṃ yuvasva vaiśvānara mahi naḥ śarma yacha rudrebhiraghne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, bestow upon our chiefs and nobles that famous power, that wealth which feedeth many.  Accordant with the Vasus and the Rudras, Agni, Vaiśvānara, give us sure protection.

verses.sanskrit: पर सम्राजो असुरस्य परशस्तिं पुंसः कर्ष्टीनामनुमाद्यस्य इन्द्रस्येव पर तवसस कर्तानि वन्दे दारुं वन्दमानोविवक्मि |||
verses.transliteration: pra samrājo asurasya praśastiṃ puṃsaḥ kṛṣṭīnāmanumādyasya indrasyeva pra tavasas kṛtāni vande dāruṃ vandamānovivakmi

translations.griffith: PRAISE of the Asura, high imperial Ruler, the Manly One in whom the folk shall triumph-  I laud his deeds who is as strong as Indra, and lauding celebrate the Fort-destroyer.

verses.sanskrit: कविं केतुं धासिं भानुमद्रेर्हिन्वन्ति शं राज्यं रोदस्योः पुरन्दरस्य गीर्भिरा विवासे.अग्नेर्व्रतानि पूर्व्या महानि |||
verses.transliteration: kaviṃ ketuṃ dhāsiṃ bhānumadrerhinvanti śaṃ rājyaṃ rodasyoḥ purandarasya ghīrbhirā vivāse.aghnervratāni pūrvyā mahāni

translations.griffith: Sage, Sing, Food, Light,—they bring him from the mountain, the blessed Sovran of the earth and heaven.  I decorate with songs the mighty actions which Agni, Fort-destroyer, did aforetime.

verses.sanskrit: नयक्रतून गरथिनो मर्ध्रवाचः पणीन्रश्रद्धानव्र्धानयज्ञान पर-पर तान दस्यून्रग्निर्विवाय पूर्वश्चकारापरानयज्यून |||
verses.transliteration: nyakratūn ghrathino mṛdhravācaḥ paṇīnraśraddhānavṛdhānayajñān pra-pra tān dasyūnraghnirvivāya pūrvaścakārāparānayajyūn

translations.griffith: The foolish, faithless, rudely-speaking niggards, without belief or sacrifice or worship,—  Far far sway hath Agni chased those Dasytis, and, in the cast, hath turned the godless westward.

verses.sanskrit: यो अपाचीने तमसि मदन्तीः पराचीश्चकार नर्तमः शचीभिः तमीशानं वस्वो अग्निं गर्णीषे.अनानतं दमयन्तं पर्तन्यून |||
verses.transliteration: yo apācīne tamasi madantīḥ prācīścakāra nṛtamaḥ śacībhiḥ tamīśānaṃ vasvo aghniṃ ghṛṇīṣe.anānataṃ damayantaṃ pṛtanyūn

translations.griffith: Him who brought eastward, manliest with his prowess, the Maids rejoicing in the western darkness,  That Agni I extol, the Lord of riches, unyielding tamer of assailing foemen.

verses.sanskrit: यो देह्यो अनमयद वधस्नैर्यो अर्यपत्नीरुषसश्चकार स निरुध्या नहुषो यज्वो अग्निर्विशश्चक्रे बलिह्र्तः सहोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yo dehyo anamayad vadhasnairyo aryapatnīruṣasaścakāra sa nirudhyā nahuṣo yajvo aghnirviśaścakre balihṛtaḥ sahobhiḥ

translations.griffith: Him who brake down the walls with deadly weapons, and gave the Mornings to anoble Husband,  Young Agni, who with conquering strength subduing the tribes of Nahus made them bring their tribute.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य शर्मन्नुप विश्वे जनास एवैस्तस्थुः सुमतिं भिक्षमाणाः वैश्वानरो वरमा रोदस्योराग्निः ससाद पित्रोरुपस्थम |||
verses.transliteration: yasya śarmannupa viśve janāsa evaistasthuḥ sumatiṃ bhikṣamāṇāḥ vaiśvānaro varamā rodasyorāghniḥ sasāda pitrorupastham

translations.griffith: In whose protection all men rest by nature, desiring to enjoy his gracious favour-  Agni Vaiśvānara in his Parents, bosom hath found the choicest seat in earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: आ देवो ददे बुध्न्या वसूनि वैश्वानर उदिता सूर्यस्य आ समुद्रादवरादा परस्मादाग्निर्ददे दिव आ पर्थिव्याः |||
verses.transliteration: ā devo dade budhnyā vasūni vaiśvānara uditā sūryasya ā samudrādavarādā parasmādāghnirdade diva ā pṛthivyāḥ

translations.griffith: Vaiśvānara the God, at the sun's setting, hath taken to himself deep-hidden treasures:  Agni hath taken them from earth and heaven, from the sea under and the sea above us.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो देवं चित सहसानमग्निमश्वं न वाजिनं हिषे नमोभिः भवा नो दूतो अध्वरस्य विद्वान तमना देवेषु विविदे मितद्रुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo devaṃ cit sahasānamaghnimaśvaṃ na vājinaṃ hiṣe namobhiḥ bhavā no dūto adhvarasya vidvān tmanā deveṣu vivide mitadruḥ

translations.griffith: I SEND forth even your God, victorious Agni, like a strong courser, with mine adoration.  Herald of sacrifice be he who knoweth he hath reached Gods, himself, with measured motion.

verses.sanskrit: आ याह्यग्ने पथ्या अनु सवा मन्द्रो देवानां सख्यं जुषाणः आ सानु शुष्मैर्नदयन पर्थिव्या जम्भेभिर्विश्वमुशधग वनानि |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhyaghne pathyā anu svā mandro devānāṃ sakhyaṃ juṣāṇaḥ ā sānu śuṣmairnadayan pṛthivyā jambhebhirviśvamuśadhagh vanāni

translations.griffith: By paths that are thine own come hither, Agni, joyous, delighting in the Gods’ alliance,  Making the heights of earth roar with thy fury, burning with eager teeth the woods and forests.

verses.sanskrit: पराचीनो यज्ञः सुधितं हि बर्हिः परीणीते अग्निरीळितो न होता आ मातरा विश्ववारे हुवानो यतो यविष्ठ जज्ञिषे सुशेवः |||
verses.transliteration: prācīno yajñaḥ sudhitaṃ hi barhiḥ prīṇīte aghnirīḷito na hotā ā mātarā viśvavāre huvāno yato yaviṣṭha jajñiṣe suśevaḥ

translations.griffith: The grass is strewn; the sacrifice advances adored as Priest, Agni is made propitious,  Invoking both All-boon-bestowing Mothers of whom, Most Youthful! thou wast born to help us.

verses.sanskrit: सद्यो अध्वरे रथिरं जनन्त मानुषासो विचेतसो य एषाम विशामधायि विश्पतिर्दुरोणे.अग्निर्मन्द्रो मधुवचा रतावा |||
verses.transliteration: sadyo adhvare rathiraṃ jananta mānuṣāso vicetaso ya eṣām viśāmadhāyi viśpatirduroṇe.aghnirmandro madhuvacā ṛtāvā

translations.griffith: Forthwith the men, the best of these for wisdom, have made him leader in the solemn worship.  As Lord in homes of men is Agni stablished, the Holy One, the joyous, sweetly speaking.

verses.sanskrit: असादि वर्तो वह्निराजगन्वानग्निर्ब्रह्मा नर्षदने विधर्ता दयौश्च यं पर्थिवी वाव्र्धाते आ यं होता यजति विश्ववारम |||
verses.transliteration: asādi vṛto vahnirājaghanvānaghnirbrahmā nṛṣadane vidhartā dyauśca yaṃ pṛthivī vāvṛdhāte ā yaṃ hotā yajati viśvavāram

translations.griffith: He hath come, chosen bearer, and is seated in man's home, Brahman, Agni, the Supporter,  He whom both Heaven anct Earth exalt and strengthenwhom, Giver of all boons, the Hotar worships.

verses.sanskrit: एते दयुम्नेभिर्विश्वमातिरन्त मन्त्रं ये वारं नर्या अतक्षन पर ये विशस्तिरन्त शरोषमाणा आ ये मे अस्य दीधयन्न्र्तस्य |||
verses.transliteration: ete dyumnebhirviśvamātiranta mantraṃ ye vāraṃ naryā atakṣan pra ye viśastiranta śroṣamāṇā ā ye me asya dīdhayannṛtasya

translations.griffith: These have passed all in glory, who, the manly, have wrought with skill the hymn of adoration;  Who, listening, have advanced the people's welfare, and set their thoughts on this my holy statute.

verses.sanskrit: नू तवामग्न ईमहे वसिष्ठा ईशानं सूनो सहसो वसूनाम इषं सतोत्र्भ्यो मघवद्भ्य आनड यूयं पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: nū tvāmaghna īmahe vasiṣṭhā īśānaṃ sūno sahaso vasūnām iṣaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavadbhya ānaḍ yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: We, the Vasisthas, now implore thee, Agni, O Son of Strength, the Lord of wealth and treasure.  Thou hast brought food to singers and to nobles. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: इन्धे राजा समर्यो नमोभिर्यस्य परतीकमाहुतं घर्तेन नरो हव्येभिरीळते सबाध आग्निरग्र उषसामशोचि |||
verses.transliteration: indhe rājā samaryo namobhiryasya pratīkamāhutaṃ ghṛtena naro havyebhirīḷate sabādha āghniraghra uṣasāmaśoci

translations.griffith: THE King whose face is decked with oil is kindled with homage offered by his faithful servant.  The men, the priests adore him with oblations. Agni hath shone forth when the dawn is breaking.

verses.sanskrit: अयमु षय सुमहानवेदि होता मन्द्रो मनुषो यज्वो अग्निः वि भा अकः सस्र्जानः पर्थिव्यां कर्ष्णपविरोषधीभिर्ववक्षे |||
verses.transliteration: ayamu ṣya sumahānavedi hotā mandro manuṣo yajvo aghniḥ vi bhā akaḥ sasṛjānaḥ pṛthivyāṃ kṛṣṇapaviroṣadhībhirvavakṣe

translations.griffith: Yea, he hath been acknowledged as most mighty, the joyous Priest of men, the youthful Agni.  He, spreading o’er the earth, made light around him, and grew among the plants with blackened fellies..

verses.sanskrit: कया नो अग्ने वि वसः सुव्र्क्तिं कामु सवधां रणवः शस्यमानः कदा भवेम पतयह सुदत्र रायो वन्तारो दुष्टरस्य साधोः |||
verses.transliteration: kayā no aghne vi vasaḥ suvṛktiṃ kāmu svadhāṃ ṛṇavaḥ śasyamānaḥ kadā bhavema patayah sudatra rāyo vantāro duṣṭarasya sādhoḥ

translations.griffith: How dost thou decorate our hymn, O Agni? What power dost thou exert when thou art lauded?  When, Bounteous God, may we be lords of riches, winners of precious wealth which none may conquer?

verses.sanskrit: पर-परायमग्निर्भरतस्य शर्ण्वे वि यत सूर्यो न रोचतेब्र्हद भाः अभि यः पूरुं पर्तनासु तस्थौ दयुतानो दैव्यो अतिथिः शुशोच |||
verses.transliteration: pra-prāyamaghnirbharatasya śṛṇve vi yat sūryo na rocatebṛhad bhāḥ abhi yaḥ pūruṃ pṛtanāsu tasthau dyutāno daivyo atithiḥ śuśoca

translations.griffith: Far famed is this the Bhārata's own Agni he shineth like the Sun with lofty splendour.  He who hath vanquished Pūru in the battle, the heavenly guest hath glowed in full refulgence.

verses.sanskrit: असन्नित तवे आहवनानि भूरि भुवो विश्वेभिः सुमना अनीकैः सतुतश्चिदग्ने शर्ण्विषे गर्णानः सवयं वर्धस्व तन्वं सुजात |||
verses.transliteration: asannit tve āhavanāni bhūri bhuvo viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ stutaścidaghne śṛṇviṣe ghṛṇānaḥ svayaṃ vardhasva tanvaṃ sujāta

translations.griffith: Full many oblations are in thee collected: with all thine aspects thou hast waxen gracious.  Thou art already famed as praised and lauded, yet still, O nobly born, increase thy body.

verses.sanskrit: इदं वचः शतसाः संसहस्रमुदग्नये जनिषीष्ट दविबर्हाः शं यत सतोत्र्भ्य आपये भवाति दयुमदमीवचातनं रक्षोहा |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ vacaḥ śatasāḥ saṃsahasramudaghnaye janiṣīṣṭa dvibarhāḥ śaṃ yat stotṛbhya āpaye bhavāti dyumadamīvacātanaṃ rakṣohā

translations.griffith: Be this my song, that winneth countless treasure, engendered with redoubled force for Agni,  That, splendid, chasing sickness, slaying demons, it may delight our friend and bless the singers.

verses.sanskrit: नू तवामग्न ईमहे ... ||
verses.transliteration: nū tvāmaghna īmahe ...

translations.griffith: We, the Vasisthas, now implore thee, Agni, O Son of Strength, the Lord of wealth and riches.  Thou hast brought food to singers and to nobles. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: अबोधि जार उषसामुपस्थाद धोता मन्द्रः कवितमः पावकः दधाति केतुमुभयस्य जन्तोर्हव्या देवेषु दरविणं सुक्र्त्सु |||
verses.transliteration: abodhi jāra uṣasāmupasthād dhotā mandraḥ kavitamaḥ pāvakaḥ dadhāti ketumubhayasya jantorhavyā deveṣu draviṇaṃ sukṛtsu

translations.griffith: ROUSED from their bosom is the Dawns' beloved, the joyous Priest, most sapient, Purifier.  He gives a signal both to Gods and mortals, to Gods oblations, riches to the pious.

verses.sanskrit: स सुक्रतुर्यो वि दुरः पणीनां पुनानो अर्कं पुरुभोजसं नः होता मन्द्रो विशां दमूनास्तिरस्तमो दद्र्शे राम्याणाम |||
verses.transliteration: sa sukraturyo vi duraḥ paṇīnāṃ punāno arkaṃ purubhojasaṃ naḥ hotā mandro viśāṃ damūnāstirastamo dadṛśe rāmyāṇām

translations.griffith: Most wise is he who, forcing doors of Paṇis, brought the bright Sun to us who feedeth many.  The cheerful Priest, men's Friend and home-companion, through still night's darkness he is made apparent.

verses.sanskrit: अमूरः कविरदितिर्विवस्वान सुसंसन मित्रो अतिथिः शिवोनः चित्रभानुरुषसां भात्यग्रे.अपां गर्भः परस्वा विवेश |||
verses.transliteration: amūraḥ kaviraditirvivasvān susaṃsan mitro atithiḥ śivonaḥ citrabhānuruṣasāṃ bhātyaghre.apāṃ gharbhaḥ prasvaā viveśa

translations.griffith: Wise, ne.'er deceived, uncircumscribed, refulgent, our gracious guest, a Friend with good attendants,  Shines forth with wondrous light before the Mornings; the young plants hath he entered, Child of Waters.

verses.sanskrit: ईळेन्यो वो मनुषो युगेषु समनगा अशुचज्जातवेदाः सुसन्द्र्शा भानुना यो विभाति परति गावः समिधानं बुधन्त |||
verses.transliteration: īḷenyo vo manuṣo yugheṣu samanaghā aśucajjātavedāḥ susandṛśā bhānunā yo vibhāti prati ghāvaḥ samidhānaṃ budhanta

translations.griffith: Seeking our gatherings, he, your Jātavedas, hath shone adorable through human ages,  Who gleams refulgent with his lovely lustre: the kine have waked to meet him when enkindled.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने याहि दूत्यं मा रिषण्यो देवानछा बरह्मक्र्ता गणेन सरस्वतीं मरुतो अश्विनापो यक्षि देवान रत्नधेयायविश्वान |||
verses.transliteration: aghne yāhi dūtyaṃ mā riṣaṇyo devānachā brahmakṛtā ghaṇena sarasvatīṃ maruto aśvināpo yakṣi devān ratnadheyāyaviśvān

translations.griffith: Go on thy message to the Gods, and fail not, O Agni, with their band who pray and worship.  Bring all the Gods that they may give us riches, Sarasvatī, the Maruts, Aśvins, Waters.

verses.sanskrit: तवामग्ने समिधानो वसिष्ठो जरूथं हन यक्षि राये पुरन्धिम पुरुणीथा जातवेदो जरस्व यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmaghne samidhāno vasiṣṭho jarūthaṃ han yakṣi rāye purandhim puruṇīthā jātavedo jarasva yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Vasiṣṭha, when enkindling thee, O Agni, hath slain jarutha. Give us wealth in plenty.  Sing praise in choral song, O Jātavedas. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: उषो न जारः पर्थु पाजो अश्रेद दविद्युतद दीद्यच्छोशुचानः वर्षा हरिः शुचिरा भाति भासा धियो हिन्वान उशतीरजीगः |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo na jāraḥ pṛthu pājo aśred davidyutad dīdyacchośucānaḥ vṛṣā hariḥ śucirā bhāti bhāsā dhiyo hinvāna uśatīrajīghaḥ

translations.griffith: HE hath sent forth, bright, radiant, and refulgent, like the Dawn's Lover, his far-spreading lustre.  Pure in his splendour shines the golden Hero: our longing thoughts hath he aroused and wakened.

verses.sanskrit: सवर्ण वस्तोरुषसामरोचि यज्ञं तन्वाना उशिजो न मन्म अग्निर्जन्मानि देव आ वि विद्वान दरवद दूतो देवयावा वनिष्ठः |||
verses.transliteration: svarṇa vastoruṣasāmaroci yajñaṃ tanvānā uśijo na manma aghnirjanmāni deva ā vi vidvān dravad dūto devayāvā vaniṣṭhaḥ

translations.griffith: He, like the Sun, hath shone while Morn is breaking, and priests who weave the sacrifice sing praises,  Agni, the God, who knows their generations and visits Gods, most bounteous, rapid envoy.

verses.sanskrit: अछा गिरो मतयो देवयन्तीरग्निं यन्ति दरविणं भिक्षमाणाः सुसन्द्र्शं सुप्रतीकं सवञ्चं हव्यवाहमरतिम्मानुषाणाम |||
verses.transliteration: achā ghiro matayo devayantīraghniṃ yanti draviṇaṃ bhikṣamāṇāḥ susandṛśaṃ supratīkaṃ svañcaṃ havyavāhamaratimmānuṣāṇām

translations.griffith: Our songs and holy hymns go forth to Agni, seeking the God and asking him for riches,  Him fair to see, of goodly aspect, mighty, men's messenger who carries their oblations.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं नो अग्ने वसुभिः सजोषा रुद्रं रुद्रेभिरा वहा बर्हन्तम आदित्येभिरदितिं विश्वजन्यां बर्हस्पतिं रक्वभिर्विश्ववारम |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ no aghne vasubhiḥ sajoṣā rudraṃ rudrebhirā vahā bṛhantam ādityebhiraditiṃ viśvajanyāṃ bṛhaspatiṃ ṛkvabhirviśvavāram

translations.griffith: joined with the Vasus, Agni, bring thou Indra bring hither mighty Rudra with the Rudras,  Aditi good to all men with Ādityas, Bṛhaspati All-bounteous, with the Singers.

verses.sanskrit: मन्द्रं होतारमुशिजो यविष्ठमग्निं विश ईळते अध्वरेषु स हि कषपावानभवद रयीणामतन्द्रो दूतो यजथाय देवान |||
verses.transliteration: mandraṃ hotāramuśijo yaviṣṭhamaghniṃ viśa īḷate adhvareṣu sa hi kṣapāvānabhavad rayīṇāmatandro dūto yajathāya devān

translations.griffith: Men eagerly implore at sacrifices Agni, Most Youthful God, the joyous Herald.  For he is Lord and Ruler over riches, and for Gods’ worship an unwearied envoy.

verses.sanskrit: महानस्यध्वरस्य परकेतो न रते तवदम्र्ता मादयन्ते आ विश्वेभिः सरथं याहि देवैर्न्यग्ने होता परथमः सदेह |||
verses.transliteration: mahānasyadhvarasya praketo na ṛte tvadamṛtā mādayante ā viśvebhiḥ sarathaṃ yāhi devairnyaghne hotā prathamaḥ sadeha

translations.griffith: GREAT art thou, Agni, sacrifice's Herald: not without thee are deathless Gods made joyful.  Come hither with all Deities about thee here take thy seat, the first, as Priest, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: तवामीळते अजिरं दूत्याय हविष्मन्तः सदमिन मानुषासः यस्य देवैरासदो बर्हिरग्ने.अहान्यस्मै सुदिना भवन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmīḷate ajiraṃ dūtyāya haviṣmantaḥ sadamin mānuṣāsaḥ yasya devairāsado barhiraghne.ahānyasmai sudinā bhavanti

translations.griffith: Men with oblations evermore entreat thee, the swift, to undertake an envoy's duty.  He on whose sacred grass with Gods thou sittest, to him, O Agni, are the days propitious.

verses.sanskrit: तरिश्चिदक्तोः पर चिकितुर्वसूनि तवे अन्तर्दाशुषे मर्त्याय मनुष्वदग्न इह यक्षि देवान भवा नो दूतो अधिशस्तिपावा |||
verses.transliteration: triścidaktoḥ pra cikiturvasūni tve antardāśuṣe martyāya manuṣvadaghna iha yakṣi devān bhavā no dūto adhiśastipāvā

translations.griffith: Three times a day in thee are shown the treasures sent for the mortal who presents oblation.  Bring the Gods hither like a man, O Agni: be thou our envoy, guarding us from curses.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निरीशे बर्हतो अध्वरस्याग्निर्विश्वस्य हविषः कर्तस्य करतुं हयस्य वसवो जुषन्ताथा देवा दधिरे हव्यवाहम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirīśe bṛhato adhvarasyāghnirviśvasya haviṣaḥ kṛtasya kratuṃ hyasya vasavo juṣantāthā devā dadhire havyavāham

translations.griffith: Lord of the lofty sacrifice is Agni, Agni is Lord of every gift presented.  The Vasus were contented with his wisdom, so the Gods made him their oblationbearer.

verses.sanskrit: आग्ने वह हविरद्याय देवानिन्द्रज्येष्ठास इह मादयन्ताम इमं यज्ञं दिवि देवेषु धेहि यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: āghne vaha haviradyāya devānindrajyeṣṭhāsa iha mādayantām imaṃ yajñaṃ divi deveṣu dhehi yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: O Agni, bring the Gods to taste our presents: with Indra leading, here let them be joyful.  Convey this sacrifice to Gods in heaven. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: अगन्म महा नमसा यविष्ठं यो दीदाय समिद्धः सवे दुरोणे चित्रभानुं रोदसी अन्तरुर्वी सवाहुतं विश्वतः परत्यञ्चम |||
verses.transliteration: aghanma mahā namasā yaviṣṭhaṃ yo dīdāya samiddhaḥ sve duroṇe citrabhānuṃ rodasī antarurvī svāhutaṃ viśvataḥ pratyañcam

translations.griffith: WE with great reverence have approached The Youngest who hath shone forth well-kindled in his dwelling,  With wondrous light between wide earth and heaven, well-worshipped, looking forth in all directions.

verses.sanskrit: स मह्ना विश्वा दुरितानि साह्वानग्निः षटवे दम आ जातवेदाः स नो रक्षिषद दुरितादवद्यादस्मान गर्णत उत नो मघोनः |||
verses.transliteration: sa mahnā viśvā duritāni sāhvānaghniḥ ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ sa no rakṣiṣad duritādavadyādasmān ghṛṇata uta no maghonaḥ

translations.griffith: Through his great might o’ercoming all misfortunes, praised in the house is Agni Jātavedas.  May he protect us from disgrace and trouble, both us who laud him and our noble patrons.

verses.sanskrit: तवं वरुण उत मित्रो अग्ने तवां वर्धन्ति मतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः तवे वसु सुषणनानि सन्तु यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ varuṇa uta mitro aghne tvāṃ vardhanti matibhirvasiṣṭhāḥ tve vasu suṣaṇanāni santu yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: O Agni, thou art Varuṇa and Mitra: Vasisthas with their holy hymns exalt thee.  With thee be most abundant gain of treasure. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पराग्नये विश्वशुचे धियन्धे.असुरघ्ने मन्म धीतिं भरध्वम भरे हविर्न बर्हिषि परीणानो वैश्वानराय यतये मतीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: prāghnaye viśvaśuce dhiyandhe.asuraghne manma dhītiṃ bharadhvam bhare havirna barhiṣi prīṇāno vaiśvānarāya yataye matīnām

translations.griffith: BRING song and hymn to Agni, Asura-slayer, enlightener of all and thought-bestower.  Like an oblation on the grass, to please him, I bring this to Vaiśvānara, hymn-inspirer.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने शोचिषा शोशुचान आ रोदसी अप्र्णा जायमानः तवं देवानभिशस्तेरमुञ्चो वैस्वानर जातवेदो महित्वा |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne śociṣā śośucāna ā rodasī apṛṇā jāyamānaḥ tvaṃ devānabhiśasteramuñco vaisvānara jātavedo mahitvā

translations.griffith: Thou with thy flame, O Agni, brightly glowing, hast at thy birth filled full the earth and heaven.  TIOU with thy might, Vaiśvānara Jātavedas, settest the Gods free frodi the curse that bound them.

verses.sanskrit: जातो यदग्ने भुवना वयख्यः पशून न गोपा इर्यः परिज्मा वैश्वानर बरह्मणे विन्द गातुं यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: jāto yadaghne bhuvanā vyakhyaḥ paśūn na ghopā iryaḥ parijmā vaiśvānara brahmaṇe vinda ghātuṃ yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Agni, when, born thou lookedst on all creatures, like a brisk herdsman moving round his cattle.  The path to prayer, Vaiśvānara, thou foundest. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: समिधा जातवेदसे देवाय देवहूतिभिः हविर्भिः शुक्रशोचिषे नमस्विनो वयं दाशेमाग्नये |||
verses.transliteration: samidhā jātavedase devāya devahūtibhiḥ havirbhiḥ śukraśociṣe namasvino vayaṃ dāśemāghnaye

translations.griffith: WITH reverence and with offered gifts serve we the God whose flame is bright:  Let us bring Jātavedas fuel, and adore Agni when we invoke the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: वयं ते अग्ने समिधा विधेम वयं दाशेम सुष्टुती यजत्र वयं घर्तेनाध्वरस्य होतर्वयं देव हविषा भद्रशोचे |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ te aghne samidhā vidhema vayaṃ dāśema suṣṭutī yajatra vayaṃ ghṛtenādhvarasya hotarvayaṃ deva haviṣā bhadraśoce

translations.griffith: Agni, may we perform thy rites with fuel, and honour thee, O Holy one, with praises:  Honour thee, Priest of sacrifice! with butter, thee, God of blessed light! with our oblation.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो देवेभिरुप देवहूतिमग्ने याहि वषट्क्र्तिं जुषाणः तुभ्यं देवाय दाशतः सयाम यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā no devebhirupa devahūtimaghne yāhi vaṣaṭkṛtiṃ juṣāṇaḥ tubhyaṃ devāya dāśataḥ syāma yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Come, Agni, with the Gods to our invoking, come, pleased, to offerings sanctified with Vaṣaṭ.  May we be his who pays thee, God, due honour. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: उपसद्याय मीळ्हुष आस्ये जुहुता हविः यो नो नेदिष्ठमाप्यम |||
verses.transliteration: upasadyāya mīḷhuṣa āsye juhutā haviḥ yo no nediṣṭhamāpyam

translations.griffith: OFFER oblations in his mouth, the bounteous God's whom we must serve.  His who is nearest kin to us:

verses.sanskrit: यः पञ्च चर्षणीरभि निषसाद दमे-दमे कविर्ग्र्हपतिर्युवा |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīrabhi niṣasāda dame-dame kavirghṛhapatiryuvā

translations.griffith: Who for the Fivefold People's take hath seated him in every home  Wise, Youthful, Master of the house.

verses.sanskrit: स नो वेदो अमात्यमग्नी रक्षतु विश्वतः उतास्मान पात्वंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: sa no vedo amātyamaghnī rakṣatu viśvataḥ utāsmān pātvaṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: On all sides may that Agni guard our household folk and property;  May he deliver us from woe.

verses.sanskrit: नवं नु सतोममग्नये दिवः शयेनाय जीजनम वस्वः कुविद वनाति नः |||
verses.transliteration: navaṃ nu stomamaghnaye divaḥ śyenāya jījanam vasvaḥ kuvid vanāti naḥ

translations.griffith: I have begotten this new hymn for Agni, Falcon of the sky:  Will he not give us of his wealth?

verses.sanskrit: सपार्हा यस्य शरियो दर्शे रयिर्वीरवतो यथा अग्रे यज्ञस्य शोचतः |||
verses.transliteration: spārhā yasya śriyo dṛśe rayirvīravato yathā aghre yajñasya śocataḥ

translations.griffith: Whose lories when he glows in front of sacrite are fair to see,  Like wealth of one with hero sons.

verses.sanskrit: सेमां वेतु वषट्क्र्तिमग्निर्जुषत नो गिरः यजिष्ठो हव्यवाहनः |||
verses.transliteration: semāṃ vetu vaṣaṭkṛtimaghnirjuṣata no ghiraḥ yajiṣṭho havyavāhanaḥ

translations.griffith: May he enjoy this hallowed gift, Agni accept our songs, who bears  Oblations, best of worshippers.

verses.sanskrit: नि तवा नक्ष्य विश्पते दयुमन्तं देव धीमहि सुवीरमग्न आहुत |||
verses.transliteration: ni tvā nakṣya viśpate dyumantaṃ deva dhīmahi suvīramaghna āhuta

translations.griffith: Lord of the house, whom men must seek, we set thee down, O Worshipped Onel  Bright, rich in heroes, Agni! God

verses.sanskrit: कषप उस्रश्च दीदिहि सवग्नयस्त्वया वयम सुवीरस्त्वमस्मयुः |||
verses.transliteration: kṣapa usraśca dīdihi svaghnayastvayā vayam suvīrastvamasmayuḥ

translations.griffith: Shine forth at night and morn: through thee with fires are we provided well.  Thou, rich in heroes, art our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: उप तवा सातये नरो विप्रासो यन्ति धीतिभिः उपाक्षरासहस्रिणी |||
verses.transliteration: upa tvā sātaye naro viprāso yanti dhītibhiḥ upākṣarāsahasriṇī

translations.griffith: The men come near thee for their gain, the singers with their songs of praise:  Speech, thousandfold, comes near to thee.

verses.sanskrit: अग्नी रक्षांसि सेधति शुक्रशोचिरमर्त्यः शुचिः पावक ईड्यः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnī rakṣāṃsi sedhati śukraśociramartyaḥ śuciḥ pāvaka īḍyaḥ

translations.griffith: Bright, Purifier, meet for praise, Immortal with refulgent glow,  Agni drives Rākṣasas away.

verses.sanskrit: स नो राधांस्या भरेशानः सहसो यहो भगश्च दातुवार्यम |||
verses.transliteration: sa no rādhāṃsyā bhareśānaḥ sahaso yaho bhaghaśca dātuvāryam

translations.griffith: As such, bring us abundant wealth, young Child of Strength, for this thou canst  May Bhaga give us what is choice.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने वीरवद यशो देवश्च सविता भगः दितिश्चदाति वार्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne vīravad yaśo devaśca savitā bhaghaḥ ditiścadāti vāryam

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, givest hero fame: Bhaga and Savitar the God,  And Did give us what is good.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने रक्षा णो अंहसः परति षम देव रीषतः तपिष्ठैरजरो दह |||
verses.transliteration: aghne rakṣā ṇo aṃhasaḥ prati ṣma deva rīṣataḥ tapiṣṭhairajaro daha

translations.griffith: Agni, preserve us from distress: consume our enemies, O God,  Eternal, with the hottest flames.

verses.sanskrit: अधा मही न आयस्यनाध्र्ष्टो नर्पीतये पूर्भवा शतभुजिः |||
verses.transliteration: adhā mahī na āyasyanādhṛṣṭo nṛpītaye pūrbhavā śatabhujiḥ

translations.griffith: And, irresistible, be thou a mighty iron fort to us,  With hundred walls for man's defence.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नः पाह्यंहसो दोषावस्तरघायतः दिवा नक्तमदाभ्य |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ pāhyaṃhaso doṣāvastaraghāyataḥ divā naktamadābhya

translations.griffith: Do thou preserve us, eve and morn, from sorrow, from the wicked men,  Infallible! by day and night.

verses.sanskrit: एना वो अग्निं नमसोर्जो नपातमा हुवे परियं चेतिष्ठमरतिं सवध्वरं विश्वस्य दूतमम्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: enā vo aghniṃ namasorjo napātamā huve priyaṃ cetiṣṭhamaratiṃ svadhvaraṃ viśvasya dūtamamṛtam

translations.griffith: WITH this my reverent hymn I call Agni for you, the Son of Strength,  Dear, wisest envoy, served with noble sacrifice, immortal messenger of all.

verses.sanskrit: स योजते अरुषा विश्वभोजसा स दुद्रवत सवाहुतः सुब्रह्मा यज्ञः सुशमी वसूनां देवं राधो जनानाम |||
verses.transliteration: sa yojate aruṣā viśvabhojasā sa dudravat svāhutaḥ subrahmā yajñaḥ suśamī vasūnāṃ devaṃ rādho janānām

translations.griffith: His two red horses, all-supporting, let him yoke: let him, well-worshipped, urge them fast.  Then hath the sacrifice good prayers and happy end, and heavenly gift of wealth to men.

verses.sanskrit: उदस्य शोचिरस्थादाजुह्वानस्य मीळ्हुषः उद धूमासोरुषासो दिविस्प्र्शः समग्निमिन्धते नरः |||
verses.transliteration: udasya śocirasthādājuhvānasya mīḷhuṣaḥ ud dhūmāsoaruṣāso divispṛśaḥ samaghnimindhate naraḥ

translations.griffith: The flame of him the Bountiful, the Much-invoked, hath mounted up,  And his red-coloured smoke-clouds reach and touch the sky: the men are kindling Agni well.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा दूतं कर्ण्महे यशस्तमं देवाना वीतये वह विश्वा सूनो सहसो मर्तभोजना रास्व तद यत तवेमहे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā dūtaṃ kṛṇmahe yaśastamaṃ devānā vītaye vaha viśvā sūno sahaso martabhojanā rāsva tad yat tvemahe

translations.griffith: Thee, thee Most Glorious One we make our messenger. Bring the Gods hither to the feast.  Give us, O Son of Strength, all food that fcedeth man: give that for which we pray to thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने गर्हपतिस्त्वं होता नो अध्वरे तवं पोता विश्ववार परचेता यक्षि वेषि च वार्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne ghṛhapatistvaṃ hotā no adhvare tvaṃ potā viśvavāra pracetā yakṣi veṣi ca vāryam

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, art the homestead's Lord, our Herald at the sacrifice.  Lord of all boons, thou art the Cleanser and a Sage. Pay worship, and enjoy the good.

verses.sanskrit: कर्धि रत्नं यजमानाय सुक्रतो तवं हि रत्नधा असि आन रते शिशीहि विश्वं रत्विजं सुशंसो यश्च दक्षते |||
verses.transliteration: kṛdhi ratnaṃ yajamānāya sukrato tvaṃ hi ratnadhā asi āna ṛte śiśīhi viśvaṃ ṛtvijaṃ suśaṃso yaśca dakṣate

translations.griffith: Give riches to the sacrificer, O Most Wise, for thou art he who granteth wealth.  Inspire with zeal each priest at this our solemn rite; all who are skilled in singing praise.

verses.sanskrit: तवे अग्ने सवाहुत परियासः सन्तु सूरयः यन्तारो ये मघवानो जनानामूर्वान दयन्त गोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: tve aghne svāhuta priyāsaḥ santu sūrayaḥ yantāro ye maghavāno janānāmūrvān dayanta ghonām

translations.griffith: O Agni who art worshipped well, dear let our princes he to thee,  Our wealthy patrons who are governors of men, who part, as gifts, their stalls of kine.

verses.sanskrit: येषामिळा घर्तहस्ता दुरोण आनपि पराता निषीदति तांस्त्रायस्व सहस्य दरुहो निदो यछा नः शर्म दीर्घश्रुत |||
verses.transliteration: yeṣāmiḷā ghṛtahastā duroṇa ānapi prātā niṣīdati tāṃstrāyasva sahasya druho nido yachā naḥ śarma dīrghaśrut

translations.griffith: They in whose home, her hand bearing the sacred oil, Iḷā sits down well-satisfied-  Guard them, Victorious God, from slander and from harm. give us a refuge famed afar.

verses.sanskrit: स मन्द्रया च जिह्वया वह्निरासा विदुष्टरः अग्ने रयिं मघवद्भ्यो न आ वह हव्यदातिं च सूदय |||
verses.transliteration: sa mandrayā ca jihvayā vahnirāsā viduṣṭaraḥ aghne rayiṃ maghavadbhyo na ā vaha havyadātiṃ ca sūdaya

translations.griffith: Do thou, a Priest with pleasant tongue, most wise, and very near to us,  Agni, bring riches hither to our liberal chiefs, and speed the oflering of our gifts.

verses.sanskrit: ये राधांसि ददत्यश्व्या मघा कामेन शरवसो महः तानंहसः पिप्र्हि पर्त्र्भिष टवं शतं पूर्भिर्यविष्ठ्य |||
verses.transliteration: ye rādhāṃsi dadatyaśvyā maghā kāmena śravaso mahaḥ tānaṃhasaḥ pipṛhi partṛbhiṣ ṭvaṃ śataṃ pūrbhiryaviṣṭhya

translations.griffith: They who bestow as bounty plenteous wealth of steeds, moved by desire of great renown-  Do thou with saving help preserve them from distress, Most Youthful! with a hundred forts.

verses.sanskrit: देवो वो दरविणोदाः पूर्णां विवष्ट्यासिचम उद वा सिञ्चध्वमुप वा पर्णध्वमादिद वो देव ओहते |||
verses.transliteration: devo vo draviṇodāḥ pūrṇāṃ vivaṣṭyāsicam ud vā siñcadhvamupa vā pṛṇadhvamādid vo deva ohate

translations.griffith: The God who gives your wealth demands a full libation poured to him.  Pour ye it forth, then fill the vessel full again: then doth the God pay heed to you.

verses.sanskrit: तं होतारमध्वरस्य परचेतसं वह्निं देवा अक्र्ण्वत दधाति रत्नं विधते सुवीर्यमग्निर्जनाय दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ hotāramadhvarasya pracetasaṃ vahniṃ devā akṛṇvata dadhāti ratnaṃ vidhate suvīryamaghnirjanāya dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Him have the Gods appointed Priest of sacrifice, oblation-bearer, passing wise.  Agni gives wealth and valour to the worshipper, to folk who offer up their gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने भव सुषमिधा समिद्ध उत बर्हिरुर्विया वि सत्र्णीताम ||
verses.transliteration: aghne bhava suṣamidhā samiddha uta barhirurviyā vi stṛṇītām

translations.griffith: AGNI, be kindled well with proper fuel, and let the grass be scattered wide about thee.

verses.sanskrit: उत दवार उशतीर्वि शरयन्तामुत देवानुशत आ वहेह ||
verses.transliteration: uta dvāra uśatīrvi śrayantāmuta devānuśata ā vaheha

translations.griffith: Let the impatient Portals be thrown open bring thou the Gods impatient to come hither.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने वीहि हविषा वक्षि देवान सवध्वरा कर्णुहि जातवेदः ||
verses.transliteration: aghne vīhi haviṣā vakṣi devān svadhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ

translations.griffith: Taste, Agni: serve the Gods with our oblation. Offer good sacrifices, Jātavedas!

verses.sanskrit: सवध्वरा करति जातवेदा यक्षद देवानम्र्तान पिप्रयच्च ||
verses.transliteration: svadhvarā karati jātavedā yakṣad devānamṛtān piprayacca

translations.griffith: Let Jātavedas pay fair sacrifices, worship andgratify the Gods Immortal.

verses.sanskrit: वंस्व विश्वा वार्याणि परचेतः सत्या भवन्त्वाशिषो नोद्य ||
verses.transliteration: vaṃsva viśvā vāryāṇi pracetaḥ satyā bhavantvāśiṣo noadya

translations.griffith: Wise God, win for us things that are all-goodly, and let the prayers, we pray today be fruitful.

verses.sanskrit: तवामु ते दधिरे हव्यवाहं देवासो अग्न ऊर्ज आ नपातम ||
verses.transliteration: tvāmu te dadhire havyavāhaṃ devāso aghna ūrja ā napātam

translations.griffith: Thee, even thee, the Son of Strength, O Agni, those Gods have made the bearer of oblations.

verses.sanskrit: ते ते देवाय दाशतः सयाम महो नो रत्ना वि दध इयानः ||
verses.transliteration: te te devāya dāśataḥ syāma maho no ratnā vi dadha iyānaḥ

translations.griffith: To thee the God may we perform our worship: do thou, besought, grant us abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit: तवे ह यत पितरश्चिन न इन्द्र विश्वा वामा जरितारो असन्वन तवे गावः सुदुघास्त्वे हयश्वास्त्वं वसु देवयतेवनिष्ठः |||
verses.transliteration: tve ha yat pitaraścin na indra viśvā vāmā jaritāro asanvan tve ghāvaḥ sudughāstve hyaśvāstvaṃ vasu devayatevaniṣṭhaḥ

translations.griffith: ALL is with thee, O Indra, all the treasures which erst our fathers won who sang thy praises.  With thee are milch-kine good to milk, and horses: best winner thou of riches for the pious.

verses.sanskrit: राजेव हि जनिभिः कषेष्येवाव दयुभिरभि विदुष कविः सन पिशा गिरो मघवन गोभिरश्वैस्त्वायतः शिशीहिराये अस्मान |||
verses.transliteration: rājeva hi janibhiḥ kṣeṣyevāva dyubhirabhi viduṣ kaviḥ san piśā ghiro maghavan ghobhiraśvaistvāyataḥ śiśīhirāye asmān

translations.griffith: For like a King among his wives thou dwellest: with glories, as a Sage, surround and help us.  Make us, thy servants, strong for wealth, and honour our songs wirth kine and steeds and decoration.

verses.sanskrit: इमा उ तवा पस्प्र्धानासो अत्र मन्द्रा गिरो देवयन्तीरुप सथुः अर्वाची ते पथ्या राय एतु सयाम ते सुमताविन्द्र शर्मन |||
verses.transliteration: imā u tvā paspṛdhānāso atra mandrā ghiro devayantīrupa sthuḥ arvācī te pathyā rāya etu syāma te sumatāvindra śarman

translations.griffith: Here these our holy hymns with joy and gladness in pious emulation have approached thee.  Hitherward come thy path that leads to riches: may we find shelter in thy favour, Indra.

verses.sanskrit: धेनुं न तवा सूयवसे दुदुक्षन्नुप बरह्माणि सस्र्जे वसिष्ठः तवामिन मे गोपतिं विश्व आहा न इन्द्रः सुमतिं गन्त्वछ |||
verses.transliteration: dhenuṃ na tvā sūyavase dudukṣannupa brahmāṇi sasṛje vasiṣṭhaḥ tvāmin me ghopatiṃ viśva āhā na indraḥ sumatiṃ ghantvacha

translations.griffith: Vasiṣṭha hath poured forth his prayers, desiring to milk thee like a cow in goodly pasture.  All these my people call thee Lord of cattle: may Indra. come unto the prayer we offer.

verses.sanskrit: अर्णांसि चित पप्रथाना सुदास इन्द्रो गाधान्यक्र्णोत सुपारा शर्धन्तं शिम्युमुचथस्य नव्यः शापं सिन्धूनामक्र्णोदशस्तीः |||
verses.transliteration: arṇāṃsi cit paprathānā sudāsa indro ghādhānyakṛṇot supārā śardhantaṃ śimyumucathasya navyaḥ śāpaṃ sindhūnāmakṛṇodaśastīḥ

translations.griffith: What though the floods spread widely, Indra made them shallow and easy for Sudās to traverse.  He, worthy of our praises, caused the Simyu, foe of our hymn, to curse the rivers' fury.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोळा इत तुर्वशो यक्षुरासीद राये मत्स्यासो निशिता अपीव शरुष्टिं चक्रुर्भ्र्गवो दरुह्यवश्च सखा सखायमतरद विषूचोः |||
verses.transliteration: puroḷā it turvaśo yakṣurāsīd rāye matsyāso niśitā apīva śruṣṭiṃ cakrurbhṛghavo druhyavaśca sakhā sakhāyamatarad viṣūcoḥ

translations.griffith: Eager for spoil was Turvaśa Purodas, fain to win wealth, like fishes urged by hunger.  The Bhṛgus and the Druhyus quickly listened: friend rescued friend mid the two distant peoples.

verses.sanskrit: आ पक्थासो भलानसो भनन्तालिनासो विषाणिनः शिवासः आ यो.अनयत सधमा आर्यस्य गव्या तर्त्सुभ्यो अजगन युधा नर्न |||
verses.transliteration: ā pakthāso bhalānaso bhanantālināso viṣāṇinaḥ śivāsaḥ ā yo.anayat sadhamā āryasya ghavyā tṛtsubhyo ajaghan yudhā nṛn

translations.griffith: Together came the Pakthas, the Bhalanas, the Alinas, the Sivas, the Visanins.  Yet to the Trtsus came the Ārya's Comrade, through love of spoil and heroes' war, to lead them.

verses.sanskrit: दुराध्यो अदितिं सरेवयन्तो.अचेतसो वि जग्र्भ्रे परुष्णीम मह्नाविव्यक पर्थिवीं पत्यमानः पशुष कविरशयच्चायमानः |||
verses.transliteration: durādhyo aditiṃ srevayanto.acetaso vi jaghṛbhre paruṣṇīm mahnāvivyak pṛthivīṃ patyamānaḥ paśuṣ kaviraśayaccāyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: Fools, in their folly fain to waste her waters, they parted inexhaustible Paruṣṇī.  Lord of the Earth, he with his might repressed them: still lay the herd and the affrighted herdsman.

verses.sanskrit: ईयुरर्थं न नयर्थं परुष्णीमाशुश्चनेदभिपित्वं जगाम सुदास इन्द्रः सुतुकानमित्रानरन्धयन मानुषे वध्रिवाचः |||
verses.transliteration: īyurarthaṃ na nyarthaṃ paruṣṇīmāśuścanedabhipitvaṃ jaghāma sudāsa indraḥ sutukānamitrānarandhayan mānuṣe vadhrivācaḥ

translations.griffith: As to their goal they sped to their destruetion: they sought Paruṣṇī; e’en the swift returned not.  Indra abandoned, to Sudās the manly, the swiftly flying foes, unmanly babblers.

verses.sanskrit: ईयुर्गावो न यवसादगोपा यथाक्र्तमभि मित्रं चितासः पर्श्निगावः पर्श्निनिप्रेषितासः शरुष्टिं चक्रुर्नियुतो रन्तयश्च |||
verses.transliteration: īyurghāvo na yavasādaghopā yathākṛtamabhi mitraṃ citāsaḥ pṛśnighāvaḥ pṛśninipreṣitāsaḥ śruṣṭiṃ cakrurniyuto rantayaśca

translations.griffith: They went like kine unherded from the pasture, each clinging to a friend as chance directed.  They who drive spotted steeds, sent down by Pṛśni, gave ear, the Warriors and the harnessed horses.

verses.sanskrit: एकं च यो विंशतिं च शरवस्या वैकर्णयोर्जनान राजा नयस्तः दस्मो न सद्मन नि शिशाति बर्हिः शूरः सर्गमक्र्णोदिन्द्र एषाम |||
verses.transliteration: ekaṃ ca yo viṃśatiṃ ca śravasyā vaikarṇayorjanān rājā nyastaḥ dasmo na sadman ni śiśāti barhiḥ śūraḥ sarghamakṛṇodindra eṣām

translations.griffith: The King who scattered one-and-twenty people of both Vaikarna tribes through lust of glory-  As the skilled priest clips grass within the chamber, so hath the Hero Indra, wrought their downfall.

verses.sanskrit: अध शरुतं कवषं वर्द्धमप्स्वनु दरुह्युं नि वर्णग वज्रबाहुः वर्णाना अत्र सख्याय सख्यं तवायन्तो ये अमदन्ननु तवा |||
verses.transliteration: adha śrutaṃ kavaṣaṃ vṛddhamapsvanu druhyuṃ ni vṛṇagh vajrabāhuḥ vṛṇānā atra sakhyāya sakhyaṃ tvāyanto ye amadannanu tvā

translations.griffith: Thou, thunder-armed, o’erwhelmedst in the waters famed ancient Kavasa and then the Druhyu.  Others here claiming friendship to their friendship, devoted unto thee, in thee were joyful.

verses.sanskrit: वि सद्यो विश्वा दरंहितान्येषामिन्द्रः पुरः सहसा सप्त दर्दः वयानवस्य तर्त्सवे गयं भाग जेष्म पूरुं विदथे मर्ध्रवाचम |||
verses.transliteration: vi sadyo viśvā dṛṃhitānyeṣāmindraḥ puraḥ sahasā sapta dardaḥ vyānavasya tṛtsave ghayaṃ bhāgh jeṣma pūruṃ vidathe mṛdhravācam

translations.griffith: Indra at once with conquering might demolished all their strong places and their seven castles.  The goods of Anu's son he gave to Trtsu. May we in sacrifice conquer scorned Pūru.

verses.sanskrit: नि गव्यवो.अनवो दरुह्यवश्च षष्टिः शता सुषुपुः षट सहस्रा षष्टिर्वीरासो अधि षड दुवोयु विश्वेदिन्द्रस्य वीर्या कर्तानि |||
verses.transliteration: ni ghavyavo.anavo druhyavaśca ṣaṣṭiḥ śatā suṣupuḥ ṣaṭ sahasrā ṣaṣṭirvīrāso adhi ṣaḍ duvoyu viśvedindrasya vīryā kṛtāni

translations.griffith: The Anavas and Druhyus, seeking booty, have slept, the sixty hundred, yea, six thousand,  And six-and-sixty heroes. For the pious were all these mighty exploits done by Indra.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रेणैते तर्त्सवो वेविषाणा आपो न सर्ष्टा अधवन्त नीचीः दुर्मित्रासः परकलविन मिमाना जहुर्विश्वानि भोजना सुदासे |||
verses.transliteration: indreṇaite tṛtsavo veviṣāṇā āpo na sṛṣṭā adhavanta nīcīḥ durmitrāsaḥ prakalavin mimānā jahurviśvāni bhojanā sudāse

translations.griffith: These Trtsus under Indra's careful guidance came speeding like loosed waters rushing downward.  The foemen, measuring exceeding closely, abandoned to Sudās all their provisions.

verses.sanskrit: अर्धं वीरस्य शर्तपामनिन्द्रं परा शर्धन्तं नुनुदे अभि कषाम इन्द्रो मन्युं मन्युम्यो मिमाय भेजे पथो वर्तनिम्पत्यमानः |||
verses.transliteration: ardhaṃ vīrasya śṛtapāmanindraṃ parā śardhantaṃ nunude abhi kṣām indro manyuṃ manyumyo mimāya bheje patho vartanimpatyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: The hero's side who drank the dressed oblation, Indra's denier, far o’er earth he scattered.  Indra brought down the fierce destroyer's fury. He gave them various roads, the path's Controller.

verses.sanskrit: आध्रेण चित तद वेकं चकार सिंह्यं चित पेत्वेना जघान अव सरक्तीर्वेश्याव्र्श्चदिन्द्रः परायछद विश्वा भोजना सुदासे |||
verses.transliteration: ādhreṇa cit tad vekaṃ cakāra siṃhyaṃ cit petvenā jaghāna ava sraktīrveśyāvṛścadindraḥ prāyachad viśvā bhojanā sudāse

translations.griffith: E’en with the weak he wrought this matchless exploit: e’en with a goat he did to death a lion.  He pared the pillar's angles with a needle. Thus to Sudās Indra gave all provisions.

verses.sanskrit: शश्वन्तो हि शत्रवो रारधुष टे भेदस्य चिच्छर्धतो विन्द रन्धिम मर्तानेन सतुवतो यः कर्णोति तिग्मं तस्मिन नि जहि वज्रमिन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: śaśvanto hi śatravo rāradhuṣ ṭe bhedasya cicchardhato vinda randhim martānena stuvato yaḥ kṛṇoti tighmaṃ tasmin ni jahi vajramindra

translations.griffith: To thee have all thine enemies submitted: e’en the fierce Bheda hast thou made thy subject.  Cast down thy sharpened thunderbolt, O Indra, on him who harms the men who sing thy praises.

verses.sanskrit: आवदिन्द्रं यमुना तर्त्सवश्च परात्र भेदं सर्वतातामुषायत अजासश्च शिग्रवो यक्षवश्च बलिं शीर्षाणि जभ्रुरश्व्यानि |||
verses.transliteration: āvadindraṃ yamunā tṛtsavaśca prātra bhedaṃ sarvatātāmuṣāyat ajāsaśca śighravo yakṣavaśca baliṃ śīrṣāṇi jabhruraśvyāni

translations.griffith: Yamuna and the Trtsus aided Indra. There he stripped Bheda bare of all his treasures.  The Ajas and the Sigrus and the Yaksus brought in to him as tribute heads of horses.

verses.sanskrit: न त इन्द्र सुमतयो न रायः संचक्षे पूर्वा उषसो न नूत्नाः देवकं चिन मान्यमानं जघन्थाव तमना बर्हतः शम्बरं भेत |||
verses.transliteration: na ta indra sumatayo na rāyaḥ saṃcakṣe pūrvā uṣaso na nūtnāḥ devakaṃ cin mānyamānaṃ jaghanthāva tmanā bṛhataḥ śambaraṃ bhet

translations.griffith: Not to be scorned, but like Dawns past and recent, O Indra, are thy favours and thy riches.  Devaka, Mānyamana's son, thou slewest, and smotest Śambara from the lofty mountain.

verses.sanskrit: पर ये गर्हादममदुस्त्वाया पराशरः शतयातुर्वसिष्ठः न ते भोजस्य सख्यं मर्षन्ताधा सूरिभ्यः सुदिना वयुछान |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye ghṛhādamamadustvāyā parāśaraḥ śatayāturvasiṣṭhaḥ na te bhojasya sakhyaṃ mṛṣantādhā sūribhyaḥ sudinā vyuchān

translations.griffith: They who, from home, have gladdened thee, thy servants Parasara, Vasiṣṭha, Satayatu,  Will not forget thy friendship, liberal Giver. So shall the days dawn prosperous for the princes.

verses.sanskrit: दवे नप्तुर्देववतः शते गोर्द्वा रथा वधूमन्ता सुदासः अर्हन्नग्ने पैजवनस्य दानं होतेव सद्म पर्येमि रेभन |||
verses.transliteration: dve napturdevavataḥ śate ghordvā rathā vadhūmantā sudāsaḥ arhannaghne paijavanasya dānaṃ hoteva sadma paryemi rebhan

translations.griffith: Priest-like, with praise, I move around the altar, earning Paijavana's reward, O Agni,  Two hundred cows from Devavan's descendant, two chariots from Sudās with mares to draw them.

verses.sanskrit: चत्वारो मा पैजवनस्य दानाः समद्दिष्टयः कर्शनिनो निरेके रज्रासो मा पर्थिविष्ठाः सुदासस्तोकं तोकाय शरवसे वहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: catvāro mā paijavanasya dānāḥ smaddiṣṭayaḥ kṛśanino nireke ṛjrāso mā pṛthiviṣṭhāḥ sudāsastokaṃ tokāya śravase vahanti

translations.griffith: Gift of Paijavana, four horses bear me in foremost place, trained steeds with pearl to deck them.  Sudās's brown steeds, firmly-stepping, carry me and my son for progeny and glory.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य शरवो रोदसी अन्तरुर्वी शीर्ष्णे-शीर्ष्णे विबभाजा विभक्ता सप्तेदिन्द्रं न सरवतो गर्णन्ति नि युध्यामधिमशिशादभीके |||
verses.transliteration: yasya śravo rodasī antarurvī śīrṣṇe-śīrṣṇe vibabhājā vibhaktā saptedindraṃ na sravato ghṛṇanti ni yudhyāmadhimaśiśādabhīke

translations.griffith: Him whose fame spreads between wide earth and heaven, who, as dispenser, gives each chief his portion,  Seven flowing Rivers glorify like Indra. He slew Yudhyamadhi in close encounter.

verses.sanskrit: इमं नरो मरुतः सश्चतानु दिवोदासं न पितरं सुदासः अविष्टना पैजवनस्य केतं दूणाशं कषत्रमजरं दुवोयु |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ naro marutaḥ saścatānu divodāsaṃ na pitaraṃ sudāsaḥ aviṣṭanā paijavanasya ketaṃ dūṇāśaṃ kṣatramajaraṃ duvoyu

translations.griffith: Attend on him O ye heroic Maruts as on Sudās's father Divodāsa.  Further Paijavana's desire with favour. Guard faithfully his lasting firm dominion.

verses.sanskrit: यस्तिग्मश्र्ङगो वर्षभो न भीम एकः कर्ष्टीश्च्यावयति पर विश्वाः यः शश्वतो अदाशुषो गयस्य परयन्तासिसुष्वितराय वेदः |||
verses.transliteration: yastighmaśṛṅgho vṛṣabho na bhīma ekaḥ kṛṣṭīścyāvayati pra viśvāḥ yaḥ śaśvato adāśuṣo ghayasya prayantāsisuṣvitarāya vedaḥ

translations.griffith: HE like a bull with sharpened horns, terrific, singly excites and agitates all the people:  Thou givest him who largely pours libations his goods who pours not, for his own possession.

verses.sanskrit: तवं ह तयदिन्द्र कुत्समावः शुश्रूषमाणस्तन्वा समर्ये दासं यच्छुष्णं कुयवं नयस्मा अरन्धय आर्जुनेयाय शिक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ ha tyadindra kutsamāvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇastanvā samarye dāsaṃ yacchuṣṇaṃ kuyavaṃ nyasmā arandhaya ārjuneyāya śikṣan

translations.griffith: Thou, verily, Indra, gavest help to Kutsa, willingly giving car to him in battle,  When, aiding Ārjuneya, thou subduedst to him both Kuyava and the Dāsa Śuṣṇa.

verses.sanskrit: तवं धर्ष्णो धर्षता वीतहव्यं परावो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः सुदासम पर पौरुकुत्सिं तरसदस्युमावः कषेत्रसाता वर्त्रहत्येषु पूरुम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyaṃ prāvo viśvābhirūtibhiḥ sudāsam pra paurukutsiṃ trasadasyumāvaḥ kṣetrasātā vṛtrahatyeṣu pūrum

translations.griffith: O Bold One, thou with all thine aids hast boldly holpen Sudās whose offerings were accepted,  Pūru in winning land and slaying foemen, and Trasadasyu son of Purukutsa.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नर्भिर्न्र्मणो देववीतौ भूरीणि वर्त्रा हर्यश्व हंसि तवं नि दस्युं चुमुरिं धुनिं चास्वापयो दभीतये सुहन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ nṛbhirnṛmaṇo devavītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi tvaṃ ni dasyuṃ cumuriṃ dhuniṃ cāsvāpayo dabhītaye suhantu

translations.griffith: At the Gods’ banquet, hero-souled! with Heroes, Lord of Bay Steeds, thou slewest many foemen.  Thou sentest in swift death to sleep the Dasyu, both Cumuri and Dhuni, for Dabhīti.

verses.sanskrit: तव चयौत्नानि वज्रहस्त तानि नव यत पुरो नवतिं च सद्यः निवेशने शततमाविवेषीरहञ्च वर्त्रं नमुचिमुताहन |||
verses.transliteration: tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puro navatiṃ ca sadyaḥ niveśane śatatamāviveṣīrahañca vṛtraṃ namucimutāhan

translations.griffith: These were thy mighty powers that, Thunder-wielder, thou swiftly crushedst nine-and-ninety castles:  Thou capturedst the hundredth in thine onslaught; thou slewest Namuci, thou slewest Vṛtra.

verses.sanskrit: सना ता त इन्द्र भोजनानि रातहव्याय दाशुषे सुदासे वर्ष्णे ते हरी वर्षणा युनज्मि वयन्तु बरह्माणि पुरुशाक वाजम |||
verses.transliteration: sanā tā ta indra bhojanāni rātahavyāya dāśuṣe sudāse vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puruśāka vājam

translations.griffith: Old are the blessings, Indra, which thou gavest Sudās the worshipper who brought oblations.  For thee, the Strong, I yoke thy strong Bay Horses: may our prayers reach thee and win strength, Most Mighty!

verses.sanskrit: मा ते अस्यां सहसावन परिष्टावघाय भूम हरिवः परादै तरायस्व नो.अव्र्केभिर्वरूथैस्तव परियासः सूरिषु सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: mā te asyāṃ sahasāvan pariṣṭāvaghāya bhūma harivaḥ parādai trāyasva no.avṛkebhirvarūthaistava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma

translations.griffith: Give us not up, Lord of Bay Horses, Victor, in this thine own assembly, to the wicked.  Deliver us with true and faithful succours: dear may we be to thee among the princes.

verses.sanskrit: परियास इत ते मघवन्नभिष्टौ नरो मदेम शरणे सखायः नि तुर्वशं नि याद्वं शिशीह्यतिथिग्वाय शंस्यं करिष्यन |||
verses.transliteration: priyāsa it te maghavannabhiṣṭau naro madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ ni turvaśaṃ ni yādvaṃ śiśīhyatithighvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan

translations.griffith: May we men, Maghavan, the friends thou lovest, near thee be joyful under thy protection.  Fain to fulfil the wish of Atithigva humble. the pride of Turvaśa and Yadva.

verses.sanskrit: सद्यश्चिन नु ते मघवन्नभिष्टौ नरः शंसन्त्युक्थशास उक्था ये ते हवेभिर्वि पणीन्रदाशन्नस्मान वर्णीष्व युज्याय तस्मै |||
verses.transliteration: sadyaścin nu te maghavannabhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsantyukthaśāsa ukthā ye te havebhirvi paṇīnradāśannasmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai

translations.griffith: Swiftly, in truth, O Maghavan, about thee men skilled in hymning sing their songs and praises. '  Elect us also into their assembly who by their calls on thee despoiled the niggards.

verses.sanskrit: एते सतोमा नरां नर्तम तुभ्यमस्मद्र्यञ्चो ददतो मघानि तेषामिन्द्र वर्त्रहत्ये शिवो भूः सखा च शूरो.अविताच नर्णाम |||
verses.transliteration: ete stomā narāṃ nṛtama tubhyamasmadryañco dadato maghāni teṣāmindra vṛtrahatye śivo bhūḥ sakhā ca śūro.avitāca nṛṇām

translations.griffith: Thine are these lauds, O manliest of heroes, lauds which revert to us and give us riches.  Favour these, Indra, when they fight with faemen, as Friend and Hero and the heroes' Helper.

verses.sanskrit: नू इन्द्र शूर सतवमान ऊती बरह्मजूतस्तन्वा वाव्र्धस्व उप नो वाजान मिमीह्युप सतीन यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: nū indra śūra stavamāna ūtī brahmajūtastanvā vāvṛdhasva upa no vājān mimīhyupa stīn yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Now, lauded for thine aid, Heroic Indra, sped by our prayer, wax mighty in thy body.  Apportion to us strength and habitations. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रो जज्ञे वीर्याय सवधावाञ्चक्रिरपो नर्यो यत करिष्यन जग्मिर्युवा नर्षदनमवोभिस्त्राता न इन्द्र एनसो महश्चित |||
verses.transliteration: ughro jajñe vīryāya svadhāvāñcakrirapo naryo yat kariṣyan jaghmiryuvā nṛṣadanamavobhistrātā na indra enaso mahaścit

translations.griffith: STRONG, Godly-natured, born for hero exploit, man's Friend, hedoth whatever deed he willeth.  Saving us e’en from great transgression, Indra, the Youthful, visiteth man's home with favour.

verses.sanskrit: हन्त वर्त्रमिन्द्रः शूशुवानः परावीन नु वीरो जरितारमूती कर्ता सुदासे अह वा उ लोकं दाता वसु मुहुरा दाशुषे भूत |||
verses.transliteration: hanta vṛtramindraḥ śūśuvānaḥ prāvīn nu vīro jaritāramūtī kartā sudāse aha vā u lokaṃ dātā vasu muhurā dāśuṣe bhūt

translations.griffith: Waxing greatness Indra slayeth Vṛtra: the Hero with his aid hath helped the singer.  He gave Sudās wide room and space, and often hath granted wealth to him who brought oblations.

verses.sanskrit: युध्मो अनर्वा खजक्र्त समद्वा शूरः सत्राषाड जनुषेमषाळ्हः वयास इन्द्रः पर्तनाः सवोजा अधा विश्वंशत्रूयन्तं जघान |||
verses.transliteration: yudhmo anarvā khajakṛt samadvā śūraḥ satrāṣāḍ januṣemaṣāḷhaḥ vyāsa indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā adhā viśvaṃśatrūyantaṃ jaghāna

translations.griffith: Soldier unchecked, war-rousing, battling Hero, unconquered from of old, victorious ever,  Indra the very strong hath scattered armies; yea, he hath slain each foe who fought against him.

verses.sanskrit: उभे चिदिन्द्र रोदसी महित्वा पप्राथ तविषीभिस्तुविष्मः नि वज्रमिन्द्रो हरिवान मिमिक्षन समन्धसा मदेषु वाुवोच |||
verses.transliteration: ubhe cidindra rodasī mahitvā paprātha taviṣībhistuviṣmaḥ ni vajramindro harivān mimikṣan samandhasā madeṣu vāuvoca

translations.griffith: Thou with thy greatness hast filled full, O Indra, even both the worlds with might, O thou Most Mighty.  Lord of Bays, Indra, brandishing his thunder, is gratified with Soma at the banquet.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा जजान वर्षणं रणाय तमु चिन नारी नर्यं ससूव पर यः सेनानीरध नर्भ्यो अस्तीनः सत्वा गवेषणः स धर्ष्णुः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā jajāna vṛṣaṇaṃ raṇāya tamu cin nārī naryaṃ sasūva pra yaḥ senānīradha nṛbhyo astīnaḥ satvā ghaveṣaṇaḥ sa dhṛṣṇuḥ

translations.griffith: A Bull begat the Bull for joy of battle, and a strong Mother brought forth him the manly.  He who is Chief of men, their armies' Leader, is strong Hero, bold, and fain for booty.
