verses.sanskrit: नू चित स भरेषते जनो न रेषन मनो यो अस्य घोरमाविवासात यज्ञैर्य इन्द्रे दधते दुवांसि कषयत स राय रतपा रतेजाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū cit sa bhreṣate jano na reṣan mano yo asya ghoramāvivāsāt yajñairya indre dadhate duvāṃsi kṣayat sa rāya ṛtapā ṛtejāḥ

translations.griffith: The people falter not, nor suffer sorrow, who win themselves this God's terrific spirit.  He who with sacrifices worships Indra is lord of wealth, law-born and law's protector.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र पूर्वो अपराय शिक्षन्नयज्ज्यायान कनीयसो देष्णम अम्र्त इत पर्यासीत दूरमा चित्र चित्र्यं भरा रयिं नः |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra pūrvo aparāya śikṣannayajjyāyān kanīyaso deṣṇam amṛta it paryāsīta dūramā citra citryaṃ bharā rayiṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: Whene’er the elder fain would help the younger the greater cometh to the lesser's present.  Shall the Immortal sit aloof' inactive? O Wondrous Indra, bring us wondrous riches.

verses.sanskrit: यस्त इन्द्र परियो जनो ददाशदसन निरेके अद्रिवः सखा ते वयं ते अस्यां सुमतौ चनिष्ठाः सयाम वरूथे अघ्नतो नर्पीतौ |||
verses.transliteration: yasta indra priyo jano dadāśadasan nireke adrivaḥ sakhā te vayaṃ te asyāṃ sumatau caniṣṭhāḥ syāma varūthe aghnato nṛpītau

translations.griffith: Thy dear folk, Indra, who present oblations, are, in chief place, thy friends, O Thunder-wielder.  May we be best content in this thy favour, sheltered by One who slays not, but preserves us.

verses.sanskrit: एष सतोमो अचिक्रदद वर्षा त उत सतामुर्मघवन्नक्रपिष्ट रायस कामो जरितारं त आगन तवमङग शक्र वस्व आशको नः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa stomo acikradad vṛṣā ta uta stāmurmaghavannakrapiṣṭa rāyas kāmo jaritāraṃ ta āghan tvamaṅgha śakra vasva āśako naḥ

translations.griffith: To thee the mighty hymn hath clamoured loudly, and, Maghavan, the eloquent hath besought thee.  Desire of wealth hath come upon thy singer: help us then, gakra, to our share of riches.

verses.sanskrit: स न इन्द्र तवयताया इषे धास्त्मना च ये मघवानो जुनन्ति वस्वी षु ते जरित्रे अस्तु शक्तिर्यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: sa na indra tvayatāyā iṣe dhāstmanā ca ye maghavāno junanti vasvī ṣu te jaritre astu śaktiryūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Place us by food which thou hast given, O Indra, us and the wealthy patrons who command us.  Let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: असावि देवं गोर्जीकमन्धो नयस्मिन्निन्द्रो जनुषेमुवोच बोधामसि तवा हर्यश्व यज्ञैर्बोधा न सतोममन्धसो मदेषु |||
verses.transliteration: asāvi devaṃ ghoṛjīkamandho nyasminnindro januṣemuvoca bodhāmasi tvā haryaśva yajñairbodhā na stomamandhaso madeṣu

translations.griffith: PRESSED is the juice divine with milk commingled: thereto hath Indra ever been accustomed.  We wake thee, Lord of Bays, with sacrifices: mark this our laud in the wild joy of Soma.

verses.sanskrit: पर यन्ति यज्ञं विपयन्ति बर्हिः सोममादो विदथे दुध्रवाचः नयु भरियन्ते यशसो गर्भादा दूर उपब्दो वर्षणोन्र्षाचः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yanti yajñaṃ vipayanti barhiḥ somamādo vidathe dudhravācaḥ nyu bhriyante yaśaso ghṛbhādā dūra upabdo vṛṣaṇonṛṣācaḥ

translations.griffith: On to the rite they move, the grass they scatter, these Soma-drinkers eloquent in synod.  Hither, for men to grasp, are brought the press-stones, far-thundering, famous, strong, that wait on heroes.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिन्द्र सरवितवा अपस कः परिष्ठिता अहिना शूर पूर्वीः तवद वावक्रे रथ्यो न धेना रेजन्ते विश्वा कर्त्रिमाणि भीषा |||
verses.transliteration: tvamindra sravitavā apas kaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ tvad vāvakre rathyo na dhenā rejante viśvā kṛtrimāṇi bhīṣā

translations.griffith: Indra, thou settest free the many waters that were encompassed, Hero, by the Dragon.  Down rolled, as if on chariots borne, the rivers: through fear of thee all things created tremble.

verses.sanskrit: भीमो विवेषायुधेभिरेषामपांसि विश्वा नर्याणि विद्वान इन्द्रः पुरो जर्ह्र्षाणो वि दूधोद वि वज्रहस्तो महिनाजघान |||
verses.transliteration: bhīmo viveṣāyudhebhireṣāmapāṃsi viśvā naryāṇi vidvān indraḥ puro jarhṛṣāṇo vi dūdhod vi vajrahasto mahinājaghāna

translations.griffith: Skilled in all manly deeds the God terrific hath with his weapons mastered these opponents.  Indra in rapturous joy shook down their castles he slew them in his might, the Thunder-wielder.

verses.sanskrit: न यातव इन्द्र जूजुवुर्नो न वन्दना शविष्ठ वेद्याभिः स शर्धदर्यो विषुणस्य जन्तोर्मा शिश्नदेवा अपि गुरतं नः |||
verses.transliteration: na yātava indra jūjuvurno na vandanā śaviṣṭha vedyābhiḥ sa śardhadaryo viṣuṇasya jantormā śiśnadevā api ghurtaṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: No evil spirits have impelled us, Indra, nor fiends, O Mightiest God, with their devices.  Let our true God subdue the hostile rabble: let not the lewd approach our holy worship.

verses.sanskrit: अभि करत्वेन्द्र भूरध जमन न ते विव्यं महिमानं रजांसि सवेना हि वर्त्रं शवसा जघन्थ न शत्रुरन्तंविविदद युधा ते |||
verses.transliteration: abhi kratvendra bhūradha jman na te vivyaṃ mahimānaṃ rajāṃsi svenā hi vṛtraṃ śavasā jaghantha na śatrurantaṃvividad yudhā te

translations.griffith: Thou in thy strength surpassest Earth and Heaven: the regions comprehend not all thy greatness.  With thine own power and might thou slewest Vṛtra: no foe hath found the end of thee in battle.

verses.sanskrit: देवाश्चित ते असुर्याय पूर्वे.अनु कषत्राय ममिरे सहांसि इन्द्रो मघानि दयते विषह्येन्द्रं वाजस्य जोहुवन्त सातौ |||
verses.transliteration: devāścit te asuryāya pūrve.anu kṣatrāya mamire sahāṃsi indro maghāni dayate viṣahyendraṃ vājasya johuvanta sātau

translations.griffith: Even the earlier Deities submitted their powers to thy supreme divine dominion.  Indra wins wealth and deals it out to other's: men in the strife for booty call on Indra.

verses.sanskrit: कीरिश्चिद धि तवामवसे जुहावेशानमिन्द्र सौभगस्य भूरेः अवो बभूथ शतमूते अस्मे अभिक्षत्तुस्त्वावतो वरूता |||
verses.transliteration: kīriścid dhi tvāmavase juhāveśānamindra saubhaghasya bhūreḥ avo babhūtha śatamūte asme abhikṣattustvāvato varūtā

translations.griffith: The humble hath invoked thee for protection, thee, Lord of great felicity, O Indra.  Thou with a hundred aids hast been our Helper: one who brings gifts like thee hath his defender.

verses.sanskrit: सखायस्त इन्द्र विश्वह सयाम नमोव्र्धासो महिना तरुत्र वन्वन्तु समा ते.अवसा समीके.अभीतिमर्यो वनुषां शवांसि |||
verses.transliteration: sakhāyasta indra viśvaha syāma namovṛdhāso mahinā tarutra vanvantu smā te.avasā samīke.abhītimaryo vanuṣāṃ śavāṃsi

translations.griffith: May we, O Indra, be thy friends for ever, eagerly, Conqueror, yielding greater homage.  May, through thy grace, the strength of us who battle quell in the shock the onset of the foeman.

verses.sanskrit: स न इन्द्र तवयताया ... ||
verses.transliteration: sa na indra tvayatāyā ...

translations.griffith: Place us by food which thou hast given, O Indra, us and the wealthy patrons who command us.  Let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पिबा सोममिन्द्र मन्दतु तवा यं ते सुषाव हर्यश्वाद्रिः सोतुर्बाहुभ्यां सुयतो नार्वा |||
verses.transliteration: pibā somamindra mandatu tvā yaṃ te suṣāva haryaśvādriḥ soturbāhubhyāṃ suyato nārvā

translations.griffith: DRINK Soma, Lord of Bays, and let it cheer thee: Indra, the stone, like a well guided courser,  Directed by the presser's arms hath pressed it.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते मदो युज्यश्चारुरस्ति येन वर्त्राणि हर्यश्व हंसि स तवामिन्द्र परभूवसो ममत्तु |||
verses.transliteration: yaste mado yujyaścārurasti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi sa tvāmindra prabhūvaso mamattu

translations.griffith: So let the draught of joy, thy dear companion, by which, O Lord of Bays, thou slayest foemen,  Delight thee, Indra, Lord of princely treasures.

verses.sanskrit: बोधा सु मे मघवन वाचमेमां यां ते वसिष्ठो अर्चतिप्रशस्तिम इमा बरह्म सधमादे जुषस्व |||
verses.transliteration: bodhā su me maghavan vācamemāṃ yāṃ te vasiṣṭho arcatipraśastim imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva

translations.griffith: Mark closely, Maghavan, the words I utter, this eulogy recited by Vasiṣṭha:  Accept the prayers I offer at thy banquet.

verses.sanskrit: शरुधी हवं विपिपानस्याद्रेर्बोधा विप्रस्यार्चतो मनीषाम कर्ष्वा दुवांस्यन्तमा सचेमा |||
verses.transliteration: śrudhī havaṃ vipipānasyādrerbodhā viprasyārcato manīṣām kṛṣvā duvāṃsyantamā sacemā

translations.griffith: Hear thou the call of the juice-drinking press-stone: hear thou the Brahman's hymn who sings and lauds thee.  Take to thine inmost self these adorations.

verses.sanskrit: न ते गिरो अपि मर्ष्ये तुरस्य न सुष्टुतिमसुर्यस्य विद्वान सदा ते नाम सवयशो विवक्मि |||
verses.transliteration: na te ghiro api mṛṣye turasya na suṣṭutimasuryasya vidvān sadā te nāma svayaśo vivakmi

translations.griffith: I know and ne’er forget the hymns and praises of thee, the Conqueror, and thy strength immortal.  Thy name I ever utter. Self-Refulgent

verses.sanskrit: भूरि हि ते सवना मानुषेषु भूरि मनीषी हवते तवामित मारे अस्मन मघवञ जयोक कः |||
verses.transliteration: bhūri hi te savanā mānuṣeṣu bhūri manīṣī havate tvāmit māre asman maghavañ jyok kaḥ

translations.griffith: Among mankind many are thy libations, and many a time the pious sageinvokes thee.  O Maghavan, be not long distant from us.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्येदिमा सवना शूर विश्वा तुभ्यं बरह्माणि वर्धना कर्णोमि तवं नर्भिर्हव्यो विश्वधासि |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyedimā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyaṃ brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi tvaṃ nṛbhirhavyo viśvadhāsi

translations.griffith: All these libations are for thee, O Hero: to thee I offer these my prayers. that strengthen.  Ever, in every place, must men invoke thee.

verses.sanskrit: नू चिन नु ते मन्यमानस्य दस्मोदश्नुवन्ति महिमानमुग्र न वीर्यमिन्द्र ते न राधः |||
verses.transliteration: nū cin nu te manyamānasya dasmodaśnuvanti mahimānamughra na vīryamindra te na rādhaḥ

translations.griffith: Never do men attain, O Wonder-Worker, thy greatness, Mighty One, who must be lauded,  Nor, Indra, thine heroic power and bounty.

verses.sanskrit: ये च पूर्व रषयो ये च नूत्ना इन्द्र बरह्माणि जनयन्त विप्राः अस्मे ते सन्तु सख्या शिवानि यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: ye ca pūrva ṛṣayo ye ca nūtnā indra brahmāṇi janayanta viprāḥ asme te santu sakhyā śivāni yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Among all Ṛṣis, Indra, old and recent, who have engendered hymns as sacred singers,  Even with us be thine auspicious friendships. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: उदु बरह्माण्यैरत शरवस्येन्द्रं समर्ये महया वसिष्ठ आ यो विश्वानि शवसा ततानोपश्रोता म ईवतो वचांसि |||
verses.transliteration: udu brahmāṇyairata śravasyendraṃ samarye mahayā vasiṣṭha ā yo viśvāni śavasā tatānopaśrotā ma īvato vacāṃsi

translations.griffith: PRAYERS have been offered up through love of glory: Vasiṣṭha, honour Indra in the battle.  He who with might extends through all existence hears words which I, his faithful servant, utter.

verses.sanskrit: अयामि घोष इन्द्र देवजामिरिरज्यन्त यच्छुरुधो विवाचि नहि सवमायुश्चिकिते जनेषु तानीदंहांस्यति पर्ष्यस्मान |||
verses.transliteration: ayāmi ghoṣa indra devajāmirirajyanta yacchurudho vivāci nahi svamāyuścikite janeṣu tānīdaṃhāṃsyati parṣyasmān

translations.griffith: A cry was raised which reached the Gods, O Indra, a cry to them to send us strength in combat.  None among men knows his own life's duration: bear us in safety over these our troubles.

verses.sanskrit: युजे रथं गवेषणं हरिभ्यामुप बरह्माणि जुजुषाणमस्थुः वि बाधिष्ट सय रोदसी महित्वेन्द्रो वर्त्राण्यप्रती जघन्वान |||
verses.transliteration: yuje rathaṃ ghaveṣaṇaṃ haribhyāmupa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇamasthuḥ vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvendro vṛtrāṇyapratī jaghanvān

translations.griffith: The Bays, the booty-seeking car I harness: my prayers have reached him who accepts them gladly.  Indra, when he had slain resistless foemen, forced with his might the two world-halves asunder.

verses.sanskrit: आपश्चित पिप्यु सतर्यो न गावो नक्षन्न्र्तं जरितारस्त इन्द्र याहि वायुर्न नियुतो न अछा तवं हि धीभिर्दयसे वि वाजान |||
verses.transliteration: āpaścit pipyu staryo na ghāvo nakṣannṛtaṃ jaritārasta indra yāhi vāyurna niyuto na achā tvaṃ hi dhībhirdayase vi vājān

translations.griffith: Like barren cows, moreover, swelled the waters: the singen sought thy holy rite, O Indra.  Come unto us as with his team comes Vāyu: thou, through our solemn hymns bestowest booty.

verses.sanskrit: ते तवा मदा इन्द्र मादयन्तु शुष्मिणं तुविराधसं जरित्रे एको देवत्रा दयसे हि मर्तानस्मिञ्छूर सवने मादयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: te tvā madā indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇaṃ tuvirādhasaṃ jaritre eko devatrā dayase hi martānasmiñchūra savane mādayasva

translations.griffith: So may these gladdening draughts rejoice thee, Indra, the Mighty, very bounteous to the singer.  Alone among the Gods thou pitiest mortals: O Hero, make thee glad at this libation.

verses.sanskrit: एवेदिन्द्रं वर्षणं वज्रबाहुं वसिष्ठासो अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः स न सतुतो वीरवत पातु गोमद यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: evedindraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhuṃ vasiṣṭhāso abhyarcantyarkaiḥ sa na stuto vīravat pātu ghomad yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Thus the Vasisthas glorify with praises Indra, the Powerful whose arm wields thunder.  Praised, may he guard our wealth in kine and heroes. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: योनिष ट इन्द्र सदने अकारि तमा नर्भिः पुरुहूत पर याहि असो यथा नो.अविता वर्धे च ददो वसूनि ममदश्च सोमैः |||
verses.transliteration: yoniṣ ṭa indra sadane akāri tamā nṛbhiḥ puruhūta pra yāhi aso yathā no.avitā vṛdhe ca dado vasūni mamadaśca somaiḥ

translations.griffith: A HOME is made for thee to dwell in, Indra: O Much-invoked, go thitherwith the heroes.  That thou, to prosper us, mayst be our Helper, vouchsafe us wealth, rejoice with draughts of Soma.

verses.sanskrit: गर्भीतं ते मन इन्द्र दविबर्हाः सुतः सोमः परिषिक्ता मधूनि विस्र्ष्टधेना भरते सुव्र्क्तिरियमिन्द्रं जोहुवती मनीषा |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛbhītaṃ te mana indra dvibarhāḥ sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni visṛṣṭadhenā bharate suvṛktiriyamindraṃ johuvatī manīṣā

translations.griffith: Indra, thy wish, twice-strong, is comprehended: pressed is the Soma, poured are pleasant juices.  This hymn of praise, from loosened tongue, made perfect, draws Indra to itself with loud invoking.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो दिव आ पर्थिव्या रजीषिन्निदं बर्हिः सोमपेयाय याहि वहन्तु तवा हरयो मद्र्यञ्चमाङगूषमछा तवसं मदाय |||
verses.transliteration: ā no diva ā pṛthivyā ṛjīṣinnidaṃ barhiḥ somapeyāya yāhi vahantu tvā harayo madryañcamāṅghūṣamachā tavasaṃ madāya

translations.griffith: Come, thou Impetuous; God, from earth or heaven; come to our holy grass to drink the Soma.  Hither to me let thy Bay Horses bring thee to listen to our hymns and make thee joyful.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः सजोषा बरह्म जुषाणो हर्यश्वयाहि वरीव्र्जत सथविरेभिः सुशिप्रास्मे दधद वर्षणं शुष्ममिन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: ā no viśvābhirūtibhiḥ sajoṣā brahma juṣāṇo haryaśvayāhi varīvṛjat sthavirebhiḥ suśiprāsme dadhad vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmamindra

translations.griffith: Come unto us with all thine aids, accordant, Lord of Bay Steeds, accepting our devotions,  Fair-helmeted, o’ercoming with the mighty, and lending us the strength of bulls, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: एष सतोमो मह उग्राय वाहे धुरीवात्यो न वाजयन्नधायि इन्द्र तवायमर्क ईट्टे वसूनां दिवीव दयामधि नः शरोमतं धाः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa stomo maha ughrāya vāhe dhurīvātyo na vājayannadhāyi indra tvāyamarka īṭṭe vasūnāṃ divīva dyāmadhi naḥ śromataṃ dhāḥ

translations.griffith: As to the chariot pole a vigorous courser, this laud is brought to the great strong Upholder.  This hymn solicits wealth of thee: in heaven, as ’twere above the sky, set thou our glory.

verses.sanskrit: एवा न इन्द्र वार्यस्य पूर्धि पर ते महीं सुमतिं वेविदाम इषं पिन्व मघवद्भ्यः सुवीरां यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: evā na indra vāryasya pūrdhi pra te mahīṃ sumatiṃ vevidāma iṣaṃ pinva maghavadbhyaḥ suvīrāṃ yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: With precious things. O Indra, thus content us: may we attain to thine exalted favour.  Send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते मह इन्द्रोतयुग्र समन्यवो यत समरन्त सेनाः पताति दिद्युन नर्यस्य बाह्वोर्मा ते मनो विष्वद्र्यग वि चारीत |||
verses.transliteration: ā te maha indrotyughra samanyavo yat samaranta senāḥ patāti didyun naryasya bāhvormā te mano viṣvadryagh vi cārīt

translations.griffith: WHEN with thy mighty help, O potent Indra, the armies rush together in their fury.  When from the strong man's arm the lightning flieth, let not the mind go forth to side with others.

verses.sanskrit: नि दुर्ग इन्द्र शनथिह्यमित्रानभि ये नो मर्तासो अमन्ति आरे तं शंसं कर्णुहि निनित्सोरा नो भर सम्भरणं वसूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ni durgha indra śnathihyamitrānabhi ye no martāso amanti āre taṃ śaṃsaṃ kṛṇuhi ninitsorā no bhara sambharaṇaṃ vasūnām

translations.griffith: O Indra, where the ground is hard to traverse, smite down our foes, the mortals who assail us,  Keep far from us the curse of the reviler: bring us accumulated store of treasures.

verses.sanskrit: शतं ते शिप्रिन्नूतयः सुदासे सहस्रं शंसा उत रातिरस्तु जहि वधर्वनुषो मर्त्यस्यास्मे दयुम्नमधि रत्नं च धेहि |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ te śiprinnūtayaḥ sudāse sahasraṃ śaṃsā uta rātirastu jahi vadharvanuṣo martyasyāsme dyumnamadhi ratnaṃ ca dhehi

translations.griffith: God of the fair helm, give Sudās a hundred succours, a thousand blessings, and thy bounty.  Strike down the weapon of our mortal foeman: bestow upon us splendid fame and riches.

verses.sanskrit: तवावतो हीन्द्र करत्वे अस्मि तवावतो.अवितुः शूर रातौ विश्वेदहानि तविषीव उग्रनोकः कर्णुष्व हरिवो न मर्धीः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāvato hīndra kratve asmi tvāvato.avituḥ śūra rātau viśvedahāni taviṣīva ughranokaḥ kṛṇuṣva harivo na mardhīḥ

translations.griffith: I wait the power of one like thee, O Indra, gifts of a Helper such as thou art, Hero.  Strong, Mighty God, dwell with me now and ever: Lord of Bay Horses, do not thou desert us.

verses.sanskrit: कुत्सा एते हर्यश्वाय शूषमिन्द्रे सहो देवजूतमियानाः सत्रा कर्धि सुहना शूर वर्त्रा वयं तरुत्राः सनुयाम वाजम |||
verses.transliteration: kutsā ete haryaśvāya śūṣamindre saho devajūtamiyānāḥ satrā kṛdhi suhanā śūra vṛtrā vayaṃ tarutrāḥ sanuyāma vājam

translations.griffith: Here are the Kutsas supplicating Indra for might, the Lord of Bays for God-sent conquest.  Make our foes ever easy to be vanquished: may we, victorious, win the spoil, O Hero.

verses.sanskrit: एवा न इन्द्र वार्यस्य ... ||
verses.transliteration: evā na indra vāryasya ...

translations.griffith: With precious things, O Indra, thus content us: may we attain to thine exalted favour.  Send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: न सोम इन्द्रमसुतो ममाद नाब्रह्माणो मघवानं सुतासः तस्मा उक्थं जनये यज्जुजोषन नर्वन नवीयः शर्णवद यथा नः |||
verses.transliteration: na soma indramasuto mamāda nābrahmāṇo maghavānaṃ sutāsaḥ tasmā ukthaṃ janaye yajjujoṣan nṛvan navīyaḥ śṛṇavad yathā naḥ

translations.griffith: SOMA unpressed ne’er gladdened liberal Indra, no juices pressed without a prayer have pleased him.  I generate a laud that shall delight him, new and heroic, so that he may hear us.

verses.sanskrit: उक्थ-उक्थे सोम इन्द्रं ममाद नीथे-नीथे मघवानं सुतासः यदीं सबाधः पितरं न पुत्राः समानदक्षा अवसे हवन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: uktha-ukthe soma indraṃ mamāda nīthe-nīthe maghavānaṃ sutāsaḥ yadīṃ sabādhaḥ pitaraṃ na putrāḥ samānadakṣā avase havante

translations.griffith: At every laud the Soma gladdens Indra: pressed juices please him as each psalm is chanted,  What time the priests with one united effort call him to aid, as sons invoke their father.

verses.sanskrit: चकार ता कर्णवन नूनमन्या यानि बरुवन्ति वेधसः सुतेषु जनीरिव पतिरेकः समानो नि माम्र्जे पुर इन्द्रःसु सर्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: cakāra tā kṛṇavan nūnamanyā yāni bruvanti vedhasaḥ suteṣu janīriva patirekaḥ samāno ni māmṛje pura indraḥsu sarvāḥ

translations.griffith: These deeds he did; let him achieve new exploits, such as the priests declare at their libations.  Indra hath taken and possessed all castles, like as one common husband doth his spouses.

verses.sanskrit: एवा तमाहुरुत शर्ण्व इन्द्र एको विभक्ता तरणिर्मघानाम मिथस्तुर ऊतयो यस्य पूर्वीरस्मे भद्राणि सश्चतप्रियाणि |||
verses.transliteration: evā tamāhuruta śṛṇva indra eko vibhaktā taraṇirmaghānām mithastura ūtayo yasya pūrvīrasme bhadrāṇi saścatapriyāṇi

translations.griffith: Even thus have they declared him. Famed is Indra as Conqueror, sole distributer of treasures;  Whose many succours come in close succession. May dear delightful benefits attend us.

verses.sanskrit: एवा वसिष्ठ इन्द्रमूतये नॄन कर्ष्टीनां वर्षभं सुते गर्णाति सहस्रिण उप नो माहि वाजान यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: evā vasiṣṭha indramūtaye nṝn kṛṣṭīnāṃ vṛṣabhaṃ sute ghṛṇāti sahasriṇa upa no māhi vājān yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Thus, to bring help to men, Vasiṣṭha laudeth Indra, the peoples' Hero, at libation.  Bestow upon us strength and wealth in thousands. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं नरो नेमधिता हवन्ते यत पार्या युनजते धियस्ताः शूरो नर्षाता शवसश्चकान आ गोमति वरजे भजात्वं नः |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ naro nemadhitā havante yat pāryā yunajate dhiyastāḥ śūro nṛṣātā śavasaścakāna ā ghomati vraje bhajātvaṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: MEN call on Indra in the armed encounter that he may make the hymns they sing decisive.  Hero, rejoicing in thy might, in combat give us a portion of the stall of cattle,

verses.sanskrit: य इन्द्र शुष्मो मघवन ते अस्ति शिक्षा सखिभ्यः पुरुहूतन्र्भ्यः तवं हि दर्ळ्हा मघवन विचेता अपा वर्धि परिव्र्तं न राधः |||
verses.transliteration: ya indra śuṣmo maghavan te asti śikṣā sakhibhyaḥ puruhūtanṛbhyaḥ tvaṃ hi dṛḷhā maghavan vicetā apā vṛdhi parivṛtaṃ na rādhaḥ

translations.griffith: Grant, Indra Maghavan, invoked of many, to these my friends the strength which thou possessest.  Thou, Maghavan, hast rent strong places open: unclose for us, Wise God, thy hidden bounty.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो राजा जगतश्चर्षणीनामधि कषमि विषुरूपं यदस्ति ततो ददाति दाशुषे वसूनि चोदद राध उपस्तुतश्चिदर्वाक |||
verses.transliteration: indro rājā jaghataścarṣaṇīnāmadhi kṣami viṣurūpaṃ yadasti tato dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codad rādha upastutaścidarvāk

translations.griffith: King of the living world, of men, is Indra, of all in varied form that earth containeth.  Thence to the worshipper he giveth riches: may he enrich us also when we laud him.

verses.sanskrit: नू चिन न इन्द्रो मघवा सहूती दानो वाजं नि यमते न ऊती अनूना यस्य दक्षिणा पीपाय वामं नर्भ्यो अभिवीता सखिभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: nū cin na indro maghavā sahūtī dāno vājaṃ ni yamate na ūtī anūnā yasya dakṣiṇā pīpāya vāmaṃ nṛbhyo abhivītā sakhibhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Maghavan Indra, when we all invoke him, bountiful ever sendeth strength to aid us:  Whose perfect guerdon, never failing, bringeth wealth to the men, to friends the thing they covet.

verses.sanskrit: नू इन्द्र राये वरिवस कर्धी न आ ते मनो वव्र्त्याम मघाय गोमदश्वावद रथवद वयन्तो यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: nū indra rāye varivas kṛdhī na ā te mano vavṛtyāma maghāya ghomadaśvāvad rathavad vyanto yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Quick, Indra, give us room and way to riches, and let us bring thy mind to grant us treasures,  That we may win us cars and Steeds and cattle. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मा ण इन्द्रोप याहि विद्वानर्वाञ्चस्ते हरयः सन्तु युक्ताः विश्वे चिद धि तवा विहवन्त मर्ता अस्माकमिच्छ्र्णुहि विश्वमिन्व |||
verses.transliteration: brahmā ṇa indropa yāhi vidvānarvāñcaste harayaḥ santu yuktāḥ viśve cid dhi tvā vihavanta martā asmākamicchṛṇuhi viśvaminva

translations.griffith: COME to our prayers, O Indra, thou who knowest: let thy Bay Steeds be yoked and guided hither.  Though mortal men on every side invoke thee, still give thine ear to us, O All-impeller.

verses.sanskrit: हवं त इन्द्र महिमा वयानड बरह्म यत पासि शवसिन्न्र्षीणाम आ यद वज्रं दधिषे हस्त उग्र घोरः सन करत्वा जनिष्ठा अषाळः |||
verses.transliteration: havaṃ ta indra mahimā vyānaḍ brahma yat pāsi śavasinnṛṣīṇām ā yad vajraṃ dadhiṣe hasta ughra ghoraḥ san kratvā janiṣṭhā aṣāḷaḥ

translations.griffith: Thy greatness reacheth to our invocation, the sages' prayer which, Potent God, thou guardest.  What time thy hand, O Mighty, holds the thunder, awful in strength thou hast become resistless.

verses.sanskrit: तव परणीतीन्द्र जोहुवानान सं यन नॄन न रोदसी निनेथ महे कषत्राय शवसे हि जज्ञे.अतूतुजिं चित तूतुजिरशिश्नत |||
verses.transliteration: tava praṇītīndra johuvānān saṃ yan nṝn na rodasī ninetha mahe kṣatrāya śavase hi jajñe.atūtujiṃ cit tūtujiraśiśnat

translations.griffith: What time thou drewest both world-halves together, like heroes led by thee who call each other-  For thou wast born for strength and high dominion-then e’en the active overthrew the sluggish.

verses.sanskrit: एभिर्न इन्द्राहभिर्दशस्य दुर्मित्रासो हि कषितयः पवन्ते परति यच्चष्टे अन्र्तमनेना अव दविता वरुणो मायीनः सात |||
verses.transliteration: ebhirna indrāhabhirdaśasya durmitrāso hi kṣitayaḥ pavante prati yaccaṣṭe anṛtamanenā ava dvitā varuṇo māyīnaḥ sāt

translations.griffith: Honour us in these present days, O Indra, for hostile men are making expiation.  Our sin that sinless Varuṇa discovered, the Wondrous-Wise hath long ago forgiven.

verses.sanskrit: वोचेमेदिन्द्रं मघवानमेनं महो रायो राधसो यद ददन्नः यो अर्चतो बरह्मक्र्तिमविष्ठो यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: vocemedindraṃ maghavānamenaṃ maho rāyo rādhaso yad dadannaḥ yo arcato brahmakṛtimaviṣṭho yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra, that he may grant us gifts of ample riches,  Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सोम इन्द्र तुभ्यं सुन्व आ तु पर याहि हरिवस्तदोकाः पिबा तवस्य सुषुतस्य चारोर्ददो मघानि मघवन्नियानः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ soma indra tubhyaṃ sunva ā tu pra yāhi harivastadokāḥ pibā tvasya suṣutasya cārordado maghāni maghavanniyānaḥ

translations.griffith: THIS Soma hath been pressed for thee, O Indra: come hither, Lord of Bays, for this thou lovest.  Drink of this fair, this well-effused libation: Maghavan, give us wealth when we implore thee.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मन वीर बरह्मक्र्तिं जुषाणो.अर्वाचीनो हरिभिर्याहि तूयम अस्मिन्नू षु सवने मादयस्वोप बरह्माणि शर्णव इमा नः |||
verses.transliteration: brahman vīra brahmakṛtiṃ juṣāṇo.arvācīno haribhiryāhi tūyam asminnū ṣu savane mādayasvopa brahmāṇi śṛṇava imā naḥ

translations.griffith: Come to us quickly with thy Bay Steeds, Hero, come to our prayer, accepting our devotion.  Enjoy thyself aright at this libation, and listen thou unto the prayers we offer.

verses.sanskrit: का ते अस्त्यरंक्र्तिः सूक्तैः कदा नूनं ते मघवन दाशेम विश्वा मतीरा ततने तवायाधा म इन्द्र शर्णवो हवेमा |||
verses.transliteration: kā te astyaraṃkṛtiḥ sūktaiḥ kadā nūnaṃ te maghavan dāśema viśvā matīrā tatane tvāyādhā ma indra śṛṇavo havemā

translations.griffith: What satisfaction do our hymns afford thee? When, Maghavan? Now let us do thee service.  Hymns, only hymns, with love for thee, I weave thee: then hear, O Indra, these mine invocations.

verses.sanskrit: उतो घा ते पुरुष्या इदासन येषां पूर्वेषामश्र्णोरषीणाम अधाहं तवा मघवञ जोहवीमि तवं न इन्द्रासि परमतिः पितेव |||
verses.transliteration: uto ghā te puruṣyā idāsan yeṣāṃ pūrveṣāmaśṛṇorṣīṇām adhāhaṃ tvā maghavañ johavīmi tvaṃ na indrāsi pramatiḥ piteva

translations.griffith: They, verily, were also human beings whom thou wast wont to hear, those earlier sages.  Hence I, O Indra Maghavan, invoke thee: thou art our Providence, even as a Father.

verses.transliteration: vocemedindraṃ ...

translations.griffith: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra, that he may grant us gifts of ample riches,  Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो देव शवसा याहि शुष्मिन भवा वर्ध इन्द्र रायो अस्य महे नर्म्णाय नर्पते सुवज्र महि कषत्राय पौंस्याय शूर |||
verses.transliteration: ā no deva śavasā yāhi śuṣmin bhavā vṛdha indra rāyo asya mahe nṛmṇāya nṛpate suvajra mahi kṣatrāya pauṃsyāya śūra

translations.griffith: WITH power and strength, O Mighty God, approach us: be the augmenter, Indra, of these riches;  Strong Thunderer, Lord of men, for potent valour, for manly exploit and for high dominion.

verses.sanskrit: हवन्त उ तवा हव्यं विवाचि तनूषु शूराः सूर्यस्य सातौ तवं विश्वेषु सेन्यो जनेषु तवं वर्त्राणि रन्धया सुहन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: havanta u tvā havyaṃ vivāci tanūṣu śūrāḥ sūryasya sātau tvaṃ viśveṣu senyo janeṣu tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi randhayā suhantu

translations.griffith: Thee, worth invoking, in the din of battle, heroes invoke in fray for life and sunlight.  Among all people thou art foremost fighter: give up our enemies to easy slaughter.

verses.sanskrit: अहा यदिन्द्र सुदिना वयुछान दधो यत केतुमुपमं समत्सु नयग्निः सीददसुरो न होता हुवानो अत्र सुभगाय देवान |||
verses.transliteration: ahā yadindra sudinā vyuchān dadho yat ketumupamaṃ samatsu nyaghniḥ sīdadasuro na hotā huvāno atra subhaghāya devān

translations.griffith: When fair bright days shall dawn on us, O Indra, and thou shalt bring thy banner near in battle,  Agni the Asura shall sit as Herald, calling Gods hither for our great good fortune.

verses.sanskrit: वयं ते त इन्द्र ये च देव सतवन्त शूर ददतो मघानि यछा सूरिभ्य उपमं वरूथं सवाभुवो जरणामश्नवन्त |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ te ta indra ye ca deva stavanta śūra dadato maghāni yachā sūribhya upamaṃ varūthaṃ svābhuvo jaraṇāmaśnavanta

translations.griffith: Thine are we, Indra, thine, both these who praise thee, and those who give rich gifts, O God and Hero.  Grant to our princes excellent protection, may they wax old and still be strong and happy.

verses.transliteration: vocemedindraṃ ...

translations.griffith: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra that he may grant us gifts of ample riches:  Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर व इन्द्राय मादनं हर्यश्वाय गायत सखायः सोमपाव्ने |||
verses.transliteration: pra va indrāya mādanaṃ haryaśvāya ghāyata sakhāyaḥ somapāvne

translations.griffith: SING ye a song, to make him glad, to Indra, Lord of Tawny Steeds,  The Soma-drinker, O my friends.

verses.sanskrit: शंसेदुक्थं सुदानव उत दयुक्षं यथा नरः चक्र्मा सत्यराधसे |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃsedukthaṃ sudānava uta dyukṣaṃ yathā naraḥ cakṛmā satyarādhase

translations.griffith: To him the Bounteous say the laud, and let us glorify, as men May do, the Giver of true gifts.

verses.sanskrit: तवं न इन्द्र वाजयुस्त्वं गव्युः शतक्रतो तवं हिरण्ययुर्वसो |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indra vājayustvaṃ ghavyuḥ śatakrato tvaṃ hiraṇyayurvaso

translations.griffith: O Indra, Lord of boundless might, for us thou winnest strength and kine,  Thou winnest gold for us, Good Lord.

verses.sanskrit: वयमिन्द्र तवायवो.अभि पर णोनुमो वर्षन विद्धी तवस्य नो वसो |||
verses.transliteration: vayamindra tvāyavo.abhi pra ṇonumo vṛṣan viddhī tvasya no vaso

translations.griffith: Faithful to thee we loudly sing, heroic Indra, songs to thee: Mark, O Good Lord, this act of ours.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो निदे च वक्तवे.अर्यो रन्धीरराव्णे तवे अपि करतुर्मम |||
verses.transliteration: mā no nide ca vaktave.aryo randhīrarāvṇe tve api kraturmama

translations.griffith: Give us not up to man's reproach, to foeman's hateful calumny: In thee alone is all my strength.

verses.sanskrit: तवं वर्मासि सप्रथः पुरोयोधश्च वर्त्रहन तवया परतिब्रुवे युजा |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ varmāsi saprathaḥ puroyodhaśca vṛtrahan tvayā pratibruve yujā

translations.griffith: Thou art mine ample coat of mail, my Champion, Vṛtra-Slayer, thou:  With thee for Friend I brave the foe.

verses.sanskrit: महानुतासि यस्य ते.अनु सवधावरी सहः मम्नाते इन्द्ररोदसी |||
verses.transliteration: mahānutāsi yasya te.anu svadhāvarī sahaḥ mamnāte indrarodasī

translations.griffith: Yea, great art thou whose conquering might two independent Powers confess.  The Heaven, O India, and the Earth.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा मरुत्वती परि भुवद वाणी सयावरी नक्षमाणा सह दयुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā marutvatī pari bhuvad vāṇī sayāvarī nakṣamāṇā saha dyubhiḥ

translations.griffith: So let the voice surround thee, which attends the Maruts on their way,  Reaching thee with the rays of light.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वासस्त्वान्विन्दवो भुवन दस्ममुप दयवि सं ते नमन्त कर्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvāsastvānvindavo bhuvan dasmamupa dyavi saṃ te namanta kṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Let the ascending drops attain to thee, the Wondrous God, in heaven:  Let all the folk bow down to thee.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो महे महिव्र्धे भरध्वं परचेतसे पर सुमतिं कर्णुध्वम विशः पूर्वीः पर चरा चर्षणिप्राः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo mahe mahivṛdhe bharadhvaṃ pracetase pra sumatiṃ kṛṇudhvam viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra carā carṣaṇiprāḥ

translations.griffith: Bring to the Wise, the Great, who waxeth mighty, your offerings, and make ready your devotion;  To many clans he goeth, man's controller.

verses.sanskrit: उरुव्यचसे महिने सुव्र्क्तिमिन्द्राय बरह्म जनयन्त विप्राः तस्य वरतानि न मिनन्ति धीराः |||
verses.transliteration: uruvyacase mahine suvṛktimindrāya brahma janayanta viprāḥ tasya vratāni na minanti dhīrāḥ

translations.griffith: For Indra, the sublime, the far-pervading, have singers generated prayer and praises:  The sages never violate his statutes.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं वाणीरनुत्तमन्युमेव सत्रा राजानं दधिरे सहध्यै हर्यश्वाय बर्हया समापीन |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vāṇīranuttamanyumeva satrā rājānaṃ dadhire sahadhyai haryaśvāya barhayā samāpīn

translations.griffith: The choirs have stablished Indra King for ever, for victory, him whose anger is resistless:  And, for the Bays' Lord, strengthened those he loveth.

verses.sanskrit: मो षु तवा वाघतश्चनारे अस्मन नि रीरमन आरात्ताच्चित सधमादं न आ गहीह वा सन्नुप शरुधि |||
verses.transliteration: mo ṣu tvā vāghataścanāre asman ni rīraman ārāttāccit sadhamādaṃ na ā ghahīha vā sannupa śrudhi

translations.griffith: LET none, no, not thy worshippers, delay thee far away from us.  Even from far away come thou unto our feast, or listen if already here.

verses.sanskrit: इमे हि ते बरह्मक्र्तः सुते सचा मधौ न मक्ष आसते इन्द्रे कामं जरितारो वसूयवो रथे न पादमा दधुः |||
verses.transliteration: ime hi te brahmakṛtaḥ sute sacā madhau na makṣa āsate indre kāmaṃ jaritāro vasūyavo rathe na pādamā dadhuḥ

translations.griffith: For here, like flies on honey, these who pray to thee sit by the juice that they have poured.  Wealth-craving singers have on Indra set their hope, as men set foot upon a car.

verses.sanskrit: रायस्कामो वज्रहस्तं सुदक्षिणं पुत्रो न पितरं हुवे ||
verses.transliteration: rāyaskāmo vajrahastaṃ sudakṣiṇaṃ putro na pitaraṃ huve

translations.griffith: Longing for wealth I call on him, the Thunderer with the strong right hand,  As a son calleth on his sire.

verses.sanskrit: इम इन्द्राय सुन्विरे सोमासो दध्याशिरः ताना मदाय वज्रहस्त पीतये हरिभ्यां याह्योक आ |||
verses.transliteration: ima indrāya sunvire somāso dadhyāśiraḥ tānā madāya vajrahasta pītaye haribhyāṃ yāhyoka ā

translations.griffith: These Soma juices, mixed with curd, have been expressed for Indra here.  Come with thy Bay Steeds, Thunder-wielder, to our home, to drink them till they make thee glad.

verses.sanskrit: शरवच्छ्रुत्कर्ण ईयते वसूनां नू चिन नो मर्धिषद गिरः सद्यश्चिद यः सहस्राणि शता ददन नकिर्दित्सन्तमा मिनत |||
verses.transliteration: śravacchrutkarṇa īyate vasūnāṃ nū cin no mardhiṣad ghiraḥ sadyaścid yaḥ sahasrāṇi śatā dadan nakirditsantamā minat

translations.griffith: May he whose ear is open hear us. He is asked for wealth: will he despise our prayer?  Him who bestows at once a hundred thousand gifts none shall restrain when he would give.

verses.sanskrit: स वीरो अप्रतिष्कुत इन्द्रेण शूशुवे नर्भिः यस्ते गभीरा सवनानि वर्त्रहन सुनोत्या च धावति |||
verses.transliteration: sa vīro apratiṣkuta indreṇa śūśuve nṛbhiḥ yaste ghabhīrā savanāni vṛtrahan sunotyā ca dhāvati

translations.griffith: The hero never checked by men hath gained his strength through Indra, he  Who presses out and pours his deep libations forth, O Vṛtra-slayer, unto thee.

verses.sanskrit: भवा वरूथं मघवन मघोनां यत समजासि शर्धतः वि तवाहतस्य वेदनं भजेमह्या दूणाशो भरा गयम |||
verses.transliteration: bhavā varūthaṃ maghavan maghonāṃ yat samajāsi śardhataḥ vi tvāhatasya vedanaṃ bhajemahyā dūṇāśo bharā ghayam

translations.griffith: When thou dost drive the fighting men together be, thou Mighty One, the mighty's shield.  May we divide the wealth of him whom thou hast slain: bring us, Unreachable, his goods.

verses.sanskrit: सुनोता सोमपाव्ने सोममिन्द्राय वज्रिणे पचता पक्तीरवसे कर्णुध्वमित पर्णन्नित पर्णते मयः |||
verses.transliteration: sunotā somapāvne somamindrāya vajriṇe pacatā paktīravase kṛṇudhvamit pṛṇannit pṛṇate mayaḥ

translations.griffith: For Indra, Soma-drinker, armed with thunder, press the Soma juice.  Make ready your dressed meats: cause him to favour us. The Giver blesses him who gives.

verses.sanskrit: मा सरेधत सोमिनो दक्षता महे कर्णुध्वं राय आतुजे तरणिरिज्जयति कषेति पुष्यति न देवासः कवत्नवे |||
verses.transliteration: mā sredhata somino dakṣatā mahe kṛṇudhvaṃ rāya ātuje taraṇirijjayati kṣeti puṣyati na devāsaḥ kavatnave

translations.griffith: Grudge not, ye Soma pourers; stir you, pay the rites, for wealth, to the great Conqueror.  Only the active conquers dwells in peace, and thrives: not for the niggard are the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: नकिः सुदासो रथं पर्यास न रीरमत इन्द्रो यस्याविता यस्य मरुतो गमत स गोमति वरजे |||
verses.transliteration: nakiḥ sudāso rathaṃ paryāsa na rīramat indro yasyāvitā yasya maruto ghamat sa ghomati vraje

translations.griffith: No one hath overturned or stayed the car of him who freely gives.  The man whom Indra and the Marut host defend comes to a stable full of kine.

verses.sanskrit: गमद वाजं वाजयन्निन्द्र मर्त्यो यस्य तवमविता भुवः अस्माकं बोध्यविता रथानामस्माकं शूर नर्णाम |||
verses.transliteration: ghamad vājaṃ vājayannindra martyo yasya tvamavitā bhuvaḥ asmākaṃ bodhyavitā rathānāmasmākaṃ śūra nṛṇām

translations.griffith: Indra, that man when fighting shall obtain the spoil, whose strong defender thou wilt be.  Be thou the gracious helper, Hero I of our cars, be thou the helper of our men.

verses.sanskrit: उदिन नयस्य रिच्यते.अंशो धनं न जिग्युषः य इन्द्रोहरिवान न दभन्ति तं रिपो दक्षं दधाति सोमिनि |||
verses.transliteration: udin nyasya ricyate.aṃśo dhanaṃ na jighyuṣaḥ ya indroharivān na dabhanti taṃ ripo dakṣaṃ dadhāti somini

translations.griffith: His portion is exceeding great like a victorious soldier's spoil.  Him who is Indra, Lord of Bays, no foes subdue. He gives the Soma-pourer strength.

verses.sanskrit: मन्त्रमखर्वं सुधितं सुपेशसं दधात यज्ञियेष्वा पूर्वीश्चन परसितयस्तरन्ति तं य इन्द्रे कर्मणा भुवत |||
verses.transliteration: mantramakharvaṃ sudhitaṃ supeśasaṃ dadhāta yajñiyeṣvā pūrvīścana prasitayastaranti taṃ ya indre karmaṇā bhuvat

translations.griffith: Make for the Holy Gods a hymn that is not mean, but well-arranged and fair of form.  Even many snares and bonds subdue not him who dwells with Indra through his sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: कस्तमिन्द्र तवावसुमा मर्त्यो दधर्षति शरद्धा इत तेमघवन पार्ये दिवि वाजी वाजं सिषासति |||
verses.transliteration: kastamindra tvāvasumā martyo dadharṣati śraddhā it temaghavan pārye divi vājī vājaṃ siṣāsati

translations.griffith: Indra, what mortal will attack the man who hath his wealth in thee?  The strong will win the spoil on the decisive day through faith in thee, O Maghavan.

verses.sanskrit: मघोनः सम वर्त्रहत्येषु चोदय ये ददति परिया वसु तवप्रणीती हर्यश्व सूरिभिर्विश्वा तरेम दुरिता |||
verses.transliteration: maghonaḥ sma vṛtrahatyeṣu codaya ye dadati priyā vasu tavapraṇītī haryaśva sūribhirviśvā tarema duritā

translations.griffith: In battles with the foe urge on our mighty ones who give the treasures dear to thee,  And may we with our princes, Lord of Tawny Steeds! pass through all peril, led by thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवेदिन्द्रावमं वसु तवं पुष्यसि मध्यमम सत्रा विश्वस्य परमस्य राजसि नकिष टवा गोषु वर्ण्वते |||
verses.transliteration: tavedindrāvamaṃ vasu tvaṃ puṣyasi madhyamam satrā viśvasya paramasya rājasi nakiṣ ṭvā ghoṣu vṛṇvate

translations.griffith: Thine, Indra, is the lowest wealth, thou cherishest the mid-most wealth,  Thou ever rulest all the highest: in the fray for cattle none resisteth thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवं विश्वस्य धनदा असि शरुतो य ईं भवन्त्याजयः तवायं विश्वः पुरुहूत पार्थिवो.अवस्युर्नाम भिक्षते |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ viśvasya dhanadā asi śruto ya īṃ bhavantyājayaḥ tavāyaṃ viśvaḥ puruhūta pārthivo.avasyurnāma bhikṣate

translations.griffith: Thou art renowned as giving wealth to every one in all the battles that are fought.  Craving protection, all these people of the earth, O Much-invoked, implore thy name.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र यावतस्त्वमेतावदहमीशीय सतोतारमिद दिधिषेय रदावसो न पापत्वाय रासीय |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra yāvatastvametāvadahamīśīya stotāramid didhiṣeya radāvaso na pāpatvāya rāsīya

translations.griffith: If I, O Indra, were the Lord of riches ample as thine own,  I should support the singer, God. who givest wealth! and not abandon him to woe.

verses.sanskrit: शिक्षेयमिन महयते दिवे-दिवे राय आ कुहचिद्विदे नहि तवदन्यन मघवन न आप्यं वस्यो अस्ति पिता चन |||
verses.transliteration: śikṣeyamin mahayate dive-dive rāya ā kuhacidvide nahi tvadanyan maghavan na āpyaṃ vasyo asti pitā cana

translations.griffith: Each day would I enrich the man who sang my praise, in whatsoever place he were.  No kinship is there better, Maghavan, than thine: a father even is no more.

verses.sanskrit: तरणिरित सिषासति वाजं पुरन्ध्या युजा आ व इन्द्रम्पुरुहूतं नमे गिरा नेमिं तष्टेव सुद्र्वम |||
verses.transliteration: taraṇirit siṣāsati vājaṃ purandhyā yujā ā va indrampuruhūtaṃ name ghirā nemiṃ taṣṭeva sudrvam

translations.griffith: With Plenty for his true ally the active man will gain the spoil.  Your Indra, Much-invoked, I bend with song, as bends a wright his wheel of solid wood.

verses.sanskrit: न दुष्टुती मर्त्यो विन्दते वसु न सरेधन्तं रयिर्नशत सुशक्तिरिन मघवन तुभ्यं मावते देष्णं यत पार्ये दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: na duṣṭutī martyo vindate vasu na sredhantaṃ rayirnaśat suśaktirin maghavan tubhyaṃ māvate deṣṇaṃ yat pārye divi

translations.griffith: A moral wins no riches by unworthy praise: wealth comes not to the niggard churl.  Light is the task to give, O Maghavan, to one like me on the decisive day.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा शूर नोनुमो.अदुग्धा इव धेनवः ईशानमस्य जगतः सवर्द्र्शमीशानमिन्द्र तस्थुषः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā śūra nonumo.adughdhā iva dhenavaḥ īśānamasya jaghataḥ svardṛśamīśānamindra tasthuṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Like kine unmilked we call aloud, Hero, to thee, and sing thy praise,  Looker on heavenly light, Lord of this moving world, Lord, Indra, of what moveth not.

verses.sanskrit: न तवावानन्यो दिव्यो न पार्थिवो न जातो न जनिष्यते अश्वायन्तो मघवन्निन्द्र वाजिनो गव्यन्तस्त्वा हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: na tvāvānanyo divyo na pārthivo na jāto na janiṣyate aśvāyanto maghavannindra vājino ghavyantastvā havāmahe

translations.griffith: None other like to thee, of earth or of the heavens, hath been or ever will be born.  Desiring horses, Indra Maghavan! and kine, as men of might we call on thee.

verses.sanskrit: अभी षतस्तदा भरेन्द्र जयायः कनीयसः पुरूवसुर्हि मघवन सनादसि भरे-भरे च हव्यः |||
verses.transliteration: abhī ṣatastadā bharendra jyāyaḥ kanīyasaḥ purūvasurhi maghavan sanādasi bhare-bhare ca havyaḥ

translations.griffith: Bring, Indra, the Victorious Ones; bring, elder thou, the younger host.  For, Maghavan, thou art rich in treasures from of old, and must be called in every fight.

verses.sanskrit: परा णुदस्व मघवन्नमित्रान सुवेदा नो वसू कर्धि अस्माकं बोध्यविता महाधने भवा वर्धः सखीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: parā ṇudasva maghavannamitrān suvedā no vasū kṛdhi asmākaṃ bodhyavitā mahādhane bhavā vṛdhaḥ sakhīnām

translations.griffith: Drive thou away our enemies, O Maghavan: make riches easy to be won.  Be thou our good Protector in the strife for spoil: Cherisher of our friends be thou.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र करतुं न आ भर पिता पुत्रेभ्यो यथा शिक्षा णोस्मिन पुरुहूत यामनि जीवा जयोतिरशीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: indra kratuṃ na ā bhara pitā putrebhyo yathā śikṣā ṇoasmin puruhūta yāmani jīvā jyotiraśīmahi

translations.griffith: O Indra, give us wisdom as a sire gives wisdom to his sons.  Guide us, O Much-invoked, in this our way may we still live and look upon the light.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो अज्ञाता वर्जना दुराध्यो माशिवासो अव करमुः तवया वयं परवतः शश्वतीरपो.अति शूर तरामसि |||
verses.transliteration: mā no ajñātā vṛjanā durādhyo māśivāso ava kramuḥ tvayā vayaṃ pravataḥ śaśvatīrapo.ati śūra tarāmasi

translations.griffith: Grant that no mighty foes, unknown, malevolent, unhallowed, tread us to the ground.  With thine assistance, Hero, may we ass through all the waters that are rul`ng down.

verses.sanskrit: शवित्यञ्चो मा दक्षिणतस्कपर्दा धियंजिन्वासो अभि हि परमन्दुः उत्तिष्ठन वोचे परि बर्हिषो नॄन न मे दूरादवितवे वसिष्ठाः |||
verses.transliteration: śvityañco mā dakṣiṇataskapardā dhiyaṃjinvāso abhi hi pramanduḥ uttiṣṭhan voce pari barhiṣo nṝn na me dūrādavitave vasiṣṭhāḥ

translations.griffith: THESE who wear hair-knots on the right, the movers of holy thought, white-robed, have won me over.  I warned the men, when from the grass I raised me, Not from afar can my Vasisthas help you.

verses.sanskrit: दूरादिन्द्रमनयन्ना सुतेन तिरो वैशन्तमति पान्तमुग्रम पाशद्युम्नस्य वायतस्य सोमात सुतादिन्द्रो.अव्र्णीतावसिष्ठान |||
verses.transliteration: dūrādindramanayannā sutena tiro vaiśantamati pāntamughram pāśadyumnasya vāyatasya somāt sutādindro.avṛṇītāvasiṣṭhān

translations.griffith: With  Soma  they brought Indra from a distance, Over Vaisanta, from the strong libation.  Indra preferred Vasisthas to the Soma pressed by the son of Vayata, Pasadyumna.

verses.sanskrit: एवेन नु कं सिन्धुमेभिस्ततारेवेन नु कं भेदमेभिर्जघान एवेन नु कं दाशराज्ञे सुदासं परावदिन्द्रो बरह्मणा वो वसिष्ठाः |||
verses.transliteration: even nu kaṃ sindhumebhistatāreven nu kaṃ bhedamebhirjaghāna even nu kaṃ dāśarājñe sudāsaṃ prāvadindro brahmaṇā vo vasiṣṭhāḥ

translations.griffith: So, verily, with these he crossed the river, in company with these he slaughtered Bheda.  So in the fight with the Ten Kings, Vasisthas! did Indra help Sudās through your devotions.

verses.sanskrit: जुष्टी नरो बरह्मणा वः पितॄणामक्षमव्ययं न किला रिषाथ यच्छक्वरीषु बर्हता रवेणेन्द्रे शुष्ममदधाता वसिष्ठाः |||
verses.transliteration: juṣṭī naro brahmaṇā vaḥ pitṝṇāmakṣamavyayaṃ na kilā riṣātha yacchakvarīṣu bṛhatā raveṇendre śuṣmamadadhātā vasiṣṭhāḥ

translations.griffith: I gladly, men I with prayer prayed by our fathers have fixed your axle: ye shall not be injured:  Since, when ye sang aloud the Sakvari verses, Vasisthas! ye invigorated Indra.

verses.sanskrit: उद दयामिवेत तर्ष्णजो नाथितासो.अदीधयुर्दाशराज्ञे वर्तासः वसिष्ठस्य सतुवत इन्द्रो अश्रोदुरुं तर्त्सुभ्यो अक्र्णोदु लोकम |||
verses.transliteration: ud dyāmivet tṛṣṇajo nāthitāso.adīdhayurdāśarājñe vṛtāsaḥ vasiṣṭhasya stuvata indro aśroduruṃ tṛtsubhyo akṛṇodu lokam

translations.griffith: Like thirsty men they looked to heaven, in battle with the Ten Kings, surrounded and imploring.  Then Indra heard Vasiṣṭha as he praised him, and gave the Trtsus ample room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit: दण्डा इवेद गोजनास आसन परिछिन्ना भरता अर्भकासः अभवच्च पुरेता वसिष्ठ आदित तर्त्सूनां विशो अप्रथन्त |||
verses.transliteration: daṇḍā ived ghoajanāsa āsan parichinnā bharatā arbhakāsaḥ abhavacca puraetā vasiṣṭha ādit tṛtsūnāṃ viśo aprathanta

translations.griffith: Like sticks and staves wherewith they drive the cattle, Stripped bare, the Bharatas were found defenceless:  Vasiṣṭha then became their chief and leader: then widely. were the Trtsus' clans extended.

verses.sanskrit: तरयः कर्ण्वन्ति भुवनेषु रेतस्तिस्रः परजा आर्या जयोतिरग्राः तरयो घर्मास उषसं सचन्ते सर्वानित ताननुविदुर्वसिष्ठाः |||
verses.transliteration: trayaḥ kṛṇvanti bhuvaneṣu retastisraḥ prajā āryā jyotiraghrāḥ trayo gharmāsa uṣasaṃ sacante sarvānit tānanuvidurvasiṣṭhāḥ

translations.griffith: Three fertilize the worlds with genial moisture: three noble Creatures cast a light before them.  Three that give warmth to all attend the morning. All these have they discovered, these Vasisthas.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्यस्येव वक्षथो जयोतिरेषां समुद्रस्येव महिमा गभीरः वातस्येव परजवो नान्येन सतोमो वसिष्ठा अन्वेतवे वः |||
verses.transliteration: sūryasyeva vakṣatho jyotireṣāṃ samudrasyeva mahimā ghabhīraḥ vātasyeva prajavo nānyena stomo vasiṣṭhā anvetave vaḥ

translations.griffith: Like the Sun's growing glory is their splendour, and like the sea's is their unflathomed greatness.  Their course is like the wind's. Your laud, Vasisthas, can never be attained by any other.

verses.sanskrit: त इन निण्यं हर्दयस्य परकेतैः सहस्रवल्शमभि संचरन्ति यमेन ततं परिधिं वयन्तो.अप्सरस उप सेदुर्वसिष्ठाः |||
verses.transliteration: ta in niṇyaṃ hṛdayasya praketaiḥ sahasravalśamabhi saṃcaranti yamena tataṃ paridhiṃ vayanto.apsarasa upa sedurvasiṣṭhāḥ

translations.griffith: They with perceptions of the heart in secret resort to that which spreads a thousand branches.  The Apsaras brought hither the Vasisthas wearing the vesture spun for them by Yama.

verses.sanskrit: विद्युतो जयोतिः परि संजिहानं मित्रावरुणा यदपश्यतां तवा तत ते जन्मोतैकं वसिष्ठागस्त्यो यत तवा विशाजभार |||
verses.transliteration: vidyuto jyotiḥ pari saṃjihānaṃ mitrāvaruṇā yadapaśyatāṃ tvā tat te janmotaikaṃ vasiṣṭhāghastyo yat tvā viśaājabhāra

translations.griffith: A form of lustre springing from the lightning wast thou, when Varuṇa and Mitra saw thee.  Tliy one and only birth was then, Vasiṣṭha, when from thy stock Agastya brought thee hither.

verses.sanskrit: उतासि मैत्रावरुणो वसिष्ठोर्वश्या बरह्मन मनसो.अधि जातः दरप्सं सकन्नं बरह्मणा दैव्येन विश्वे देवाः पुष्करे तवाददन्त |||
verses.transliteration: utāsi maitrāvaruṇo vasiṣṭhorvaśyā brahman manaso.adhi jātaḥ drapsaṃ skannaṃ brahmaṇā daivyena viśve devāḥ puṣkare tvādadanta

translations.griffith: Born of their love for Urvasi, Vasiṣṭha thou, priest, art son of Varuṇa and Mitra;  And as a fallen drop, in heavenly fervour, all the Gods laid thee on a lotus-blossorn.

verses.sanskrit: स परकेत उभयस्य परविद्वान सहस्रदान उत वा सदानः यमेन ततं परिधिं वयिष्यन्नप्सरसः परि जज्ञे वसिष्ठः |||
verses.transliteration: sa praketa ubhayasya pravidvān sahasradāna uta vā sadānaḥ yamena tataṃ paridhiṃ vayiṣyannapsarasaḥ pari jajñe vasiṣṭhaḥ

translations.griffith: He thinker, knower both of earth and heaven, endowed with many a gift, bestowing thousands,  Destined to wear the vesture spun by Yama, sprang from the Apsaras to life, Vasiṣṭha.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रे ह जाताविषिता नमोभिः कुम्भे रेतः सिषिचतुः समानम ततो ह मान उदियाय मध्यात ततो जातं रषिमाहुर्वसिष्ठम |||
verses.transliteration: satre ha jātāviṣitā namobhiḥ kumbhe retaḥ siṣicatuḥ samānam tato ha māna udiyāya madhyāt tato jātaṃ ṛṣimāhurvasiṣṭham

translations.griffith: Born at the sacrifice, urged by adorations, both with a common flow bedewed the pitcher.  Then from the midst thereof there rose up Māna, and thence they say was born the sage Vasiṣṭha.

verses.sanskrit: उक्थभ्र्तं सामभ्र्तं बिभर्ति गरावाणं बिभ्रत पर वदात्यग्रे उपैनमाध्वं सुमनस्यमाना आ वो गछाति परत्र्दो वसिष्ठः |||
verses.transliteration: ukthabhṛtaṃ sāmabhṛtaṃ bibharti ghrāvāṇaṃ bibhrat pra vadātyaghre upainamādhvaṃ sumanasyamānā ā vo ghachāti pratṛdo vasiṣṭhaḥ

translations.griffith: He brings the bearer of the laud and Sāman: first shall he speak bringing the stone for pressing.  With grateful hearts in reverence approach him: to you, O Pratrdas, Vasiṣṭha cometh.

verses.sanskrit: पर शुक्रैतु देवी मनीषा अस्मत सुतष्टो रथो न वाजी ||
verses.transliteration: pra śukraitu devī manīṣā asmat sutaṣṭo ratho na vājī

translations.griffith: MAY our divine and brilliant hymn go forth, like a swift chariot wrought and fashioned well.

verses.sanskrit: विदुः पर्थिव्या दिवो जनित्रं शर्ण्वन्त्यापो अध कषरन्तीः ||
verses.transliteration: viduḥ pṛthivyā divo janitraṃ śṛṇvantyāpo adha kṣarantīḥ

translations.griffith: The waters listen as they flow along: they know the origin of heaven and earth.

verses.sanskrit: आपश्चिदस्मै पिन्वन्त पर्थ्वीर्व्र्त्रेषु शूरा मंसन्त उग्राः ||
verses.transliteration: āpaścidasmai pinvanta pṛthvīrvṛtreṣu śūrā maṃsanta ughrāḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, the broad waters swell their flood ior him: of him strong heroes think amid their foes.

verses.sanskrit: आ धूर्ष्वस्मै दधाताश्वानिन्द्रो न वज्री हिरण्यबाहुः ||
verses.transliteration: ā dhūrṣvasmai dadhātāśvānindro na vajrī hiraṇyabāhuḥ

translations.griffith: Set ye for him the coursers to the pole: like Indra Thunderer is the Golden-armed.

verses.sanskrit: अभि पर सथाताहेव यज्ञं यातेव पत्मन तमना हिनोत ||
verses.transliteration: abhi pra sthātāheva yajñaṃ yāteva patman tmanā hinota

translations.griffith: Arouse you, like the days, to sacrifice speed gladly like a traveller on the way.

verses.sanskrit: तमना समत्सु हिनोत यज्ञं दधात केतुं जनाय वीरम ||
verses.transliteration: tmanā samatsu hinota yajñaṃ dadhāta ketuṃ janāya vīram

translations.griffith: Go swift to battles, to the sacrifice: set up a flag, a hero for the folk.

verses.sanskrit: उदस्य शुष्माद भानुर्नार्त बिभर्ति भारं पर्थिवी नभूम ||
verses.transliteration: udasya śuṣmād bhānurnārta bibharti bhāraṃ pṛthivī nabhūma

translations.griffith: Up from his strength hath risen as ’twere a light: it bears the load as earth bears living things.

verses.sanskrit: हवयामि देवानयातुरग्ने साधन्न्र्तेन धियं दधामि ||
verses.transliteration: hvayāmi devānayāturaghne sādhannṛtena dhiyaṃ dadhāmi

translations.griffith: Agni, no demon I invoke the Gods: by law completing it, I form a hymn.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वो देवीं धियं दधिध्वं पर वो देवत्रा वाचं कर्णुध्वम ||
verses.transliteration: abhi vo devīṃ dhiyaṃ dadhidhvaṃ pra vo devatrā vācaṃ kṛṇudhvam

translations.griffith: Closely albout you lay your heavenly song, and send your voice to where the Gods abide.

verses.sanskrit: आ चष्ट आसां पाथो नदीनां वरुण उग्रः सहस्रचक्षाः ||
verses.transliteration: ā caṣṭa āsāṃ pātho nadīnāṃ varuṇa ughraḥ sahasracakṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Varuṇa, Mighty, with a thousand eyes, beholds the paths wherein these rivers run.

verses.sanskrit: राजा राष्ट्रानां पेशो नदीनामनुत्तमस्मै कषत्रं विश्वायु ||
verses.transliteration: rājā rāṣṭrānāṃ peśo nadīnāmanuttamasmai kṣatraṃ viśvāyu

translations.griffith: He, King of kings, the glory of the floods, o’er all that liveth hath resistless sway.

verses.sanskrit: अविष्टो अस्मान विश्वासु विक्ष्वद्युं कर्णोत शंसं निनित्सोः ||
verses.transliteration: aviṣṭo asmān viśvāsu vikṣvadyuṃ kṛṇota śaṃsaṃ ninitsoḥ

translations.griffith: May he assist us among all the tribes, and make the envier's praise devoid of light.

verses.sanskrit: वयेतु दिद्युद दविषामशेवा युयोत विष्वग रपस्तनूनाम ||
verses.transliteration: vyetu didyud dviṣāmaśevā yuyota viṣvagh rapastanūnām

translations.griffith: May the foes' threatening arrow pass us by: may he put far from us our bodies' sin.

verses.sanskrit: अवीन नो अग्निर्हव्यान नमोभिः परेष्ठो अस्मा अधायि सतोमः ||
verses.transliteration: avīn no aghnirhavyān namobhiḥ preṣṭho asmā adhāyi stomaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, oblation-cater, through our prayers aid us: to him our dearest laud is brought.

verses.sanskrit: सजूर्देवेभिरपां नपातं सखायं कर्ध्वं शिवो नो अस्तु ||
verses.transliteration: sajūrdevebhirapāṃ napātaṃ sakhāyaṃ kṛdhvaṃ śivo no astu

translations.griffith: Accordant with the Gods choose for our Friend the Waters’ Child: may he be good to us.

verses.sanskrit: अब्जामुक्थैरहिं गर्णीषे बुध्ने नदीनां रजस्सु षीदन ||
verses.transliteration: abjāmukthairahiṃ ghṛṇīṣe budhne nadīnāṃ rajassu ṣīdan

translations.griffith: With lauds I sing the Dragon born of floods: he sits beneath the streams in middle air.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो.अहिर्बुध्न्यो रिषे धान मा यज्ञो अस्य सरिधद रतायोः ||
verses.transliteration: mā no.ahirbudhnyo riṣe dhān mā yajño asya sridhad ṛtāyoḥ

translations.griffith: Ne’er may the Dragon of the Deep harm us: ne’er fail this faithful servant's sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: उत न एषु नर्षु शरवो धुः पर राये यन्तु शर्धन्तो अर्यः ||
verses.transliteration: uta na eṣu nṛṣu śravo dhuḥ pra rāye yantu śardhanto aryaḥ

translations.griffith: To these our heroes may they grant renown: may pious men march boldly on to wealth.

verses.sanskrit: तपन्ति शत्रुं सवर्ण भूमा महासेनासो अमेभिरेषाम ||
verses.transliteration: tapanti śatruṃ svarṇa bhūmā mahāsenāso amebhireṣām

translations.griffith: Leading great hosts, with fierce attacks of these, they burn their foes as the Sun burns the earth.

verses.sanskrit: आ यन नः पत्नीर्गमन्त्यछा तवष्टा सुपाणिर्दधातुवीरान ||
verses.transliteration: ā yan naḥ patnīrghamantyachā tvaṣṭā supāṇirdadhātuvīrān

translations.griffith: What time our wives draw near to us, may he, left-handed Tvaṣṭar, give us hero sons.

verses.sanskrit: परति न सतोमं तवष्टा जुषेत सयादस्मे अरमतिर्वसूयुः ||
verses.transliteration: prati na stomaṃ tvaṣṭā juṣeta syādasme aramatirvasūyuḥ

translations.griffith: May Tvaṣṭar find our hymn acceptable, and may Aramati, seeking wealth, be ours.

verses.sanskrit: ता नो रासन रातिषाचो वसून्या रोदसी वरुणानी शर्णोतु वरूत्रीभिः सुशरणो नो अस्तु तवष्टा सुदत्रो वि दधातु रायः |||
verses.transliteration: tā no rāsan rātiṣāco vasūnyā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu varūtrībhiḥ suśaraṇo no astu tvaṣṭā sudatro vi dadhātu rāyaḥ

translations.griffith: May they who lavish gifts bestow those treasures: may Rodasī and Varuṇānī listen.  May he, with the Varūtrīs, be our refuge, may bountiful Tvaṣṭar give us store of riches.

verses.sanskrit: तन नो रायः पर्वतास्तन न आपस्तद रातिषाच ओषधीरुत दयौः वनस्पतिभिः पर्थिवी सजोषा उभे रोदसी परि पासतो नः |||
verses.transliteration: tan no rāyaḥ parvatāstan na āpastad rātiṣāca oṣadhīruta dyauḥ vanaspatibhiḥ pṛthivī sajoṣā ubhe rodasī pari pāsato naḥ

translations.griffith: So may rich Mountains and the liberal Waters, so may all Herbs that grow on ground, and Heaven,  And Earth accordant with the Forest-Sovrans, and both the World-halves round about protect us.

verses.sanskrit: अनु तदुर्वी रोदसी जिहातामनु दयुक्षो वरुण इन्द्रसखा अनु विश्वे मरुतो ये सहासो रायः सयाम धरुणं धियध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: anu tadurvī rodasī jihātāmanu dyukṣo varuṇa indrasakhā anu viśve maruto ye sahāso rāyaḥ syāma dharuṇaṃ dhiyadhyai

translations.griffith: To this may both the wide Worlds lend approval, and Varuṇa in heaven, whose Friend is Indra.  May all the Maruts give consent, the Victors, that we may hold great wealth in firm possession.

verses.sanskrit: तन न इन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निराप ओषधीर्वनिनो जुषन्त शर्मन सयाम मरुतामुपस्थे यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: tan na indro varuṇo mitro aghnirāpa oṣadhīrvanino juṣanta śarman syāma marutāmupasthe yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: May Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, and Agni, Waters, Herbs, Trees accept the praise we offer.  May we find refuge in the Marut's bosom. Protect us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: शं न इन्द्राग्नी भवतामवोभिः शं न इन्द्रावरुणा रातहव्या शमिन्द्रासोमा सुविताय शं योः शं न इन्द्रापूषणा वाजसातौ |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ na indrāghnī bhavatāmavobhiḥ śaṃ na indrāvaruṇā rātahavyā śamindrāsomā suvitāya śaṃ yoḥ śaṃ na indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau

translations.griffith: BEFRIEND us with their aids Indra and Agni, Indra and Varuṇa who receive oblations!  Indra and Soma give health, strength and comfort, Indra and Pūṣan be our help in battle.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो भगः शमु नः शंसो अस्तु शं नः पुरन्धिःशमु सन्तु रायः शं नः सत्यस्य सुयमस्य शंसःशं नो अर्यमा पुरुजातो अस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no bhaghaḥ śamu naḥ śaṃso astu śaṃ naḥ purandhiḥśamu santu rāyaḥ śaṃ naḥ satyasya suyamasya śaṃsaḥśaṃ no aryamā purujāto astu

translations.griffith: Auspicious Friends to us be Bhaga, Sathsa, auspicious be Purandhi aid all Riches;  The blessing of the true and well-conducted, and Aryaman in many forms apparent.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो धाता शमु धर्ता नो अस्तु शं न उरूची भवतुस्वधाभिः शं रोदसी बर्हती शं नो अद्रिः शं नोदेवानां सुहवानि सन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no dhātā śamu dhartā no astu śaṃ na urūcī bhavatusvadhābhiḥ śaṃ rodasī bṛhatī śaṃ no adriḥ śaṃ nodevānāṃ suhavāni santu

translations.griffith: Kind unto us he Maker and Sustainer, and the far-reaching Pair with God-like natures.  Auspicious unto us be Earth and Heaven, the Mountain, and the Gods’ fair invocations.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो अग्निर्ज्योतिरनीको अस्तु शं नो मित्रावरुणावश्विना शम शं नः सुक्र्तां सुक्र्तानि सन्तु शं न इषिरोभि वातु वातः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no aghnirjyotiranīko astu śaṃ no mitrāvaruṇāvaśvinā śam śaṃ naḥ sukṛtāṃ sukṛtāni santu śaṃ na iṣiroabhi vātu vātaḥ

translations.griffith: Favour us Agni with his face of splendour, and Varuva and Mitra and the Aśvins.  Favour us noble actions of the pious, impetuous vita blow on us with favour.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो दयावाप्र्थिवी पूर्वहूतौ शमन्तरिक्षं दर्शयेनो अस्तु शं न ओषधीर्वनिनो भवन्तु शं नो रजसस पतिरस्तु जिष्णुः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī pūrvahūtau śamantarikṣaṃ dṛśayeno astu śaṃ na oṣadhīrvanino bhavantu śaṃ no rajasas patirastu jiṣṇuḥ

translations.griffith: Early invoked, may Heaven and Earth be friendly, and Air's mid-region good for us to look on.  To us may Herbs and Forest-Trees be gracious, gracious the Lord Victorious of the region.

verses.sanskrit: शं न इन्द्रो वसुभिर्देवो अस्तु शमादित्येभिर्वरुणः सुशंसः शं नो रुद्रो रुद्रेभिर्जलाषः शं नस्त्वष्टा गनाभिरिह शर्णोतु |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ na indro vasubhirdevo astu śamādityebhirvaruṇaḥ suśaṃsaḥ śaṃ no rudro rudrebhirjalāṣaḥ śaṃ nastvaṣṭā ghnābhiriha śṛṇotu

translations.griffith: Be the God Indra with the Vasus friendly, and, with Ādityas, Varuṇa who blesseth.  Kind, with the Rudras, be the Healer Rudra, and, with the Dames, may Tvaṣṭar kindly listen.

verses.sanskrit: शं नः सोमो भवतु बरह्म शं नः शं नो गरावाणःशमु सन्तु यज्ञाः शं नः सवरूणां मितयो भवन्तु शं नः परस्वः शं वस्तु वेदिः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ naḥ somo bhavatu brahma śaṃ naḥ śaṃ no ghrāvāṇaḥśamu santu yajñāḥ śaṃ naḥ svarūṇāṃ mitayo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ prasvaḥ śaṃ vastu vediḥ

translations.griffith: Blest unto us be Soma, and devotions, blest be the Sacrifice, the Stones for pressing.  Blest be the fixing of the sacred Pillars, blest be the tender Grass and blest the Altar.

verses.sanskrit: शं नः सूर्य उरुचक्षा उदेतु शं नश्चतस्रः परदिशो भवन्तु शं नः पर्वता धरुवयो भवन्तु शं नः सिन्धवः शमु सन्त्वापः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ naḥ sūrya urucakṣā udetu śaṃ naścatasraḥ pradiśo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ parvatā dhruvayo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ sindhavaḥ śamu santvāpaḥ

translations.griffith: May the far-seeing Sun rise up to bless us: be the four Quarters of the sky auspicious.  Auspicious be the firmly-seated Mountains, auspicious be the Rivers and the Waters.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो अदितिर्भवतु वरतेभिः शं नो भवन्तु मरुतः सवर्काः शं नो विष्णुः शं उ पूषा नो अस्तु शं नो भवित्रं शं वस्तु वायुः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no aditirbhavatu vratebhiḥ śaṃ no bhavantu marutaḥ svarkāḥ śaṃ no viṣṇuḥ śaṃ u pūṣā no astu śaṃ no bhavitraṃ śaṃ vastu vāyuḥ

translations.griffith: May Adid through holy works be gracioas, and may the Maruts, loud in song, be friendly.  May Viṣṇu give felicity, and Pūṣan, the Air that cherisheth our life, and Vāyu.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो देवः सविता तरायमाणः शं नो भवन्तूषसो विभातीः शं नः पर्जन्यो भवतु परजाभ्यः शं नःक्षेत्रस्य पतिरस्तु शम्भुः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavantūṣaso vibhātīḥ śaṃ naḥ parjanyo bhavatu prajābhyaḥ śaṃ naḥkṣetrasya patirastu śambhuḥ

translations.griffith: Prosper us Savitar, the God who rescues, and let the radiant Mornings be propitious.  Auspicious to all creatures be Parjanya, auspicious be the field's benign Protector.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो देवा विश्वदेवा भवन्तु शं सरस्वती सह धीभिरस्तु शमभिषाचः शमु रातिषाचः शं नो दिव्याः पार्थिवाः शं नो अप्याः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no devā viśvadevā bhavantu śaṃ sarasvatī saha dhībhirastu śamabhiṣācaḥ śamu rātiṣācaḥ śaṃ no divyāḥ pārthivāḥ śaṃ no apyāḥ

translations.griffith: May all the fellowship of Gods befriend us, Sarasvatī, with Holy Thoughts, be gracious.  Friendly be they, the Liberal Ones who seek us, yea, those who dwell in heaven, on earth, in waters.

verses.sanskrit: शं नः सत्यस्य पतयो भवन्तु शं नो अर्वन्तः शमु सन्तु गावः शं न रभवः सुक्र्तः सुहस्ताः शं नो भवन्तु पितरो हवेषु |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ naḥ satyasya patayo bhavantu śaṃ no arvantaḥ śamu santu ghāvaḥ śaṃ na ṛbhavaḥ sukṛtaḥ suhastāḥ śaṃ no bhavantu pitaro haveṣu

translations.griffith: May the great Lords of Truth protect and aid us: blest to us be our horses and our cattle.  Kind be the pious skilful-handed Ṛbhus, kind be the Fathers at our invocations.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो अज एकपाद देवो अस्तु शं नो.अहिर्बुध्न्यः शं समुद्रः शं नो अपां नपात पेरुरस्तु शं नः पर्श्निर्भवतु देवगोपा |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no aja ekapād devo astu śaṃ no.ahirbudhnyaḥ śaṃ samudraḥ śaṃ no apāṃ napāt perurastu śaṃ naḥ pṛśnirbhavatu devaghopā

translations.griffith: May Aja-Ekapād, the God, be gracious, gracious the Dragon of the Deep, and Ocean.  Gracious be he the swelling Child of Waters, gracious be Pṛśni who hath Gods to guard her.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्या रुद्रा वसवो जुषन्तेदं बरह्म करियमाणं नवीयः शर्ण्वन्तु नि दिव्याः पार्थिवासो गोजाता उत ये यज्ञियासः |||
verses.transliteration: ādityā rudrā vasavo juṣantedaṃ brahma kriyamāṇaṃ navīyaḥ śṛṇvantu ni divyāḥ pārthivāso ghojātā uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ

translations.griffith: So may the Rudras, Vasus, and Ādityas accept the new hymn which we now are making.  May all the Holy Ones of earth and heaven, and the Cow's offipring hear our invocation.

verses.sanskrit: ये देवानां यज्ञिया यज्ञियानां मनोर्यजत्रा अम्र्ता रतज्ञाः ते नो रासन्तामुरुगायमद्य यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: ye devānāṃ yajñiyā yajñiyānāṃ manoryajatrā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ te no rāsantāmurughāyamadya yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: They who of Holy Gods are very holy, Immortal, knowing Law, whom man must worship,—  May these to-day give us broad paths to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर बरह्मैतु सदनाद रतस्य वि रश्मिभिः सस्र्जे सूर्यो गाः वि सानुना पर्थिवी सस्र उर्वी पर्थु परतीकमध्येधे अग्निः |||
verses.transliteration: pra brahmaitu sadanād ṛtasya vi raśmibhiḥ sasṛje sūryo ghāḥ vi sānunā pṛthivī sasra urvī pṛthu pratīkamadhyedhe aghniḥ

translations.griffith: LET the prayer issue from the seat of Order, for Sūrya with his beams hath loosed the cattle.  With lofty ridges earth is far extended, and Agni's flame hath lit the spacious surface.

verses.sanskrit: इमां वां मित्रावरुणा सुव्र्क्तिमिषं न कर्ण्वे असुरा नवीयः इनो वामन्यः पदवीरदब्धो जनं च मित्रो यतति बरुवाणः |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktimiṣaṃ na kṛṇve asurā navīyaḥ ino vāmanyaḥ padavīradabdho janaṃ ca mitro yatati bruvāṇaḥ

translations.griffith: O Asuras, O Varuṇa and Mitra, this hymn to you, like food, anew I offer.  One of you is a strong unerring Leader, and Mitra, speaking, stirreth men to labour.

verses.sanskrit: आ वातस्य धरजतो रन्त इत्या अपीपयन्त धेनवो न सूदाः महो दिवः सदने जायमानो.अचिक्रदद वर्षभः सस्मिन्नूधन |||
verses.transliteration: ā vātasya dhrajato ranta ityā apīpayanta dhenavo na sūdāḥ maho divaḥ sadane jāyamāno.acikradad vṛṣabhaḥ sasminnūdhan

translations.griffith: The movements of the gliding wind come hither: like cows, the springs are filled to overflowing.  Born in the station e’en of lofty heaven the Bull hath loudly bellowed in this region.

verses.sanskrit: गिरा य एता युनजद धरी त इन्द्र परिया सुरथा शूर धायू पर यो मन्युं रिरिक्षतो मिनात्या सुक्रतुमर्यमणं वव्र्त्याम |||
verses.transliteration: ghirā ya etā yunajad dharī ta indra priyā surathā śūra dhāyū pra yo manyuṃ ririkṣato minātyā sukratumaryamaṇaṃ vavṛtyām

translations.griffith: May I bring hither with my song, O Indra, wise Aryaman who yokes thy dear Bay Horses,  Voracious, with thy noble car, O Hero, him who defeats the wrath of the malicious.

verses.sanskrit: यजन्ते अस्य सख्यं वयश्च नमस्विनः सव रतस्य धामन वि पर्क्षो बाबधे नर्भि सतवान इदं नमो रुद्राय परेष्ठम |||
verses.transliteration: yajante asya sakhyaṃ vayaśca namasvinaḥ sva ṛtasya dhāman vi pṛkṣo bābadhe nṛbhi stavāna idaṃ namo rudrāya preṣṭham

translations.griffith: In their own place of sacrifice adorers worship to gain long life and win his friendship.  He hath poured food on men when they have praised him; be this, the dearest reverence, paid to Rudra.

verses.sanskrit: आ यत साकं यशसो वावशानाः सरस्वती सप्तथी सिन्धुमाता याः सुष्वयन्त सुदुघाः सुधारा अभि सवेन पयसा पीप्यानाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yat sākaṃ yaśaso vāvaśānāḥ sarasvatī saptathī sindhumātā yāḥ suṣvayanta sudughāḥ sudhārā abhi svena payasā pīpyānāḥ

translations.griffith: Coming together, glorious, loudly roaring - Sarasvatī, Mother of Floods, the seventh-  With copious milk, with fair streams, strongly flowing, full swelling with the volume of their water;

verses.sanskrit: उत तये नो मरुतो मन्दसाना धियं तोकं च वाजिनो.अवन्तु मा नः परि खयदक्षरा चरन्त्यवीव्र्धन युज्यं ते रयिं नः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tye no maruto mandasānā dhiyaṃ tokaṃ ca vājino.avantu mā naḥ pari khyadakṣarā carantyavīvṛdhan yujyaṃ te rayiṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: And may the mighty Maruts, too, rejoicing, aid our devotion and protect our offspring.  Let not swift-moving Aksara neglect us: they have increased our own appropriate riches,

verses.sanskrit: पर वो महीमरमतिं कर्णुध्वं पर पूषणं विदथ्यं न वीरम भगं धियो.अवितारं नो अस्याः सातौ वाजं रातिषाचं पुरन्धिम |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo mahīmaramatiṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ pra pūṣaṇaṃ vidathyaṃ na vīram bhaghaṃ dhiyo.avitāraṃ no asyāḥ sātau vājaṃ rātiṣācaṃ purandhim

translations.griffith: Bring ye the great Aramati before you, and Pūṣan as the Hero of the synod,  Bhaga who looks upon this hymn with favour, and, as our strength, the bountiful Purandbi.

verses.sanskrit: अछायं वो मरुतः शलोक एत्वछा विष्णुं निषिक्तपामवोभिः उत परजायै गर्णते वयो धुर्यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: achāyaṃ vo marutaḥ śloka etvachā viṣṇuṃ niṣiktapāmavobhiḥ uta prajāyai ghṛṇate vayo dhuryūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: May this our song of praise reach you, O Maruts, and Viṣṇu guardian of the future infant.  May they vouchsafe the singer strength for offspring. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आ वो वाहिष्ठो वहतु सतवध्यै रथो वाजा रभुक्षणो अम्र्क्तः अभि तरिप्र्ष्ठैः सवनेषु सोमैर्मदे सुशिप्रा महभिः पर्णध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vo vāhiṣṭho vahatu stavadhyai ratho vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktaḥ abhi tripṛṣṭhaiḥ savaneṣu somairmade suśiprā mahabhiḥ pṛṇadhvam

translations.griffith: LET your best-bearing car that must be lauded, ne’er injured, bring you Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans.  Fill you, fair-helmeted! with mighty Soma, thrice-mixed, at our libations to delight you.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं ह रत्नं मघवत्सु धत्थ सवर्द्र्श रभुक्षणो अम्र्क्तम सं यज्ञेषु सवधावन्तः पिबध्वं वि नो राधांसि मतिभिर्दयध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ ha ratnaṃ maghavatsu dhattha svardṛśa ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktam saṃ yajñeṣu svadhāvantaḥ pibadhvaṃ vi no rādhāṃsi matibhirdayadhvam

translations.griffith: Ye who behold the light of heaven, Ṛbhukṣans, give our rich patrons unmolested riches.  Drink, heavenly-natured. at our sacrifices, and give us bounties for the hymns we sing you.

verses.sanskrit: उवोचिथ हि मघवन देष्णं महो अर्भस्य वसुनो विभागे उभा ते पूर्णा वसुना गभस्ती न सून्र्ता नि यमते वसव्या |||
verses.transliteration: uvocitha hi maghavan deṣṇaṃ maho arbhasya vasuno vibhāghe ubhā te pūrṇā vasunā ghabhastī na sūnṛtā ni yamate vasavyā

translations.griffith: For thou, O Bounteous One, art used to giving, at parting treasure whether small or ample.  Filled full are both thine arms with great possessions: thy goodness keeps thee not from granting riches.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिन्द्र सवयशा रभुक्षा वाजो न साधुरस्तमेष्य रक्वा वयं नु ते दाश्वांसः सयाम बरह्म कर्ण्वन्तो हरिवो वसिष्ठाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamindra svayaśā ṛbhukṣā vājo na sādhurastameṣy ṛkvā vayaṃ nu te dāśvāṃsaḥ syāma brahma kṛṇvanto harivo vasiṣṭhāḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, high-famed, as Vāja and Ṛbhukṣans, thou goest working, singing to the dwelling.  Lord of Bay Steeds, this day may we Vasisthas offer our prayers to thee and bring oblations.

verses.sanskrit: सनितासि परवतो दाशुषे चिद याभिर्विवेषो हर्यश्व धीभिः ववन्मा नु ते युज्याभिरूती कदा न इन्द्र राय आ दशस्येः |||
verses.transliteration: sanitāsi pravato dāśuṣe cid yābhirviveṣo haryaśva dhībhiḥ vavanmā nu te yujyābhirūtī kadā na indra rāya ā daśasyeḥ

translations.griffith: Thou winnest swift advancement for thy servant, through hymns, Lord of Bay Steeds, which thou hast favoured.  For thee with friendly succour have we battled, and when, O Indra, wilt thou grant us riches?

verses.sanskrit: वासयसीव वेधसस्त्वं नः कदा न इन्द्र वचसो बुबोधः अस्तं तात्या धिया रयिं सुवीरं पर्क्षो नो अर्वा नयुहीत वाजी |||
verses.transliteration: vāsayasīva vedhasastvaṃ naḥ kadā na indra vacaso bubodhaḥ astaṃ tātyā dhiyā rayiṃ suvīraṃ pṛkṣo no arvā nyuhīta vājī

translations.griffith: To us thy priests a home, as ’twere, thou givest: when, Indra wilt thou recognize our praises?  May thy strong Steed, through our ancestral worship, bring food and wealth with heroes to our dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: अभि यं देवी निरतिश्चिदीशे नक्षन्त इन्द्रं शरदःसुप्र्क्षः उप तरिबन्धुर्जरदष्टिमेत्यस्ववेशं यं कर्णवन्त मर्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi yaṃ devī nirtiścidīśe nakṣanta indraṃ śaradaḥsupṛkṣaḥ upa tribandhurjaradaṣṭimetyasvaveśaṃ yaṃ kṛṇavanta martāḥ

translations.griffith: Though Nirrti the Goddess reigneth round him, Autumns with food in plenty come to Indra.  With three close Friends to length of days he cometh, he whom men let not rest at home in quiet.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो राधांसि सवितः सतवध्या आ रायो यन्तु पर्वतस्यरातौ सदा नो दिव्यः पायुः सिषक्तु यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā no rādhāṃsi savitaḥ stavadhyā ā rāyo yantu parvatasyarātau sadā no divyaḥ pāyuḥ siṣaktu yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Promise us gifts, O Savitar: may riches come unto us in Parvata's full bounty.  May the Celestial Guardian still attend us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: उदु षय देवः सविता ययाम हिरण्ययीममतिं यामशिश्रेत नूनं भगो हव्यो मानुषेभिर्वि यो रत्ना पुरूवसुर्दधाति |||
verses.transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā yayāma hiraṇyayīmamatiṃ yāmaśiśret nūnaṃ bhagho havyo mānuṣebhirvi yo ratnā purūvasurdadhāti

translations.griffith: ON high hath Savitar, this God, extended the golden lustre which he spreads around him.  Now, now must Bhaga be invoked by mortals, Lord of great riches who distributes treasures.

verses.sanskrit: उदु तिष्ठ सवितः शरुध्यस्य हिरण्यपाणे परभ्र्ताव रतस्य वयुर्वीं पर्थ्वीममतिं सर्जान आ नर्भ्यो मर्तभोजनं सुवानः |||
verses.transliteration: udu tiṣṭha savitaḥ śrudhyasya hiraṇyapāṇe prabhṛtāv ṛtasya vyurvīṃ pṛthvīmamatiṃ sṛjāna ā nṛbhyo martabhojanaṃ suvānaḥ

translations.griffith: Rise up, O Savitar whose hands are golden, and hear this man while sacrifice is offered,  Spreading afar thy broad and wide effulgence, and bringing mortal men the food that feeds them.

verses.sanskrit: अपि षटुतः सविता देवो अस्तु यमा चिद विश्वे वसवो गर्णन्ति स न सतोमान नमस्यश्चनो धाद विश्वेभिः पातु पायुभिर्नि सूरीन |||
verses.transliteration: api ṣṭutaḥ savitā devo astu yamā cid viśve vasavo ghṛṇanti sa na stomān namasyaścano dhād viśvebhiḥ pātu pāyubhirni sūrīn

translations.griffith: Let Savitar the God he hymned with praises, to whom the Vasus, even, all sing glory.  Sweet be our lauds to him whose due is worship: may he with all protection guard our princes.

verses.sanskrit: अभि यं देव्यदितिर्ग्र्णाति सवं देवस्य सवितुर्जुषाणा अभि सम्राजो वरुणो गर्णन्त्यभि मित्रासो अर्यमा सजोषाः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi yaṃ devyaditirghṛṇāti savaṃ devasya saviturjuṣāṇā abhi samrājo varuṇo ghṛṇantyabhi mitrāso aryamā sajoṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Even he whom Aditi the Goddess praises, rejoicing in God Savitar's incitement:  Even he who praise the high imperial Rulers, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, sing in concert.

verses.sanskrit: अभि ये मिथो वनुषः सपन्ते रातिं दिवो रातिषाचः पर्थिव्याः अहिर्बुध्न्य उत नः शर्णोतु वरूत्र्येकधेनुभिर्नि पातु |||
verses.transliteration: abhi ye mitho vanuṣaḥ sapante rātiṃ divo rātiṣācaḥ pṛthivyāḥ ahirbudhnya uta naḥ śṛṇotu varūtryekadhenubhirni pātu

translations.griffith: They who come emulous to our oblation, dispensing bounty, from the earth and heaven.  May they and Ahibudhnya hear our calling: guard us Varūtrī with the Ekadhenus.

verses.sanskrit: अनु तन नो जास्पतिर्मंसीष्ट रत्नं देवस्य सवितुरियानः भगमुग्रो.अवसे जोहवीति भगमनुग्रो अध याति रत्नम |||
verses.transliteration: anu tan no jāspatirmaṃsīṣṭa ratnaṃ devasya savituriyānaḥ bhaghamughro.avase johavīti bhaghamanughro adha yāti ratnam

translations.griffith: This may the Lord of Life, entreated, grant us,—the wealth which Savitar the God possesses.  The mighty calls on Bhaga for protection, on Bhaga calls the weak to give him riches.

verses.sanskrit: शं नो भवन्तु वाजिनो हवेषु देवताता मितद्रवः सवर्काः जम्भयन्तो.अहिं वर्कं रक्षांसि सनेम्यस्मद युयवन्नमीवाः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no bhavantu vājino haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ svarkāḥ jambhayanto.ahiṃ vṛkaṃ rakṣāṃsi sanemyasmad yuyavannamīvāḥ

translations.griffith: Bless us the Vajins when we call, while slowly they move, strong Singers, to the Gods’ assembly.  Crushing the wolf, the serpent, and the demons, may they completely banish all affliction.

verses.sanskrit: वाजे-वाजे.अवत वाजिनो नो धनेषु विप्रा अम्र्ता रतज्ञाः अस्य मध्वः पिबत मादयध्वं तर्प्ता यात पथिभिर्देवयानैः |||
verses.transliteration: vāje-vāje.avata vājino no dhaneṣu viprā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvaṃ tṛptā yāta pathibhirdevayānaiḥ

translations.griffith: Deep-skilled in Law eternal, deathless, Singers, O Vajins, help us in each fray for booty.  Drink of this meath, he satisfied, be joyful: then go on paths which Gods are wont to travel.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो अग्निः सुमतिं वस्वो अश्रेत परतीची जूर्णिर्देवतातिमेति भेजाते अद्री रथ्येव पन्थां रतं होता न इषितो यजाति |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvo aghniḥ sumatiṃ vasvo aśret pratīcī jūrṇirdevatātimeti bhejāte adrī rathyeva panthāṃ ṛtaṃ hotā na iṣito yajāti

translations.griffith: AGNI, erect, hath shown enriching favour: the flame goes forward to the Gods’ assembly.  Like car-borne men the stones their path have chosen: let the priest, quickened, celebrate our worship.

verses.sanskrit: पर वाव्र्जे सुप्रया बर्हिरेषामा विश्पतीव बीरिट इयाते विशामक्तोरुषसः पूर्वहूतौ वायुः पूषा सवस्तये नियुत्वान |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāvṛje suprayā barhireṣāmā viśpatīva bīriṭa iyāte viśāmaktoruṣasaḥ pūrvahūtau vāyuḥ pūṣā svastaye niyutvān

translations.griffith: Soft to the tread, their sacred grass is scattered: these go like Kings amid the band around them,  At the folks early call on Night and Morning,—Vāyu, and Pūṣan with his team, to bless us.

verses.sanskrit: जमया अत्र वसवो रन्त देवा उरावन्तरिक्षे मर्जयन्त शुभ्राः अर्वाक पथ उरुज्रयः कर्णुध्वं शरोता दूतस्य जग्मुषो नो अस्य |||
verses.transliteration: jmayā atra vasavo ranta devā urāvantarikṣe marjayanta śubhrāḥ arvāk patha urujrayaḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ śrotā dūtasya jaghmuṣo no asya

translations.griffith: Here on their path the noble Gods proceeded: in the wide firmament the Beauteous decked them.  Bend your way hither, ye who travel widely: hear this our envoy who hath gone to meet you.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि यज्ञेषु यज्ञियास ऊमाः सधस्थं विश्वे अभि सन्ति देवाः तानध्वर उशतो यक्ष्यग्ने शरुष्टी भगं नासत्या पुरन्धिम |||
verses.transliteration: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsa ūmāḥ sadhasthaṃ viśve abhi santi devāḥ tānadhvara uśato yakṣyaghne śruṣṭī bhaghaṃ nāsatyā purandhim
