translations.griffith: For they are holy aids at sacrifices: all Gods approach the place of congregation.  Bring these, desirous, to our worship, Agni, swift the Nisatyas, Bhaga, and Purandhi.

verses.sanskrit: आग्ने गिरो दिव आ पर्थिव्या मित्रं वह वरुणमिन्द्रमग्निम आर्यमणमदितिं विष्णुमेषां सरस्वती मरुतो मादयन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: āghne ghiro diva ā pṛthivyā mitraṃ vaha varuṇamindramaghnim āryamaṇamaditiṃ viṣṇumeṣāṃ sarasvatī maruto mādayantām

translations.griffith: Agni, to these men's hymns, from earth, from heaven, bring Mitra, Varuṇa, Indra, and Agni,  And Aryaman, and Aditi, and Viṣṇu. Sarasvatī be joyful, and the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit: ररे हव्यं मतिभिर्यज्ञियानां नक्षत कामं मर्त्यानामसिन्वन धाता रयिमविदस्यं सदासां सक्षीमहि युज्येभिर्नु देवैः |||
verses.transliteration: rare havyaṃ matibhiryajñiyānāṃ nakṣat kāmaṃ martyānāmasinvan dhātā rayimavidasyaṃ sadāsāṃ sakṣīmahi yujyebhirnu devaiḥ

translations.griffith: Even as the holy wish, the gift is offered: may he, unsated, come when men desire him.  Give never-failing ever-conquering riches: with Gods for our allies may we be victors.

verses.sanskrit: नू रोदसी अभिष्टुते वसिष्ठैरतावानो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः यछन्तु चन्द्रा उपमं नो अर्कं यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: nū rodasī abhiṣṭute vasiṣṭhairtāvāno varuṇo mitro aghniḥ yachantu candrā upamaṃ no arkaṃ yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Now have both worlds been praised by the Vasisthas; and holy Mitra, Varuṇa, and Agni.  May they, bright Deities, make our song supremest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: ओ शरुष्टिर्विदथ्या समेतु परति सतोमं दधीमहि तुराणाम यदद्य देवः सविता सुवाति सयामास्य रत्निनो विभागे |||
verses.transliteration: o śruṣṭirvidathyā sametu prati stomaṃ dadhīmahi turāṇām yadadya devaḥ savitā suvāti syāmāsya ratnino vibhāghe

translations.griffith: BE gathered all the audience of the synod: let us begin their praise whose course is rapid.  Whate’er God Savitar this day produces, may we be where the Wealthy One distributes.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रस्तन नो वरुणो रोदसी च दयुभक्तमिन्द्रो अर्यमा ददातु दिदेष्टु देव्यदिती रेक्णो वायुश्च यन नियुवैते भगश्च |||
verses.transliteration: mitrastan no varuṇo rodasī ca dyubhaktamindro aryamā dadātu dideṣṭu devyaditī rekṇo vāyuśca yan niyuvaite bhaghaśca

translations.griffith: This, dealt from heaven ' may both the Worlds vouchsafe us, and Varuṇa, Indra, Aryaman, and Mitra.  May Goddess Aditi assign us riches, Vāyu and Bhaga make them ours for ever.

verses.sanskrit: सेदुग्रो अस्तु मरुतः स शुष्मी यं मर्त्यं पर्षदश्वा अवाथ उतेमग्निः सरस्वती जुनन्ति न तस्य रायः पर्येतास्ति |||
verses.transliteration: sedughro astu marutaḥ sa śuṣmī yaṃ martyaṃ pṛṣadaśvā avātha utemaghniḥ sarasvatī junanti na tasya rāyaḥ paryetāsti

translations.griffith: Strong be the man and full of power, O Maruts, whom ye, borne on by spotted coursers, favour.  Him, too, Sarasvatī and Agni further, and there is none to rob him of his riches.

verses.sanskrit: अयं हि नेता वरुण रतस्य मित्रो राजानो अर्यमापो धुः सुहवा देव्यदितिरनर्वा ते नो अंहो अति पर्षन्नरिष्टान |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ hi netā varuṇa ṛtasya mitro rājāno aryamāpo dhuḥ suhavā devyaditiranarvā te no aṃho ati parṣannariṣṭān

translations.griffith: This Varuṇa is guide of Law, he, Mitra, and Aryaman, the Kings, our work have finished.  Divine and foeless Aditi quickly listens. May these deliver us unharmed from trouble.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य देवस्य मीळ्हुषो वया विष्णोरेषस्य परभ्र्थे हविर्भिः विदे हि रुद्रो रुद्रियं महित्वं यासिष्टं वर्तिरश्विनाविरावत |||
verses.transliteration: asya devasya mīḷhuṣo vayā viṣṇoreṣasya prabhṛthe havirbhiḥ vide hi rudro rudriyaṃ mahitvaṃ yāsiṣṭaṃ vartiraśvināvirāvat

translations.griffith: With offerings I propitiate the branches of this swift-moving God, the bounteous Viṣṇu.  Hence Rudra gained his Rudra-strength: O Aśvins, ye sought the house that hath celestial viands.

verses.sanskrit: मात्र पूषन्नाघ्र्ण इरस्यो वरूत्री यद रातिषाचश्च रासन मयोभुवो नो अर्वन्तो नि पान्तु वर्ष्टिं परिज्मा वातो ददातु |||
verses.transliteration: mātra pūṣannāghṛṇa irasyo varūtrī yad rātiṣācaśca rāsan mayobhuvo no arvanto ni pāntu vṛṣṭiṃ parijmā vāto dadātu

translations.griffith: Be not thou angry here, O glowing Pūṣan, for what Varūtrī and the Bounteous gave us.  May the swift-moving Gods protect and bless us, and Vāta send us rain, wha wanders round us.

verses.transliteration: nū rodasī ...

translations.griffith: Now have both worlds been praised by the Vasisthas, and holy Mitra, Varuṇa, and Agni.  May they, bright Deities, make our song supremest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: परातरग्निं परातरिन्द्रं हवामहे परातर्मित्रावरुणाप्रातरश्विना परातर्भगं पूषणं बरह्मणस पतिं परातः सोममुत रुद्रं हुवेम |||
verses.transliteration: prātaraghniṃ prātarindraṃ havāmahe prātarmitrāvaruṇāprātaraśvinā prātarbhaghaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇas patiṃ prātaḥ somamuta rudraṃ huvema

translations.griffith: AGNI at dawn, and Indra we invoke at dawn, and Varuṇa and Mitra, and the Aśvins twain.  Bhaga at dawn, Pūṣan, and Brahmaṇaspati, Soma at dawn, Rudra we will invoke at dawn.

verses.sanskrit: परातर्जितं भगमुग्रं हुवेम वयं पुत्रमदितेर्यो विधर्ता आध्रश्चिद यं मन्यमानस्तुरश्चिद राजा चिद यं भगं भक्षीत्याह |||
verses.transliteration: prātarjitaṃ bhaghamughraṃ huvema vayaṃ putramaditeryo vidhartā ādhraścid yaṃ manyamānasturaścid rājā cid yaṃ bhaghaṃ bhakṣītyāha

translations.griffith: We will invoke strong, early-conquering Bhaga, the Son of Aditi, the great supporter:  Thinking of whom, the poor, yea, even the mighty, even the King himself says, Give me Bhaga.

verses.sanskrit: भग परणेतर्भग सत्यराधो भगेमां धियमुदवा ददन नः भग पर णो जनय गोभिरश्वैर्भग पर नर्भिर्न्र्वन्तः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: bhagha praṇetarbhagha satyarādho bhaghemāṃ dhiyamudavā dadan naḥ bhagha pra ṇo janaya ghobhiraśvairbhagha pra nṛbhirnṛvantaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: Bhaga our guide, Bhaga whose gifts are faithful, favour this song, and give us wealth, O Bhaga.  Bhaga, augment our store of kine and horses, Bhaga, may we be rich in men and heroes.

verses.sanskrit: उतेदानीं भगवन्तः सयामोत परपित्व उत मध्ये अह्नाम उतोदिता मघवन सूर्यस्य वयं देवानां सुमतौ सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: utedānīṃ bhaghavantaḥ syāmota prapitva uta madhye ahnām utoditā maghavan sūryasya vayaṃ devānāṃ sumatau syāma

translations.griffith: So may felicity be ours at present, and when the day approaches, and at noontide;  And may we still, O Bounteous One, at sunset be happy in the Deities' loving-kindness.

verses.sanskrit: भग एव भगवानस्तु देवास्तेन वयं भगवन्तः सयाम तं तवा भग सर्व इज्जोहवीति स नो भग पुरेता भवेह |||
verses.transliteration: bhagha eva bhaghavānastu devāstena vayaṃ bhaghavantaḥ syāma taṃ tvā bhagha sarva ijjohavīti sa no bhagha puraetā bhaveha

translations.griffith: May Bhaga verily be bliss-bestower, and through him, Gods! may happiness attend us.  As such, O Bhaga, all with might invoke thee: as such be thou our Champion here, O Bhaga.

verses.sanskrit: समध्वरायोषसो नमन्त दधिक्रावेव शुचये पदाय अर्वाचीनं वसुविदं भगं नो रथमिवाश्वा वाजिन आ वहन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: samadhvarāyoṣaso namanta dadhikrāveva śucaye padāya arvācīnaṃ vasuvidaṃ bhaghaṃ no rathamivāśvā vājina ā vahantu

translations.griffith: To this our worship may all Dawns incline them, and come to the pure place like Dadhikrāvan.  As strong steeds draw a chariot may they bring us hitherward Bhaga who discovers treasure.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्न उषासो वीरवतीः सदमुछन्तु भद्राः घर्तं दुहाना विश्वतः परपीता यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: aśvāvatīrghomatīrna uṣāso vīravatīḥ sadamuchantu bhadrāḥ ghṛtaṃ duhānā viśvataḥ prapītā yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: May blessed Mornings dawn on us for ever, with wealth of kine, of horses, and of heroes,  Streaming with all abundance, pouring fatness. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर बरह्माणो अङगिरसो नक्षन्त पर करन्दनुर्नभन्यस्य वेतु पर धेनव उदप्रुतो नवन्त युज्यातामद्री अध्वरस्य पेशः |||
verses.transliteration: pra brahmāṇo aṅghiraso nakṣanta pra krandanurnabhanyasya vetu pra dhenava udapruto navanta yujyātāmadrī adhvarasya peśaḥ

translations.griffith: LET Brahmans and Aṅgirases come forward, and let the roar of cloudy heaven surround us.  Loud low the Milch-kine swimming in the waters: set be the stones that grace our holy service.

verses.sanskrit: सुगस्ते अग्ने सनवित्तो अध्वा युक्ष्वा सुते हरितो रोहितश्च ये वा सद्मन्नरुषा वीरवाहो हुवे देवानां जनिमानिसत्तः |||
verses.transliteration: sughaste aghne sanavitto adhvā yukṣvā sute harito rohitaśca ye vā sadmannaruṣā vīravāho huve devānāṃ janimānisattaḥ

translations.griffith: Fair, Agni, is thy long-known path to travel: yoke for the juice tfiy bay, thy ruddy horses,  Or red steeds, Hero-bearing, for the chamber. Seated, I call the Deities' generations.

verses.sanskrit: समु वो यज्ञं महयन नमोभिः पर होता मन्द्रो रिरिच उपाके यजस्व सु पुर्वणीक देवाना यज्ञियामरमतिं वव्र्त्याः |||
verses.transliteration: samu vo yajñaṃ mahayan namobhiḥ pra hotā mandro ririca upāke yajasva su purvaṇīka devānā yajñiyāmaramatiṃ vavṛtyāḥ

translations.griffith: They glorify your sacrifice with worship, yet the glad Priest near them is left unequalled.  Bring the Gods hither, thou of many aspects: turn hitherward Aramati the Holy.

verses.sanskrit: यदा वीरस्य रेवतो दुरोणे सयोनशीरतिथिराचिकेतत सुप्रीतो अग्निः सुधितो दम आ स विशे दाति वार्यमियत्यै |||
verses.transliteration: yadā vīrasya revato duroṇe syonaśīratithirāciketat suprīto aghniḥ sudhito dama ā sa viśe dāti vāryamiyatyai

translations.griffith: What time the Guest hath made himself apparent, at ease reclining in the rich man's dwelling,  Agni, well-pleased, well-placed within the chamber gives to a house like this wealth worth the choosing.

verses.sanskrit: इमं नो अग्ने अध्वरं जुषस्व मरुत्स्विन्द्रे यशसं कर्धी नः आ नक्ता बर्हिः सदतामुषासोशन्ता मित्रावरुणायजेह |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ no aghne adhvaraṃ juṣasva marutsvindre yaśasaṃ kṛdhī naḥ ā naktā barhiḥ sadatāmuṣāsośantā mitrāvaruṇāyajeha

translations.griffith: Accept this sacrifice of ours, O Agni; glorify it with Indra and the Maruts.  Here on our grass let Night and Dawn be seated: bring longing Varuṇa and Mitra hither.

verses.sanskrit: एवाग्निं सहस्यं वसिष्ठो रायस्कामो विश्वप्स्न्यस्य सतौत इषं रयिं पप्रथद वाजमस्मे यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: evāghniṃ sahasyaṃ vasiṣṭho rāyaskāmo viśvapsnyasya staut iṣaṃ rayiṃ paprathad vājamasme yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Thus hath Vasiṣṭha praised victorious Agni, yearning for wealth that giveth all subsistence.  May he bestow on us food, strength, and riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो यज्ञेषु देवयन्तो अर्चन दयावा नमोभिः परिथिवी इषध्यै येषां बरह्माण्यसमानि विप्रा विष्वग वियन्ति वनिनो न शाखाः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo yajñeṣu devayanto arcan dyāvā namobhiḥ prithivī iṣadhyai yeṣāṃ brahmāṇyasamāni viprā viṣvagh viyanti vanino na śākhāḥ

translations.griffith: SING out the pious at your sacrifices to move with adorations Earth and Heaven-  The Holy Singers, whose unmatched devotions, like a tree's branches, part in all directions.

verses.sanskrit: पर यज्ञ एतु हेत्वो न सप्तिरुद यछध्वं समनसो घर्ताचीः सत्र्णीत बर्हिरध्वराय साधूर्ध्वा शोचींषि देवयून्यस्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yajña etu hetvo na saptirud yachadhvaṃ samanaso ghṛtācīḥ stṛṇīta barhiradhvarāya sādhūrdhvā śocīṃṣi devayūnyasthuḥ

translations.griffith: Let sacrifice proceed like some fleet courser: with one accord lift ye on high the ladles.  Strew sacred grass meet for the solenm service: bright flames that love the Gods have mounted upward.

verses.sanskrit: आ पुत्रासो न मातरं विभ्र्त्राः सानौ देवासो बर्हिषःसदन्तु आ विश्वाची विदथ्यामनक्त्वग्ने मा नो देवताता मर्धस कः |||
verses.transliteration: ā putrāso na mātaraṃ vibhṛtrāḥ sānau devāso barhiṣaḥsadantu ā viśvācī vidathyāmanaktvaghne mā no devatātā mṛdhas kaḥ

translations.griffith: Like babes in arms reposing on their mother, let the Gods sit upon the grass's summit.  Let general fire make bright the flame of worship: scorn us not, Agni, in the Gods’ assembly.

verses.sanskrit: ते सीषपन्त जोषमा यजत्रा रतस्य धाराः सुदुघा दुहानाः जयेष्ठं वो अद्य मह आ वसूनामा गन्तन समनसो यति षठ |||
verses.transliteration: te sīṣapanta joṣamā yajatrā ṛtasya dhārāḥ sudughā duhānāḥ jyeṣṭhaṃ vo adya maha ā vasūnāmā ghantana samanaso yati ṣṭha

translations.griffith: Gladly the Gods have let themselves be honoured, milking the copious streams of holy Order.  The highest might to-day is yours, the Vasits': come ye, as many as ye are, one-minded.

verses.sanskrit: एवा नो अग्ने विक्ष्वा दशस्य तवया वयं सहसावन्नास्क्राः राया युजा सधमादो अरिष्टा यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: evā no aghne vikṣvā daśasya tvayā vayaṃ sahasāvannāskrāḥ rāyā yujā sadhamādo ariṣṭā yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: So, Agni, send us wealth among the people: may we be closely knit to thee, O Victor,  Unharmed, and rich, and taking joy together. Preserve us evermore, ye ods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: दधिक्रां वः परथममश्विनोषसमग्निं समिद्धं भगमूतये हुवे इन्द्रं विष्णुं पूषणं बरह्मणस पतिमादित्यान दयावाप्र्थिवी अपः सवः |||
verses.transliteration: dadhikrāṃ vaḥ prathamamaśvinoṣasamaghniṃ samiddhaṃ bhaghamūtaye huve indraṃ viṣṇuṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇas patimādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ

translations.griffith: I CALL on Dadhikrās, the first, to give you aid, the Aśvins, Bhaga, Dawn, and Agni kindled well,  Indra, and Viṣṇu, Pūṣan, Brahmaṇaspati, Ādityas, Heaven and Earth, the Waters, and the Light.

verses.sanskrit: दधिक्रामु नमसा बोधयन्त उदीराणा यज्ञमुपप्रयन्तः इळां देवीं बर्हिषि सादयन्तो.अश्विना विप्रा सुहवाहुवेम |||
verses.transliteration: dadhikrāmu namasā bodhayanta udīrāṇā yajñamupaprayantaḥ iḷāṃ devīṃ barhiṣi sādayanto.aśvinā viprā suhavāhuvema

translations.griffith: When, rising, to the sacrifice we hasten, awaking Dadhikrās with adorations.  Seating on sacred grass the Goddess Iḷā. let us invoke the sage swift-hearing Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: दधिक्रावाणं बुबुधानो अग्निमुप बरुव उषसं सूर्यं गाम बरध्नं मांश्चतोर्वरुणस्य बभ्रुं ते विश्वास्मद दुरिता यावयन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: dadhikrāvāṇaṃ bubudhāno aghnimupa bruva uṣasaṃ sūryaṃ ghām bradhnaṃ māṃścatorvaruṇasya babhruṃ te viśvāsmad duritā yāvayantu

translations.griffith: While I am thus arousing Dadhikrāvan I speak to Agni, Earth, and Dawn, and Sūrya,  The red, the brown of Varuṇa ever mindful: may they ward off from us all grief and trouble.

verses.sanskrit: दधिक्रावा परथमो वाज्यर्वाग्रे रथानां भवति परजानन संविदान उषसा सूर्येणादित्येभिर्वसुभिरङगिरोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: dadhikrāvā prathamo vājyarvāghre rathānāṃ bhavati prajānan saṃvidāna uṣasā sūryeṇādityebhirvasubhiraṅghirobhiḥ

translations.griffith: Foremost is Dadhikrāvan, vigorous courser; in forefront of the cars, his way he knoweth,  Closely allied with Sūrya and with Morning, Ādityas, and Aṅgirases, and Vasus.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो दधिक्राः पथ्यामनक्त्व रतस्य पन्थामन्वेतवा उ शर्णोतु नो दैव्यं शर्धो अग्निः शर्ण्वन्तु विश्वे महिषामूराः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no dadhikrāḥ pathyāmanaktv ṛtasya panthāmanvetavā u śṛṇotu no daivyaṃ śardho aghniḥ śṛṇvantu viśve mahiṣāamūrāḥ

translations.griffith: May Dadhikrās prepare the way we travel that we may pass along the path of Order.  May Agni bear us, and the Heavenly Army: hear us all Mighty Ones whom none deceiveth.

verses.sanskrit: आ देवो यातु सविता सुरत्नो.अन्तरिक्षप्रा वहमानो अश्वैः हस्ते दधानो नर्या पुरूणि निवेशयञ्च परसुवञ्च भूम |||
verses.transliteration: ā devo yātu savitā suratno.antarikṣaprā vahamāno aśvaiḥ haste dadhāno naryā purūṇi niveśayañca prasuvañca bhūma

translations.griffith: MAY the God Savitar, rich in goodly treasures, filling the region, borne by steeds, come hither,  In his hand holding much that makes men happy, lulling to slumber and arousing creatures.

verses.sanskrit: उदस्य बाहू शिथिरा बर्हन्ता हिरण्यया दिवो अन्ताननष्टाम नूनं सो अस्य महिमा पनिष्ट सूरश्चिदस्मा अनु दादपस्याम |||
verses.transliteration: udasya bāhū śithirā bṛhantā hiraṇyayā divo antānanaṣṭām nūnaṃ so asya mahimā paniṣṭa sūraścidasmā anu dādapasyām

translations.griffith: Golden, sublime, and easy in their motion, his arms extend unto the bounds of heaven.  Now shall that mightiness of his he lauded: even Sūrya yields to him in active vigour.

verses.sanskrit: स घा नो देवः सविता सहावा साविषद वसुपतिर्वसूनि विश्रयमाणो अमतिमुरूचीं मर्तभोजनमध रासते नः |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghā no devaḥ savitā sahāvā sāviṣad vasupatirvasūni viśrayamāṇo amatimurūcīṃ martabhojanamadha rāsate naḥ

translations.griffith: May this God Savitar, the Strong and Mighty, the Lord of precious wealth, vouchsafe us treasures.  May he, advancing his far-spreading lustre, bestow on us the food that feedeth mortals.

verses.sanskrit: इमा गिरः सवितारं सुजिह्वं पूर्णगभस्तिमीळते सुपाणिम चित्रं वयो बर्हदस्मे दधातु यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: imā ghiraḥ savitāraṃ sujihvaṃ pūrṇaghabhastimīḷate supāṇim citraṃ vayo bṛhadasme dadhātu yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: These songs praise Savitar whose tongue is pleasant, praise him whose arms are full, whose hands are lovely.  High vital strength, and manifold, may he grant us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: इमा रुद्राय सथिरधन्वने गिरः कषिप्रेषवे देवाय सवधाव्ने अषाळ्हाय सहमानाय वेधसे तिग्मायुधाय भरता शर्णोतु नः |||
verses.transliteration: imā rudrāya sthiradhanvane ghiraḥ kṣipreṣave devāya svadhāvne aṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase tighmāyudhāya bharatā śṛṇotu naḥ

translations.griffith: To Rudra bring these songs, whose bow is firm and strong, the self-dependent God with swiftly-flying shafts,  The Wise, the Conqueror whom none may overcome, armed with sharp-pointed weapons: may he hear our call.

verses.sanskrit: स हि कषयेण कषम्यस्य जन्मनः साम्राज्येन दिव्यस्य चेतति अवन्नवन्तीरुप नो दुरश्चरानमीवो रुद्र जासु नो भव |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi kṣayeṇa kṣamyasya janmanaḥ sāmrājyena divyasya cetati avannavantīrupa no duraścarānamīvo rudra jāsu no bhava

translations.griffith: He through his lordship thinks on beings of the earth, on heavenly beings through his high imperial sway.  Come willingly to our doors that gladly welcome thee, and heal all sickness, Rudra., in our families.

verses.sanskrit: या ते दिद्युदवस्र्ष्टा दिवस परि कष्मया चरति परि साव्र्णक्तु नः सहस्रं ते सवपिवात भेषजा मा नस्तोकेषुतनयेषु रीरिषह |||
verses.transliteration: yā te didyudavasṛṣṭā divas pari kṣmayā carati pari sāvṛṇaktu naḥ sahasraṃ te svapivāta bheṣajā mā nastokeṣutanayeṣu rīriṣah

translations.griffith: May thy bright arrow which, shot down by thee from heaven, flieth upon the earth, pass us uninjured by.  Thou, very gracious God, hast thousand medicines: inflict no evil on our sons or progeny.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो वधी रुद्र मा परा दा मा ते भूम परसितौ हीळितस्य आ नो भज बर्हिषि जीवशंसे यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: mā no vadhī rudra mā parā dā mā te bhūma prasitau hīḷitasya ā no bhaja barhiṣi jīvaśaṃse yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Slay us not, nor abandon us, O Rudra let not thy noose, when thou art angry, seize us.  Give us trimmed grass and fame among the living. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आपो यं वः परथमं देवयन्त इन्द्रपानमूर्मिमक्र्ण्वतेळः तं वो वयं शुचिमरिप्रमद्य घर्तप्रुषं मधुमन्तं वनेम |||
verses.transliteration: āpo yaṃ vaḥ prathamaṃ devayanta indrapānamūrmimakṛṇvateḷaḥ taṃ vo vayaṃ śucimaripramadya ghṛtapruṣaṃ madhumantaṃ vanema

translations.griffith: MAY we obtain this day from you, O Waters, that wave of pure refreshment, which the pious  Made erst the special beverage of Indra, bright, stainless, rich in sweets and dropping fatness.

verses.sanskrit: तमूर्मिमापो मधुमत्तमं वो.अपां नपादवत्वाशुहेमा यस्मिन्निन्द्रो वसुभिर्मादयाते तमश्याम देवयन्तो वो अद्य |||
verses.transliteration: tamūrmimāpo madhumattamaṃ vo.apāṃ napādavatvāśuhemā yasminnindro vasubhirmādayāte tamaśyāma devayanto vo adya

translations.griffith: May the Floods' Offspring, he whose course is rapid, protect that wave most rich in sweets, O Waters,  That shall make Indra and the Vasus joyful. This may we gain from you to-day, we pious.

verses.sanskrit: शतपवित्राः सवधया मदन्तीर्देवीर्देवानामपि यन्ति पाथः ता इन्द्रस्य न मिनन्ति वरतानि सिन्धुभ्यो हव्यं घर्तवज्जुहोत |||
verses.transliteration: śatapavitrāḥ svadhayā madantīrdevīrdevānāmapi yanti pāthaḥ tā indrasya na minanti vratāni sindhubhyo havyaṃ ghṛtavajjuhota

translations.griffith: All-purifying, joying in their nature, to paths of Gods the Goddesses move onward.  They never violate the laws of Indra. Present the oil-rich offering to the Rivers.

verses.sanskrit: याः सूर्यो रश्मिभिराततान याभ्य इन्द्रो अरदद गातुमूर्मिम ते सिन्धवो वरिवो धातना नो यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: yāḥ sūryo raśmibhirātatāna yābhya indro aradad ghātumūrmim te sindhavo varivo dhātanā no yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Whom Sūrya with his bright beams hath attracted, and Indra dug the path for them to travel,  May these Streams give us ample room and freedom. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: रभुक्षणो वाजा मादयध्वमस्मे नरो मघवानः सुतस्य आ वो.अर्वाचः करतवो न यातां विभ्वो रथं नर्यं वर्तयन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhukṣaṇo vājā mādayadhvamasme naro maghavānaḥ sutasya ā vo.arvācaḥ kratavo na yātāṃ vibhvo rathaṃ naryaṃ vartayantu

translations.griffith: YE liberal Heroes, Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans, come and delight you with our flowing Soma.  May your strength, Vibhus, as ye come to meet us, turn hitherward your car that brings men profit.

verses.sanskrit: रभुरभुभिरभि वः सयाम विभ्वो विभुभिः शवसा शवांसि वाजो अस्मानवतु वाजसाताविन्द्रेण युजा तरुषेमव्र्त्रम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhurbhubhirabhi vaḥ syāma vibhvo vibhubhiḥ śavasā śavāṃsi vājo asmānavatu vājasātāvindreṇa yujā taruṣemavṛtram

translations.griffith: May we as Ṛbhu with your Ṛbhus conquer strength with our strength, as Vibhus with the Vibhus.  May Vāja aid us in the fight for booty, and helped by Indra may we quell the foeman.

verses.sanskrit: ते चिद धि पूर्वीरभि सन्ति शासा विश्वानर्य उपरताति वन्वन इन्द्रो विभ्वान रभुक्षा वाजो अर्यः शत्रोर्मिथत्या कर्णवन वि नर्म्णम |||
verses.transliteration: te cid dhi pūrvīrabhi santi śāsā viśvānarya uparatāti vanvan indro vibhvān ṛbhukṣā vājo aryaḥ śatrormithatyā kṛṇavan vi nṛmṇam

translations.griffith: For they rule many tribes with high dominion, and conquer all their foes in close encounter.  May Indra, Vibhvan, Vāja, and Ṛbhukṣan destroy by turns the wicked foeman's valour.

verses.sanskrit: नू देवासो वरिवः कर्तना नो भूत नो विश्वे.अवसे सजोषाः समस्मे इषं वसवो ददीरन यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: nū devāso varivaḥ kartanā no bhūta no viśve.avase sajoṣāḥ samasme iṣaṃ vasavo dadīran yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Now, Deities, give us ample room and freedom: be all of you, one-minded, our protection.  So let the Vasus grant us strength and vigour. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: समुद्रज्येष्ठाः सलिलस्य मध्यात पुनाना यन्त्यनिविशमानाः इन्द्रो या वज्री वर्षभो रराद ता आपो देवीरिहमामवन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: samudrajyeṣṭhāḥ salilasya madhyāt punānā yantyaniviśamānāḥ indro yā vajrī vṛṣabho rarāda tā āpo devīrihamāmavantu

translations.griffith: FORTH from the middle of the flood the Waters-their chief the Sea-flow cleansing, never sleeping.  Indra, the Bull, the Thunderer, dug their channels: here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect me.

verses.sanskrit: या आपो दिव्या उत वा सरवन्ति खनित्रिमा उत वा याः सवयंजाः समुद्रार्था याः शुचयः पावकास्ता आपो .. . |||
verses.transliteration: yā āpo divyā uta vā sravanti khanitrimā uta vā yāḥ svayaṃjāḥ samudrārthā yāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāstā āpo .. .

translations.griffith: Waters which come from heaven, or those that wander dug from the earth, or flowing free by nature,  Bright, purifying, speeding to the Ocean, here let those Waters. Goddesses, protect me.

verses.sanskrit: यासां राजा वरुणो याति मध्ये सत्यान्र्ते अवपश्यञ जनानाम मधुश्चुतः शुचयो याः पावकास्ता आपो ... |||
verses.transliteration: yāsāṃ rājā varuṇo yāti madhye satyānṛte avapaśyañ janānām madhuścutaḥ śucayo yāḥ pāvakāstā āpo ...

translations.griffith: Those amid whom goes Varuṇa the Sovran, he who discriminates men's truth and falsehood-  Distilling meath, the bright, the purifying, here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect me.

verses.sanskrit: यासु राजा वरुणो यासु सोमो विश्वे देवा यासूर्जं मदन्ति वैश्वानरो यास्वग्निः परविष्टस्ता आपो ... |||
verses.transliteration: yāsu rājā varuṇo yāsu somo viśve devā yāsūrjaṃ madanti vaiśvānaro yāsvaghniḥ praviṣṭastā āpo ...

translations.griffith: They from whom Varuṇa the King, and Soma, and all the Deities drink strength and vigour,  They into whom Vaiśvānara Agni entered, here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect Me.

verses.sanskrit: आ मां मित्रावरुणेह रक्षतं कुलाययद विश्वयन मा न आ गन अजकावं दुर्द्र्शीकं तिरो दधे मा मां पद्येन रपसा विदत तसरुः |||
verses.transliteration: ā māṃ mitrāvaruṇeha rakṣataṃ kulāyayad viśvayan mā na ā ghan ajakāvaṃ durdṛśīkaṃ tiro dadhe mā māṃ padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ

translations.griffith: O MITRA-VARUNA, guard and protect me here: let not that come to me which nests within and swells.  I drive afar the scorpion hateful to the sight: let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

verses.sanskrit: यद विजामन परुषि वन्दनं भुवदष्ठीवन्तौ परि कुल्फौ च देहत अग्निष टच्छोचन्नप बाधतामितो मा माम्पद्येन ... |||
verses.transliteration: yad vijāman paruṣi vandanaṃ bhuvadaṣṭhīvantau pari kulphau ca dehat aghniṣ ṭacchocannapa bādhatāmito mā māmpadyena ...

translations.griffith: Eruption that appears upon the twofold joints, and that which overspreads the ankles and the knees,  May the refulgent Agni banish far away let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

verses.sanskrit: यच्छल्मलौ भवति यन नदीषु यदोषधीभ्यः परि जायते विषम विश्वे देवा निरितस्तत सुवन्तु मा मां पद्येन ... |||
verses.transliteration: yacchalmalau bhavati yan nadīṣu yadoṣadhībhyaḥ pari jāyate viṣam viśve devā niritastat suvantu mā māṃ padyena ...

translations.griffith: The poison that is formed upon the Salmali, that which is found in streams, that which the plants produce,  All this may all the Gods banish and drive away: let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

verses.sanskrit: याः परवतो निवत उद्वत उदन्वतीरनुदकाश्च याः ता अस्मभ्यं पयसा पिन्वमानाः शिवा देवीरशिपदा भवन्तु सर्वा नद्यो अशिमिदा भवन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: yāḥ pravato nivata udvata udanvatīranudakāśca yāḥ tā asmabhyaṃ payasā pinvamānāḥ śivā devīraśipadā bhavantu sarvā nadyo aśimidā bhavantu

translations.griffith: The steep declivities, the valleys, and the heights, the channels full of water, and the waterless-  May those who swell with water, gracious Goddesses, never afflict us with the Sipada disease, may all the rivers keep us free from Simida.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्यानामवसा नूतनेन सक्षीमहि शर्मणा शन्तमेन अनागास्त्वे अदितित्वे तुरास इमं यज्ञं दधतु शरोषमाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: ādityānāmavasā nūtanena sakṣīmahi śarmaṇā śantamena anāghāstve adititve turāsa imaṃ yajñaṃ dadhatu śroṣamāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: THROUGH the Ādityas’ most auspicious shelter, through their most recent succour may we conquer.  May they, the Mighty, giving ear, establish this sacrifice, to make us free and sinless.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्यासो अदितिर्मादयन्तां मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो रजिष्ठाः अस्माकं सन्तु भुवनस्य गोपाः पिबन्तु सोममवसे नो अद्य |||
verses.transliteration: ādityāso aditirmādayantāṃ mitro aryamā varuṇo rajiṣṭhāḥ asmākaṃ santu bhuvanasya ghopāḥ pibantu somamavase no adya

translations.griffith: Let Aditi rejoice and the Ādityas, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, most righteous.  May they, the Guardians of the world, protect us, and, to show favour, drink this day our Soma.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्या विश्वे मरुतश्च विश्वे देवाश्च विश्व रभवश्च विश्वे इन्द्रो अग्निरश्विना तुष्टुवाना यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: ādityā viśve marutaśca viśve devāśca viśva ṛbhavaśca viśve indro aghniraśvinā tuṣṭuvānā yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: All Universal Deities, the Maruts, all the Ādityas, yea, and all the Ṛbhus,  Indra, and Agni, and the Aśvins, lauded. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्यासो अदितयः सयाम पूर्देवत्रा वसवो मर्त्यत्रा सनेम मित्रावरुणा सनन्तो भवेम दयावाप्र्थिवी भवन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: ādityāso aditayaḥ syāma pūrdevatrā vasavo martyatrā sanema mitrāvaruṇā sananto bhavema dyāvāpṛthivī bhavantaḥ

translations.griffith: MAY we be free from every bond, Ādityas! a castle among Gods and men, ye Vasus.  Winning, may we win Varuṇa and Mitra, and, being, may we be, O Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रस्तन नो वरुणो मामहन्त शर्म तोकाय तनयाय गोपाः मा वो भुजेमान्यजातमेनो मा तत कर्म वसवो यच्चयध्वे |||
verses.transliteration: mitrastan no varuṇo māmahanta śarma tokāya tanayāya ghopāḥ mā vo bhujemānyajātameno mā tat karma vasavo yaccayadhve

translations.griffith: May Varuṇa and Mitra grant this blessing, our Guardians, shelter to our seed and offspring.  Let us not suffer for another's trespass. nor do the thing that ye, O Vasus, punish.

verses.sanskrit: तुरण्यवो.अङगिरसो नक्षन्त रत्नं देवस्य सवितुरियानाः पिता च तन नो महान यजत्रो विश्वे देवाः समनसो जुषन्त |||
verses.transliteration: turaṇyavo.aṅghiraso nakṣanta ratnaṃ devasya savituriyānāḥ pitā ca tan no mahān yajatro viśve devāḥ samanaso juṣanta

translations.griffith: The ever-prompt Aṅgirases, imploring riches from Savitar the God, obtained them.  So may our Father who is great and holy, and all the Gods, accordant, grant this favour.

verses.sanskrit: पर दयावा यज्ञैः पर्थिवी नमोभिः सबाध ईळे बर्हतीयजत्रे ते चिद धि पूर्वे कवयो गर्णन्तः पुरो मही दधिरे देवपुत्रे |||
verses.transliteration: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī namobhiḥ sabādha īḷe bṛhatīyajatre te cid dhi pūrve kavayo ghṛṇantaḥ puro mahī dadhire devaputre

translations.griffith: AS priest with solemn rites and adorations I worship Heaven and Earth, the High and Holy.  To them, great Parents of the Gods, have sages of ancient time, singing, assigned precedence.

verses.sanskrit: पर पूर्वजे पितरा नव्यसीभिर्गीर्भिः कर्णुध्वं सदने रतस्य आ नो दयावाप्र्थिवी दैव्येन जनेन यातं महि वां वरूथम |||
verses.transliteration: pra pūrvaje pitarā navyasībhirghīrbhiḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ sadane ṛtasya ā no dyāvāpṛthivī daivyena janena yātaṃ mahi vāṃ varūtham

translations.griffith: With newest hymns set in the seat of Order, those the Two Parents, born before all others,  Come, Heaven and Earth, with the Celestial People, hither to us, for strong is your protection.

verses.sanskrit: उतो हि वां रत्नधेयानि सन्ति पुरूणि दयावाप्र्थिवी सुदासे अस्मे धत्तं यदसदस्क्र्धोयु यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: uto hi vāṃ ratnadheyāni santi purūṇi dyāvāpṛthivī sudāse asme dhattaṃ yadasadaskṛdhoyu yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Yea, Heaven and Earth, ye hold in your possession full many a treasure for the liberal giver.  Grant us that wealth which comes in free abundance. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: वास्तोष पते परति जानीह्यस्मान सवावेशो अनमीवो भवा नः यत तवेमहे परति तन नो जुषस्व शं नो भव दविपदे शं चतुष्पदे |||
verses.transliteration: vāstoṣ pate prati jānīhyasmān svāveśo anamīvo bhavā naḥ yat tvemahe prati tan no juṣasva śaṃ no bhava dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade

translations.griffith: ACKNOWLEDGE us, O Guardian of the Homestead: bring no disease, and give us happy entrance.  Whate’er we ask of thee, be pleased to grant it, and prosper thou quadrupeds and bipeds.

verses.sanskrit: वास्तोष पते परतरणो न एधि गयस्फानो गोभिरश्वेभिरिन्दो अजरासस्ते सख्ये सयाम पितेव पुत्रान परति नो जुषस्व |||
verses.transliteration: vāstoṣ pate prataraṇo na edhi ghayasphāno ghobhiraśvebhirindo ajarāsaste sakhye syāma piteva putrān prati no juṣasva

translations.griffith: Protector of the Home, be our promoter: increase our wealth in kine and steeds, O Indu.  May we be ever-youthful in thy friendship: be pleased in us as in his sons a father.

verses.sanskrit: वास्तोष पते शग्मया संसदा ते सक्षीमहि रण्वया गातुमत्या पाहि कषेम उत योगे वरं नो यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: vāstoṣ pate śaghmayā saṃsadā te sakṣīmahi raṇvayā ghātumatyā pāhi kṣema uta yoghe varaṃ no yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Through thy dear fellowship that bringeth welfare, may we be victors, Guardian of the Dwelling!  Protect our happiness in rest and labour. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: अमीवहा वास्तोष पते विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन सखा सुशेव एधि नः |||
verses.transliteration: amīvahā vāstoṣ pate viśvā rūpāṇyāviśan sakhā suśeva edhi naḥ

translations.griffith: VASTOSPATI, who killest all disease and wearest every form,  Be an auspicious Friend to us.

verses.sanskrit: यदर्जुन सारमेय दतः पिशङग यछसे वीव भराजन्त रष्टय उप सरक्वेषु बप्सतो नि षु सवप |||
verses.transliteration: yadarjuna sārameya dataḥ piśaṅgha yachase vīva bhrājanta ṛṣṭaya upa srakveṣu bapsato ni ṣu svapa

translations.griffith: When, O bright Son of Saramā, thou showest, tawny-hued! thy teeth,  They gleam like lances' points within thy mouth when thou wouldst bite; go thou to steep.

verses.sanskrit: सतेनं राय सारमेय तस्करं वा पुनःसर सतोतॄनिन्द्रस्य रायसि किमस्मान दुछुनायसे नि षु सवप |||
verses.transliteration: stenaṃ rāya sārameya taskaraṃ vā punaḥsara stotṝnindrasya rāyasi kimasmān duchunāyase ni ṣu svapa

translations.griffith: Saramā's Son, retrace thy way: bark at the robber and the thief.  At Indra's singers barkest thou? Why dust thou seek to terrify us? Go to sleep.

verses.sanskrit: तवं सूकरस्य दर्द्र्हि तव दर्दर्तु सूकरः सतोतॄनिन्द्रस्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ sūkarasya dardṛhi tava dardartu sūkaraḥ stotṝnindrasya ...

translations.griffith: Be on thy guard against the boar, and let the boar beware of thee.  At Indra's singers barkest thou? Why dost thou seek to terrify us? Go to sleep.

verses.sanskrit: सस्तु माता सस्तु पिता सस्तु शवा सस्तु विश्पतिः ससन्तु सर्वे जञातयः सस्त्वयमभितो जनः |||
verses.transliteration: sastu mātā sastu pitā sastu śvā sastu viśpatiḥ sasantu sarve jñātayaḥ sastvayamabhito janaḥ

translations.griffith: Sleep mother, let the father sleep, sleep dog and master of the house.  Let all the kinsmen sleep, sleep all the people who are round about.

verses.sanskrit: य आस्ते यश्च चरति यश्च पश्यति नो जनः तेषांसं हन्मो अक्षाणि यथेदं हर्म्यं तथा |||
verses.transliteration: ya āste yaśca carati yaśca paśyati no janaḥ teṣāṃsaṃ hanmo akṣāṇi yathedaṃ harmyaṃ tathā

translations.griffith: The man who sits, the man who walks, and whosoever looks on us,  Of these we closely shut the eyes, even as we closely shut this house.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रश्र्ङगो वर्षभो यः समुद्रादुदाचरत तेना सहस्येना वयं नि जनान सवापयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: sahasraśṛṅgho vṛṣabho yaḥ samudrādudācarat tenā sahasyenā vayaṃ ni janān svāpayāmasi

translations.griffith: The Bull who hath a thousand horns, who rises up from out the sea,—  By him the Strong and Mighty One we lull and make the people sleep.

verses.sanskrit: परोष्ठशया वह्येशया नारीर्यास्तल्पशीवरीः सत्रियो याः पुण्यगन्धास्ताः सर्वाः सवापयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: proṣṭhaśayā vahyeśayā nārīryāstalpaśīvarīḥ striyo yāḥ puṇyaghandhāstāḥ sarvāḥ svāpayāmasi

translations.griffith: The women sleeping in the court, lying without, or stretched on beds,  The matrons with their odorous sweetsthese, one and all, we lull to sleep.

verses.sanskrit: क ईं वयक्ता नरः सनीळा रुद्रस्य मर्या अध सवश्वाः ||
verses.transliteration: ka īṃ vyaktā naraḥ sanīḷā rudrasya maryā adha svaśvāḥ

translations.griffith: Wno are these radiant men in serried rank, Rudra's young heroes borne by noble steeds?

verses.sanskrit: नकिर्ह्येषां जनूंषि वेद ते अङग विद्रे मिथो जनित्रम ||
verses.transliteration: nakirhyeṣāṃ janūṃṣi veda te aṅgha vidre mitho janitram

translations.griffith: Verily no one knoweth whence they sprang: they, and they only, know each other's birth.

verses.sanskrit: अभि सवपूभिर्मिथो वपन्त वातस्वनसः शयेना अस्प्र्ध्रन ||
verses.transliteration: abhi svapūbhirmitho vapanta vātasvanasaḥ śyenā aspṛdhran

translations.griffith: They strew each other with their blasts, these Hawks: they strove together, roaring like the wind.

verses.sanskrit: एतानि धीरो निण्या चिकेत पर्श्निर्यदूधो मही जभार ||
verses.transliteration: etāni dhīro niṇyā ciketa pṛśniryadūdho mahī jabhāra

translations.griffith: A sage was he who knew these mysteries, what in her udder mighty Pṛśni bore.

verses.sanskrit: सा विट सुवीरा मरुद्भिरस्तु सनात सहन्ती पुष्यन्ती नर्म्णम ||
verses.transliteration: sā viṭ suvīrā marudbhirastu sanāt sahantī puṣyantī nṛmṇam

translations.griffith: Ever victorious, through the Maruts, be this band of Heroes, nursing manly strength,

verses.sanskrit: यामं येष्ठाः शुभा शोभिष्ठाः शरिया सम्मिश्ला ओजोभिरुग्राः ||
verses.transliteration: yāmaṃ yeṣṭhāḥ śubhā śobhiṣṭhāḥ śriyā sammiślā ojobhirughrāḥ

translations.griffith: Most bright in splendour, flectest on their way, close-knit to glory, strong with varied power.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रं व ओज सथिरा शवांस्यधा मरुद्भिर्गणस्तुविष्मान ||
verses.transliteration: ughraṃ va oja sthirā śavāṃsyadhā marudbhirghaṇastuviṣmān

translations.griffith: Yea, mighty is your power and firm your strength: so, potent, with the Maruts, be the band.

verses.sanskrit: शुभ्रो वः शुष्मः करुध्मी मनांसि धुनिर्मुनिरिव शर्धस्य धर्ष्णोः ||
verses.transliteration: śubhro vaḥ śuṣmaḥ krudhmī manāṃsi dhunirmuniriva śardhasya dhṛṣṇoḥ

translations.griffith: Bright is your spirit, wrathful are your minds: your bold troop's minstrel is like one inspired.

verses.sanskrit: सनेम्यस्मद युयोत दिद्युं मा वो दुर्मतिरिह परणं नः ||
verses.transliteration: sanemyasmad yuyota didyuṃ mā vo durmatiriha praṇaṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: Ever avert your blazing shaft from us, and let not your displeasure reach us here

verses.sanskrit: परिया वो नाम हुवे तुराणामा यत तर्पन मरुतो वावशानाः ||
verses.transliteration: priyā vo nāma huve turāṇāmā yat tṛpan maruto vāvaśānāḥ

translations.griffith: Your dear names, conquering Maruts, we invoke, calling aloud till we are satisfied.

verses.sanskrit: सवायुधास इष्मिणः सुनिष्का उत सवयं तन्वः शुम्भमानाः ||
verses.transliteration: svāyudhāsa iṣmiṇaḥ suniṣkā uta svayaṃ tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ

translations.griffith: Well-armed, impetuous in their haste, they deck themselves, their forms, with oblations: to you, the pure, ornaments made of gold.

verses.sanskrit: शुची वो हव्या मरुतः शुचीनां शुचिं हिनोम्यध्वरं शुचिभ्यः रतेन सत्यं रतसाप आयञ्छुचिजन्मानः शुचयः पावकाः |||
verses.transliteration: śucī vo havyā marutaḥ śucīnāṃ śuciṃ hinomyadhvaraṃ śucibhyaḥ ṛtena satyaṃ ṛtasāpa āyañchucijanmānaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ

translations.griffith: Pure, Maruts, pure yourselves, are your oblations: to you, the pure, pure sacrifice I offer.  By Law they came to truth, the Law's observers, bright by their birth, and pure, and sanctifying.

verses.sanskrit: अंसेष्वा मरुतः खादयो वो वक्षस्सु रुक्मा उपशिश्रियाणाः वि विद्युतो न वर्ष्टिभी रुचाना अनु सवधामायुधैर्यछमानाः |||
verses.transliteration: aṃseṣvā marutaḥ khādayo vo vakṣassu rukmā upaśiśriyāṇāḥ vi vidyuto na vṛṣṭibhī rucānā anu svadhāmāyudhairyachamānāḥ

translations.griffith: Your rings, O Maruts, rest upon your shoulders, and chains of gold are twined upon your bosoms.  Gleaming with drops of rain, like lightning-flashes, after your wont ye whirl about your weapons.

verses.sanskrit: पर बुध्न्या व ईरते महांसि पर नामानि परयज्यवस्तिरध्वम सहस्रियं दम्यं भागमेतं गर्हमेधीयं मरुतो जुषध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: pra budhnyā va īrate mahāṃsi pra nāmāni prayajyavastiradhvam sahasriyaṃ damyaṃ bhāghametaṃ ghṛhamedhīyaṃ maruto juṣadhvam

translations.griffith: Wide in the depth of air spread forth your glories, far, most adorable, ye bear your titles.  Maruts, accept this thousandfold allotment of household sacrifice and household treasure.

verses.sanskrit: यदि सतुतस्य मरुतो अधीथेत्था विप्रस्य वाजिनो हवीमन मक्षू रायः सुवीर्यस्य दात नू चिद यमन्य आदभदरावा |||
verses.transliteration: yadi stutasya maruto adhīthetthā viprasya vājino havīman makṣū rāyaḥ suvīryasya dāta nū cid yamanya ādabhadarāvā

translations.griffith: If, Maruts, ye regard the praise recited here at this mighty singer invocation,  Vouchsafe us quickly wealth with noble heroes, wealth which no man uho hateth us may injure.

verses.sanskrit: अत्यासो न ये मरुतः सवञ्चो यक्षद्र्शो न शुभयन्त मर्याः ते हर्म्येष्ठाः शिशवो न शुभ्रा वत्सासो न परक्रीळिनः पयोधाः |||
verses.transliteration: atyāso na ye marutaḥ svañco yakṣadṛśo na śubhayanta maryāḥ te harmyeṣṭhāḥ śiśavo na śubhrā vatsāso na prakrīḷinaḥ payodhāḥ

translations.griffith: The Maruts, fleet as coursers, while they deck them like youths spectators of a festal meeting,  Linger, like beauteous colts, about the dwelling, like frisking calves, these who pour down the water.

verses.sanskrit: दशस्यन्तो नो मरुतो मर्ळन्तु वरिवस्यन्तो रोदसी सुमेके आरे गोहा नर्हा वधो वो अस्तु सुम्नेभिरस्मे वसवो नमध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: daśasyanto no maruto mṛḷantu varivasyanto rodasī sumeke āre ghohā nṛhā vadho vo astu sumnebhirasme vasavo namadhvam

translations.griffith: So may the Maruts help us and be gracious, bringing free room to lovely Earth and Heaven.  Far be your bolt that slayeth men and cattle. Ye Vasus, turn yourselves to us with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आ वो होता जोहवीति सत्तः सत्राचीं रातिं मरुतो गर्णानः य ईवतो वर्षणो अस्ति गोपाः सो अद्वयावी हवते व उक्थैः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vo hotā johavīti sattaḥ satrācīṃ rātiṃ maruto ghṛṇānaḥ ya īvato vṛṣaṇo asti ghopāḥ so advayāvī havate va ukthaiḥ

translations.griffith: The priest, when seated, loudly calls you, Maruts, praising in song your universal bounty.  He, Bulls! who hath so much in his possession, free from duplicity, with hymns invokes you.

verses.sanskrit: इमे तुरं मरुतो रामयन्तीमे सहः सहस आ नमन्ति इमेशंसं वनुष्यतो नि पान्ति गुरु दवेषो अररुषे दधन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ime turaṃ maruto rāmayantīme sahaḥ sahasa ā namanti imeśaṃsaṃ vanuṣyato ni pānti ghuru dveṣo araruṣe dadhanti

translations.griffith: These Maruts bring the swift man to a stand-still, and strength with mightier strength they break and humble  These guard the singer from the man who hates him and lay their sore displeasure on the wicked.

verses.sanskrit: इमे रध्रं चिन मरुतो जुनन्ति भर्मिं चिद यथा वसवो जुषन्त अप बाधध्वं वर्षणस्तमांसि धत्त विश्वं तनय |||
verses.transliteration: ime radhraṃ cin maruto junanti bhṛmiṃ cid yathā vasavo juṣanta apa bādhadhvaṃ vṛṣaṇastamāṃsi dhatta viśvaṃ tanaya

translations.griffith: These Maruts rouse even the poor and needy: the Vasus love him as an active champion.  Drive to a distance, O ye Bulls, the darkness: give us full store of children and descendants.

verses.sanskrit: ं तोकमस्मे ||
verses.transliteration: ṃ tokamasme

translations.griffith: Never, O Maruts, may we lose your bounty, nor, car-borne Lords! be hitidmost when ye deal it.  Give us a share in that delightful treasure, the genuine wealth that, Bulls! is your possession.

verses.sanskrit: मा वो दात्रान मरुतो निरराम मा पश्चाद दघ्म रथ्यो विभागे आ न सपार्हे भजतना वसव्ये यदीं सुजातं वर्षणो वो अस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: mā vo dātrān maruto nirarāma mā paścād daghma rathyo vibhāghe ā na spārhe bhajatanā vasavye yadīṃ sujātaṃ vṛṣaṇo vo asti

translations.griffith: What time the men in fury rush together for running streams, for pastures, and for houses.  Then, O ye Maruts, ye who spring from Rudra, be our protectors in the strife with foemen.

verses.sanskrit: सं यद धनन्त मन्युभिर्जनासः शूरा यह्वीष्वोषधीषु विक्षु अध समा नो मरुतो रुद्रियासस्त्रातारो भूत पर्तनास्वर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yad dhananta manyubhirjanāsaḥ śūrā yahvīṣvoṣadhīṣu vikṣu adha smā no maruto rudriyāsastrātāro bhūta pṛtanāsvaryaḥ

translations.griffith: Full many a deed ye did for our forefathers worthy of lauds which, even of old, they sang you.  lle strong man, with the Maruts, wins in battle, the charger, with the Maruts, gains the booty.

verses.sanskrit: भूरि चक्र मरुतः पित्र्याण्युक्थानि या वः शस्यन्ते पुरा चित मरुद्भिरुग्रः पर्तनासु साळ्हा मरुद्भिरित सनिता वाजमर्वा |||
verses.transliteration: bhūri cakra marutaḥ pitryāṇyukthāni yā vaḥ śasyante purā cit marudbhirughraḥ pṛtanāsu sāḷhā marudbhirit sanitā vājamarvā

translations.griffith: Ours, O ye Maruts, be the vigorous Hero, the Lord Divine of men, the strong Sustainer,  With whom to fair lands we may cross the waters, and dwell in our own home with you beside us.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे वीरो मरुतः शुष्म्यस्तु जनानां यो असुरो विधर्ता अपो येन सुक्षितये तरेमाध सवमोको अभि वः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: asme vīro marutaḥ śuṣmyastu janānāṃ yo asuro vidhartā apo yena sukṣitaye taremādha svamoko abhi vaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: May Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa and Agni, Waters, and Plants, and Trees accept our praises.  May we find shelter in the Marut's bosom. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: तन न इन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निर... ||
verses.transliteration: tan na indro varuṇo mitro aghnir...

translations.griffith: Missing line from Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: मध्वो वो नाम मारुतं यजत्राः पर यज्ञेषु शवसा मदन्ति ये रेजयन्ति रोदसी चिदुर्वी पिन्वन्त्युत्सं यदयासुरुग्राः |||
verses.transliteration: madhvo vo nāma mārutaṃ yajatrāḥ pra yajñeṣu śavasā madanti ye rejayanti rodasī cidurvī pinvantyutsaṃ yadayāsurughrāḥ

translations.griffith: YEA, through the power of your sweet juice, ye Holy! the Marut host is glad at sacrifices.  They cause even spacious heaven and earth to tremble, they make the spring flow when they come, the Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: निचेतारो हि मरुतो गर्णन्तं परणेतारो यजमानस्य मन्म अस्माकमद्य विदथेषु बर्हिरा वीतये सदत पिप्रियाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: nicetāro hi maruto ghṛṇantaṃ praṇetāro yajamānasya manma asmākamadya vidatheṣu barhirā vītaye sadata pipriyāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: The Maruts watch the man who sings their praises, promoters of the thought of him who worships.  Seat you on sacred grass in our assembly, this day, with friendly minds, to share the banquet.

verses.sanskrit: नैतावदन्ये मरुतो यथेमे भराजन्ते रुक्मैरायुधैस्तनूभिः आ रोदसी विश्वपिशः पिशानाः समानमञ्ज्यञ्जते शुभे कम |||
verses.transliteration: naitāvadanye maruto yatheme bhrājante rukmairāyudhaistanūbhiḥ ā rodasī viśvapiśaḥ piśānāḥ samānamañjyañjate śubhe kam

translations.griffith: No others gleam so brightly as these Maruts with their own forms, their golden gauds, their weapons.  With all adornments, decking earth and heaven, they heighten, for bright show, their common splendour.

verses.sanskrit: रधक सा वो मरुतो दिद्युदस्तु यद व आगः पुरुषता कराम मा वस्तस्यामपि भूमा यजत्रा अस्मे वो अस्तु सुमतिश्चनिष्ठा |||
verses.transliteration: ṛdhak sā vo maruto didyudastu yad va āghaḥ puruṣatā karāma mā vastasyāmapi bhūmā yajatrā asme vo astu sumatiścaniṣṭhā

translations.griffith: Far from us be your blazing dart, O Maruts, when we, through human frailty, sin against you.  Let us not he exposed to that, ye Holy! May your most loving favour still attend us.

verses.sanskrit: कर्ते चिदत्र मरुतो रणन्तानवद्यासः शुचयः पावकाः पर णो.अवत सुमतिभिर्यजत्राः पर वाजेभिस्तिरत पुष्यसे नः |||
verses.transliteration: kṛte cidatra maruto raṇantānavadyāsaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ pra ṇo.avata sumatibhiryajatrāḥ pra vājebhistirata puṣyase naḥ

translations.griffith: May even what we have done delight the Maruts, the blameless Ones, the bright, the purifying.  Further us, O ye Holy, with your kindness: advance us mightily that we may prosper.

verses.sanskrit: उत सतुतासो मरुतो वयन्तु विश्वेभिर्नामभिर्नरो हवींषि ददात नो अम्र्तस्य परजायै जिग्र्त रायः सून्र्ता मघानि |||
verses.transliteration: uta stutāso maruto vyantu viśvebhirnāmabhirnaro havīṃṣi dadāta no amṛtasya prajāyai jighṛta rāyaḥ sūnṛtā maghāni

translations.griffith: And may the Maruts, praised by all their titles, Heroes, enjoy the taste of our oblations.  Give us of Amṛta for the sake of offspring: awake the excellent fair stores of riches.

verses.sanskrit: आ सतुतासो मरुतो विश्व ऊती अछा सूरीन सर्वताता जिगात ये नस्त्मना शतिनो वर्धयन्ति यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā stutāso maruto viśva ūtī achā sūrīn sarvatātā jighāta ye nastmanā śatino vardhayanti yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Hither, ye Maruts, praised, with all your succours, with all felicity come to our princes,  Who, of themselves, a hundredfold increase us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर साकमुक्षे अर्चता गणाय यो दैव्यस्य धाम्नस्तुविष्मान उत कषोदन्ति रोदसी महित्वा नक्षन्ते नाकं निरतेरवंशात |||
verses.transliteration: pra sākamukṣe arcatā ghaṇāya yo daivyasya dhāmnastuviṣmān uta kṣodanti rodasī mahitvā nakṣante nākaṃ nirteravaṃśāt

translations.griffith: SING to the troop that pours down rain in common, the Mighty Company of celestial nature.  They make the world-halves tremble with their greatness: from depths of earth and sky they reach to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: जनूश्चिद वो मरुतस्त्वेष्येण भीमासस्तुविमन्यवो.अयासः पर ये महोभिरोजसोत सन्ति विश्वो वो यामन भयते सवर्द्र्क |||
verses.transliteration: janūścid vo marutastveṣyeṇa bhīmāsastuvimanyavo.ayāsaḥ pra ye mahobhirojasota santi viśvo vo yāman bhayate svardṛk

translations.griffith: Yea, your birth, Maruts, was with wild commotion, ye who move swiftly, fierce in wrath, terrific.  Ye all-surpassing in your might and vigour, each looker on the light fears at your coming.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हद वयो मघवद्भ्यो दधात जुजोषन्निन मरुतः सुष्टुतिं नः गतो नाध्वा वि तिराति जन्तुं पर ण सपार्हाभिरूतिभिस्तिरेत |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhad vayo maghavadbhyo dadhāta jujoṣannin marutaḥ suṣṭutiṃ naḥ ghato nādhvā vi tirāti jantuṃ pra ṇa spārhābhirūtibhistireta

translations.griffith: Give ample vital power unto our princes let our fair praises gratify the Maruts.  As the way travelled helpeth people onward, so further us with your delightful succours.

verses.sanskrit: युष्मोतो विप्रो मरुतः शतस्वी युष्मोतो अर्वा सहुरिः सहस्री युष्मोतः सम्राळ उत हन्ति वर्त्रं पर तद वो अस्तु धूतयो देष्णम |||
verses.transliteration: yuṣmoto vipro marutaḥ śatasvī yuṣmoto arvā sahuriḥ sahasrī yuṣmotaḥ samrāḷ uta hanti vṛtraṃ pra tad vo astu dhūtayo deṣṇam

translations.griffith: Your favoured singer counts his wealth by hundreds: the strong steed whom ye favour wins a thousand.  The Sovran whom ye aid destroys the foeman. May this your gift, ye Shakers, be distinguished.

verses.sanskrit: ताना रुद्रस्य मीळ्हुषो विवासे कुविन नंसन्ते मरुतः पुनर्नः यत सस्वर्ता जिहीळिरे यदाविरव तदेन ईमहे तुराणाम |||
verses.transliteration: tānā rudrasya mīḷhuṣo vivāse kuvin naṃsante marutaḥ punarnaḥ yat sasvartā jihīḷire yadāvirava tadena īmahe turāṇām

translations.griffith: I call, as such, the Sons of bounteous Rudra: will not the Maruts turn again to us-ward?  What secret sin or open stirs their anger, that we implore the Swift Ones to forgive us.

verses.sanskrit: परा सा वाचि सुष्टुतिर्मघोनामिदं सूक्तं मरुतो जुषन्त आराच्चिद दवेषो वर्षणो युयोत यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: prā sā vāci suṣṭutirmaghonāmidaṃ sūktaṃ maruto juṣanta ārāccid dveṣo vṛṣaṇo yuyota yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: This eulogy of the Bounteous hath been spoken: accept, ye Maruts, this our hymn of praises.  Ye Bulls, keep those who hate us at a distance. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: यं तरायध्व इदम-इदं देवासो यं च नयथ तस्मा अग्ने वरुण मित्रार्यमन मरुतः शर्म यछत |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ trāyadhva idam-idaṃ devāso yaṃ ca nayatha tasmā aghne varuṇa mitrāryaman marutaḥ śarma yachata

translations.griffith: WHOMSO ye rescue here and there, whomso ye guide, O Deities,  To him give shelter, Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa, ye Maruts, and thou Aryaman.

verses.sanskrit: युष्माकं देवा अवसाहनि परिय ईजानस्तरति दविषः पर स कषयं तिरते वि महीरिषो यो वो वराय दाशति |||
verses.transliteration: yuṣmākaṃ devā avasāhani priya ījānastarati dviṣaḥ pra sa kṣayaṃ tirate vi mahīriṣo yo vo varāya dāśati

translations.griffith: Through your kind favour, Gods, on some auspicious day, the worshipper subdues his foes.  That man increases home and strengthening ample food who brings you offerings as ye list.

verses.sanskrit: नहि वश्चरमं चन वसिष्ठः परिमंसते अस्माकमद्य मरुतः सुते सचा विश्वे पिबत कामिनः |||
verses.transliteration: nahi vaścaramaṃ cana vasiṣṭhaḥ parimaṃsate asmākamadya marutaḥ sute sacā viśve pibata kāminaḥ

translations.griffith: Vasiṣṭha will not overlook the lowliest one among you all.  O Maruts, of our Soma juice effused to-day drink all of you with eager haste.

verses.sanskrit: नहि व ऊतिः पर्तनासु मर्धति यस्मा अराध्वं नरः अभि व आवर्त सुमतिर्नवीयसी तूयं यात पिपीषवः |||
verses.transliteration: nahi va ūtiḥ pṛtanāsu mardhati yasmā arādhvaṃ naraḥ abhi va āvart sumatirnavīyasī tūyaṃ yāta pipīṣavaḥ

translations.griffith: Your succour in the battle injures not the man to whom ye, Heroes, grant your gifts.  May your most recent favour turn to us again. Come quickly, ye who fain would drink.

verses.sanskrit: ओ षु घर्ष्विराधसो यातनान्धांसि पीतये इमा वो हव्या मरुतो ररे हि कं मो षवन्यत्र गन्तन |||
verses.transliteration: o ṣu ghṛṣvirādhaso yātanāndhāṃsi pītaye imā vo havyā maruto rare hi kaṃ mo ṣvanyatra ghantana

translations.griffith: Come hitherward to drink the juice, O ye whose bounties give you joy.  These offerings are for you, these, Maruts, I present. Go not to any place but this.

verses.sanskrit: आ च नो बर्हिः सदताविता च न सपार्हाणि दातवे वसु अस्रेधन्तो मरुतः सोम्ये मधौ सवाहेह मादयाध्वै |||
verses.transliteration: ā ca no barhiḥ sadatāvitā ca na spārhāṇi dātave vasu asredhanto marutaḥ somye madhau svāheha mādayādhvai

translations.griffith: Sit on our sacred grass, be graciously inclined to give the wealth for which we long,  To take delight, ye Maruts, Friends of all, with Svāhā, in sweet Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: सस्वश्चिद धि तन्वः शुम्भमाना आ हंसासो नीलप्र्ष्ठा अपप्तन विश्वं शर्धो अभितो मा नि षेद नरो न रण्वाः सवने मदन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: sasvaścid dhi tanvaḥ śumbhamānā ā haṃsāso nīlapṛṣṭhā apaptan viśvaṃ śardho abhito mā ni ṣeda naro na raṇvāḥ savane madantaḥ

translations.griffith: Decking the beauty of their forms in secret the Swans with purple backs have flown down hither.  Around me all the Company hath settled, like joyous Heroes glad in our libation.

verses.sanskrit: यो नो मरुतो अभि दुर्ह्र्णायुस्तिरश्चित्तानि वसवो जिघांसति दरुहः पाशान परति स मुचीष्ट तपिष्ठेन हन्मनाहन्तना तम |||
verses.transliteration: yo no maruto abhi durhṛṇāyustiraścittāni vasavo jighāṃsati druhaḥ pāśān prati sa mucīṣṭa tapiṣṭhena hanmanāhantanā tam

translations.griffith: Maruts, the man whose wrath is hard to master, he who would slay us ere we think, O Vasus,  May he be tangled in the toils of mischief; smite ye him down with your most flaming weapon.

verses.sanskrit: सान्तपना इदं हविर्मरुतस्तज्जुजुष्टन युष्माकोतीरिशादसः |||
verses.transliteration: sāntapanā idaṃ havirmarutastajjujuṣṭana yuṣmākotīriśādasaḥ

translations.griffith: O Maruts, ye consuming Gods, enjoy this offering brought for you,  To help us, ye who slay the foe.

verses.sanskrit: गर्हमेधास आ गत मरुतो माप भूतन युष्माकोती सुदानवः |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛhamedhāsa ā ghata maruto māpa bhūtana yuṣmākotī sudānavaḥ

translations.griffith: Sharers of household sacrifice, come, Maruts, stay not far away,  That ye may help us, Bounteous Ones.

verses.sanskrit: इहेह वः सवतवसः कवयः सूर्यत्वचः यज्ञं मरुत आव्र्णे |||
verses.transliteration: iheha vaḥ svatavasaḥ kavayaḥ sūryatvacaḥ yajñaṃ maruta āvṛṇe

translations.griffith: Here, Self-strong Maruts, yea, even here. ye Sages with your sunbright skins  I dedicate your sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तर्यम्बकं यजामहे सुगन्धिं पुष्टिवर्धनम उर्वारुकमिवबन्धनान मर्त्योर्मुक्षीय माम्र्तात |||
verses.transliteration: tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sughandhiṃ puṣṭivardhanam urvārukamivabandhanān mṛtyormukṣīya māmṛtāt

translations.griffith: Tryambaka we worship, sweet augmenter of prosperity.  As from its stem the cucumber, so may I be released from death, not reft of immortality.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्य सूर्य बरवो.अनागा उद्यन मित्राय वरुणाय सत्यम वयं देवत्रादिते सयाम तव परियासो अर्यमन गर्णन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: yadadya sūrya bravo.anāghā udyan mitrāya varuṇāya satyam vayaṃ devatrādite syāma tava priyāso aryaman ghṛṇantaḥ

translations.griffith: WHEN thou, O Sun, this day, arising sinless, shalt speak the truth to Varuṇa and Mitra,  O Aditi, may all the Deities love us, and thou, O Aryaman, while we are singing.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय मित्रावरुणा नर्चक्षा उभे उदेति सूर्यो अभि जमन विश्वस्य सथातुर्जगतश्च गोपा रजु मर्तेषु वर्जिना चपश्यन |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya mitrāvaruṇā nṛcakṣā ubhe udeti sūryo abhi jman viśvasya sthāturjaghataśca ghopā ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā capaśyan

translations.griffith: Looking on man, O Varuṇa and Mitra, this Sun ascendeth up by both the pathways,  Guardian of all things fixt, of all that moveth, beholding good and evil acts of mortals.

verses.sanskrit: अयुक्त सप्त हरितः सधस्थाद या ईं वहन्ति सूर्यं घर्ताचीः धामानि मित्रावरुणा युवाकुः सं यो यूथेव जनिमानि चष्टे |||
verses.transliteration: ayukta sapta haritaḥ sadhasthād yā īṃ vahanti sūryaṃ ghṛtācīḥ dhāmāni mitrāvaruṇā yuvākuḥ saṃ yo yūtheva janimāni caṣṭe

translations.griffith: He from their home hath yoked the Seven gold Coursers who, dropping oil and fatness, carry Sūrya.  Yours, Varuṇa and Mitra, he surveyeth the worlds and living creatures like a herdsman.

verses.sanskrit: उद वां पर्क्षासो मधुमन्तो अस्थुरा सूर्यो अरुहच्छुक्रमर्णः यस्मा आदित्या अध्वनो रदन्ति मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणःसजोषाः |||
verses.transliteration: ud vāṃ pṛkṣāso madhumanto asthurā sūryo aruhacchukramarṇaḥ yasmā ādityā adhvano radanti mitro aryamā varuṇaḥsajoṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Your coursers rich in store of sweets have mounted: to the bright ocean Sūrya hath ascended,  For whom the Ādityas make his pathway ready, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, accordant.

verses.sanskrit: इमे चेतारो अन्र्तस्य भूरेर्मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो हि सन्ति इम रतस्य वाव्र्धुर्दुरोणे शग्मासः पुत्रा अदितेरदब्धाः |||
verses.transliteration: ime cetāro anṛtasya bhūrermitro aryamā varuṇo hi santi ima ṛtasya vāvṛdhurduroṇe śaghmāsaḥ putrā aditeradabdhāḥ

translations.griffith: For these, even Aryaman, Varuṇa and Mitra, are the chastisers of all guile and falsehood.  These, Aditi's Sons, infallible and mighty, have waxen in the home of law Eternal.

verses.sanskrit: इमे मित्रो वरुणो दूळभासो.अचेतसं चिच्चितयन्ति दक्षैः अपि करतुं सुचेतसं वतन्तस्तिरश्चिदंहः सुपथानयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ime mitro varuṇo dūḷabhāso.acetasaṃ ciccitayanti dakṣaiḥ api kratuṃ sucetasaṃ vatantastiraścidaṃhaḥ supathānayanti

translations.griffith: These, Mitra, Varuṇa whom none deceiveth, with great power quicken even the fool to wisdom,  And, wakening, moreover, thoughtful insight, lead it by easy paths o’er grief and trouble.

verses.sanskrit: इमे दिवो अनिमिषा पर्थिव्याश्चिकित्वांसो अचेतसं नयन्ति परव्राजे चिन नद्यो गाधमस्ति पारं नो अस्य विष्पितस्य पर्षन |||
verses.transliteration: ime divo animiṣā pṛthivyāścikitvāṃso acetasaṃ nayanti pravrāje cin nadyo ghādhamasti pāraṃ no asya viṣpitasya parṣan

translations.griffith: They ever vigilant, with eyes that close not, caring for heaven and earth, lead on the thoughtless.  Even in the river's bed there is a shallow. across this broad expanse may they conduct us.

verses.sanskrit: यद गोपावददितिः शर्म भद्रं मित्रो यछन्ति वरुणः सुदासे तस्मिन्ना तोकं तनयं दधाना मा कर्म देवहेळनं तुरासः |||
verses.transliteration: yad ghopāvadaditiḥ śarma bhadraṃ mitro yachanti varuṇaḥ sudāse tasminnā tokaṃ tanayaṃ dadhānā mā karma devaheḷanaṃ turāsaḥ

translations.griffith: When Aditi and Varuṇa and Mitra, like guardians, give Sudās their friendly shelter,  Granting him sons and lineal succession, let us not, bold ones! move the Gods to anger.

verses.sanskrit: अव वेदिं होत्राभिर्यजेत रिपः काश्चिद वरुणध्रुतः सः परि दवेषोभिरर्यमा वर्णक्तूरुं सुदासे वर्षणा उ लोकम |||
verses.transliteration: ava vediṃ hotrābhiryajeta ripaḥ kāścid varuṇadhrutaḥ saḥ pari dveṣobhiraryamā vṛṇaktūruṃ sudāse vṛṣaṇā u lokam

translations.griffith: May he with ofierings purify the altar from any stains of Varuṇa's reviler.  Aryaman save us us all those who hate us: give room and freedom to Sudās, ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: सस्वश्चिद धि सम्र्तिस्त्वेष्येषामपीच्येन सहसा सहन्ते युष्मद भिया वर्षणो रेजमाना दक्षस्य चिन महिना मर्ळता नः |||
verses.transliteration: sasvaścid dhi samṛtistveṣyeṣāmapīcyena sahasā sahante yuṣmad bhiyā vṛṣaṇo rejamānā dakṣasya cin mahinā mṛḷatā naḥ

translations.griffith: Hid from our eyes is their resplendent meeting: by their mysterious might they hold dominion.  Heroes! we cry trembling in fear before you, even in the greatness of your power have mercy.

verses.sanskrit: यो बरह्मणे सुमतिमायजाते वाजस्य सातौ परमस्य रायः सीक्षन्त मन्युं मघवानो अर्य उरु कषयाय चक्रिरे सुधातु |||
verses.transliteration: yo brahmaṇe sumatimāyajāte vājasya sātau paramasya rāyaḥ sīkṣanta manyuṃ maghavāno arya uru kṣayāya cakrire sudhātu

translations.griffith: He who wins favour for his prayer by worship, that he may gain him strength and highest riches,  That good man's mind the Mighty Ones will follow: they have brought comfort to his spacious dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: इयं देव पुरोहितिर्युवभ्यां यज्ञेषु मित्रावरुणावकारि विश्वानि दुर्गा पिप्र्तं तिरो नो यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ deva purohitiryuvabhyāṃ yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇāvakāri viśvāni durghā pipṛtaṃ tiro no yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: This priestly task, Gods! Varuṇa and Mitra! hath been performed for you at sacrifices.  Convey us safely over every peril. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: उद वां चक्षुर्वरुण सुप्रतीकं देवयोरेति सूर्यस्ततन्वान अभि यो विश्वा भुवनानि चष्टे स मन्युं मर्त्येष्वा चिकेत |||
verses.transliteration: ud vāṃ cakṣurvaruṇa supratīkaṃ devayoreti sūryastatanvān abhi yo viśvā bhuvanāni caṣṭe sa manyuṃ martyeṣvā ciketa

translations.griffith: O VARUNA and Mitra, Sūrya spreading the beauteous light of you Twain Gods ariseth.  He who beholdetb all existing creatures observetb well the zeal that is in mortals.

verses.sanskrit: पर वां स मित्रावरुणाव रतावा विप्रो मन्मानि दीर्घश्रुदियर्ति यस्य बरह्माणि सुक्रतू अवाथ आ यत करत्वा न शरदः पर्णैथे |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāṃ sa mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāvā vipro manmāni dīrghaśrudiyarti yasya brahmāṇi sukratū avātha ā yat kratvā na śaradaḥ pṛṇaithe

translations.griffith: The holy sage, renowned afar, directeth his hymns to you, O Varuṇa and Mitra,—  He whose devotions, sapient Gods, ye favour so that ye fill, as ’twere, with power his autumns.

verses.sanskrit: परोरोर्मित्रावरुणा पर्थिव्याः पर दिव रष्वाद बर्हतः सुदानू सपशो दधाथे ओषधीषु विक्ष्व रधग यतो अनिमिषंरक्षमाणा |||
verses.transliteration: prorormitrāvaruṇā pṛthivyāḥ pra diva ṛṣvād bṛhataḥ sudānū spaśo dadhāthe oṣadhīṣu vikṣv ṛdhagh yato animiṣaṃrakṣamāṇā

translations.griffith: From the wide earth, O Varuṇa and Mitra from the great lofty heaven, ye, Bounteous Givers, -  Have in the fields and houses set your warder-, who visit every spot and watch unceasing.

verses.sanskrit: शंसा मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम शुष्मो रोदसी बद्बधे महित्वा अयन मासा अयज्वनामवीराः पर यज्ञमन्मा वर्जनं तिराते |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃsā mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma śuṣmo rodasī badbadhe mahitvā ayan māsā ayajvanāmavīrāḥ pra yajñamanmā vṛjanaṃ tirāte

translations.griffith: I praise the strength of Varuṇa and Mitra that strength, by mightiness, keeps both worlds asunder.  Heroless pass the months of the ungodly he who loves sacrifice makes his home enduring.

verses.sanskrit: अमूरा विश्वा वर्षणाविमा वां न यासु चित्रं दद्र्शेन यक्षम दरुहः सचन्ते अन्र्ता जनानां न वां निण्यान्यचिते अभूवन |||
verses.transliteration: amūrā viśvā vṛṣaṇāvimā vāṃ na yāsu citraṃ dadṛśena yakṣam druhaḥ sacante anṛtā janānāṃ na vāṃ niṇyānyacite abhūvan

translations.griffith: Steers, all infallible are these your people in whom no wondrous thing is seen, no worship.  Guile follows close the men who are untruthful: no secrets may be hidden from your knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: समु वां यज्ञं महयं नमोभिर्हुवे वां मित्रावरुणा सबाधः पर वां मन्मान्य रचसे नवानि कर्तानि बरह्म जुजुषन्निमानि |||
verses.transliteration: samu vāṃ yajñaṃ mahayaṃ namobhirhuve vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā sabādhaḥ pra vāṃ manmāny ṛcase navāni kṛtāni brahma jujuṣannimāni

translations.griffith: I will exalt your sacrifice with homage: as priest, I, Mitra-Varuṇa, invoke you.  May these new hymns and prayers that I have fashioned delight you to the profit of the singer.

verses.sanskrit: इयं देव पुरोहितिर... ||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ deva purohitir...

translations.griffith: This priestly task, Gods! Varuṇa and Mitra! hath been performed for you at sacrifices.  Convey us safely over every peril. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: उत सूर्यो बर्हदर्चींष्यश्रेत पुरु विश्वा जनिम मानुषाणाम समो दिवा दद्र्शे रोचमानः करत्वा कर्तः सुक्र्तःकर्त्र्भिर्भूत |||
verses.transliteration: ut sūryo bṛhadarcīṃṣyaśret puru viśvā janima mānuṣāṇām samo divā dadṛśe rocamānaḥ kratvā kṛtaḥ sukṛtaḥkartṛbhirbhūt

translations.griffith: SURYA hath sent aloft his beams of splendour o’er all the tribes of men in countless places.  Together with the heaven he shines apparent, formed by his Makers well with power and wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: स सूर्य परति पुरो न उद गा एभिः सतोमेभिरेतशेभिरेवैः पर नो मित्राय वरुणाय वोचो.अनागसो अर्यम्णे अग्नये च |||
verses.transliteration: sa sūrya prati puro na ud ghā ebhiḥ stomebhiretaśebhirevaiḥ pra no mitrāya varuṇāya voco.anāghaso aryamṇe aghnaye ca

translations.griffith: So hast thou mounted up before us, Sūrya, through these our praises, with fleet dappled horses.  Declare us free from all offence to Mitra, and Varuṇa, and Aryaman, and Agni.

verses.sanskrit: वि नः सहस्रं शुरुधो रदन्त्व रतावानो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः यछन्तु चन्द्रा उपमं नो अर्कमा नः कामं पूपुरन्तुस्तवानाः |||
verses.transliteration: vi naḥ sahasraṃ śurudho radantv ṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro aghniḥ yachantu candrā upamaṃ no arkamā naḥ kāmaṃ pūpurantustavānāḥ

translations.griffith: May holy Agni, Varuṇa, and Mitra send down their riches upon us in thousands.  May they, the Bright Ones, make our praise-song perfect, and, when we laud them, grant us all our wishes.

verses.sanskrit: दयावाभूमी अदिते तरासीथां नो ये वां जज्ञुः सुजनिमान रष्वे मा हेळे भूम वरुणस्य वायोर्मा मित्रस्य परियतमस्य नर्णाम |||
verses.transliteration: dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṃ no ye vāṃ jajñuḥ sujanimāna ṛṣve mā heḷe bhūma varuṇasya vāyormā mitrasya priyatamasya nṛṇām

translations.griffith: O undivided Heaven and Earth, preserve us, us, Lofty Ones! your nobIy-born descendants.  Let us not anger Varuṇa, nor Vāyu, nor him, the dearest Friend of mortals, Mitra.

verses.sanskrit: पर बाहवा सिस्र्तं जीवसे न आ नो गव्यूतिमुक्षतं घर्तेन आ नो जने शरवयतं युवाना शरुतं मे मित्रावरुणा हवेमा |||
verses.transliteration: pra bāhavā sisṛtaṃ jīvase na ā no ghavyūtimukṣataṃ ghṛtena ā no jane śravayataṃ yuvānā śrutaṃ me mitrāvaruṇā havemā

translations.griffith: Stretch forth your arms and let our lives be lengthened: with fatness dew the pastures of our cattle.  Ye Youthful, make us famed among the people: hear, Mitra-Varuṇa, these mine invocations.

verses.sanskrit: नू मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमा नस्त्मने तोकाय वरिवो दधन्तु सुगा नो विश्वा सुपथानि सन्तु यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: nū mitro varuṇo aryamā nastmane tokāya varivo dadhantu sughā no viśvā supathāni santu yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Now Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman vouchsafe us freedom and room, for us and for our children.  May we find paths all fair and good to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: उद वेति सुभगो विश्वचक्षाः साधारणः सूर्यो मानुषाणाम चक्षुर्मित्रस्य वरुणस्य देवश्चर्मेव यः समविव्यक तमांसि |||
verses.transliteration: ud veti subhagho viśvacakṣāḥ sādhāraṇaḥ sūryo mānuṣāṇām cakṣurmitrasya varuṇasya devaścarmeva yaḥ samavivyak tamāṃsi

translations.griffith: COMMON to all mankind, auspicious Sūrya, he who beholdeth all, is mounting upward;  The God, the eye of Varuṇa and Mitra, who rolled up darkness like a piece of leather.

verses.sanskrit: उद वेति परसवीता जनानां महान केतुरर्णवः सूर्यस्य समानं चक्रं पर्याविव्र्त्सन यदेतशो वहति धूर्षु युक्तः |||
verses.transliteration: ud veti prasavītā janānāṃ mahān keturarṇavaḥ sūryasya samānaṃ cakraṃ paryāvivṛtsan yadetaśo vahati dhūrṣu yuktaḥ

translations.griffith: Sūrya's great ensign, restless as the billow, that urgeth men to action, is advancing:  Onward he still would roll the wheel well-rounded, which Etaśa, harnessed to the car-pole, moveth.

verses.sanskrit: विभ्राजमान उषसामुपस्थाद रेभैरुदेत्यनुमद्यमानः एष मे देवः सविता चछन्द यः समानं न परमिनातिधाम |||
verses.transliteration: vibhrājamāna uṣasāmupasthād rebhairudetyanumadyamānaḥ eṣa me devaḥ savitā cachanda yaḥ samānaṃ na praminātidhāma

translations.griffith: Refulgent from the bosom of the Mornings, he in Whom singers take delight ascendeth.  This Savitar, God, is my chief joy and pleasure, who breaketh not the universal statute.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो रुक्म उरुचक्षा उदेति दूरेर्थस्तरणिर्भ्राजमानः नूनं जनाः सूर्येण परसूता अयन्नर्थानि कर्णवन्नपांसि |||
verses.transliteration: divo rukma urucakṣā udeti dūrearthastaraṇirbhrājamānaḥ nūnaṃ janāḥ sūryeṇa prasūtā ayannarthāni kṛṇavannapāṃsi

translations.griffith: Golden, far-seeing, from the heaven he riseth: far is his goal, he hasteth on resplendent.  Men, verily, inspirited by Sūrya speed to their aims and do the work assigned them.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रा चक्रुरम्र्ता गातुमस्मै शयेनो न दीयन्नन्वेति पाथः परति वां सूर उदिते विधेम नमोभिर्मित्रावरुणोत हव्यैः |||
verses.transliteration: yatrā cakruramṛtā ghātumasmai śyeno na dīyannanveti pāthaḥ prati vāṃ sūra udite vidhema namobhirmitrāvaruṇota havyaiḥ

translations.griffith: Where the irrunortals have prepared his pathway he flieth through the region like a falcon.  With homage and oblations will we serve you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, when the Sun hath risen.

verses.sanskrit: नू मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमा ... ||
verses.transliteration: nū mitro varuṇo aryamā ...

translations.griffith: Now Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman vouchsafe us freedom and room, for us and for our children.  May we find paths all fair and good to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: दिवि कषयन्ता रजसः पर्थिव्यां पर वां घर्तस्य निर्णिजोददीरन हव्यं नो मित्रो अर्यमा सुजातो राजा सुक्षत्रो वरुणो जुषन्त |||
verses.transliteration: divi kṣayantā rajasaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pra vāṃ ghṛtasya nirṇijodadīran havyaṃ no mitro aryamā sujāto rājā sukṣatro varuṇo juṣanta

translations.griffith: YE Twain who rule, in heaven and earth, the region, clothed be your clouds in robes of oil and fatness.  May the imperial Varuṇa, and Mitra, and high-born Aryaman accept our presents.

verses.sanskrit: आ राजाना मह रतस्य गोपा सिन्धुपती कषत्रिया यातमर्वाक इळां नो मित्रावरुणोत वर्ष्टिमव दिव इन्वतं जीरदानू |||
verses.transliteration: ā rājānā maha ṛtasya ghopā sindhupatī kṣatriyā yātamarvāk iḷāṃ no mitrāvaruṇota vṛṣṭimava diva invataṃ jīradānū

translations.griffith: Kings, guards of rrtighty everlasting Order, come hitherward, ye Princes, Lords of Rivers.  Send us from heaven, O Varuṇa and Mitra, rain and sweet food, ye who pour down your bounties.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रस्तन नो वरुणो देवो अर्यः पर साधिष्ठेभिः पथिभिर्नयन्तु बरवद यथा न आदरिः सुदास इषा मदेम सह देवगोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: mitrastan no varuṇo devo aryaḥ pra sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhirnayantu bravad yathā na ādariḥ sudāsa iṣā madema saha devaghopāḥ

translations.griffith: May the dear God, and Varuṇa and Mitra conduct us by the most effective pathways,  That foes may say unto Sudās our chieftain, May, we, too, joy in food with Gods to guard us.

verses.sanskrit: यो वां गर्तं मनसा तक्षदेतमूर्ध्वां धीतिं कर्णवद धारयच्च उक्षेथां मित्रावरुणा घर्तेन ता राजानासुक्षितीस्तर्पयेथाम |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāṃ ghartaṃ manasā takṣadetamūrdhvāṃ dhītiṃ kṛṇavad dhārayacca ukṣethāṃ mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtena tā rājānāsukṣitīstarpayethām

translations.griffith: Him who hath wrought for you this car in spirit, who makes the song rise upward and sustains it,  Bedew with fatness, Varuṇa nd Mitra ye Kings, make glad the pleasant dwelling-places.

verses.sanskrit: एष सतोमो वरुण मित्र तुभ्यं सोमः शुक्रो न वायवे.अयामि अविष्टं धियो जिग्र्तं पुरम्धीर्यूयं पात |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa stomo varuṇa mitra tubhyaṃ somaḥ śukro na vāyave.ayāmi aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jighṛtaṃ puramdhīryūyaṃ pāta

translations.griffith: To you this laud, O Varuṇa and Mitra is offered like bright Soma juice to Vāyu.  Favour our songs of praise, wake thought and spirit. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: परति वां सूर उदिते सूक्तैर्मित्रं हुवे वरुणं पूतदक्षम ययोरसुर्यमक्षितं जयेष्ठं विश्वस्य यामन्नाचिता जिगत्नु |||
verses.transliteration: prati vāṃ sūra udite sūktairmitraṃ huve varuṇaṃ pūtadakṣam yayorasuryamakṣitaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ viśvasya yāmannācitā jighatnu

translations.griffith: WITH hymns I call you, when the Sun hath risen, Mitra, and Varuṇa whose thoughts are holy,  Whose Power Divine, supreme and everlasting, comes with good heed at each man's supplication.

verses.sanskrit: ता हि देवानामसुरा तावर्या ता नः कषितीः करतमूर्जयन्तीः अश्याम मित्रावरुणा वयं वां दयावा च यत्र पीपयन्नहा च |||
verses.transliteration: tā hi devānāmasurā tāvaryā tā naḥ kṣitīḥ karatamūrjayantīḥ aśyāma mitrāvaruṇā vayaṃ vāṃ dyāvā ca yatra pīpayannahā ca

translations.griffith: For they are Asuras of Gods, the friendly make, both of you, our lands exceeding fruitful.  May we obtain you, Varuṇa and Mitra, wherever Heaven and Earth and days may bless us.

verses.sanskrit: ता भूरिपाशावन्र्तस्य सेतू दुरत्येतू रिपवे मर्त्याय रतस्य मित्रावरुणा पथा वामपो न नावा दुरिता तरेम |||
verses.transliteration: tā bhūripāśāvanṛtasya setū duratyetū ripave martyāya ṛtasya mitrāvaruṇā pathā vāmapo na nāvā duritā tarema

translations.griffith: Bonds of the sinner, they bear many nooses: the wicked mortal hardly may escape them.  Varuṇa-Mitra, may your path of Order bear us o’er trouble as a boat o’er waters.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो मित्रावरुणा हव्यजुष्टिं घर्तैर्गव्यूतिमुक्षतमिळाभिः परति वामत्र वरमा जनाय पर्णीतमुद्नो दिव्यस्य चारोः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no mitrāvaruṇā havyajuṣṭiṃ ghṛtairghavyūtimukṣatamiḷābhiḥ prati vāmatra varamā janāya pṛṇītamudno divyasya cāroḥ

translations.griffith: Come, taste our offering, Varuṇa and Mitra: bedew our pasture wil sweet food and fatness.  Pour down in plenty here upon the people the choicest of your fair celestial water.

verses.sanskrit: एष सतोमो वरुण मित्र ... ||
verses.transliteration: eṣa stomo varuṇa mitra ...

translations.griffith: To you this laud, O Varuṇa and Mitra, is offered, like bright Soma juice to Vāyu.  Favour our songs of praise, wake thought and spirit. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर मित्रयोर्वरुणयोः सतोमो न एतु शूष्यः नमस्वान तुविजातयोः |||
verses.transliteration: pra mitrayorvaruṇayoḥ stomo na etu śūṣyaḥ namasvān tuvijātayoḥ

translations.griffith: LET our strong hymn of praise go forth, the laud of Mitra-Varuṇa,  With homage to that high-born Pair;

verses.sanskrit: या धारयन्त देवाः सुदक्षा दक्षपितरा असुर्याय परमहसा |||
verses.transliteration: yā dhārayanta devāḥ sudakṣā dakṣapitarā asuryāya pramahasā

translations.griffith: The Two exceeding wise, the Sons of Dakṣa, whom the gods ordained  For lordship, excellently great.

verses.sanskrit: ता न सतिपा तनूपा वरुण जरितॄणाम मित्र साधयतं धियः |||
verses.transliteration: tā na stipā tanūpā varuṇa jaritṝṇām mitra sādhayataṃ dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: Such, Guardians of our homes and us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, fulfil  The thoughts of those who sing your praise.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्य सूर उदिते.अनागा मित्रो अर्यमा सुवाति सविताभगः |||
verses.transliteration: yadadya sūra udite.anāghā mitro aryamā suvāti savitābhaghaḥ

translations.griffith: So when the Sun hath risen to-day, may sinless Mitra, Aryaman,  Bhaga, and Savitar sendus forth.

verses.sanskrit: सुप्रावीरस्तु स कषयः पर नु यामन सुदानवः ये नो अंहो.अतिपिप्रति |||
verses.transliteration: suprāvīrastu sa kṣayaḥ pra nu yāman sudānavaḥ ye no aṃho.atipiprati

translations.griffith: May this our home be guarded well forward, ye Bounteous, on the way,  Who bear us safely o’er distress.

verses.sanskrit: उत सवराजो अदितिरदब्धस्य वरतस्य ये महो राजान ईशते |||
verses.transliteration: uta svarājo aditiradabdhasya vratasya ye maho rājāna īśate

translations.griffith: And those Self-reigning, Aditi, whose statute is inviolate,  The Kings who rule a vast domain.

verses.sanskrit: परति वां सूर उदिते मित्रं गर्णीषे वरुणम अर्यमणंरिशादसम |||
verses.transliteration: prati vāṃ sūra udite mitraṃ ghṛṇīṣe varuṇam aryamaṇaṃriśādasam

translations.griffith: Soon as the Sun hath risen, to you, to Mitra-Varuṇa, I sing,  And Aryarnan who slays the foe.

verses.sanskrit: राया हिरण्यया मतिरियमव्र्काय शवसे इयं विप्रामेधसातये |||
verses.transliteration: rāyā hiraṇyayā matiriyamavṛkāya śavase iyaṃ viprāmedhasātaye

translations.griffith: With wealth of gold may this my song bring unmolested power and might,  And, Brahmans, gain the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: ते सयाम देव वरुण ते मित्र सूरिभिः सह इषं सवश्च धीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: te syāma deva varuṇa te mitra sūribhiḥ saha iṣaṃ svaśca dhīmahi

translations.griffith: May we be thine, God Varuṇa, and with our princes, Mitra, thine.  Food and Heaven's light will we obtain.

verses.sanskrit: बहवः सूरचक्षसो.अग्निजिह्वा रताव्र्धः तरीणि ये येमुर्विदथानि धीतिभिर्विश्वानि परिभूतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: bahavaḥ sūracakṣaso.aghnijihvā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ trīṇi ye yemurvidathāni dhītibhirviśvāni paribhūtibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Many are they who strengthen Law, Sun-eyed, with Agni for their tongue,  They who direct the three great gatherings with their thoughts, yea, all things with surpassing might.

verses.sanskrit: वि ये दधुः शरदं मासमादहर्यज्ञमक्तुं चाद रचम अनाप्यं वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा कषत्रं राजान आशत |||
verses.transliteration: vi ye dadhuḥ śaradaṃ māsamādaharyajñamaktuṃ cād ṛcam anāpyaṃ varuṇo mitro aryamā kṣatraṃ rājāna āśata

translations.griffith: They who have stablished year and month and then the day, night, sacrifice and holy verse,  Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryarnan, the Kings, have won dominion which none else may gain.

verses.sanskrit: तद वो अद्य मनामहे सूक्तैः सूर उदिते यदोहते वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा यूयं रतस्य रथ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tad vo adya manāmahe sūktaiḥ sūra udite yadohate varuṇo mitro aryamā yūyaṃ ṛtasya rathyaḥ

translations.griffith: So at the rising of the Sun we think of you with hymns to-day,  Even as Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman deserve: ye are the charioteers of Law.

verses.sanskrit: रतावान रतजाता रताव्र्धो घोरासो अन्र्तद्विषः तेषांवः सुम्ने सुछर्दिष्टमे नरः सयाम ये च सूरयः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtāvāna ṛtajātā ṛtāvṛdho ghorāso anṛtadviṣaḥ teṣāṃvaḥ sumne suchardiṣṭame naraḥ syāma ye ca sūrayaḥ

translations.griffith: True to Law, born in Law the strengtheners of Law, terrible, haters of the false,  In their felicity which gives the best defence may we men and our princes dwell.

verses.sanskrit: उदु तयद दर्शतं वपुर्दिव एति परतिह्वरे यदीमाशुर्वहति देव एतशो विश्वस्मै चक्षसे अरम |||
verses.transliteration: udu tyad darśataṃ vapurdiva eti pratihvare yadīmāśurvahati deva etaśo viśvasmai cakṣase aram

translations.griffith: Uprises, on the slope of heaven, that marvel that attracts die sight  As swift celestial Etaśa bears it away, prepared for every eye to see.

verses.sanskrit: शीर्ष्णः-शीर्ष्णो जगतस्तस्थुषस पतिं समया विश्वमा रजः सप्त सवसारः सुविताय सूर्यं वहन्ति हरितो रथे |||
verses.transliteration: śīrṣṇaḥ-śīrṣṇo jaghatastasthuṣas patiṃ samayā viśvamā rajaḥ sapta svasāraḥ suvitāya sūryaṃ vahanti harito rathe

translations.griffith: Lord of each single head, of fixt and moving things, equally through the whole expanse,  The Seven sister Bays bear Sūrya on his car, to bring us wealth and happiness.

verses.sanskrit: तच्चक्षुर्देवहितं शुक्रमुच्चरत पश्येम शरदः शतं जीवेम शरदः शतम |||
verses.transliteration: taccakṣurdevahitaṃ śukramuccarat paśyema śaradaḥ śataṃ jīvema śaradaḥ śatam
