translations.griffith: A hundred autumns may we see that bright Eye, God-ordained, arise  A hundred autumns may we live.

verses.sanskrit: काव्येभिरदाभ्या यातं वरुण दयुमत मित्रश्च सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: kāvyebhiradābhyā yātaṃ varuṇa dyumat mitraśca somapītaye

translations.griffith: Infallible through your wisdom, come hither, resplendent Varuṇa,  And Mitra, to the Soma draught.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो धामभिर्वरुण मित्रश्चा यातमद्रुहा पिबतं सोममातुजी |||
verses.transliteration: divo dhāmabhirvaruṇa mitraścā yātamadruhā pibataṃ somamātujī

translations.griffith: Come as the laws of Heaven ordain, Varuṇa, Mitra, void of guile:  Press near and drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: आ यातं मित्रावरुणा जुषाणावाहुतिं नरा पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा |||
verses.transliteration: ā yātaṃ mitrāvaruṇā juṣāṇāvāhutiṃ narā pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā

translations.griffith: Come, Mitra, Varuṇa, accept, Heroes, our sacrificial gift:  Drink Soma, ye who strengthen Law.

verses.sanskrit: परति वां रथं नर्पती जरध्यै हविष्मता मनसा यज्ञियेन यो वां दूतो न धिष्ण्यावजीगरछा सूनुर्न पितरा विवक्मि |||
verses.transliteration: prati vāṃ rathaṃ nṛpatī jaradhyai haviṣmatā manasā yajñiyena yo vāṃ dūto na dhiṣṇyāvajīgharachā sūnurna pitarā vivakmi

translations.griffith: I WITH a holy heart that brings oblation will sing forth praise to meet your car, ye Princes,  Which, Much-desired! hath wakened as your envoy. I call you hither as a son his parents.

verses.sanskrit: अशोच्यग्निः समिधानो अस्मे उपो अद्र्श्रन तमसश्चिदन्ताः अचेति केतुरुषसः पुरस्ताच्छ्रिये दिवो दुहितुर्जायमानः |||
verses.transliteration: aśocyaghniḥ samidhāno asme upo adṛśran tamasaścidantāḥ aceti keturuṣasaḥ purastācchriye divo duhiturjāyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: Brightly hath Agni shone by us enkindled: the limits even of darkness were apparent.  Eastward is seen the Banner of the Morning, the Banner born to give Heaven's Daughter glory.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वां नूनमश्विना सुहोता सतोमैः सिषक्ति नासत्या विवक्वान पूर्वीभिर्यातं पथ्याभिरर्वाक सवर्विदा वसुमता रथेन |||
verses.transliteration: abhi vāṃ nūnamaśvinā suhotā stomaiḥ siṣakti nāsatyā vivakvān pūrvībhiryātaṃ pathyābhirarvāk svarvidā vasumatā rathena

translations.griffith: With hymns the deft priest is about you, Aśvins, the eloquent priest attends you now, Nāsatyas.  Come by the paths that ye are wont to travel, on car that finds the light, laden with treasure.

verses.sanskrit: अवोर्वां नूनमश्विना युवाकुर्हुवे यद वां सुते माध्वीवसूयुः आ वां वहन्तु सथविरासो अश्वाः पिबाथो अस्मेसुषुता मधूनि |||
verses.transliteration: avorvāṃ nūnamaśvinā yuvākurhuve yad vāṃ sute mādhvīvasūyuḥ ā vāṃ vahantu sthavirāso aśvāḥ pibātho asmesuṣutā madhūni

translations.griffith: When, suppliant for your help, Lovers of Sweetness! I seeking wealth call you to our libation,  Hitherward let your vigorous horses bear you: drink ye with us the well-pressed Soma juices.

verses.sanskrit: पराचीमु देवाश्विना धियं मे.अम्र्ध्रां सातये कर्तं वसूयुम विश्वा अविष्टं वाज आ पुरन्धीस्ता नः शक्तं शचीपती शचीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: prācīmu devāśvinā dhiyaṃ me.amṛdhrāṃ sātaye kṛtaṃ vasūyum viśvā aviṣṭaṃ vāja ā purandhīstā naḥ śaktaṃ śacīpatī śacībhiḥ

translations.griffith: Bring forward, Aśvins, Gods, to its fulfilment my never-wearied prayer that asks for riches.  Vouchsafe us all high spirit in the combat, and with your powers, O Lords of Power, assist us.

verses.sanskrit: अविष्टं धीष्वश्विना न आसु परजावद रेतो अह्रयं नो अस्तु आ वां तोके तनये तूतुजानाः सुरत्नासो देववीतिंगमेम |||
verses.transliteration: aviṣṭaṃ dhīṣvaśvinā na āsu prajāvad reto ahrayaṃ no astu ā vāṃ toke tanaye tūtujānāḥ suratnāso devavītiṃghamema

translations.griffith: Favour us in these prayers of ours, O Aśvins. May we have genial vigour, ne’er to fail us.  So may we, strong in children and descendants, go, wealthy, to the banquet that awaits you.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय वां पूर्वगत्वेव सख्ये निधिर्हितो माध्वी रातो अस्मे अहेळता मनसा यातमर्वागश्नन्ता हव्यं मानुषीषु विक्षु |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya vāṃ pūrvaghatveva sakhye nidhirhito mādhvī rāto asme aheḷatā manasā yātamarvāghaśnantā havyaṃ mānuṣīṣu vikṣu

translations.griffith: Lovers of Sweetness, we have brought this treasure to you as ’twere an envoy sent for friendship.  Come unto us with spirits free from anger, in homes of men enjoying our oblation.

verses.sanskrit: एकस्मिन योगे भुरणा समाने परि वां सप्त सरवतो रथो गात न वायन्ति सुभ्वो देवयुक्ता ये वां धूर्षु तरणयोवहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ekasmin yoghe bhuraṇā samāne pari vāṃ sapta sravato ratho ghāt na vāyanti subhvo devayuktā ye vāṃ dhūrṣu taraṇayovahanti

translations.griffith: With one, the same, intention, ye swift movers, o’er the Seven Rivers hath your chariot travelled.  Yoked by the Gods, your strong steeds never weary while speeding forward at the pole they bear you.

verses.sanskrit: असश्चता मघवद्भ्यो हि भूतं ये राया मघदेयं जुनन्ति पर ये बन्धुं सून्र्ताभिस्तिरन्ते गव्या पर्ञ्चन्तो अश्व्या मघानि |||
verses.transliteration: asaścatā maghavadbhyo hi bhūtaṃ ye rāyā maghadeyaṃ junanti pra ye bandhuṃ sūnṛtābhistirante ghavyā pṛñcanto aśvyā maghāni

translations.griffith: Exhaustless be your bounty to our princes who with their wealth incite the gift of riches,  Who further friendship with their noble natures, combining wealth in kine with wealth in herses.

verses.sanskrit: नू मे हवमा शर्णुतं युवाना यासिष्टं वर्तिरश्विनाविरावत धत्तं रत्नानि जरतं च सूरीन यूयं पात .. . |||
verses.transliteration: nū me havamā śṛṇutaṃ yuvānā yāsiṣṭaṃ vartiraśvināvirāvat dhattaṃ ratnāni jarataṃ ca sūrīn yūyaṃ pāta .. .

translations.griffith: Now hear, O Youthful Twain, mine invocation: come, Aśvins, to the home where food aboundeth.  Vouchsafe us wealth, do honour to our nobles. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आ शुभ्रा यातमश्विना सवश्वा गिरो दस्रा जुजुषाणा युवाकोः हव्यानि च परतिभ्र्ता वीतं नः |||
verses.transliteration: ā śubhrā yātamaśvinā svaśvā ghiro dasrā jujuṣāṇā yuvākoḥ havyāni ca pratibhṛtā vītaṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: COME, radiant Aśvins, with your noble horses: accept your servant's hymns, ye Wonder-Workers:  Enjoy oblations which we bring to greet you.

verses.sanskrit: पर वामन्धांसि मद्यान्यस्थुररं गन्तं हविषो वीतये मे तिरो अर्यो हवनानि शरुतं नः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāmandhāṃsi madyānyasthuraraṃ ghantaṃ haviṣo vītaye me tiro aryo havanāni śrutaṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: The gladdening juices stand prepared before you: come quickly and partake of mine oblation.  Pass by the calling of our foe and bear us.

verses.sanskrit: पर वां रथो मनोजवा इयर्ति तिरो रजांस्यश्विना शतोतिः अस्मभ्यं सूर्यावसू इयानः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāṃ ratho manojavā iyarti tiro rajāṃsyaśvinā śatotiḥ asmabhyaṃ sūryāvasū iyānaḥ

translations.griffith: Your chariot with a hundred aids, O Aśvins, beareth you swift as thought across the regions,  Speeding to us, O ye whose wealth is Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: अयं ह यद वां देवया उ अद्रिरूर्ध्वो विवक्ति सोमसुद युवभ्याम आ वल्गू विप्रो वव्र्तीत हव्यैः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ ha yad vāṃ devayā u adrirūrdhvo vivakti somasud yuvabhyām ā valghū vipro vavṛtīta havyaiḥ

translations.griffith: What time this stone of yours, the Gods’ adorer, upraised, sounds forth for you as Soma-presser,  Let the priest bring you, Fair Ones, through oblations.

verses.sanskrit: चित्रं ह यद वां भोजनं नवस्ति नयत्रये महिष्वन्तं युयोतम यो वामोमानं दधते परियः सन |||
verses.transliteration: citraṃ ha yad vāṃ bhojanaṃ nvasti nyatraye mahiṣvantaṃ yuyotam yo vāmomānaṃ dadhate priyaḥ san

translations.griffith: The nourishment ye have is, truly, wondrous: ye gave thereof a quickening store to Atri,  Who being dear to you, receives your favour.

verses.sanskrit: उत तयद वां जुरते अश्विना भूच्च्यवानाय परतीत्यं हविर्दे अधि यद वर्प इतूति धत्थः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyad vāṃ jurate aśvinā bhūccyavānāya pratītyaṃ havirde adhi yad varpa itaūti dhatthaḥ

translations.griffith: That gift, which all may gain, ye gave Cyavāna, when he grew old, who offered you oblations,  When ye bestowed on him enduring beauty.

verses.sanskrit: उत तयं भुज्युमश्विना सखायो मध्ये जहुर्दुरेवासः समुद्रे निरीं पर्षदरावा यो युवाकुः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyaṃ bhujyumaśvinā sakhāyo madhye jahurdurevāsaḥ samudre nirīṃ parṣadarāvā yo yuvākuḥ

translations.griffith: What time his wicked friends abandoned Bhujyu, O Aśvins, in the middle of the ocean,  Your horse delivered him, your faithful servant.

verses.sanskrit: वर्काय चिज्जसमानाय शक्तमुत शरुतं शयवे हूयमाना यावघ्न्यामपिन्वतमपो न सतर्यं चिच्छक्त्यश्विनाशचीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛkāya cijjasamānāya śaktamuta śrutaṃ śayave hūyamānā yāvaghnyāmapinvatamapo na staryaṃ cicchaktyaśvināśacībhiḥ

translations.griffith: Ye lent your aid to Vrka when exhausted, and listened when invoked to Śayu's calling.  Ye made the cow pour forth her milk like water, and, Aśvins, strengthened with your strength the barren.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय कारुर्जरते सूक्तैरग्रे बुधान उषसां सुमन्मा इषा तं वर्धदघ्न्या पयोभिर्यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya kārurjarate sūktairaghre budhāna uṣasāṃ sumanmā iṣā taṃ vardhadaghnyā payobhiryūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: With his fair hymns this singer, too, extols you, waking with glad thoughts at the break of morning.  May the cow nourish him with milk to feed llim. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां रथो रोदसी बद्बधानो हिरण्ययो वर्षभिर्यात्वश्वैः घर्तवर्तनिः पविभी रुचान इषां वोळ्हा नर्पतिर्वाजिनीवान |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ ratho rodasī badbadhāno hiraṇyayo vṛṣabhiryātvaśvaiḥ ghṛtavartaniḥ pavibhī rucāna iṣāṃ voḷhā nṛpatirvājinīvān

translations.griffith: MAY your gold chariot, drawn by vigorous horses, come to us, blocking up the earth  and heaven,  Bright with its fellies while its way drops fatness, food-laden, rich in coursers, man's protector.

verses.sanskrit: स पप्रथानो अभि पञ्च भूमा तरिवन्धुरो मनसा यातु युक्तः विशो येन गछथो देवयन्तीः कुत्रा चिद याममश्विना दधाना |||
verses.transliteration: sa paprathāno abhi pañca bhūmā trivandhuro manasā yātu yuktaḥ viśo yena ghachatho devayantīḥ kutrā cid yāmamaśvinā dadhānā

translations.griffith: Let it approach, yoked by thewill, three-seated, extending far and wide o’er fivefold beings,  Whereon ye visit God-adoring races, bending your course whither ye will, O Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: सवश्वा यशसा यातमर्वाग दस्रा निधिं मधुमन्तं पिबाथः वि वां रथो वध्वा यादमानो.अन्तान दिवो बाधते वर्तनिभ्याम |||
verses.transliteration: svaśvā yaśasā yātamarvāgh dasrā nidhiṃ madhumantaṃ pibāthaḥ vi vāṃ ratho vadhvā yādamāno.antān divo bādhate vartanibhyām

translations.griffith: Renowned, with noble horses, come ye hither: drink, Wondrous Pair, the cup that holds sweet juices.  Your car whereon your Spouse is wont to travel marks with its track the farthest ends of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: युवोः शरियं परि योषाव्र्णीत सूरो दुहिता परितक्म्यायाम यद देवयन्तमवथः शचीभिः परि घरंसमोमना वां वयो गात |||
verses.transliteration: yuvoḥ śriyaṃ pari yoṣāvṛṇīta sūro duhitā paritakmyāyām yad devayantamavathaḥ śacībhiḥ pari ghraṃsamomanā vāṃ vayo ghāt

translations.griffith: When night was turning to the grey of morning the Maiden, Sūrya's Daughter, chose your splendour.  When with your power and might ye aid the pious he comes through heat to life by your assistance.

verses.sanskrit: यो ह सय वां रथिरा वस्त उस्रा रथो युजानः परियातिवर्तिः तेन नः शं योरुषसो वयुष्टौ नयश्विना वहतं यज्ञे अस्मिन |||
verses.transliteration: yo ha sya vāṃ rathirā vasta usrā ratho yujānaḥ pariyātivartiḥ tena naḥ śaṃ yoruṣaso vyuṣṭau nyaśvinā vahataṃ yajñe asmin

translations.griffith: O Chariot-borne, this car of yours invested with rays of light comes harnessed to our dwelling.  Herewith, O Aśvins, while the dawn is breaking, to this our sacrifice bring peace and blessing.

verses.sanskrit: नरा गौरेव विद्युतं तर्षाणास्माकमद्य सवनोप यातम पुरुत्रा हि वां मतिभिर्हवन्ते मा वामन्ये नि यमन देवयन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: narā ghaureva vidyutaṃ tṛṣāṇāsmākamadya savanopa yātam purutrā hi vāṃ matibhirhavante mā vāmanye ni yaman devayantaḥ

translations.griffith: Like the wild cattle thirsty for the lightning, Heroes, come nigh this day to our libations.  Men call on you with hymns in many places, but let not other worshippers detain you.

verses.sanskrit: युवं भुज्युमवविद्धं समुद्र उदूहथुरर्णसो अस्रिधानैः पतत्रिभिरश्रमैरव्यथिभिर्दंसनाभिरश्विना पारयन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ bhujyumavaviddhaṃ samudra udūhathurarṇaso asridhānaiḥ patatribhiraśramairavyathibhirdaṃsanābhiraśvinā pārayantā

translations.griffith: Bhujyu, abandoned in the midst of ocean, ye raised from out the water with your horses,  Uninjured, winged, flagging not, undaunted, with deeds of wonder saving him, O Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: नू मे हवमा शर्णुतं युवाना ... ||
verses.transliteration: nū me havamā śṛṇutaṃ yuvānā ...

translations.griffith: Now hear, O Youthful Twain, mine invocation: come, Aśvins, to the home where food aboundeth.  Vouchsafe us wealth, do honour to our nobles. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आ विश्ववाराश्विना गतं नः पर तत सथानमवाचि वां पर्थिव्याम अश्वो न वाजी शुनप्र्ष्ठो अस्थादा यत सेदथुर्ध्रुवसे न योनिम |||
verses.transliteration: ā viśvavārāśvinā ghataṃ naḥ pra tat sthānamavāci vāṃ pṛthivyām aśvo na vājī śunapṛṣṭho asthādā yat sedathurdhruvase na yonim

translations.griffith: RICH in all blessings, Aśvins come ye hither: this place on earth is called your own possession,  Like a strong horse with a fair back it standeth, whereon, as in a lap, ye seat you firmly.

verses.sanskrit: सिषक्ति सा वां सुमतिश्चनिष्ठातापि घर्मो मनुषो दुरोणे यो वां समुद्रान सरितः पिपर्त्येतग्वा चिन न सुयुजा युजानः |||
verses.transliteration: siṣakti sā vāṃ sumatiścaniṣṭhātāpi gharmo manuṣo duroṇe yo vāṃ samudrān saritaḥ pipartyetaghvā cin na suyujā yujānaḥ

translations.griffith: This most delightful eulogy awaits you in the man's house drink-offering hath been heated,  Which bringeth you over the seas and rivers, yoking as’twere two well-matched shining horses.

verses.sanskrit: यानि सथानान्यश्विना दधाथे दिवो यह्वीष्वोषधीषु विक्षु नि पर्वतस्य मूर्धनि सदन्तेषं जनाय दाशुषेवहन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: yāni sthānānyaśvinā dadhāthe divo yahvīṣvoṣadhīṣu vikṣu ni parvatasya mūrdhani sadanteṣaṃ janāya dāśuṣevahantā

translations.griffith: Whatever dwellings ye possess, O Aśvins, in fields of men or in the streams of heaven,  Resting upon the summit of the mountain, or bringing food to him who gives oblation,

verses.sanskrit: चनिष्टं देवा ओषधीष्वप्सु यद योग्या अश्नवैथे रषीणाम पुरूणि रत्ना दधतौ नयस्मे अनु पूर्वाणि चख्यथुर्युगानि |||
verses.transliteration: caniṣṭaṃ devā oṣadhīṣvapsu yad yoghyā aśnavaithe ṛṣīṇām purūṇi ratnā dadhatau nyasme anu pūrvāṇi cakhyathuryughāni

translations.griffith: Delight yourselves, ye Gods, in plants and waters when Ṛṣis give them and ye find they suit You.  Enriching us with treasures in abundance ye have looked back to former generations.

verses.sanskrit: शुश्रुवांसा चिदश्विना पुरूण्यभि बरह्माणि चक्षाथे रषीणाम परति पर यातं वरमा जनायास्मे वामस्तु सुमतिश्चनिष्ठा |||
verses.transliteration: śuśruvāṃsā cidaśvinā purūṇyabhi brahmāṇi cakṣāthe ṛṣīṇām prati pra yātaṃ varamā janāyāsme vāmastu sumatiścaniṣṭhā

translations.griffith: Aśvins, though ye have heard them oft aforetime, regard the many prayers which Ṛṣis offer.  Come to the man even as his heart desireth: may we enjoy your most delightful favour.

verses.sanskrit: यो वां यज्ञो नासत्या हविष्मान कर्तब्रह्मा समर्यो भवाति उप पर यातं वरमा वसिष्ठमिमा बरह्माण्य रच्यन्ते युवभ्याम |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāṃ yajño nāsatyā haviṣmān kṛtabrahmā samaryo bhavāti upa pra yātaṃ varamā vasiṣṭhamimā brahmāṇy ṛcyante yuvabhyām

translations.griffith: Come to the sacrifice offered you, Nāsatyas, with men, oblations, and prayer duly uttered.  Come to Vasiṣṭha as his heart desireth, for unto you these holy hymns are chanted.

verses.sanskrit: इयं मनीषा इयमश्विना गीरिमां सुव्र्क्तिं वर्षणा जुषेथाम इमा बरह्माणि युवयून्यग्मन यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ manīṣā iyamaśvinā ghīrimāṃ suvṛktiṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām imā brahmāṇi yuvayūnyaghman yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: This is the thought, this is the song, O Aśvins: accept this hymn of ours, ye Steers, with favour.  May these our prayers addressed to you come nigh you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: अप सवसुरुषसो नग जिहीते रिणक्ति कर्ष्णीररुषाय पन्थाम अश्वामघा गोमघा वां हुवेम दिवा नक्तं शरुमस्मद युयोतम |||
verses.transliteration: apa svasuruṣaso nagh jihīte riṇakti kṛṣṇīraruṣāya panthām aśvāmaghā ghomaghā vāṃ huvema divā naktaṃ śarumasmad yuyotam

translations.griffith: THE Night retireth from the Dawn her Sister; the Dark one yieldeth to the Red her pathway.  Let us invoke you rich in steeds and cattle - by day and night keep far from us the arrow.

verses.sanskrit: उपायातं दाशुषे मर्त्याय रथेन वाममश्विना वहन्ता युयुतमस्मदनिराममीवां दिवा नक्तं माध्वी तरासिथां नः |||
verses.transliteration: upāyātaṃ dāśuṣe martyāya rathena vāmamaśvinā vahantā yuyutamasmadanirāmamīvāṃ divā naktaṃ mādhvī trāsithāṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: Bearing rich treasure in your car, O Aśvins, come to the mortal who presents oblation.  Keep at a distance penury and sickness; Lovers of Sweetness, day and night preserve us.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां रथमवमस्यां वयुष्टौ सुम्नायवो वर्षणो वर्तयन्तु सयूमगभस्तिं रतयुग्भिरश्वैराश्विना वसुमन्तं वहेथाम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ rathamavamasyāṃ vyuṣṭau sumnāyavo vṛṣaṇo vartayantu syūmaghabhastiṃ ṛtayughbhiraśvairāśvinā vasumantaṃ vahethām

translations.griffith: May your strong horses, seeking bliss, bring hither your chariot at the earliest flush of morning.  With coursers yoked by Law drive hither, Aśvins, your car whose reins are light, laden with treasure.

verses.sanskrit: यो वां रथो नर्पती अस्ति वोळ्हा तरिवन्धुरो वसुमानुस्रयामा आ न एना नासत्योप यातमभि यद वां विश्वप्स्न्यो जिगाति |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāṃ ratho nṛpatī asti voḷhā trivandhuro vasumānusrayāmā ā na enā nāsatyopa yātamabhi yad vāṃ viśvapsnyo jighāti

translations.griffith: The chariot, Princes, that conveys you, moving at daylight, triple-seated, fraught with riches,  Even with this come unto us, Nāsatyas, that laden with all food it may approach us.

verses.sanskrit: युवं चयवानं जरसो.अमुमुक्तं नि पेदव ऊहथुराशुमश्वम निरंहसस्तमस सपर्तमत्रिं नि जाहुषं शिथिरे धातमन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ cyavānaṃ jaraso.amumuktaṃ ni pedava ūhathurāśumaśvam niraṃhasastamasa spartamatriṃ ni jāhuṣaṃ śithire dhātamantaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye freed Cyavāna from old age and weakness: ye brought the courser fleet of food to Pedu.  Ye rescued Atri from distress and darkness, and loosed for Jāhuṣa the bonds that bound him.

verses.sanskrit: इयं मनीषा इयमश्विना गीर... ||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ manīṣā iyamaśvinā ghīr...

translations.griffith: This is the thought, this is the song, O Aśvins: accept this hymn of ours, ye Steers, With favour.  May these our prayers addressed to you come nigh you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आ गोमता नासत्या रथेनाश्वावता पुरुश्चन्द्रेण यातम अभि वां विश्वा नियुतः सचन्ते सपार्हया शरिया तन्वा शुभाना |||
verses.transliteration: ā ghomatā nāsatyā rathenāśvāvatā puruścandreṇa yātam abhi vāṃ viśvā niyutaḥ sacante spārhayā śriyā tanvā śubhānā

translations.griffith: COME, O Nāsatyas, on your car resplendent, rich in abundant wealth of kine and horses.  As harnessed steeds, all our laudations follow you whose forms shine with most delightful beauty.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो देवेभिरुप यातमर्वाक सजोषसा नासत्या रथेन युवोर्हि नः सख्या पित्र्याणि समानो बन्धुरुत तस्य वित्तम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no devebhirupa yātamarvāk sajoṣasā nāsatyā rathena yuvorhi naḥ sakhyā pitryāṇi samāno bandhuruta tasya vittam

translations.griffith: Come with the Gods associate, come ye hither to us, Nāsatyas, with your car accordant.  'Twixt you and us there is ancestral friendship and common kin: remember and regard it.

verses.sanskrit: उदु सतोमासो अश्विनोरबुध्रञ जामि बरह्माण्युषसश्च देवीः आविवासन रोदसी धिष्ण्येमे अछा विप्रो नासत्या विवक्ति |||
verses.transliteration: udu stomāso aśvinorabudhrañ jāmi brahmāṇyuṣasaśca devīḥ āvivāsan rodasī dhiṣṇyeme achā vipro nāsatyā vivakti

translations.griffith: Awakened are the songs that praise the Aśvins, the kindred prayers and the Celestial Mornings.  Inviting those we long for, Earth and Heaven, the singer calleth these Nāsatyas hither.

verses.sanskrit: वि चेदुछन्त्यश्विना उषासः पर वां बरह्माणि कारवो भरन्ते ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सविता देवो अश्रेद बर्हदग्नयः समिधा जरन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: vi ceduchantyaśvinā uṣāsaḥ pra vāṃ brahmāṇi kāravo bharante ūrdhvaṃ bhānuṃ savitā devo aśred bṛhadaghnayaḥ samidhā jarante

translations.griffith: What time the Dawns break forth in light, O Aśvins, to you the poets offer their devotions.  God Savitar hath sent aloft his splendour, and fires sing praises with the kindled fuel.

verses.sanskrit: आ पश्चातान नासत्या पुरस्तादाश्विना यातमधरादुदक्तात आ विश्वतः पाञ्चजन्येन राया यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā paścātān nāsatyā purastādāśvinā yātamadharādudaktāt ā viśvataḥ pāñcajanyena rāyā yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Come from the west, come from the cast, Nāsatyas, come, Aśvins, from below and from above us.  Bring wealth from all sides for the Fivefold People. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: अतारिष्म तमसस पारमस्य परति सतोमं देवयन्तो दधानाः पुरुदंसा पुरुतमा पुराजामर्त्या हवते अश्विना गीः |||
verses.transliteration: atāriṣma tamasas pāramasya prati stomaṃ devayanto dadhānāḥ purudaṃsā purutamā purājāmartyā havate aśvinā ghīḥ

translations.griffith: WE have o’erpassed the limit of this darkness while, worshipping the Gods, we sang their praises.  The song invoketh both Immortal Aśvins far-reaching, born of old, great WonderWorkers.

verses.sanskrit: नयु परियो मनुषः सादि होता नासत्या यो यजते वन्दते च अश्नीतं मध्वो अश्विना उपाक आ वां वोचे विदथेषु परयस्वान |||
verses.transliteration: nyu priyo manuṣaḥ sādi hotā nāsatyā yo yajate vandate ca aśnītaṃ madhvo aśvinā upāka ā vāṃ voce vidatheṣu prayasvān

translations.griffith: And, O Nāsatyas, man's dear Priest is seated, who brings to sacrifice and offers worship,  Be near and taste the pleasant juice, O Aśvins: with food, I call you to the sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: अहेम यज्ञं पथामुराणा इमां सुव्र्क्तिं वर्षणा जुषेथाम शरुष्टीवेव परेषितो वामबोधि परति सतोमैर्जरमाणो वसिष्ठः |||
verses.transliteration: ahema yajñaṃ pathāmurāṇā imāṃ suvṛktiṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām śruṣṭīveva preṣito vāmabodhi prati stomairjaramāṇo vasiṣṭhaḥ

translations.griffith: We choosing you, have let our worship follow its course: ye Steers, accept this hymn with favour.  Obeying you as your appointed servant, Vasiṣṭha singing hath with lauds aroused you.

verses.sanskrit: उप तया वह्नी गमतो विशं नो रक्षोहणा सम्भ्र्ता वीळुपाणी समन्धांस्यग्मत मत्सराणि मा नो मर्धिष्टमा गतं शिवेन |||
verses.transliteration: upa tyā vahnī ghamato viśaṃ no rakṣohaṇā sambhṛtā vīḷupāṇī samandhāṃsyaghmata matsarāṇi mā no mardhiṣṭamā ghataṃ śivena

translations.griffith: And these Two Priests come nigh unto our people, united, demon-slayers, mighty-handed.  The juices that exhilarate are mingled. Injure us not, but come with happy fortune.

verses.sanskrit: आ पश्चातान नासत्या पुरस्ताद ... ||
verses.transliteration: ā paścātān nāsatyā purastād ...

translations.griffith: Come from the west, come from the cast, Nāsatyas, come, Aśvins, from below and from above us.  Bring wealth from all sides for the Fivefold People. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: इमा उ वां दिविष्टय उस्रा हवन्ते अश्विना अयं वामह्वे.अवसे शचीवसू विशं-विशं हि गछथः |||
verses.transliteration: imā u vāṃ diviṣṭaya usrā havante aśvinā ayaṃ vāmahve.avase śacīvasū viśaṃ-viśaṃ hi ghachathaḥ

translations.griffith: THESE morning sacrifices call you, Aśvins, at the break of day.  For help have I invoked you rich in power and might: for, house by house ye visit all.

verses.sanskrit: युवं चित्रं ददथुर्भोजनं नरा चोदेथां सून्र्तावते अर्वाग रथं समनसा नि यछतं पिबतं सोम्यं मधु |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ citraṃ dadathurbhojanaṃ narā codethāṃ sūnṛtāvate arvāgh rathaṃ samanasā ni yachataṃ pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu

translations.griffith: O Heroes, ye bestow wonderful nourishment. send it to him whose songs are sweet  Accordant, both of you, drive your car down to us, and drink the savoury Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: आ यातमुप भूषतं मध्वः पिबतमश्विना दुग्धं पयोव्र्षणा जेन्यावसू मा नो मर्धिष्टमा गतम |||
verses.transliteration: ā yātamupa bhūṣataṃ madhvaḥ pibatamaśvinā dughdhaṃ payovṛṣaṇā jenyāvasū mā no mardhiṣṭamā ghatam

translations.griffith: Approach ye and be near to us. drink, O ye Aśvins, of the meath.  Draw forth the milk, ye Mighty, rich in genuine wealth: injure us not, and come to us.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वासो ये वामुप दाशुषो गर्हं युवां दीयन्ति बिभ्रतः मक्षूयुभिर्नरा हयेभिरश्विना देवा यातमस्मयू |||
verses.transliteration: aśvāso ye vāmupa dāśuṣo ghṛhaṃ yuvāṃ dīyanti bibhrataḥ makṣūyubhirnarā hayebhiraśvinā devā yātamasmayū

translations.griffith: The horses that convey you in their rapid flight down to the worshipper's abode,  With these your speedy coursers, Heroes, Aśvins, come, ye Gods, come well-inclined to us.

verses.sanskrit: अधा ह यन्तो अश्विना पर्क्षः सचन्त सूरयः ता यंसतो मघवद्भ्यो धरुवं यशश्छर्दिरस्मभ्यं नासत्या |||
verses.transliteration: adhā ha yanto aśvinā pṛkṣaḥ sacanta sūrayaḥ tā yaṃsato maghavadbhyo dhruvaṃ yaśaśchardirasmabhyaṃ nāsatyā

translations.griffith: Yea, verily, our princes seek the Aśvins in pursuit of food.  These shall give lasting glory to our liberal lords, and, both Nāsatyas, shelter us.

verses.sanskrit: पर ये ययुरव्र्कासो रथा इव नर्पातारो जनानाम उत सवेन शवसा शूशुवुर्नर उत कषियन्ति सुक्षितिम |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye yayuravṛkāso rathā iva nṛpātāro janānām uta svena śavasā śūśuvurnara uta kṣiyanti sukṣitim

translations.griffith: Those who have led the way, like cars, offending none, those who are guardians of the men-  Also through their own might the heroes have grown strong, and dwell in safe and happy homes.

verses.sanskrit: वयुषा आवो दिविजा रतेनाविष्क्र्ण्वाना महिमानमागात अप दरुहस्तम आवरजुष्टमङगिरस्तमा पथ्या अजीगः |||
verses.transliteration: vyuṣā āvo divijā ṛtenāviṣkṛṇvānā mahimānamāghāt apa druhastama āvarajuṣṭamaṅghirastamā pathyā ajīghaḥ

translations.griffith: BORN in the heavens the Dawn hath flushed, and showing her majesty is come as Law ordaineth.  She hath uncovered fiends and hateful darkness; best of Aṅgirases, hath waked the pathways.

verses.sanskrit: महे नो अद्य सुविताय बोध्युषो महे सौभगाय पर यन्धि चित्रं रयिं यशसं धेह्यस्मे देवि मर्तेषु मानुषि शरवस्युम |||
verses.transliteration: mahe no adya suvitāya bodhyuṣo mahe saubhaghāya pra yandhi citraṃ rayiṃ yaśasaṃ dhehyasme devi marteṣu mānuṣi śravasyum

translations.griffith: Rouse us this day to high and happy fortune: to great felicity, O Dawn, promote us.  Vouchsafe us manifold and splendid riches, famed among mortals, man-befriending Goddess!

verses.sanskrit: एते तये भानवो दर्शतायाश्चित्रा उषसो अम्र्तास आगुः जनयन्तो दैव्यानि वरतान्याप्र्णन्तो अन्तरिक्षा वयस्थुः |||
verses.transliteration: ete tye bhānavo darśatāyāścitrā uṣaso amṛtāsa āghuḥ janayanto daivyāni vratānyāpṛṇanto antarikṣā vyasthuḥ

translations.griffith: See, lovely Morning's everlasting splendours, bright with their varied colours, have approached us.  Filling the region of mid-air, producing the rites of holy worship, they have mounted.

verses.sanskrit: एषा सया युजाना पराकात पञ्च कषितीः परि सद्यो जिगाति अभिपश्यन्ती वयुना जनानां दिवो दुहिता भुवनस्यपत्नी |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā syā yujānā parākāt pañca kṣitīḥ pari sadyo jighāti abhipaśyantī vayunā janānāṃ divo duhitā bhuvanasyapatnī

translations.griffith: She yokes her chariot far away, and swiftly visits the lands where the Five Tribes are settled,  Looking upon the works and ways of mortals, Daughter of Heaven, the world's Imperial Lady.

verses.sanskrit: वाजिनीवती सूर्यस्य योषा चित्रामघा राय ईशे वसूनाम रषिष्टुता जरयन्ती मघोन्युषा उछति वह्निभिर्ग्र्णाना |||
verses.transliteration: vājinīvatī sūryasya yoṣā citrāmaghā rāya īśe vasūnām ṛṣiṣṭutā jarayantī maghonyuṣā uchati vahnibhirghṛṇānā

translations.griffith: She who is rich in spoil, the Spouse of Sūrya, wondrously opulent, rules all wealth and treasures.  Consumer of our youth, the seers extol her: lauded by priests rich Dawn shines out refulgent.

verses.sanskrit: परति दयुतानामरुषासो अश्वाश्चित्रा अद्र्श्रन्नुषसं वहन्तः याति शुभ्रा विश्वपिशा रथेन दधाति रत्नंविधते जनाय |||
verses.transliteration: prati dyutānāmaruṣāso aśvāścitrā adṛśrannuṣasaṃ vahantaḥ yāti śubhrā viśvapiśā rathena dadhāti ratnaṃvidhate janāya

translations.griffith: Apparent are the steeds of varied colour, the red steeds carrying resplendent Morning.  On her all-lovely car she comes, the Fair One, and brings rich treasure for her faithful servant.

verses.sanskrit: सत्या सत्येभिर्महती महद्भिर्देवी देवेभिर्यजता यजत्रैः रुजद दर्ळ्हानि दददुस्रियाणां परति गाव उषसं वावशन्त |||
verses.transliteration: satyā satyebhirmahatī mahadbhirdevī devebhiryajatā yajatraiḥ rujad dṛḷhāni dadadusriyāṇāṃ prati ghāva uṣasaṃ vāvaśanta

translations.griffith: True with the True and Mighty with the Mighty, with Gods a Goddess, Holy with the Holy,  She brake strong fences down and gave the cattle: the kine were lowing as they greeted Morning.

verses.sanskrit: नू नो गोमद वीरवद धेहि रत्नमुषो अश्वावद पुरुभोजो अस्मे मा नो बर्हिः पुरुषता निदे कर्यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: nū no ghomad vīravad dhehi ratnamuṣo aśvāvad purubhojo asme mā no barhiḥ puruṣatā nide karyūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: O Dawn, now give us wealth in kine and heroes, and horses, fraught with manifold enjoyment.  Protect our sacred grass from man's reproaches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: उदु जयोतिरम्र्तं विश्वजन्यं विश्वानरः सविता देवो अश्रेत करत्वा देवानामजनिष्ट चक्षुराविरकर्भुवनंविश्वमुषाः |||
verses.transliteration: udu jyotiramṛtaṃ viśvajanyaṃ viśvānaraḥ savitā devo aśret kratvā devānāmajaniṣṭa cakṣurāvirakarbhuvanaṃviśvamuṣāḥ

translations.griffith: SAVITAR God of all men hath sent upward his light, designed for all mankind, immortal.  Through the Gods’ power that Eye was first created. Dawn hath made all the universe apparent.

verses.sanskrit: पर मे पन्था देवयाना अद्र्श्रन्नमर्धन्तो वसुभिरिष्क्र्तासः अभूदु केतुरुषसः पुरस्तात परतीच्यागादधि हर्म्येभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: pra me panthā devayānā adṛśrannamardhanto vasubhiriṣkṛtāsaḥ abhūdu keturuṣasaḥ purastāt pratīcyāghādadhi harmyebhyaḥ

translations.griffith: I see the paths which Gods are wont to travel, innocuous paths made ready by the Vasus.  Eastward the flag of Dawn hath been uplifted; she hath come hither o’er the tops of houses.

verses.sanskrit: तानीदहानि बहुलान्यासन या पराचीनमुदिता सूर्यस्य यतः परि जार इवाचरन्त्युषो दद्र्क्षे न पुनर्यतीव |||
verses.transliteration: tānīdahāni bahulānyāsan yā prācīnamuditā sūryasya yataḥ pari jāra ivācarantyuṣo dadṛkṣe na punaryatīva

translations.griffith: Great is, in truth, the number of the Mornings which were aforetime at the Sun's uprising.  Since thou, O Dawn, hast been beheld repairing as to thy love, as one no more to leave him.

verses.sanskrit: त इद देवानां सधमाद आसन्न्र्तावानः कवयः पूर्व्यासः गूळ्हं जयोतिः पितरो अन्वविन्दन सत्यमन्त्रा अजनयन्नुषासम |||
verses.transliteration: ta id devānāṃ sadhamāda āsannṛtāvānaḥ kavayaḥ pūrvyāsaḥ ghūḷhaṃ jyotiḥ pitaro anvavindan satyamantrā ajanayannuṣāsam

translations.griffith: They were the Gods’ companions at the banquet, the ancient sages true to Law Eternal.  The Fathers found the light that lay in darkness, and with effectual words begat the Morning.

verses.sanskrit: समान ऊर्वे अधि संगतासः सं जानते न यतन्ते मिथस्ते ते देवानां न मिनन्ति वरतान्यमर्धन्तो वसुभिर्यादमानाः |||
verses.transliteration: samāna ūrve adhi saṃghatāsaḥ saṃ jānate na yatante mithaste te devānāṃ na minanti vratānyamardhanto vasubhiryādamānāḥ

translations.griffith: Meeting together in the same enclosure, they strive not, ofone mind, one with another.  They never break the Gods’ eternal statutes, and injure none, in rivalry with Vasus.

verses.sanskrit: परति तवा सतोमैरीळते वसिष्ठा उषर्बुधः सुभगे तुष्टुवांसः गवां नेत्री वाजपत्नी न उछोषः सुजाते परथमा जरस्व |||
verses.transliteration: prati tvā stomairīḷate vasiṣṭhā uṣarbudhaḥ subhaghe tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ ghavāṃ netrī vājapatnī na uchoṣaḥ sujāte prathamā jarasva

translations.griffith: Extolling thee, Blest Goddess, the Vasisthas, awake at early mom, with lauds implore thee.  Leader of kine and Queen of all that strengthens, shine, come as first to us, O high-born Morning.

verses.sanskrit: एषा नेत्री राधसः सून्र्तानामुषा उछन्ती रिभ्यते वसिष्ठैः दीर्घश्रुतं रयिमस्मे दधाना यूयं पात . .. |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā netrī rādhasaḥ sūnṛtānāmuṣā uchantī ribhyate vasiṣṭhaiḥ dīrghaśrutaṃ rayimasme dadhānā yūyaṃ pāta . ..

translations.griffith: She bringeth bounty and sweet charm of voices. The flushing Dawn is sung by the Vasisthas,  Giving us riches famed to distant places. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: उपो रुरुचे युवतिर्न योषा विश्वं जीवं परसुवन्ती चरायै अभूदग्निः समिधे मानुषाणामकर्ज्योतिर्बाधमाना तमांसि |||
verses.transliteration: upo ruruce yuvatirna yoṣā viśvaṃ jīvaṃ prasuvantī carāyai abhūdaghniḥ samidhe mānuṣāṇāmakarjyotirbādhamānā tamāṃsi

translations.griffith: SHE hath shone brightly like a youthful woman, stirring to motion every living creature.  Agni hath come to feed on mortal? fuel. She hath made light and chased away the darkness.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वं परतीची सप्रथा उदस्थाद रुशद वासो बिभ्रतीशुक्रमश्वैत हिरण्यवर्णा सुद्र्शीकसन्द्र्ग गवां मातानेत्र्यह्नामरोचि |||
verses.transliteration: viśvaṃ pratīcī saprathā udasthād ruśad vāso bibhratīśukramaśvait hiraṇyavarṇā sudṛśīkasandṛgh ghavāṃ mātānetryahnāmaroci

translations.griffith: Turned to this All, far-spreading, she hath risen and shone in brightness with white robes about her.  She hath beamed forth lovely with golden colours, Mother of kine, Guide of the days she bringeth.

verses.sanskrit: देवानां चक्षुः सुभगा वहन्ती शवेतं नयन्ती सुद्र्शीकमश्वम उषा अदर्शि रश्मिभिर्व्यक्ता चित्रामघा विश्वमनु परभूता |||
verses.transliteration: devānāṃ cakṣuḥ subhaghā vahantī śvetaṃ nayantī sudṛśīkamaśvam uṣā adarśi raśmibhirvyaktā citrāmaghā viśvamanu prabhūtā

translations.griffith: Bearing the Gods’ own Eye, auspicious Lady, leading her Courser white and fair to look on,  Distinguished by her bean-is Dawn shines apparent, come forth to all the world with wondrous treasure.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तिवामा दूरे अमित्रमुछोर्वीं गव्यूतिमभयं कर्धी नः यावय दवेष आ भरा वसूनि चोदय राधो गर्णते मघोनि |||
verses.transliteration: antivāmā dūre amitramuchorvīṃ ghavyūtimabhayaṃ kṛdhī naḥ yāvaya dveṣa ā bharā vasūni codaya rādho ghṛṇate maghoni

translations.griffith: Draw nigh with wealth and dawn away the foeman: prepare for us wide pasture free from danger.  Drive away those who hate us, bring us riches: pour bounty, opulent Lady, on the singer.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे शरेष्ठेभिर्भानुभिर्वि भाह्युषो देवि परतिरन्ती न आयुः इषं च नो दधती विश्ववारे गोमदश्वावद रथवच्च राधः |||
verses.transliteration: asme śreṣṭhebhirbhānubhirvi bhāhyuṣo devi pratirantī na āyuḥ iṣaṃ ca no dadhatī viśvavāre ghomadaśvāvad rathavacca rādhaḥ

translations.griffith: Send thy most excellent beams to shine and light us, giving us lengthened days, O Dawn, O Goddess,  Granting us food, thou who hast all things precious, and bounty rich in chariots, kine, and horses.

verses.sanskrit: यां तवा दिवो दुहितर्वर्धयन्त्युषः सुजाते मतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः सास्मासु धा रयिं रष्वं बर्हन्तं यूयं पात .. . |||
verses.transliteration: yāṃ tvā divo duhitarvardhayantyuṣaḥ sujāte matibhirvasiṣṭhāḥ sāsmāsu dhā rayiṃ ṛṣvaṃ bṛhantaṃ yūyaṃ pāta .. .

translations.griffith: O Uṣas, nobly-born, Daughter of Heaven, whom the Vasisthas with their hymns make mighty,  Bestow thou on us vast and glorious riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: परति केतवः परथमा अद्र्श्रन्नूर्ध्वा अस्या अञ्जयो वि शरयन्ते उषो अर्वाचा बर्हता रथेन जयोतिष्मता वाममस्मभ्यं वक्षि |||
verses.transliteration: prati ketavaḥ prathamā adṛśrannūrdhvā asyā añjayo vi śrayante uṣo arvācā bṛhatā rathena jyotiṣmatā vāmamasmabhyaṃ vakṣi

translations.griffith: WE have beheld her earliest lights approaching: her many glories part, on high, asunder.  On car sublime, refulgent, wending hither, O Uṣas, bring the Wealth that makes us happy.

verses.sanskrit: परति षीमग्निर्जरते समिद्धः परति विप्रासो मतिभिर्ग्र्णन्तः उषा याति जयोतिषा बाधमाना विश्वा तमांसि दुरिताप देवी |||
verses.transliteration: prati ṣīmaghnirjarate samiddhaḥ prati viprāso matibhirghṛṇantaḥ uṣā yāti jyotiṣā bādhamānā viśvā tamāṃsi duritāpa devī

translations.griffith: The fire well-kindIed sings aloud to greet her, and with their hymns the priests are chaming welcome.  Uṣas approaches in her splendour, driving all evil darkness far away, the Goddess.

verses.sanskrit: एता उ तयाः परत्यद्र्श्रन पुरस्ताज्ज्योतिर्यछन्तीरुषसोविभातीः अजीजनन सूर्यं यज्ञमग्निमपाचीनं तमो अगादजुष्टम |||
verses.transliteration: etā u tyāḥ pratyadṛśran purastājjyotiryachantīruṣasovibhātīḥ ajījanan sūryaṃ yajñamaghnimapācīnaṃ tamo aghādajuṣṭam

translations.griffith: Apparent eastward are those lights of Morning, sending out lustre, as they rise, around them.  She hath brought forth Sun, sacrifice, and Agni, and far away hath fled detested darkness.

verses.sanskrit: अचेति दिवो दुहिता मघोनी विश्वे पश्यन्त्युषसं विभातीम आस्थाद रथं सवधया युज्यमानमा यमश्वासः सुयुजो वहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: aceti divo duhitā maghonī viśve paśyantyuṣasaṃ vibhātīm āsthād rathaṃ svadhayā yujyamānamā yamaśvāsaḥ suyujo vahanti

translations.griffith: Rich Daughter of the Sky, we all behold her, yea, all men look on Dawn as she is breaking.  fler car that moves self-harnessed hath she mounted, the car drawn onward by her well-yoked horses.

verses.sanskrit: परति तवाद्य सुमनसो बुधन्तास्माकासो मघवानो वयं च तिल्विलायध्वमुषसो विभातीर्यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: prati tvādya sumanaso budhantāsmākāso maghavāno vayaṃ ca tilvilāyadhvamuṣaso vibhātīryūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Inspired with loving thoughts this day to greet thee, we and our wealthy nobles have awakened.  Show yourselves fruitful, Dawns, as ye are rising. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: वयुषा आवः पथ्या जनानां पञ्च कषितीर्मानुषीर्बोधयन्ती सुसन्द्र्ग्भिरुक्षभिर्भानुमश्रेद वि सूर्यो रोदसी चक्षसावः |||
verses.transliteration: vyuṣā āvaḥ pathyā janānāṃ pañca kṣitīrmānuṣīrbodhayantī susandṛghbhirukṣabhirbhānumaśred vi sūryo rodasī cakṣasāvaḥ

translations.griffith: ROUSING the lands where men's Five Tribes are settled, Dawn hath disclosed the pathways of the people.  She hath sent out her sheen with beauteous oxen. The Sun with light hath opened earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: वयञ्जते दिवो अन्तेष्वक्तून विशो न युक्ता उषसो यतन्ते सं ते गावस्तम आ वर्तयन्ति जयोतिर्यछन्ति सवितेव बाहू |||
verses.transliteration: vyañjate divo anteṣvaktūn viśo na yuktā uṣaso yatante saṃ te ghāvastama ā vartayanti jyotiryachanti saviteva bāhū

translations.griffith: They paint their bright rays on the sky's far limits. the Dawns come on like tribes arrayed for battle.  Thy cattle, closely shutting up the darkness, as Savitar spreads his arms, give forth their lustre.

verses.sanskrit: अभूदुषा इन्द्रतमा मघोन्यजीजनत सुविताय शरवांसि वि दिवो देवी दुहिता दधात्यङगिरस्तमा सुक्र्ते वसूनि |||
verses.transliteration: abhūduṣā indratamā maghonyajījanat suvitāya śravāṃsi vi divo devī duhitā dadhātyaṅghirastamā sukṛte vasūni

translations.griffith: Wealthy, most like to Indra, Dawn hath risen, and brought forth lauds that shall promote our welfare.  Daughter of Heaven, a Goddess, she distributes, best of Aṅgirases, treasures to the pious.

verses.sanskrit: तावदुषो राधो अस्मभ्यं रास्व यावत सतोत्र्भ्यो अरदो गर्णाना यां तवा जज्ञुर्व्र्षभस्या रवेण वि दर्ळ्हस्य दुरो अद्रेरौर्णोः |||
verses.transliteration: tāvaduṣo rādho asmabhyaṃ rāsva yāvat stotṛbhyo arado ghṛṇānā yāṃ tvā jajñurvṛṣabhasyā raveṇa vi dṛḷhasya duro adreraurṇoḥ

translations.griffith: Bestow on us, O Dawn, that ample bounty which thou didst send to those who sang thy praises;  Thou whom with bellowings of a bull they quickened: thou didst unbar the firm-set mountain's portals.

verses.sanskrit: देवं-देवं राधसे चोदयन्त्यस्मद्र्यक सून्र्ता ईरयन्ती वयुछन्ती नः सनये धियो धा यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: devaṃ-devaṃ rādhase codayantyasmadryak sūnṛtā īrayantī vyuchantī naḥ sanaye dhiyo dhā yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Impelling every God to grant his bounty sending to us the charm of pleasant voices,  Vouchsafe us thoughts, for profit, as thou breakest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: परति सतोमेभिरुषसं वसिष्ठा गीर्भिर्विप्रासः परथमा अबुध्रन विवर्तयन्तीं रजसी समन्ते आविष्क्र्ण्वतीं भुवनानि विश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: prati stomebhiruṣasaṃ vasiṣṭhā ghīrbhirviprāsaḥ prathamā abudhran vivartayantīṃ rajasī samante āviṣkṛṇvatīṃ bhuvanāni viśvā

translations.griffith: THE priests, Vasisthas, are the first awakened to welcome Uṣas with their songs and praises,  Who makes surrounding regions part asunder,and shows apparent all existing creatures.

verses.sanskrit: एषा सया नव्यमायुर्दधाना गूढ्वी तमो जयोतिषोषाबोधि अग्र एति युवतिरह्रयाणा पराचिकितत सूर्यं यज्ञमग्निम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā syā navyamāyurdadhānā ghūḍhvī tamo jyotiṣoṣāabodhi aghra eti yuvatirahrayāṇā prācikitat sūryaṃ yajñamaghnim

translations.griffith: Giving fresh life when she hath hid the darkness, this Dawn hath wakened there with new-born lustre.  Youthful and unrestrained she cometh forward: she hath turned thoughts to Sun and fire and worship.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्न उषासो ... ||
verses.transliteration: aśvāvatīrghomatīrna uṣāso ...

translations.griffith: May blessed Mornings shine on us for ever, with wealth of kine, of horses, and of heroes,  Streaming with all abundance, pouring fatness. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: परत्यु अदर्श्यायत्युछन्ती दुहिता दिवः अपो महि वययति चक्षसे तमो जयोतिष कर्णोति सूनरी |||
verses.transliteration: pratyu adarśyāyatyuchantī duhitā divaḥ apo mahi vyayati cakṣase tamo jyotiṣ kṛṇoti sūnarī

translations.griffith: ADVANCING, sending forth her rays, the Daughter of the Sky is seen.  Uncovering, that we may see, the mighty gloom, the friendly Lady makes the light.

verses.sanskrit: उदुस्रियाः सर्जते सूर्यः सचानुद्यन नक्षत्रमर्चिवत तवेदुषो वयुषि सूर्यस्य च सं भक्तेन गमेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: udusriyāḥ sṛjate sūryaḥ sacānudyan nakṣatramarcivat taveduṣo vyuṣi sūryasya ca saṃ bhaktena ghamemahi

translations.griffith: The Sun ascending, the refulgent Star, pours down his beams together with the Dawn.  O Dawn, at thine arising, and the Sun's, may we attain the share allotted us.

verses.sanskrit: परति तवा दुहितर्दिव उषो जीरा अभुत्स्महि या वहसि पुरुस्पार्हं वनन्वति रत्नं न दाशुषे मयः |||
verses.transliteration: prati tvā duhitardiva uṣo jīrā abhutsmahi yā vahasi puruspārhaṃ vananvati ratnaṃ na dāśuṣe mayaḥ

translations.griffith: Promptly we woke to welcome thee, O Uṣas, Daughter of the Sky,  Thee, Bounteous One, who bringest all we long to have, and to the offerer health and wealth.

verses.sanskrit: उछन्ती या कर्णोषि मंहना महि परख्यै देवि सवर्द्र्शे तस्यास्ते रत्नभाज ईमहे वयं सयाम मातुर्न सूनवः |||
verses.transliteration: uchantī yā kṛṇoṣi maṃhanā mahi prakhyai devi svardṛśe tasyāste ratnabhāja īmahe vayaṃ syāma māturna sūnavaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, dawning, workest fain to light the great world, yea, heaven, Goddess! that it may be seen.  We yearn to be thine own, Dealer of Wealth: may we be to this Mother like her sons.

verses.sanskrit: तच्चित्रं राध आ भरोषो यद दीर्घश्रुत्तमम यत तेदिवो दुहितर्मर्तभोजनं तद रास्व भुनजामहै |||
verses.transliteration: taccitraṃ rādha ā bharoṣo yad dīrghaśruttamam yat tedivo duhitarmartabhojanaṃ tad rāsva bhunajāmahai

translations.griffith: Bring us that wondrous bounty, Dawn, that shall be famed most far away.  What, Child of Heaven, thou hast of nourishment for man, bestow thou on us to enjoy.

verses.sanskrit: शरवः सूरिभ्यो अम्र्तं वसुत्वनं वाजानस्मभ्यं गोमतः चोदयित्री मघोनः सून्र्तावत्युषा उछदप सरिधः |||
verses.transliteration: śravaḥ sūribhyo amṛtaṃ vasutvanaṃ vājānasmabhyaṃ ghomataḥ codayitrī maghonaḥ sūnṛtāvatyuṣā uchadapa sridhaḥ

translations.griffith: Give to our princes opulence and immortal fame, and strength in herds of kine to us.  May she who prompts the wealthy, Lady of sweet strains, may Uṣas dawn our foes away.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा युवमध्वराय नो विशे जनाय महि शर्म यछतम दीर्घप्रयज्युमति यो वनुष्यति वयं जयेम पर्तनासु दूढ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇā yuvamadhvarāya no viśe janāya mahi śarma yachatam dīrghaprayajyumati yo vanuṣyati vayaṃ jayema pṛtanāsu dūḍhyaḥ

translations.griffith: GRANT us your strong protection, IndraVaruṇa, our people, and our family, for sacrifice.  May we subdue in fight our evil-hearted foes, him who attacks the man steadfast in lengthened rites.

verses.sanskrit: सम्राळ अन्यः सवराळ अन्य उच्यते वां महान्ताविन्द्रावरुणा महावसू विश्वे देवासः परमे वयोमनि सं वामोजोव्र्षणा सं बलं दधुः |||
verses.transliteration: samrāḷ anyaḥ svarāḷ anya ucyate vāṃ mahāntāvindrāvaruṇā mahāvasū viśve devāsaḥ parame vyomani saṃ vāmojovṛṣaṇā saṃ balaṃ dadhuḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, mighty and very rich One of you is called Monarch and One Autocrat.  All Gods in the most lofty region of the air have, O ye Steers, combined all power and might in you.

verses.sanskrit: अन्वपां खान्यत्र्न्तमोजसा सूर्यमैरयतं दिवि परभु ||
verses.transliteration: anvapāṃ khānyatṛntamojasā sūryamairayataṃ divi prabhu

translations.griffith: Ye with your strength have pierced the fountains of the floods: the Sun have ye brought forward as the Lord in heaven.  Cheered by this magic draught ye, Indra-Varuṇa, made the dry places stream, made songs of praise flow forth.

verses.sanskrit: म इन्द्रावरुणा मदे अस्य मायिनो.अपिन्वतमपितः पिन्वतं धियः |||
verses.transliteration: m indrāvaruṇā made asya māyino.apinvatamapitaḥ pinvataṃ dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: In battels and in frays we ministering priests, kneeling upon our knees for furtherance of our weal,  Invoke you, only you, the Lords of twofold wealth, you prompt to hear, we bards, O Indra-Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: युवामिद युत्सु पर्तनासु वह्नयो युवां कषेमस्य परसवे मितज्ञवः ईशाना वस्व उभयस्य कारव इन्द्रावरुणा सुहवा हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāmid yutsu pṛtanāsu vahnayo yuvāṃ kṣemasya prasave mitajñavaḥ īśānā vasva ubhayasya kārava indrāvaruṇā suhavā havāmahe

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, as ye created all these creatures of the world by your surpassing might,  In peace and quiet Mitra waits on Varuṇa, the Other, awful, with the Maruis seeks renown.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा यदिमानि चक्रथुर्विश्वा जातानि भुवनस्यमज्मना कषेमेण मित्रो वरुणं दुवस्यति मरुद्भिरुग्रः शुभमन्य ईयते |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇā yadimāni cakrathurviśvā jātāni bhuvanasyamajmanā kṣemeṇa mitro varuṇaṃ duvasyati marudbhirughraḥ śubhamanya īyate

translations.griffith: That Varuṇa's high worth may shine preeminent, these Twain have measured each his proper power and might.  The One subdueth the destructive enemy; the Other with a few furthereth many a man.

verses.sanskrit: महे शुल्काय वरुणस्य नु तविष ओजो मिमाते धरुवमस्य यत सवम अजामिमन्यः शनथयन्तमातिरद दभ्रेभिरन्यः पर वर्णोति भूयसः |||
verses.transliteration: mahe śulkāya varuṇasya nu tviṣa ojo mimāte dhruvamasya yat svam ajāmimanyaḥ śnathayantamātirad dabhrebhiranyaḥ pra vṛṇoti bhūyasaḥ

translations.griffith: No trouble, no misfortune, Indra-Varuṇa, no woe from any side assails the mortal man  Whose sacrifice, O Gods, ye visit and enjoy: ne’er doth the crafty guile of mortal injure him.

verses.sanskrit: न तमंहो न दुरितानि मर्त्यमिन्द्रावरुणा न तपः कुतश्चन यस्य देवा गछथो वीथो अध्वरं न तं मर्तस्य नशते परिह्व्र्तिः |||
verses.transliteration: na tamaṃho na duritāni martyamindrāvaruṇā na tapaḥ kutaścana yasya devā ghachatho vītho adhvaraṃ na taṃ martasya naśate parihvṛtiḥ

translations.griffith: With your divine protection, Heroes, come to us: mine invncation hear, if ye be pleased therewith.  Bestow ye upon us, O Indra-Varuṇa, your friendship and your kinship and your favouring grace.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वां नरा दैव्येनावसा गतं शर्णुतं हवं यदि मे जुजोषथः युवोर्हि सख्यमुत वा यदाप्यं मार्डीकमिन्द्रावरुणा नि यछतम |||
verses.transliteration: arvāṃ narā daivyenāvasā ghataṃ śṛṇutaṃ havaṃ yadi me jujoṣathaḥ yuvorhi sakhyamuta vā yadāpyaṃ mārḍīkamindrāvaruṇā ni yachatam

translations.griffith: In battle after battle, Indra-Varuṇa, be ye our Champions, ye who are the peoples' strength,  When both opposing bands invoke you for the fight, and men that they may gain offspring and progeny.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकमिन्द्रावरुणा भरे-भरे पुरोयोधा भवतं कर्ष्ट्योजसा यद वां हवन्त उभये अध सप्र्धि नरस्तोकस्य तनयस्य सातिषु |||
verses.transliteration: asmākamindrāvaruṇā bhare-bhare puroyodhā bhavataṃ kṛṣṭyojasā yad vāṃ havanta ubhaye adha spṛdhi narastokasya tanayasya sātiṣu

translations.griffith: May Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman vouchsafe us glory and great shelter spreading far.  We think of the beneficent light of Aditi, and Savitar's song of praise, the God who strengthens Law.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे इन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा दयुम्नं यछन्तु महि शर्मसप्रथः अवध्रं जयोतिरदितेरताव्र्धो देवस्य शलोकं सवितुर्मनामहे |||
verses.transliteration: asme indro varuṇo mitro aryamā dyumnaṃ yachantu mahi śarmasaprathaḥ avadhraṃ jyotiraditertāvṛdho devasya ślokaṃ saviturmanāmahe

translations.griffith: Missing line from Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: युवां नरा पश्यमानास आप्यं पराचा गव्यन्तः पर्थुपर्शवो ययुः दासा च वर्त्रा हतमार्याणि च सुदासमिन्द्रावरुणावसावतम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāṃ narā paśyamānāsa āpyaṃ prācā ghavyantaḥ pṛthuparśavo yayuḥ dāsā ca vṛtrā hatamāryāṇi ca sudāsamindrāvaruṇāvasāvatam

translations.griffith: LOOKING to you and your alliance, O ye Men, armed with broad axes they went forward, fain for spoil.  Ye smote and slew his Dāsa and his Āryan enemies, and helped Sudās with favour, Indra-Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रा नरः समयन्ते कर्तध्वजो यस्मिन्नाजा भवति किंचन परियम यत्रा भयन्ते भुवना सवर्द्र्शस्तत्रा न इन्द्रावरुणाधि वोचतम |||
verses.transliteration: yatrā naraḥ samayante kṛtadhvajo yasminnājā bhavati kiṃcana priyam yatrā bhayante bhuvanā svardṛśastatrā na indrāvaruṇādhi vocatam

translations.griffith: Where heroes come together with their banners raised, in the encounter where is naught for us to love,  Where all things that behold the light are terrified, there did ye comfort us, O Indra-Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: सं भूम्या अन्ता धवसिरा अद्र्क्षतेन्द्रावरुणा दिवि घोषारुहत अस्थुर्जनानामुप मामरातयो.अर्वागवसा हवनश्रुता गतम |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ bhūmyā antā dhvasirā adṛkṣatendrāvaruṇā divi ghoṣaāruhat asthurjanānāmupa māmarātayo.arvāghavasā havanaśrutā ghatam

translations.griffith: The boundaries of earth were seen all dark with dust: O Indra-Varuṇa, the shout went up to heaven.  The enmities of the people compassed me about. Ye heard my calling and ye came to me with help.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा वधनाभिरप्रति भेदं वन्वन्ता पर सुदासमावतम बरह्माण्येषां शर्णुतं हवीमनि सत्या तर्त्सूनामभवत पुरोहितिः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇā vadhanābhiraprati bhedaṃ vanvantā pra sudāsamāvatam brahmāṇyeṣāṃ śṛṇutaṃ havīmani satyā tṛtsūnāmabhavat purohitiḥ

translations.griffith: With your resistless weapons, Indra-Varuṇa, ye conquered Bheda and ye gave Sudās your aid.  Ye heard the prayers of these amid the cries of war: effectual was the service of the Trtsus' priest.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणावभ्या तपन्ति माघान्यर्यो वनुषामरातयः युवं हि वस्व उभयस्य राजथो.अध समा नो.अवतं पार्ये दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇāvabhyā tapanti māghānyaryo vanuṣāmarātayaḥ yuvaṃ hi vasva ubhayasya rājatho.adha smā no.avataṃ pārye divi

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, the wickedness of foes and mine assailants' hatred sorely trouble me.  Ye Twain are Lords of riches both of earth and heaven: so grant to us your aid on the decisive day.

verses.sanskrit: युवां हवन्त उभयास आजिष्विन्द्रं च वस्वो वरुणं चसातये यत्र राजभिर्दशभिर्निबाधितं पर सुदासमावतं तर्त्सुभिः सह |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāṃ havanta ubhayāsa ājiṣvindraṃ ca vasvo varuṇaṃ casātaye yatra rājabhirdaśabhirnibādhitaṃ pra sudāsamāvataṃ tṛtsubhiḥ saha

translations.griffith: The men of both the hosts invoked you in the fight, Indra and Varuṇa, that they might win the wealth,  What time ye helped Sudās, with all the Trtsu folk, when the Ten Kings had pressed him down in their attack.

verses.sanskrit: दश राजानः समिता अयज्यवः सुदासमिन्द्रावरुणा न युयुधुः सत्या नर्णामद्मसदामुपस्तुतिर्देवा एषामभवन देवहूतिषु |||
verses.transliteration: daśa rājānaḥ samitā ayajyavaḥ sudāsamindrāvaruṇā na yuyudhuḥ satyā nṛṇāmadmasadāmupastutirdevā eṣāmabhavan devahūtiṣu

translations.griffith: Ten Kings who worshipped not, O Indra-Varuṇa, confederate, in war prevailed not o’er Sudās.  True was the boast of heroes sitting at the feast: so at their invocations Gods were on their side.

verses.sanskrit: दाशराज्ञे परियत्ताय विश्वतः सुदास इन्द्रावरुणावशिक्षतम शवित्यञ्चो यत्र नमसा कपर्दिनो धिया धीवन्तो असपन्त तर्त्सवः |||
verses.transliteration: dāśarājñe pariyattāya viśvataḥ sudāsa indrāvaruṇāvaśikṣatam śvityañco yatra namasā kapardino dhiyā dhīvanto asapanta tṛtsavaḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, ye gave Sudās your aid when the Ten Kings in battle compassed him about,  There where the white-robed Trtsus with their braided hair, skilled in song worshipped you with homage and with hymn.

verses.sanskrit: वर्त्राण्यन्यः समिथेषु जिघ्नते वरतान्यन्यो अभि रक्षते सदा हवामहे वां वर्षणा सुव्र्क्तिभिरस्मे इन्द्रावरुणा शर्म यछतम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛtrāṇyanyaḥ samitheṣu jighnate vratānyanyo abhi rakṣate sadā havāmahe vāṃ vṛṣaṇā suvṛktibhirasme indrāvaruṇaā śarma yachatam

translations.griffith: One of you Twain destroys the Vṛtras in the fight, the Other evermore maintains his holy Laws.  We call on you, ye Mighty, with our hymns of praise. Vouchsafe us your protection, Indra-Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे इन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो ... ||
verses.transliteration: asme indro varuṇo mitro ...

translations.griffith: May Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman vouchsafe us glory and great shelter spreading far.  We think of the beneficent light of Aditi, and Savitar's song of praise, the God who strengthens Law.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां राजानावध्वरे वव्र्त्यां हव्येभिरिन्द्रावरुणा नमोभिः पर वां घर्ताची बाह्वोर्दधाना परि तमना विषुरूपा जिगाति |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ rājānāvadhvare vavṛtyāṃ havyebhirindrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ pra vāṃ ghṛtācī bāhvordadhānā pari tmanā viṣurūpā jighāti

translations.griffith: KINGS, Indra-Varuṇa, I would turn you hither to this our sacrifice with gifts and homage.  Held in both arms the ladle, dropping fatness, goes of itself to you whose forms are varied.

verses.sanskrit: युवो राष्ट्रं बर्हदिन्वति दयौर्यौ सेत्र्भिररज्जुभिः सिनीथः परि नो हेळो वरुणस्य वर्ज्या उरुं न इन्द्रः कर्णवदु लोकम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvo rāṣṭraṃ bṛhadinvati dyauryau setṛbhirarajjubhiḥ sinīthaḥ pari no heḷo varuṇasya vṛjyā uruṃ na indraḥ kṛṇavadu lokam

translations.griffith: Dyaus quickens and promotes your high dominion who bind with bonds not wrought of rope or cordage.  Far from us still be Varuṇa's displeasure may Indra give us spacious room to dwell in.

verses.sanskrit: कर्तं नो यज्ञं विदथेषु चारुं कर्तं बरह्माणि सूरिषुप्रशस्ता उपो रयिर्देवजूतो न एतु पर णः सपार्हाभिरूतिभिस्तिरेतम |||
verses.transliteration: kṛtaṃ no yajñaṃ vidatheṣu cāruṃ kṛtaṃ brahmāṇi sūriṣupraśastā upo rayirdevajūto na etu pra ṇaḥ spārhābhirūtibhistiretam

translations.griffith: Make ye our sacrifice fair amid the assemblies: make ye our prayers approved among our princes.  May God-sent riches come for our possession: further ye us with your delightful succours.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे इन्द्रावरुणा विश्ववारं रयिं धत्तं वसुमन्तं पुरुक्षुम पर य आदित्यो अन्र्ता मिनात्यमिता शूरो दयते वसूनि |||
verses.transliteration: asme indrāvaruṇā viśvavāraṃ rayiṃ dhattaṃ vasumantaṃ purukṣum pra ya ādityo anṛtā minātyamitā śūro dayate vasūni

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, vouchsafe us riches with store of treasure, food, and every blessing;  For the Āditya, banisher of falsehood, the Hero, dealeth wealth in boundless plenty.

verses.sanskrit: इयमिन्द्रं वरुणमष्ट मे गीः परावत तोके तनये तूतुजाना सुरत्नासो देववीतिं गमेम यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: iyamindraṃ varuṇamaṣṭa me ghīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā suratnāso devavītiṃ ghamema yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: May this my song reach Varuṇa and Indra, and, strongly urging, win me sons and offspring.  To the Gods’ banquet may we go with riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पुनीषे वामरक्षसं मनीषां सोममिन्द्राय वरुणाय जुह्वत घर्तप्रतीकामुषसं न देवीं ता नो यामन्नुरुष्यतामभीके |||
verses.transliteration: punīṣe vāmarakṣasaṃ manīṣāṃ somamindrāya varuṇāya juhvat ghṛtapratīkāmuṣasaṃ na devīṃ tā no yāmannuruṣyatāmabhīke

translations.griffith: FOR you I deck a harmless hymn, presenting the Soma juice to Varuṇa and Indra-  A hymn that shines like heavenly Dawn with fatness. May they be near us on the march and guard us.

verses.sanskrit: सपर्धन्ते वा उ देवहूये अत्र येषु धवजेषु दिद्यवः पतन्ति युवं तानिन्द्रावरुणावमित्रान हतं पराचः शर्वा विषूचः |||
verses.transliteration: spardhante vā u devahūye atra yeṣu dhvajeṣu didyavaḥ patanti yuvaṃ tānindrāvaruṇāvamitrān hataṃ parācaḥ śarvā viṣūcaḥ

translations.griffith: Here where the arrows fall amid the banners both hosts invoke the Gods in emulation.  O Indra-Varuṇa, smite back those-our foemen,yea, smite them withyour shaft to every quarter.

verses.sanskrit: आपश्चिद धि सवयशसः सदस्सु देवीरिन्द्रं वरुणं देवता धुः कर्ष्टीरन्यो धारयति परविक्ता वर्त्राण्यन्यो अप्रतीनि हन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: āpaścid dhi svayaśasaḥ sadassu devīrindraṃ varuṇaṃ devatā dhuḥ kṛṣṭīranyo dhārayati praviktā vṛtrāṇyanyo apratīni hanti

translations.griffith: Self-lucid in their seats, e’en heavenly Waters endowed with Godhead Varuṇa and Indra.  One of these holds the folk distinct and sundered, the Other smites and slays resistless foemen.

verses.sanskrit: स सुक्रतुरतचिदस्तु होता य आदित्य शवसा वां नमस्वान आववर्तदवसे वां हविष्मानसदित स सुविताय परयस्वान |||
verses.transliteration: sa sukraturtacidastu hotā ya āditya śavasā vāṃ namasvān āvavartadavase vāṃ haviṣmānasadit sa suvitāya prayasvān

translations.griffith: Wise be the priest and skilled in Law Eternal, who with his sacred gifts and oration.  Brings you to aid us with your might, Ādityas: let him have viands to promote his welfare.

verses.sanskrit: इयमिन्द्रं वरुणमष्ट मे गीः ... ||
verses.transliteration: iyamindraṃ varuṇamaṣṭa me ghīḥ ...

translations.griffith: May this my song reach Varuṇa and Indra, and, strongly urging, win me sons and offspring.  To the Gods’ banquet may we go with riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: धीरा तवस्य महिना जनूंषि वि यस्तस्तम्भ रोदसी चिदुर्वी पर नाकं रष्वं नुनुदे बर्हन्तं दविता नक्षत्रम्पप्रथच्च भूम |||
verses.transliteration: dhīrā tvasya mahinā janūṃṣi vi yastastambha rodasī cidurvī pra nākaṃ ṛṣvaṃ nunude bṛhantaṃ dvitā nakṣatrampaprathacca bhūma

translations.griffith: WISE, verily, are creatures through his greatness who stayed ever, spacious heaven and earth asunder;  Who urged the high and mighty sky to motion, the Star of old, and spread the earth before him.

verses.sanskrit: उत सवया तन्वा सं वदे तत कदा नवन्तर्वरुणे भुवानि किं मे हव्यमह्र्णानो जुषेत कदा मर्ळीकं सुमना अभि खयम |||
verses.transliteration: uta svayā tanvā saṃ vade tat kadā nvantarvaruṇe bhuvāni kiṃ me havyamahṛṇāno juṣeta kadā mṛḷīkaṃ sumanā abhi khyam

translations.griffith: With mine own heart I commune on the question how Varuṇa and I may be united.  What gift of mine will he accept unangered? When may I calmly look and find him gracious?

verses.sanskrit: पर्छे तदेनो वरुण दिद्र्क्षूपो एमि चिकितुषो विप्र्छम समानमिन मे कवयश्चिदाहुरयं ह तुभ्यं वरुणो हर्णीते |||
verses.transliteration: pṛche tadeno varuṇa didṛkṣūpo emi cikituṣo vipṛcham samānamin me kavayaścidāhurayaṃ ha tubhyaṃ varuṇo hṛṇīte

translations.griffith: Fain to know this is my sin I question others: I seek the wise, O Varuṇa, and ask them.  This one same answer even the sages gave me, "Surely this Varuṇa is angry with thee."

verses.sanskrit: किमाग आस वरुण जयेष्ठं यत सतोतारं जिघांससि सखायम पर तन मे वोचो दूळभ सवधावो.अव तवानेना नमसा तुर इयाम |||
verses.transliteration: kimāgha āsa varuṇa jyeṣṭhaṃ yat stotāraṃ jighāṃsasi sakhāyam pra tan me voco dūḷabha svadhāvo.ava tvānenā namasā tura iyām

translations.griffith: What, Varuṇa, hath been my chief transgression, that thou wouldst slay the friend who sings thy praises?  Tell me, Unconquerable Lord, and quickly sinless will I approach thee with mine homage.

verses.sanskrit: अव दरुग्धानि पित्र्या सर्जा नो.अव या वयं चक्र्मा तनूभिः अव राजन पशुत्र्पं न तायुं सर्जा वत्सं न दाम्नो वसिष्ठम |||
verses.transliteration: ava drughdhāni pitryā sṛjā no.ava yā vayaṃ cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ ava rājan paśutṛpaṃ na tāyuṃ sṛjā vatsaṃ na dāmno vasiṣṭham

translations.griffith: Free us from sins committed by our fathers, from those wherein we have ourselves offended.  O King, loose, like a thief who feeds the cattle, as from the cord a calf, set free Vasiṣṭha.

verses.sanskrit: न स सवो दक्षो वरुण धरुतिः सा सुरा मन्युर्विभीदकोचित्तिः अस्ति जयायान कनीयस उपारे सवप्नश्चनेदन्र्तस्य परयोता |||
verses.transliteration: na sa svo dakṣo varuṇa dhrutiḥ sā surā manyurvibhīdakoacittiḥ asti jyāyān kanīyasa upāre svapnaścanedanṛtasya prayotā

translations.griffith: Not our own will betrayed us, but seduction, thoughtlessness, Varuṇa wine, dice, or anger.  The old is near to lead astray the younger: even sleep removeth not all evil-doing.

verses.sanskrit: अरं दासो न मीळ्हुषे कराण्यहं देवाय भूर्णये.अनागाः अचेतयदचितो देवो अर्यो गर्त्सं राये कवितरो जुनाति |||
verses.transliteration: araṃ dāso na mīḷhuṣe karāṇyahaṃ devāya bhūrṇaye.anāghāḥ acetayadacito devo aryo ghṛtsaṃ rāye kavitaro junāti

translations.griffith: Slavelike may I do service to the Bounteous, serve, free from sin, the God inclined to anger.  This gentle Lord gives wisdom to the simple: the wiser God leads on the wise to riches.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सु तुभ्यं वरुण सवधावो हर्दि सतोम उपश्रितश्चिदस्तु शं नः कषेमे शमु योगे नो अस्तु यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ su tubhyaṃ varuṇa svadhāvo hṛdi stoma upaśritaścidastu śaṃ naḥ kṣeme śamu yoghe no astu yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: O Lord, O Varuṇa, may this laudation come close to thee and lie within thy spirit.  May it be well with us in rest and labour. Preserve us ever-more, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: रदत पथो वरुणः सूर्याय परार्णांसि समुद्रिया नदीनाम सर्गो न सर्ष्टो अर्वतीरतायञ्चकार महीरवनीरहभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: radat patho varuṇaḥ sūryāya prārṇāṃsi samudriyā nadīnām sargho na sṛṣṭo arvatīrtāyañcakāra mahīravanīrahabhyaḥ

translations.griffith: VARUNA cut a pathway out for Sūrya, and led the watery floods of rivers onward.  The Mares, as in a race, speed on in order. He made great channels for the days to follow.

verses.sanskrit: आत्मा ते वातो रज आ नवीनोत पशुर्न भूर्णिर्यवसे ससवान अन्तर्मही बर्हती रोदसीमे विश्वा ते धाम वरुण परियाणि |||
verses.transliteration: ātmā te vāto raja ā navīnot paśurna bhūrṇiryavase sasavān antarmahī bṛhatī rodasīme viśvā te dhāma varuṇa priyāṇi

translations.griffith: The wind, thy breath, hath sounded through the region like a wild beast that seeks his food in pastures.  Within these two, exalted Earth and Heaven, O Varuṇa, are all the forms thou lovest.

verses.sanskrit: परि सपशो वरुणस्य समदिष्टा उभे पश्यन्ति रोदसी सुमेके रतावानः कवयो यज्ञधीराः परचेतसो य इषयन्त मन्म |||
verses.transliteration: pari spaśo varuṇasya smadiṣṭā ubhe paśyanti rodasī sumeke ṛtāvānaḥ kavayo yajñadhīrāḥ pracetaso ya iṣayanta manma

translations.griffith: Varuṇa's spies, sent forth upon their errand, survey the two world-halves well formed and fashioned.  Wise are they, holy, skilled in sacrifices, the furtherers of the praise-songs of the prudent.

verses.sanskrit: उवाच मे वरुणो मेधिराय तरिः सप्त नामाघ्न्या बिभर्ति विद्वान पदस्य गुह्या न वोचद युगाय विप्र उपराय शिक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: uvāca me varuṇo medhirāya triḥ sapta nāmāghnyā bibharti vidvān padasya ghuhyā na vocad yughāya vipra uparāya śikṣan

translations.griffith: To me who understand hath Varuṇa spoken, the names borne by the Cow are three times seven.  The sapient God, knowing the place's secret, shall speak as ’twere to teach the race that cometh.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो दयावो निहिता अन्तरस्मिन तिस्रो भूमीरुपराः षड्विधानाः गर्त्सो राजा वरुणश्चक्र एतं दिवि परेङखंहिरण्ययं शुभे कम |||
verses.transliteration: tisro dyāvo nihitā antarasmin tisro bhūmīruparāḥ ṣaḍvidhānāḥ ghṛtso rājā varuṇaścakra etaṃ divi preṅkhaṃhiraṇyayaṃ śubhe kam

translations.griffith: On him three heavens rest and are supported, and the three earths are there in sixfold order.  The wise King Varuṇa hath made in heaven that Golden Swing to cover it with glory.

verses.sanskrit: अव सिन्धुं वरुणो दयौरिव सथाद दरप्सो न शवेतो मर्गस्तुविष्मान गम्भीरशंसो रजसो विमानः सुपारक्षत्रः सतो अस्य राजा |||
verses.transliteration: ava sindhuṃ varuṇo dyauriva sthād drapso na śveto mṛghastuviṣmān ghambhīraśaṃso rajaso vimānaḥ supārakṣatraḥ sato asya rājā

translations.griffith: Like Varuṇa from heaven he sinks in Sindhu, like a white-shining spark, a strong wild creature.  Ruling in depths and meting out the region, great saving power hath he, this world's Controller.

verses.sanskrit: यो मर्ळयाति चक्रुषे चिदागो वयं सयाम वरुणे अनागाः अनु वरतान्यदितेरधन्तो यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: yo mṛḷayāti cakruṣe cidāgho vayaṃ syāma varuṇe anāghāḥ anu vratānyaditerdhanto yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Before this Varuṇa may we be sinless him who shows mercy even to the sinner-  While we are keeping Aditi's ordinances. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर शुन्ध्युवं वरुणाय परेष्ठां मतिं वसिष्ठ मीळ्हुषे भरस्व य ईमर्वाञ्चं करते यजत्रं सहस्रामघं वर्षणं बर्हन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: pra śundhyuvaṃ varuṇāya preṣṭhāṃ matiṃ vasiṣṭha mīḷhuṣe bharasva ya īmarvāñcaṃ karate yajatraṃ sahasrāmaghaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ bṛhantam

translations.griffith: PRESENT to Varuṇa thine hymn, Vasiṣṭha, bright, most delightful to the Bounteous Giver,  Who bringeth on to us the Bull, the lofty, the Holy, laden with a thousand treasures.

verses.sanskrit: अधा नवस्य सन्द्र्शं जगन्वानग्नेरनीकं वरुणस्य मंसि सवर्यदश्मन्नधिपा उ अन्धो.अभि मा वपुर्द्र्शये निनीयात |||
verses.transliteration: adhā nvasya sandṛśaṃ jaghanvānaghneranīkaṃ varuṇasya maṃsi svaryadaśmannadhipā u andho.abhi mā vapurdṛśaye ninīyāt

translations.griffith: And now, as I am come before his presence, I take the face of Varuṇa for Agni's.  So might he bring-Lord also of the darkness-the light in heaven that I may see its beauty!

verses.sanskrit: आ यद रुहाव वरुणश्च नावं पर यत समुद्रमीरयावमध्यम अधि यदपां सनुभिश्चराव पर परेङख ईङखयावहै शुभे कम |||
verses.transliteration: ā yad ruhāva varuṇaśca nāvaṃ pra yat samudramīrayāvamadhyam adhi yadapāṃ snubhiścarāva pra preṅkha īṅkhayāvahai śubhe kam

translations.griffith: When Varuṇa and I embark together and urge our boat into the midst of ocean,  We, when we ride o’er ridges of the waters, will swing within that swing and there be happy.

verses.sanskrit: वसिष्ठं ह वरुणो नाव्याधाद रषिं चकार सवपा महोभिः सतोतारं विप्रः सुदिनत्वे अह्नां यान नु दयावस्ततनन यादुषासः |||
verses.transliteration: vasiṣṭhaṃ ha varuṇo nāvyādhād ṛṣiṃ cakāra svapā mahobhiḥ stotāraṃ vipraḥ sudinatve ahnāṃ yān nu dyāvastatanan yāduṣāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Varuṇa placed Vasiṣṭha in the vessel, and deftly with his niight made him a Ṛṣi.  When days shone bright the Sage made him a singer, while the heavens broadened and the Dawns were lengthened.

verses.sanskrit: कव तयानि नौ सख्या बभूवुः सचावहे यदव्र्कं पुरा चित बर्हन्तं मानं वरुण सवधावः सहस्रद्वारं जगमा गर्हं ते |||
verses.transliteration: kva tyāni nau sakhyā babhūvuḥ sacāvahe yadavṛkaṃ purā cit bṛhantaṃ mānaṃ varuṇa svadhāvaḥ sahasradvāraṃ jaghamā ghṛhaṃ te

translations.griffith: What hath become of those our ancient friendships, when without enmity we walked together?  I, Varuṇa, thou glorious Lord, have entered thy lofty home, thine house with thousand portals.

verses.sanskrit: य आपिर्नित्यो वरुण परियः सन तवामागांसि कर्णवत सखा ते मा त एनस्वन्तो यक्षिन भुजेम यन्धि षमा विप्र सतुवते वरूथम |||
verses.transliteration: ya āpirnityo varuṇa priyaḥ san tvāmāghāṃsi kṛṇavat sakhā te mā ta enasvanto yakṣin bhujema yandhi ṣmā vipra stuvate varūtham

translations.griffith: If he, thy true ally, hath sinned against thee, still, Varuṇa, he is the friend thou lovedst.  Let us not, Living One, as sinners I know thee: give shelter, as a Sage, to him who lauds thee.

verses.sanskrit: धरुवासु तवासु कषितिषु कषियन्तो वयस्मत पाशं वरुणोमुमोचत अवो वन्वाना अदितेरुपस्थाद यूयं पात |||
verses.transliteration: dhruvāsu tvāsu kṣitiṣu kṣiyanto vyasmat pāśaṃ varuṇomumocat avo vanvānā aditerupasthād yūyaṃ pāta

translations.griffith: While we abide in these fixed habitations, and from the lap of Aditi win favour,  May Varuṇa untie the bond that binds us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: मो षु वरुण मर्न्मयं गर्हं राजन्नहं गमम मर्ळा सुक्षत्र मर्ळय |||
verses.transliteration: mo ṣu varuṇa mṛnmayaṃ ghṛhaṃ rājannahaṃ ghamam mṛḷā sukṣatra mṛḷaya

translations.griffith: LET me not yet, King Varuṇa, enter into the house of clay:  Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

verses.sanskrit: यदेमि परस्फुरन्निव दर्तिर्न धमातो अद्रिवः मर्ळा स. म. |||
verses.transliteration: yademi prasphuranniva dṛtirna dhmāto adrivaḥ mṛḷā s. m.

translations.griffith: When, Thunderer! I move along tremulous like a wind-blown skin,  Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

verses.sanskrit: करत्वः समह दीनता परतीपं जगमा शुचे मर्ळा स. म. |||
verses.transliteration: kratvaḥ samaha dīnatā pratīpaṃ jaghamā śuce mṛḷā s. m.

translations.griffith: O Bright and Powerful God, through want of strength I erred and went astray  Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

verses.sanskrit: अपां मध्ये तस्थिवांसं तर्ष्णाविदज्जरितारम मर्ळा स. म. |||
verses.transliteration: apāṃ madhye tasthivāṃsaṃ tṛṣṇāvidajjaritāram mṛḷā s. m.

translations.griffith: Thirst found thy worshipper though he stood in the midst of water-fijods:  Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

verses.sanskrit: यत किं चेदं वरुण दैव्ये जने.अभिद्रोहं मनुष्याश्चरामसि अचित्ती यत तव धर्मा युयोपिम मा नस्तस्मादेनसो देव रीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: yat kiṃ cedaṃ varuṇa daivye jane.abhidrohaṃ manuṣyāścarāmasi acittī yat tava dharmā yuyopima mā nastasmādenaso deva rīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: O Varuṇa, whatever the offence may be which we as men commit against the heavenly host,  When through our want of thought we violate thy laws, punish us not, O God, for that iniquity.

verses.sanskrit: पर वीरया शुचयो दद्रिरे वामध्वर्युभिर्मधुमन्तः सुतासः वह वायो नियुतो याह्यछा पिबा सुतस्यान्धसो मदाय |||
verses.transliteration: pra vīrayā śucayo dadrire vāmadhvaryubhirmadhumantaḥ sutāsaḥ vaha vāyo niyuto yāhyachā pibā sutasyāndhaso madāya

translations.griffith: To you pure juice, rich in meath, are offered by priest: through longing for the Pair of Heroes.  Drive, Vāyu, bring thine harnessed horses hither: drink the pressed Soma till it make thee joyful.

verses.sanskrit: ईशानाय परहुतिं यस्त आनट छुचिं सोमं शुचिपास्तुभ्यं वायो कर्णोषि तं मर्त्येषु परशस्तं जातो-जातो जायते वाज्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: īśānāya prahutiṃ yasta ānaṭ chuciṃ somaṃ śucipāstubhyaṃ vāyo kṛṇoṣi taṃ martyeṣu praśastaṃ jāto-jāto jāyate vājyasya

translations.griffith: Whoso to thee, the Mighty, brings oblation, pure Soma unto thee, pure-drinking Vāyu,  That man thou makest famous among mortals: to him strong sons are born in quick succession.

verses.sanskrit: राये नु यं जज्ञतू रोदसीमे राये देवी धिषणा धाति देवम अध वायुं नियुतः सश्चत सवा उत शवेतं वसुधितिं निरेके |||
verses.transliteration: rāye nu yaṃ jajñatū rodasīme rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam adha vāyuṃ niyutaḥ saścata svā uta śvetaṃ vasudhitiṃ nireke

translations.griffith: The God whom both these worlds brought forth for riches, whom heavenly Dhiṣaṇā for our wealth appointeth,  His team of harnessed horses waits on Vāyu, and, foremost, on the radiant Treasure-bearer.

verses.sanskrit: उछन्नुषसः सुदिना अरिप्रा उरु जयोतिर्विविदुर्दीध्यानाः गव्यं चिदूर्वमुशिजो वि वव्रुस्तेषामनु परदिवः सस्रुरापः |||
verses.transliteration: uchannuṣasaḥ sudinā ariprā uru jyotirvividurdīdhyānāḥ ghavyaṃ cidūrvamuśijo vi vavrusteṣāmanu pradivaḥ sasrurāpaḥ

translations.griffith: The spotless Dawns with fair bright days have broken; they found the spacious light when they were shining.  Eagerly they disclosed the stall of cattle: floods streamed for them as in the days aforetime.

verses.sanskrit: ते सत्येन मनसा दीध्यानाः सवेन युक्तासः करतुना वहन्ति इन्द्रवायू वीरवाहं रथं वामीशानयोरभि पर्क्षः सचन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: te satyena manasā dīdhyānāḥ svena yuktāsaḥ kratunā vahanti indravāyū vīravāhaṃ rathaṃ vāmīśānayorabhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante

translations.griffith: These with their truthful spirit, shining brightly, move on provided with their natural insight.  Viands attend the car that beareth Heroes, your car, ye Sovran Pair, Indra and Vāyu.

verses.sanskrit: ईशानासो ये दधते सवर्णो गोभिरश्वेभिर्वसुभिर्हिरण्यैः इन्द्रवायू सूरयो विश्वमायुरर्वद्भिर्वीरैः पर्तनासु सह्युः |||
verses.transliteration: īśānāso ye dadhate svarṇo ghobhiraśvebhirvasubhirhiraṇyaiḥ indravāyū sūrayo viśvamāyurarvadbhirvīraiḥ pṛtanāsu sahyuḥ

translations.griffith: May these who give us heavenly light, these rulers, with gifts of kine and horses, gold and treasures.  These princes, through full life, Indra and Vāyu! o’ercome in battle with their steeds and heroes.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वन्तो न शरवसो भिक्षमाणा इन्द्रवायू सुष्टुतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः वाजयन्तः सववसे हुवेम यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: arvanto na śravaso bhikṣamāṇā indravāyū suṣṭutibhirvasiṣṭhāḥ vājayantaḥ svavase huvema yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: Like coursers seeking fame will we Vasisthas, O Indra-Vāyu, with our fair laudations.  Exerting all our power call you to aid us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: कुविदङग नमसा ये वर्धासः पुरा देवा अनवद्यास आसन ते वायवे मनवे बाधितायावासयन्नुषसं सूर्येण |||
verses.transliteration: kuvidaṅgha namasā ye vṛdhāsaḥ purā devā anavadyāsa āsan te vāyave manave bādhitāyāvāsayannuṣasaṃ sūryeṇa

translations.griffith: WERE not in sooth, the Gods aforetime blameless, whose pleasure was increased by adoration?  For Vāyu and for man in his affliction they caused the Morning to arise with Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: उशन्ता दूता न दभाय गोपा मासश्च पाथः शरदश्च पूर्वीः इन्द्रवायू सुष्टुतिर्वामियाना मार्डीकमीट्टे सुवितं च नव्यम |||
verses.transliteration: uśantā dūtā na dabhāya ghopā māsaśca pāthaḥ śaradaśca pūrvīḥ indravāyū suṣṭutirvāmiyānā mārḍīkamīṭṭe suvitaṃ ca navyam

translations.griffith: Guardians infallible, eager as envoys' preserve us safe through many months and autumns.  Addressed to you, our fair praise, Indra-Vāyu, implores your favour and renewed well-being.

verses.sanskrit: पीवोन्नान रयिव्र्धः सुमेधाः शवेतः सिषक्ति नियुतामभिश्रीः ते वायवे समनसो वि तस्थुर्विश्वेन नरः सवपत्यानि चक्रुः |||
verses.transliteration: pīvoannān rayivṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutāmabhiśrīḥ te vāyave samanaso vi tasthurviśven naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ

translations.griffith: Wise, bright, arranger of his teams, he. seeketh men with rich food whose treasures are abundant.  They have arranged them of one mind with Vāyu: the men have wrought all noble operations.

verses.sanskrit: यावत तरस्तन्वो यावदोजो यावन नरश्चक्षसा दीध्यानाः शुचिं सोमं शुचिपा पातमस्मे इन्द्रवायू सदतम्बर्हिरेदम |||
verses.transliteration: yāvat tarastanvo yāvadojo yāvan naraścakṣasā dīdhyānāḥ śuciṃ somaṃ śucipā pātamasme indravāyū sadatambarhiredam

translations.griffith: So far as native power and strength permit you, so far as men behold whose eyes have vision,  O ye pure-drinkers, drink with us pure Soma: sit on this sacred grass, Indra and Vāyu.

verses.sanskrit: नियुवाना नियुत सपार्हवीरा इन्द्रवि -मर्वाक आू} इदं हि वां परभ्र्तं मध्वो अग्रमध परीणाना विमुमुक्तमस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: niyuvānā niyuta spārhavīrā indravi -amarvāk āū} idaṃ hi vāṃ prabhṛtaṃ madhvo aghramadha prīṇānā vimumuktamasme

translations.griffith: Driving down teams that bear the lovely Heroes, hitherward, Indra-Vāyu, come together.  To you this prime of savoury juice is offered: here loose your horses and be friendly-minded.

verses.sanskrit: या वां शतं नियुतो याः सहस्रमिन्द्रवायू विश्ववाराः सचन्ते आभिर्यातं सुविदत्राभिरर्वाक पातं नराप्रतिभ्र्तस्य मध्वः |||
verses.transliteration: yā vāṃ śataṃ niyuto yāḥ sahasramindravāyū viśvavārāḥ sacante ābhiryātaṃ suvidatrābhirarvāk pātaṃ narāpratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ

translations.griffith: Your hundred and your thousand teams, O Indra and Vāyu, all-munificent, which attend you,  With these most gracious-minded come ye hither, and drink, O Heroes of the meath we offer.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वन्तो न शरवसो ... ||
verses.transliteration: arvanto na śravaso ...

translations.griffith: Like coursers seeking fame will we Vasisthas, O Indra-Vāyu, with our fair laudations,  Exerting all our powe-,, call you to aid us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: आ वायो भूष शुचिपा उप नः सहस्रं ते नियुतो विश्ववार उपो ते अन्धो मद्यमयामि यस्य देव दधिषे पूर्वपेयम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāyo bhūṣa śucipā upa naḥ sahasraṃ te niyuto viśvavāra upo te andho madyamayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrvapeyam

translations.griffith: O VĀYU, drinker of the pure, be near us: a thousand teams are thine, Allbounteous Giver.  To thee the rapture-bringing juice is offered, whose first draught, God, thou takest as thy portion.

verses.sanskrit: पर सोता जीरो अध्वरेष्वस्थात सोममिन्द्राय वायवे पिबध्यै पर यद वां मध्वो अग्रियं भरन्त्यध्वर्यवो देवयन्तः शचीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: pra sotā jīro adhvareṣvasthāt somamindrāya vāyave pibadhyai pra yad vāṃ madhvo aghriyaṃ bharantyadhvaryavo devayantaḥ śacībhiḥ

translations.griffith: Prompt at the holy rites forth came the presser with Soma-draughts for Indra and for Vāyu,  When ministering priests with strong devotion bring to you Twain the first taste of the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: पर याभिर्यासि दाश्वांसमछा नियुद्भिर्वायविष्टयेदुरोणे नि नो रयिं सुभोजसं युवस्व नि वीरं गव्यमश्व्यं च राधः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yābhiryāsi dāśvāṃsamachā niyudbhirvāyaviṣṭayeduroṇe ni no rayiṃ subhojasaṃ yuvasva ni vīraṃ ghavyamaśvyaṃ ca rādhaḥ

translations.griffith: The teams wherewith thou seekest him who offers, within his home, O Viyu, to direct him,  Therewith send wealth: to us with full enjoyment, a hero son and gifts of kine and horses.

verses.sanskrit: ये वायव इन्द्रमादनास आदेवासो नितोशनासो अर्यः घनन्तो वर्त्राणि सूरिभिः षयाम सासह्वांसो युधा नर्भिरमित्रान |||
verses.transliteration: ye vāyava indramādanāsa ādevāso nitośanāso aryaḥ ghnanto vṛtrāṇi sūribhiḥ ṣyāma sāsahvāṃso yudhā nṛbhiramitrān

translations.griffith: Near to the Gods and making Indra joyful, devout and ofFering precious gifts to Vāyu,  Allied with princes, smiting down the hostile, may we with heroes conquer foes in battle.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो नियुद्भिः शतिनीभिरध्वरं सहस्रिणीभिरुप याहि यज्ञम वायो अस्मिन सवने मादयस्व यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā no niyudbhiḥ śatinībhiradhvaraṃ sahasriṇībhirupa yāhi yajñam vāyo asmin savane mādayasva yūyaṃ pāta ...
