translations.griffith: With thy yoked teams in hundreds and in thousands come to our sacrifice and solemn worship.  Come, Vāyu, make thee glad at this libation. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिं नु सतोमं नवजातमद्येन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहणा जुषेथाम उभा हि वां सुहवा जोहवीमि ता वाजं सद्य उशतेधेष्ठा |||
verses.transliteration: śuciṃ nu stomaṃ navajātamadyendrāghnī vṛtrahaṇā juṣethām ubhā hi vāṃ suhavā johavīmi tā vājaṃ sadya uśatedheṣṭhā

translations.griffith: SLAYERS of enemies, Indra and Agni, accept this day our new-born pure laudation.  Again, again I call you prompt to listen, best to give quickly strength to him who craves it.

verses.sanskrit: ता सानसी शवसाना हि भूतं साकंव्र्धा शवसा शूशुवांसा कषयन्तौ रायो यवसस्य भूरेः पर्ङकतं वाजस्य सथविरस्य घर्ष्वेः |||
verses.transliteration: tā sānasī śavasānā hi bhūtaṃ sākaṃvṛdhā śavasā śūśuvāṃsā kṣayantau rāyo yavasasya bhūreḥ pṛṅktaṃ vājasya sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ

translations.griffith: For ye were strong to gain, exceeding mighty, growing together, waxing in your vigour.  Lords of the pasture filled with ample riches, bestow upon us strength both fresh and lasting.

verses.sanskrit: उपो ह यद विदथं वाजिनो गुर्धीभिर्विप्राः परमतिमिछमानाः अर्वन्तो न काष्ठां नक्षमाणा इन्द्राग्नी जोहुवतो नरस्ते |||
verses.transliteration: upo ha yad vidathaṃ vājino ghurdhībhirviprāḥ pramatimichamānāḥ arvanto na kāṣṭhāṃ nakṣamāṇā indrāghnī johuvato naraste

translations.griffith: Yea when the strong have entered our assembly, and singers seeking with their hymns your favour,  They are like steeds who come into the race-course, those men who call aloud on Indra-Agni.

verses.sanskrit: गीर्भिर्विप्रः परमतिमिछमान ईट्टे रयिं यशसं पूर्वभाजम इन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहणा सुवज्रा पर नो नव्येभिस्तिरतं देष्णैः |||
verses.transliteration: ghīrbhirvipraḥ pramatimichamāna īṭṭe rayiṃ yaśasaṃ pūrvabhājam indrāghnī vṛtrahaṇā suvajrā pra no navyebhistirataṃ deṣṇaiḥ

translations.griffith: The singer, seeking with his hymns your favour, begs splendid riches of their first possessor.  Further us with new bounties, Indra-Agni, armed with strong thunder, slayers of the foeman.

verses.sanskrit: सं यन मही मिथती सपर्धमाने तनूरुचा शूरसाता यतैते अदेवयुं विदथे देवयुभिः सत्रा हतं सोमसुता जनेन |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yan mahī mithatī spardhamāne tanūrucā śūrasātā yataite adevayuṃ vidathe devayubhiḥ satrā hataṃ somasutā janena

translations.griffith: When two great hosts, arrayed against each other, meet clothed with brightness, in the fierce encounter  Stand ye beside the godly, smite the godless; and still assist the men who press the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: इमामु षु सोमसुतिमुप न एन्द्राग्नी सौमनसाय यातम नू चिद धि परिमम्नाथे अस्माना वां शश्वद्भिर्वव्र्तीय वाजैः |||
verses.transliteration: imāmu ṣu somasutimupa na endrāghnī saumanasāya yātam nū cid dhi parimamnāthe asmānā vāṃ śaśvadbhirvavṛtīya vājaiḥ

translations.griffith: To this our Soma-pressing, Indra-Agni, come ye prepared to show your loving-kindness,  For not at any time have ye despised us. So may I draw you with all strengthenings hither.

verses.sanskrit: सो अग्न एना नमसा समिद्धो.अछा मित्रं वरुणमिन्द्रं वोचेः यत सीमागश्चक्र्मा तत सु मर्ळ तदर्यमादितिःशिश्रथन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: so aghna enā namasā samiddho.achā mitraṃ varuṇamindraṃ voceḥ yat sīmāghaścakṛmā tat su mṛḷa tadaryamāditiḥśiśrathantu

translations.griffith: So Agni, kindled mid this adoration, invite thou Mitra, Varuṇa, and Indra.  Forgive whatever sin we have committed may Aryaman and Aditi remove it.

verses.sanskrit: एता अग्न आशुषाणास इष्टीर्युवोः सचाभ्यश्याम वाजान मेन्द्रो नो विष्णुर्मरुतः परि खयन यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: etā aghna āśuṣāṇāsa iṣṭīryuvoḥ sacābhyaśyāma vājān mendro no viṣṇurmarutaḥ pari khyan yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: While we accelerate these our sacrifices, may we win strength from both of you, O Agni:  Ne’er may the Maruts, Indra, Viṣṇu slight us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: इयं वामस्य मन्मन इन्द्राग्नी पूर्व्यस्तुतिः अभ्राद वर्ष्टिरिवाजनि |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ vāmasya manmana indrāghnī pūrvyastutiḥ abhrād vṛṣṭirivājani

translations.griffith: As rain from out the cloud, for you, Indra and Agni, from my soul  This noblest praise hath been produced.

verses.sanskrit: शर्णुतं जरितुर्हवमिन्द्राग्नी वनतं गिरः ईशानापिप्यतं धियः |||
verses.transliteration: śṛṇutaṃ jariturhavamindrāghnī vanataṃ ghiraḥ īśānāpipyataṃ dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: Do ye, O Indra-Agni, hear the singer's call: accept his songs.  Ye Rulers, grant his heart's desire.

verses.sanskrit: मा पापत्वाय नो नरेन्द्राग्नी माभिशस्तये मा नो रीरधतं निदे |||
verses.transliteration: mā pāpatvāya no narendrāghnī mābhiśastaye mā no rīradhataṃ nide

translations.griffith: Give us not up to poverty, ye Heroes, Indra-Agni, nor  To slander and reproach of men.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रे अग्ना नमो बर्हत सुव्र्क्तिमेरयामहे धिया धेना अवस्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: indre aghnā namo bṛhat suvṛktimerayāmahe dhiyā dhenā avasyavaḥ

translations.griffith: To Indra and to Agni we bring reverence, high and holy hymn,  And, craving help, softwords with prayer.

verses.sanskrit: ता हि शश्वन्त ईळत इत्था विप्रास ऊतये सबाधो वाजसातये |||
verses.transliteration: tā hi śaśvanta īḷata itthā viprāsa ūtaye sabādho vājasātaye

translations.griffith: For all these holy singers here implore these Twain to succour them,  And priests that they may win them strength.

verses.sanskrit: ता वां गीर्भिर्विपन्यवः परयस्वन्तो हवामहे मेधसाता सनिष्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: tā vāṃ ghīrbhirvipanyavaḥ prayasvanto havāmahe medhasātā saniṣyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Eager to laudyou, we with songs invoke you, bearing sacred food,  Fain for success in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी अवसा गतमस्मभ्यं चर्षणीसहा मा नो दुःशंस ईशत |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī avasā ghatamasmabhyaṃ carṣaṇīsahā mā no duḥśaṃsa īśata

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, come to us with favour, ye who conquer men:  Let not the wicked master us.

verses.sanskrit: मा कस्य नो अररुषो धूर्तिः परणं मर्त्यस्य इन्द्राग्नीशर्म यछतम |||
verses.transliteration: mā kasya no araruṣo dhūrtiḥ praṇaṃ martyasya indrāghnīśarma yachatam

translations.griffith: At no time let the injurious blow of hostile mortal fall on us:  O Indra-Agni, shelter us.

verses.sanskrit: गोमद धिरण्यवद वसु यद वामश्वावदीमहे इन्द्राग्नीतद वनेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: ghomad dhiraṇyavad vasu yad vāmaśvāvadīmahe indrāghnītad vanemahi

translations.griffith: Whatever wealth we crave of you, in gold, in cattle, or in steeds,  That, Indra-Agni, let us gain;

verses.sanskrit: यत सोम आ सुते नर इन्द्राग्नी अजोहवुः सप्तीवन्ता सपर्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: yat soma ā sute nara indrāghnī ajohavuḥ saptīvantā saparyavaḥ

translations.griffith: When heroes prompt in worship call Indra and Agni, Lords of steeds,  Beside the Soma juice effused.

verses.sanskrit: उक्थेभिर्व्र्त्रहन्तमा या मन्दाना चिदा गिरा आङगूषैराविवासतः |||
verses.transliteration: ukthebhirvṛtrahantamā yā mandānā cidā ghirā āṅghūṣairāvivāsataḥ

translations.griffith: Call hither with the song and lauds those who best slay the foemen, those  Who take delight in hymns of praise.

verses.sanskrit: ताविद दुःशंसं मर्त्यं दुर्विद्वांसं रक्षस्विनम आभोगं हन्मना हतमुदधिं हन्मना हतम |||
verses.transliteration: tāvid duḥśaṃsaṃ martyaṃ durvidvāṃsaṃ rakṣasvinam ābhoghaṃ hanmanā hatamudadhiṃ hanmanā hatam

translations.griffith: Slay ye the wicked man whose thought is evil of the demon kind.  Slay him who stays the waters, slay the Serpent with your deadly dart.

verses.sanskrit: पर कषोदसा धायसा सस्र एषा सरस्वती धरुणमायसी पूः परबाबधाना रथ्येव याति विश्वा अपो महिना सिन्धुरन्याः |||
verses.transliteration: pra kṣodasā dhāyasā sasra eṣā sarasvatī dharuṇamāyasī pūḥ prabābadhānā rathyeva yāti viśvā apo mahinā sindhuranyāḥ

translations.griffith: THIS stream Sarasvatī with fostering current comes forth, our sure defence, our fort of iron.  As on a car, the flood flows on, surpassing in majesty and might all other waters.

verses.sanskrit: एकाचेतत सरस्वती नदीनां शुचिर्यती गिरिभ्य आ समुद्रात रायश्चेतन्ती भुवनस्य भूरेर्घ्र्तं पयो दुदुहे नाहुषाय |||
verses.transliteration: ekācetat sarasvatī nadīnāṃ śuciryatī ghiribhya ā samudrāt rāyaścetantī bhuvanasya bhūrerghṛtaṃ payo duduhe nāhuṣāya

translations.griffith: Pure in her course from mountains to the ocean, alone of streams Sarasvatī hath listened.  Thinking of wealth and the great world of creatures, she poured for Nahuṣa her milk and fatness.

verses.sanskrit: स वाव्र्धे नर्यो योषणासु वर्षा शिशुर्व्र्षभो यज्ञियासु स वाजिनं मघवद्भ्यो दधाति वि सातये तन्वं माम्र्जीत |||
verses.transliteration: sa vāvṛdhe naryo yoṣaṇāsu vṛṣā śiśurvṛṣabho yajñiyāsu sa vājinaṃ maghavadbhyo dadhāti vi sātaye tanvaṃ māmṛjīta

translations.griffith: Friendly to man he grew among the women, a strong young Steer amid the Holy Ladies.  He gives the fleet steed to our wealthy princes, and decks their bodies for success in battle.

verses.sanskrit: उत सया नः सरस्वती जुषाणोप शरवत सुभगा यज्णे अस्मिन मितज्ञुभिर्नमस्यैरियाना राया युजा चिदुत्तरा सखिभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī juṣāṇopa śravat subhaghā yajṇe asmin mitajñubhirnamasyairiyānā rāyā yujā ciduttarā sakhibhyaḥ

translations.griffith: May this Sarasvatī be pleased and listen at this our sacrifice, auspicious Lady,  When we with reverence, on our knees, implore her close-knit to wealth, most kind to those she loveth.

verses.sanskrit: इमा जुह्वाना युष्मदा नमोभिः परति सतोमं सरस्वति जुषस्व तव शर्मन परियतमे दधाना उप सथेयाम शरणं न वर्क्षम |||
verses.transliteration: imā juhvānā yuṣmadā namobhiḥ prati stomaṃ sarasvati juṣasva tava śarman priyatame dadhānā upa stheyāma śaraṇaṃ na vṛkṣam

translations.griffith: These offerings have ye made with adoration: say this, Sarasvatī, and accept our praises;  And, placing us under thy dear protection, may we approach thee, as a tree, for shelter.

verses.sanskrit: अयमु ते सरस्वति वसिष्ठो दवाराव रतस्य सुभगे वयावः वर्ध शुभ्रे सतुवते रासि वाजान यूयं पात ... |||
verses.transliteration: ayamu te sarasvati vasiṣṭho dvārāv ṛtasya subhaghe vyāvaḥ vardha śubhre stuvate rāsi vājān yūyaṃ pāta ...

translations.griffith: For thee, O Blest Sarasvatī, Vasiṣṭha hath here unbarred the doors d sacred Order.  Wax, Bright One, and give strength to him who lauds thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हदु गायिषे वचो.असुर्या नदीनाम सरस्वतीमिन महयासुव्र्क्तिभिः सतोमैर्वसिष्ठ रोदसी |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhadu ghāyiṣe vaco.asuryā nadīnām sarasvatīmin mahayāsuvṛktibhiḥ stomairvasiṣṭha rodasī

translations.griffith: I SING a lofty song, for she is mightiest, most divine of Streams.  Sarasvatī will I exalt with hymns and lauds, and, O Vasiṣṭha, Heaven and Earth.

verses.sanskrit: उभे यत ते महिना शुभ्रे अन्धसी अधिक्षियन्ति पूरवः सा नो बोध्यवित्री मरुत्सखा चोद राधो मघोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ubhe yat te mahinā śubhre andhasī adhikṣiyanti pūravaḥ sā no bodhyavitrī marutsakhā coda rādho maghonām

translations.griffith: When in the fulness of their strength the Pūrus dwell, Beauteous One, on thy two grassy banks,  Favour us thou who hast the Maruts for thy friends: stir up the bounty of our chiefs.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रमिद भद्रा कर्णवत सरस्वत्यकवारी चेतति वाजिनीवती गर्णाना जमदग्निवत सतुवाना च वसिष्ठवत |||
verses.transliteration: bhadramid bhadrā kṛṇavat sarasvatyakavārī cetati vājinīvatī ghṛṇānā jamadaghnivat stuvānā ca vasiṣṭhavat

translations.griffith: So may Sarasvatī auspicious send good luck; she, rich in spoil, is never niggardly in thought,  When praised in jamadagni's way and lauded as Vasiṣṭha lauds.

verses.sanskrit: जनीयन्तो नवग्रवः पुत्रीयन्तः सुदानवः सरस्वन्तं हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: janīyanto nvaghravaḥ putrīyantaḥ sudānavaḥ sarasvantaṃ havāmahe

translations.griffith: We call upon Sarasvān, as unmarried men who long for wives,  As liberal men who yearn for sons.

verses.sanskrit: ये ते सरस्व ऊर्मयो मधुमन्तो घर्तश्चुतः तेभिर्नो.अविता भव |||
verses.transliteration: ye te sarasva ūrmayo madhumanto ghṛtaścutaḥ tebhirno.avitā bhava

translations.griffith: Be thou our kind protector, O Sarasvān, with those waves of thine  Laden with sweets and dropping oil.

verses.sanskrit: पीपिवांसं सरस्वत सतनं यो विश्वदर्षतः भक्षीमहि परजामिषम |||
verses.transliteration: pīpivāṃsaṃ sarasvata stanaṃ yo viśvadarṣataḥ bhakṣīmahi prajāmiṣam

translations.griffith: May we enjoy Sarasvān's breast, all-beautiful, that swells with streams,  May we gain food and progeny.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञे दिवो नर्षदने पर्थिव्या नरो यत्र देवयवो मदन्ति इन्द्राय यत्र सवनानि सुन्वे गमन मदाय परथमं वयश च |||
verses.transliteration: yajñe divo nṛṣadane pṛthivyā naro yatra devayavo madanti indrāya yatra savanāni sunve ghaman madāya prathamaṃ vayaś ca

translations.griffith: WHERE Heaven and Earth combine in men's assembly, and ttose who love the Gods delight in worship,  Where the libations are effused for Indra, may he come first to drink and make him stronger.

verses.sanskrit: आ दैव्या वर्णीमहे ऽवांसि बर्हस्पतिर नो मह आ सखायः यथा भवेम मीळ्हुषे अनागा यो नो दाता परावतः पितेव |||
verses.transliteration: ā daivyā vṛṇīmahe 'vāṃsi bṛhaspatir no maha ā sakhāyaḥ yathā bhavema mīḷhuṣe anāghā yo no dātā parāvataḥ piteva

translations.griffith: We crave the heavenly grace of Gods to guard us-so may Bṛhaspati, O friends, exalt us-  That he, the Bounteous God, may find us sintess, who giveth from a distance like a father.

verses.sanskrit: तम उ जयेष्ठं नमसा हविर्भिः सुशेवम बरह्मणस पतिं गर्णीषे इन्द्रं शलोको महि दैव्यः सिषक्तु यो बरह्मणो देवक्र्तस्य राजा |||
verses.transliteration: tam u jyeṣṭhaṃ namasā havirbhiḥ suśevam brahmaṇas patiṃ ghṛṇīṣe indraṃ śloko mahi daivyaḥ siṣaktu yo brahmaṇo devakṛtasya rājā

translations.griffith: That Brahmaṇaspati, most High and Gracious, I glorify with offerings and with homage.  May the great song of praise divine, reach Indra who is the King of prayer the Gods’ creation.

verses.sanskrit: स आ नो योनिं सदतु परेष्ठो बर्हस्पतिर विश्ववारो यो अस्ति कामो रायः सुवीर्यस्य तं दात पर्षन नो अति सश्चतो अरिष्टान |||
verses.transliteration: sa ā no yoniṃ sadatu preṣṭho bṛhaspatir viśvavāro yo asti kāmo rāyaḥ suvīryasya taṃ dāt parṣan no ati saścato ariṣṭān

translations.griffith: May that Bṛhaspati who brings all blessings, most dearly loved, be seated by our altar.  Heroes and wealth we crave; may he bestow them, and bear us safe beyond the men who vex us.

verses.sanskrit: तम आ नो अर्कम अम्र्ताय जुष्टम इमे धासुर अम्र्तासः पुराजाः शुचिक्रन्दं यजतम पस्त्य्र्नाम बर्हस्पतिम अनर्वाणं हुवेम |||
verses.transliteration: tam ā no arkam amṛtāya juṣṭam ime dhāsur amṛtāsaḥ purājāḥ śucikrandaṃ yajatam pastyṛnām bṛhaspatim anarvāṇaṃ huvema

translations.griffith: To us these Deathless Ones, erst born, have granted this laud of ours which gives the Immortal pleasure.  Let us invoke Bṛhaspati, the foeless, the clear-voiced God, the Holy One of households

verses.sanskrit: तं शग्मासो अरुषासो अश्वा बर्हस्पतिं सहवाहो वहन्ति सहश चिद यस्य नीलवत सधस्थं नभो न रूपम अरुषं वसानाः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ śaghmāso aruṣāso aśvā bṛhaspatiṃ sahavāho vahanti sahaś cid yasya nīlavat sadhasthaṃ nabho na rūpam aruṣaṃ vasānāḥ

translations.griffith: Him, this Bṛhaspati, his red-hued horses, drawing together, full of strength, bring hither.  Robed in red colour like the cloud, they carry the Lord of Might whose friendship gives a dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: स हि शुचिः शतपत्रः स शुन्ध्युर हिरण्यवाशीर इषिरः सवर्षाः बर्हस्पतिः स सवावेश रष्वः पुरू सखिभ्य आसुतिं करिष्ठः |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi śuciḥ śatapatraḥ sa śundhyur hiraṇyavāśīr iṣiraḥ svarṣāḥ bṛhaspatiḥ sa svāveśa ṛṣvaḥ purū sakhibhya āsutiṃ kariṣṭhaḥ

translations.griffith: For he is pure, with hundred wings, refulgent, with sword of gold, impetuous, winning sunlight.  Sublime Bṛhaspati, easy of access granteth his friends most bountiful refreshment.

verses.sanskrit: देवी देवस्य रोदसी जनित्री बर्हस्पतिं वाव्र्धतुर महित्वा दक्षाय्याय दक्षता सखायः करद बरह्मणे सुतरा सुगाधा |||
verses.transliteration: devī devasya rodasī janitrī bṛhaspatiṃ vāvṛdhatur mahitvā dakṣāyyāya dakṣatā sakhāyaḥ karad brahmaṇe sutarā sughādhā

translations.griffith: Both Heaven and Earth, divine, the Deity's Parents, have made Bṛhaspati increase in grandeur.  Glorify him, O friends, who merits glory: may he give prayer fair way and easy passage.

verses.sanskrit: इयं वाम बरह्मणस पते सुव्र्क्तिर बरह्मेन्द्राय वज्रिणे अकारि अविष्टं धियो जिग्र्तम पुरंधीर जजस्तम अर्यो वनुषाम अरातीः |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ vām brahmaṇas pate suvṛktir brahmendrāya vajriṇe akāri aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jighṛtam puraṃdhīr jajastam aryo vanuṣām arātīḥ

translations.griffith: This, Brahmaṇaspati, is your laudation prayer hath been made to thunderwielding Indra.  Favour our songs, wake up our thought and spirit: destroy the godless and our foemen's malice.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पते युवम इन्द्रश च वस्वो दिव्यस्येशाथे उत पार्थिवस्य धत्तं रयिं सतुवते कीरये चिद यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: Ye Twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Bṛhaspati, and thou, O Indra.  Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो ऽरुणं दुग्धम अंशुं जुहोतन वर्षभाय कषितीनाम गौराद वेदीयां अवपानम इन्द्रो विश्वाहेद याति सुतसोमम इछन |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavo 'ruṇaṃ dughdham aṃśuṃ juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām ghaurād vedīyāṃ avapānam indro viśvāhed yāti sutasomam ichan

translations.griffith: PRIESTS, offer to the Lord of all the people the milked-out stalk of Soma, radiant-coloured.  No wild-bull knows his drinking-place like Indra who ever seeks him who hath pressed the Soma,

verses.sanskrit: यद दधिषे परदिवि चार्व अन्नं दिवे-दिवे पीतिम इद अस्य वक्षि उत हर्दोत मनसा जुषाण उशन्न इन्द्र परस्थितान पाहि सोमान |||
verses.transliteration: yad dadhiṣe pradivi cārv annaṃ dive-dive pītim id asya vakṣi uta hṛdota manasā juṣāṇa uśann indra prasthitān pāhi somān

translations.griffith: Thou dost desire to drink, each day that passes, the pleasant food which thou hast had aforetime,  O Indra, gratified in heart and spirit, drink eagerly the Soma set before thee.

verses.sanskrit: जज्ञानः सोमं सहसे पपाथ पर ते माता महिमानम उवाच एन्द्र पप्राथोर्व अन्तरिक्षं युधा देवेभ्यो वरिवश चकर्थ |||
verses.transliteration: jajñānaḥ somaṃ sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca endra paprāthorv antarikṣaṃ yudhā devebhyo varivaś cakartha

translations.griffith: Thou, newly-born, for strength didst drink the Soma; the Mother told thee of thy future greatness.  O Indra, thou hast filled mid-air's wide region, and given the Gods by battle room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit: यद योधया महतो मन्यमानान साक्षाम तान बाहुभिः शाशदानान यद वा नर्भिर वर्त इन्द्राभियुध्यास तं तवयाजिं सौश्रवसं जयेम |||
verses.transliteration: yad yodhayā mahato manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān yad vā nṛbhir vṛta indrābhiyudhyās taṃ tvayājiṃ sauśravasaṃ jayema

translations.griffith: When thou hast urged the arrocrant to combat, proud in their strength of arm, we will subdue them.  Or, Indra, when thou fightest girt by heroes, we in the glorious fray with thee will conquer.

verses.sanskrit: परेन्द्रस्य वोचम परथमा कर्तानि पर नूतना मघवा या चकार यदेद अदेवीर असहिष्ट माया अथाभवत केवलः सोमो अस्य |||
verses.transliteration: prendrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra yaded adevīr asahiṣṭa māyā athābhavat kevalaḥ somo asya

translations.griffith: I will declare the earliest deeds of Indra, and recent acts which Maghavan hath accomplished.  When he had conquered godless wiles and magic, Soma became his own entire possession.

verses.sanskrit: तवेदं विश्वम अभितः पशव्यं यत पश्यसि चक्षसा सूर्यस्य गवाम असि गोपतिर एक इन्द्र भक्षीमहि ते परयतस्य वस्वः |||
verses.transliteration: tavedaṃ viśvam abhitaḥ paśavyaṃ yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya ghavām asi ghopatir eka indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ

translations.griffith: Thine is this world of flocks and herds around thee, which with the eye of Sūrya thou beholdest.  Thou, Indra, art alone the Lord of cattle; may we enjoy the treasure which thou givest.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पते युवम इन्द्रश च वस्वो दिव्यस्येशाथे उत पार्थिवस्य धत्तं रयिं सतुवते कीरये चिद यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: Ye Twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Bṛhaspati, and thou, O Indra.  Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: परो मात्रया तन्व्र वर्धान न ते महित्वम अन्व अश्नुवन्ति उभे ते विद्म रजसी पर्थिव्या विष्णो देव तवम परमस्य वित्से |||
verses.transliteration: paro mātrayā tanvṛ vṛdhāna na te mahitvam anv aśnuvanti ubhe te vidma rajasī pṛthivyā viṣṇo deva tvam paramasya vitse

translations.griffith: MEN come not nigh thy majesty who growest beyond all bound and measure with thy body.  Both thy two regions of the earth, O Viṣṇu, we know: thou God, knowest the highest also.

verses.sanskrit: न ते विष्णो जायमानो न जातो देव महिम्नः परम अन्तम आप उद अस्तभ्ना नाकम रष्वम बर्हन्तं दाधर्थ पराचीं ककुभम पर्थिव्याः |||
verses.transliteration: na te viṣṇo jāyamāno na jāto deva mahimnaḥ param antam āpa ud astabhnā nākam ṛṣvam bṛhantaṃ dādhartha prācīṃ kakubham pṛthivyāḥ

translations.griffith: None who is born or being born, God Viṣṇu, hath reached the utmost limit of thy grandeur.  The vast high vault of heaven hast thou supported, and fixed earth's eastern pinnacle securely.

verses.sanskrit: इरावती धेनुमती हि भूतं सूयवसिनी मनुषे दशस्या वय अस्तभ्ना रोदसी विष्णव एते दाधर्थ पर्थिवीम अभितो मयूखैः |||
verses.transliteration: irāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtaṃ sūyavasinī manuṣe daśasyā vy astabhnā rodasī viṣṇav ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhito mayūkhaiḥ

translations.griffith: Rich in sweet food be ye, and rich in milch-kine, with fertile pastures, fain to do men service.  Both these worlds, Viṣṇu, hast thou stayed asunder, and firmly fixed the earth with pegs around it.

verses.sanskrit: उरुं यज्ञाय चक्रथुर उलोकं जनयन्ता सूर्यम उषासम अग्निम दासस्य चिद वर्षशिप्रस्य माया जघ्नथुर नरा पर्तनाज्येषु |||
verses.transliteration: uruṃ yajñāya cakrathur ulokaṃ janayantā sūryam uṣāsam aghnim dāsasya cid vṛṣaśiprasya māyā jaghnathur narā pṛtanājyeṣu

translations.griffith: Ye have made spacious room for sacrificing by generating Sūrya, Dawn, and Agni.  O Heroes, ye have conquered in your battles even the bull-jawed Dāsa's wiles and magic.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राविष्णू दरंहिताः शम्बरस्य नव पुरो नवतिं च शनथिष्टम शतं वर्चिनः सहस्रं च साकं हथो अप्रत्य असुरस्य वीरान |||
verses.transliteration: indrāviṣṇū dṛṃhitāḥ śambarasya nava puro navatiṃ ca śnathiṣṭam śataṃ varcinaḥ sahasraṃ ca sākaṃ hatho apraty asurasya vīrān

translations.griffith: Ye have destroyed, thou, Indra, and thou Viṣṇu, Śambara's nine-and-ninety fenced castles.  Ye Twain smote down a hundred times a thousand resistless heroes of the royal Varcin.

verses.sanskrit: इयम मनीषा बर्हती बर्हन्तोरुक्रमा तवसा वर्धयन्ती ररे वां सतोमं विदथेषु विष्णो पिन्वतम इषो वर्जनेष्व इन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: iyam manīṣā bṛhatī bṛhantorukramā tavasā vardhayantī rare vāṃ stomaṃ vidatheṣu viṣṇo pinvatam iṣo vṛjaneṣv indra

translations.griffith: This is the lofty hymn of praise, exalting the Lords of Mighty Stride, the strong and lofty.  I laud you in the solemn synods, Viṣṇu: pour ye food on us in our camps, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: वषट ते विष्णव आस आ कर्णोमि तन मे जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट हव्यम वर्धन्तु तवा सुष्टुतयो गिरो मे यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo ghiro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: O Viṣṇu, unto thee my lips cry Vaṣaṭ! Let this mine offering, Sipivista, please thee.  May these my songs of eulogy exalt thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: नू मर्तो दयते सनिष्यन यो विष्णव उरुगायाय दाशत पर यः सत्राचा मनसा यजात एतावन्तं नर्यम आविवासात |||
verses.transliteration: nū marto dayate saniṣyan yo viṣṇava urughāyāya dāśat pra yaḥ satrācā manasā yajāta etāvantaṃ naryam āvivāsāt

translations.griffith: NE’ER doth the man repent, who, seeking profit, bringeth his gift to the far-striding Viṣṇu.  He who adoreth him with all his spirit winneth himself so great a benefactor.

verses.sanskrit: तवं विष्णो सुमतिं विश्वजन्याम अप्रयुताम एवयावो मतिं दाः पर्चो यथा नः सुवितस्य भूरेर अश्वावतः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य रायः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ viṣṇo sumatiṃ viśvajanyām aprayutām evayāvo matiṃ dāḥ parco yathā naḥ suvitasya bhūrer aśvāvataḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Viṣṇu, constant in thy courses, gavest good-will to all men, and a hymn that lasteth,  That thou mightst move us to abundant comfort of very splendid wealth with store of horses.

verses.sanskrit: तरिर देवः पर्थिवीम एष एतां वि चक्रमे शतर्चसम महित्वा पर विष्णुर अस्तु तवसस तवीयान तवेषं हय अस्य सथविरस्य नाम |||
verses.transliteration: trir devaḥ pṛthivīm eṣa etāṃ vi cakrame śatarcasam mahitvā pra viṣṇur astu tavasas tavīyān tveṣaṃ hy asya sthavirasya nāma

translations.griffith: Three times strode forth this God in all his grandeur over this earth bright with a hundred splendours.  Foremost be Viṣṇu, stronger than the strongest: for glorious is his name who lives for ever.

verses.sanskrit: वि चक्रमे पर्थिवीम एष एतां कषेत्राय विष्णुर मनुषे दशस्यन धरुवासो अस्य कीरयो जनास उरुक्षितिं सुजनिमा चकार |||
verses.transliteration: vi cakrame pṛthivīm eṣa etāṃ kṣetrāya viṣṇur manuṣe daśasyan dhruvāso asya kīrayo janāsa urukṣitiṃ sujanimā cakāra

translations.griffith: Over this earth with mighty step strode Viṣṇu, ready to give it for a home to Manu.  In him the humble people trust for safety: he, nobly born, hath made them spacious dwellings.

verses.sanskrit: पर तत ते अद्य शिपिविष्ट नामार्यः शंसामि वयुनानि विद्वान तं तवा गर्णामि तवसम अतव्यान कषयन्तम अस्य रजसः पराके |||
verses.transliteration: pra tat te adya śipiviṣṭa nāmāryaḥ śaṃsāmi vayunāni vidvān taṃ tvā ghṛṇāmi tavasam atavyān kṣayantam asya rajasaḥ parāke

translations.griffith: To-day I laud this name, O gipivista, I, skilled in rules, the name of thee the Noble.  Yea, I the poor and weak praise thee the Mighty who dwellest in the realm beyond this region.

verses.sanskrit: किम इत ते विष्णो परिचक्ष्यम भूत पर यद ववक्षे शिपिविष्टो अस्मि मा वर्पो अस्मद अप गूह एतद यद अन्यरूपः समिथे बभूथ |||
verses.transliteration: kim it te viṣṇo paricakṣyam bhūt pra yad vavakṣe śipiviṣṭo asmi mā varpo asmad apa ghūha etad yad anyarūpaḥ samithe babhūtha

translations.griffith: What was there to be blamed in thee, O Viṣṇu, when thou declaredst, I am Sipivista?  Hide not this form from us, nor keep it secret, since thou didst wear another shape in battle.

verses.sanskrit: वषट ते विष्णव आस आ कर्णोमि तन मे जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट हव्यम वर्धन्तु तवा सुष्टुतयो गिरो मे यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo ghiro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: O Viṣṇu, unto thee my lips cry Vaṣaṭ! Let this mine offering, Sipivista, please thee.  May these my songs of eulogy exalt thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: तिस्रो वाचः पर वद जयोतिरग्रा या एतद दुह्रे मधुदोघम ऊधः स वत्सं कर्ण्वन गर्भम ओषधीनां सद्यो जातो वर्षभो रोरवीति |||
verses.transliteration: tisro vācaḥ pra vada jyotiraghrā yā etad duhre madhudogham ūdhaḥ sa vatsaṃ kṛṇvan gharbham oṣadhīnāṃ sadyo jāto vṛṣabho roravīti

translations.griffith: SPEAK forth three words, the words which light precedeth, which milk this udder that produceth nectar.  Quickly made manifest, the Bull hath bellowed, engendering the germ of plants, the Infant.

verses.sanskrit: यो वर्धन ओषधीनां यो अपां यो विश्वस्य जगतो देव ईशे स तरिधातु शरणं शर्म यंसत तरिवर्तु जयोतिः सवभिष्ट्य अस्मे |||
verses.transliteration: yo vardhana oṣadhīnāṃ yo apāṃ yo viśvasya jaghato deva īśe sa tridhātu śaraṇaṃ śarma yaṃsat trivartu jyotiḥ svabhiṣṭy asme

translations.griffith: Giver of growth to plants, the God who ruleth over the waters and all moving creatures,  Vouchsafe us triple shelter for our refuge, and threefold light to succour and befriend us.

verses.sanskrit: सतरीर उ तवद भवति सूत उ तवद यथावशं तन्वं चक्र एषः पितुः पयः परति गर्भ्णाति माता तेन पिता वर्धते तेन पुत्रः |||
verses.transliteration: starīr u tvad bhavati sūta u tvad yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ cakra eṣaḥ pituḥ payaḥ prati ghṛbhṇāti mātā tena pitā vardhate tena putraḥ

translations.griffith: Now he is sterile, now begetteth offspring, even as he willeth doth he change his figure.  The Father's genial flow bedews the Mother; therewith the Sire, therewith the son is nourished.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मिन विश्वानि भुवनानि तस्थुस तिस्रो दयावस तरेधा सस्रुर आपः तरयः कोशास उपसेचनासो मध्व शचोतन्त्य अभितो विरप्शम |||
verses.transliteration: yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthus tisro dyāvas tredhā sasrur āpaḥ trayaḥ kośāsa upasecanāso madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam

translations.griffith: In him all living creatures have their being, and the three heavens with triply-flowing waters.  Three reservoirs that sprinkle down their treasure shed their sweet streams around him with a murmur.

verses.sanskrit: इदं वचः पर्जन्याय सवराजे हर्दो अस्त्व अन्तरं तज जुजोषत मयोभुवो वर्ष्टयः सन्त्व अस्मे सुपिप्पला ओषधीर देवगोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ vacaḥ parjanyāya svarāje hṛdo astv antaraṃ taj jujoṣat mayobhuvo vṛṣṭayaḥ santv asme supippalā oṣadhīr devaghopāḥ

translations.griffith: May this my song to Sovran Lord Parjanya come near unto his heart and give him pleasure.  May we obtain the showers that bring enjoyment, and God-protected plants with goodly fruitage.

verses.sanskrit: स रेतोधा वर्षभः शश्वतीनां तस्मिन्न आत्मा जगतस तस्थुषश च तन म रतम पातु शतशारदाय यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः |||
verses.transliteration: sa retodhā vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnāṃ tasminn ātmā jaghatas tasthuṣaś ca tan ma ṛtam pātu śataśāradāya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ

translations.griffith: He is the Bull of all, and their impregner: he holds the life of all things fixed and moving.  May this rite save me till my hundredth autumn. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

verses.sanskrit: पर्जन्याय पर गायत दिवस पुत्राय मीळ्हुषे स नो यवसमिछतु |||
verses.transliteration: parjanyāya pra ghāyata divas putrāya mīḷhuṣe sa no yavasamichatu

translations.griffith: SING forth and laud Parjanya, son of Heaven, who sends the gift of rain  May he provide our pasturage.

verses.sanskrit: यो गर्भमोषधीनां गवां कर्णोत्यर्वताम पर्जन्यःपुरुषीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: yo gharbhamoṣadhīnāṃ ghavāṃ kṛṇotyarvatām parjanyaḥpuruṣīṇām

translations.griffith: Parjanya is the God who forms in kine, in mares, in plants of earth,  And womankind, the germ of life.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मा इदास्ये हविर्जुहोता मधुमत्तमम इळां नः संयतं करत |||
verses.transliteration: tasmā idāsye havirjuhotā madhumattamam iḷāṃ naḥ saṃyataṃ karat

translations.griffith: Offer and pour into his mouth oblation rich in savoury juice:  May he for ever give us food.

verses.sanskrit: संवत्सरं शशयाना बराह्मणा वरतचारिणः वाचं पर्जन्यजिन्वितां पर मण्डूका अवादिषुः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃvatsaraṃ śaśayānā brāhmaṇā vratacāriṇaḥ vācaṃ parjanyajinvitāṃ pra maṇḍūkā avādiṣuḥ

translations.griffith: THEY who lay quiet for a year, the Brahmans who fulfil their vows,  The Frogs have lifted up their voice, the voice Parjanya hath inspired.

verses.sanskrit: दिव्या आपो अभि यदेनमायन दर्तिं न शुष्कं सरसी शयानम गवामह न मायुर्वत्सिनीनां मण्दूकानां वग्नुरत्रा समेति |||
verses.transliteration: divyā āpo abhi yadenamāyan dṛtiṃ na śuṣkaṃ sarasī śayānam ghavāmaha na māyurvatsinīnāṃ maṇdūkānāṃ vaghnuratrā sameti

translations.griffith: What time on these, as on a dry skin lying in the pool's bed, the floods of heaven descended,  The music of the Frogs comes forth in concert like the cows lowing with their calves beside them.

verses.sanskrit: यदीमेनानुशतो अभ्यवर्षीत तर्ष्यावतः पराव्र्ष्यागतायाम अख्खलीक्र्त्या पितरं न पुत्रो अन्यो अन्यमुप वदन्तमेति |||
verses.transliteration: yadīmenānuśato abhyavarṣīt tṛṣyāvataḥ prāvṛṣyāghatāyām akhkhalīkṛtyā pitaraṃ na putro anyo anyamupa vadantameti

translations.griffith: When at the coming of the Rains the water has poured upon them as they yearned and thirsted,  One seeks another as he talks and greets him with cries of pleasure as a son his father.

verses.sanskrit: अन्यो अन्यमनु गर्भ्णात्येनोरपां परसर्गे यदमन्दिषाताम मण्डूको यदभिव्र्ष्टः कनिष्कन पर्ष्निः सम्प्र्ङकते हरितेन वाचम |||
verses.transliteration: anyo anyamanu ghṛbhṇātyenorapāṃ prasarghe yadamandiṣātām maṇḍūko yadabhivṛṣṭaḥ kaniṣkan pṛṣniḥ sampṛṅkte haritena vācam

translations.griffith: Each of these twain receives the other kindly, while they are revelling in the flow of waters,  When the Frog moistened by the rain springs forward, and Green and Spotty both combine their voices.

verses.sanskrit: यदेषामन्यो अन्यस्य वाचं शाक्तस्येव वदति शिक्षमाणः सर्वं तदेषां सम्र्धेव पर्व यत सुवाचो वदथनाध्यप्सु |||
verses.transliteration: yadeṣāmanyo anyasya vācaṃ śāktasyeva vadati śikṣamāṇaḥ sarvaṃ tadeṣāṃ samṛdheva parva yat suvāco vadathanādhyapsu

translations.griffith: When one of these repeats the other's language, as he who learns the lesson of the teacher,  Your every limb seems to be growing larger as ye converse with eloquence on the waters.

verses.sanskrit: गोमायुरेको अजमायुरेकः पर्श्निरेको हरित एक एषाम समानं नाम बिभ्रतो विरूपाः पुरुत्रा वाचं पिपिशुर्वदन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: ghomāyureko ajamāyurekaḥ pṛśnireko harita eka eṣām samānaṃ nāma bibhrato virūpāḥ purutrā vācaṃ pipiśurvadantaḥ

translations.griffith: Onc is Cow-bellow and Goat-bleat the other, one Frog is Green and one of them is Spotty.  They bear one common name, and yet they vary, and, talking, modulate the voice diversely.

verses.sanskrit: बराह्मणासो अतिरात्रे न सोमे सरो न पूर्णमभितो वदन्तः संवत्सरस्य तदहः परि षठ यन मण्डूकाः पराव्र्षीणं बभूव |||
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇāso atirātre na some saro na pūrṇamabhito vadantaḥ saṃvatsarasya tadahaḥ pari ṣṭha yan maṇḍūkāḥ prāvṛṣīṇaṃ babhūva

translations.griffith: As Brahmans, sitting round the brimful vessel, talk at the Soma-rite of Atiratra,  So, Frogs, ye gather round the pool to honour this day of all the year, the first of Rain-time.

verses.sanskrit: बराह्मणासः सोमिनो वाचमक्रत बरह्म कर्ण्वन्तः परिवत्सरीणम अध्वर्यवो घर्मिणः सिष्विदाना आविर्भवन्ति गुह्या न के चित |||
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇāsaḥ somino vācamakrata brahma kṛṇvantaḥ parivatsarīṇam adhvaryavo gharmiṇaḥ siṣvidānā āvirbhavanti ghuhyā na ke cit

translations.griffith: These Brahmans with the Soma juice, performing their year-long rite, have lifted up their voices;  And these Adhvaryus, sweating with their kettles, come forth and show themselves, and none are hidden.

verses.sanskrit: देवहितिं जुगुपुर्द्वादशस्य रतुं नरो न पर मिनन्त्येते संवत्सरे पराव्र्ष्यागतायां तप्ता घर्मा अश्नुवते विसर्गम |||
verses.transliteration: devahitiṃ jughupurdvādaśasya ṛtuṃ naro na pra minantyete saṃvatsare prāvṛṣyāghatāyāṃ taptā gharmā aśnuvate visargham

translations.griffith: They keep the twelve month's God-appointed order, and never do the men neglect the season.  Soon as the Rain-time in the year returneth, these who were heated kettles gain their freedom.

verses.sanskrit: गोमायुरदादजमायुरदात पर्श्निरदाद धरितो नो वसूनि गवां मण्डूका ददतः शतानि सहस्रसावे पर तिरन्त आयुः |||
verses.transliteration: ghomāyuradādajamāyuradāt pṛśniradād dharito no vasūni ghavāṃ maṇḍūkā dadataḥ śatāni sahasrasāve pra tiranta āyuḥ

translations.griffith: Cow-bellow and Goat-bleat have granted riches, and Green and Spotty have vouchsafed us treasure.  The Frogs who give us cows in hundreds lengthen our lives in this most fertilizing season.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा तपतं रक्ष उब्जतं नयर्पयतं वर्षणा तमोव्र्धः परा सर्णीतमचितो नयोषतं हतं नुदेथां नि शिशीतमत्रिणः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāsomā tapataṃ rakṣa ubjataṃ nyarpayataṃ vṛṣaṇā tamovṛdhaḥ parā sṛṇītamacito nyoṣataṃ hataṃ nudethāṃ ni śiśītamatriṇaḥ

translations.griffith: INDRA and Soma, burn, destroy the demon foe, send downward, O ye Bulls, those who add gloom to gloom.  Annihilate the fools, slay them and burn them up: chase them away from us, pierce the voracious ones.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा समघशंसमभ्यघं तपुर्ययस्तु चरुरग्निवानिव बरह्मद्विषे करव्यादे घोरचक्षसे दवेषो धत्तमनवायं किमीदिने |||
verses.transliteration: indrāsomā samaghaśaṃsamabhyaghaṃ tapuryayastu caruraghnivāniva brahmadviṣe kravyāde ghoracakṣase dveṣo dhattamanavāyaṃ kimīdine

translations.griffith: Indra and Soma, let sin round the wicked boil like as a caldron set amid the flames of fire.  Against the foe of prayer, devourer of raw flesh, the vile fiend fierce of eye, keep ye perpetual hate.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा दुष्क्र्तो वव्रे अन्तरनारम्भणे तमसि पर विध्यतम यथा नातः पुनरेकश्चनोदयत तद वामस्तु सहसे मन्युमच्छवः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāsomā duṣkṛto vavre antaranārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam yathā nātaḥ punarekaścanodayat tad vāmastu sahase manyumacchavaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra and Soma, plunge the wicked in the depth, yea, cast them into darkness that hath no support,  So that not one of them may ever thence return: so may your wrathful might prevail and conquer them.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा वर्तयतं दिवो वधं सं पर्थिव्या अघशंसाय तर्हणम उत तक्षतं सवर्यं पर्वतेभ्यो येन रक्षो वाव्र्धानं निजूर्वथः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divo vadhaṃ saṃ pṛthivyā aghaśaṃsāya tarhaṇam ut takṣataṃ svaryaṃ parvatebhyo yena rakṣo vāvṛdhānaṃ nijūrvathaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra and Soma, hurl your deadly crushing bolt down on the wicked fiend from heaven and from the earth.  Yea, forge out of the mountains your celestial dart wherewith ye burn to death the waxing demon race.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा वर्तयतं दिवस पर्यग्नितप्तेभिर्युवमश्महन्मभिः तपुर्वधेभिरजरेभिरत्रिणो नि पर्शाने विध्यतं यन्तु निस्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divas paryaghnitaptebhiryuvamaśmahanmabhiḥ tapurvadhebhirajarebhiratriṇo ni parśāne vidhyataṃ yantu nisvaram

translations.griffith: Indra and Soma, cast ye downward out of heaven your deadly darts of stone burning with fiery flame,  Eternal, scorching darts; plunge the voracious ones within the depth, and let them sink without a sound.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा परि वां भूतु विश्वत इयं मतिः कक्ष्याश्वेववाजिना यां वां होत्रां परिहिनोमि मेधयेमा बरह्माणि नर्पतीव जिन्वतम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāsomā pari vāṃ bhūtu viśvata iyaṃ matiḥ kakṣyāśvevavājinā yāṃ vāṃ hotrāṃ parihinomi medhayemā brahmāṇi nṛpatīva jinvatam

translations.griffith: Indra and Soma, let this hymn control you both, even as the girth encompasses two vigorous steeds-  The song of praise which I with wisdom offer you: do ye, as Lords of men, animate these my prayers.

verses.sanskrit: परति समरेथां तुजयद्भिरेवैर्हतं दरुहो रक्षसो भङगुरावतः इन्द्रासोमा दुष्क्र्ते मा सुगं भूद यो नः कदाचिदभिदासति दरुहा |||
verses.transliteration: prati smarethāṃ tujayadbhirevairhataṃ druho rakṣaso bhaṅghurāvataḥ indrāsomā duṣkṛte mā sughaṃ bhūd yo naḥ kadācidabhidāsati druhā

translations.griffith: In your impetuous manner think ye both thereon: destroy these evil beings, slay the treacherous fiends.  Indra and Soma, let the wicked have no bliss who evermore assails us with malignity.

verses.sanskrit: यो मा पाकेन मनसा चरन्तमभिचष्टे अन्र्तेभिर्वचोभिः आप इव काशिना संग्र्भीता असन्नस्त्वासत इन्द्र वक्ता |||
verses.transliteration: yo mā pākena manasā carantamabhicaṣṭe anṛtebhirvacobhiḥ āpa iva kāśinā saṃghṛbhītā asannastvāsata indra vaktā

translations.griffith: Whoso accuses me with words of falsehood when I pursue my way with guileless spirit,  May he, the speaker of untruth, be, Indra, like water which the hollowed hand compresses.

verses.sanskrit: ये पाकशंसं विहरन्त एवैर्ये वा भद्रं दूषयन्ति सवधाभिः अहये वा तान परददातु सोम आ वा दधातु निरतेरुपस्थे |||
verses.transliteration: ye pākaśaṃsaṃ viharanta evairye vā bhadraṃ dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ ahaye vā tān pradadātu soma ā vā dadhātu nirterupasthe

translations.griffith: Those who destroy, as is their wont, the simple, and with their evil natures barm the righteous,  May Soma give them over to the serpent, or to the lap of Nirrti consign them.

verses.sanskrit: यो नो रसं दिप्सति पित्वो अग्ने यो अश्वानां यो गवां यस्तनूनाम रिपु सतेन सतेयक्र्द दभ्रमेतु नि ष हीयतान्तन्वा तना च |||
verses.transliteration: yo no rasaṃ dipsati pitvo aghne yo aśvānāṃ yo ghavāṃ yastanūnām ripu stena steyakṛd dabhrametu ni ṣa hīyatāntanvā tanā ca

translations.griffith: The fiend, O Agni, who designs to injure the essence of our food, kine, steeds, or bodies,  May he, the adversary, thief, and robber, sink to destruction, both himself and offipring.

verses.sanskrit: परः सो अस्तु तन्वा तना च तिस्रः पर्थिवीरधो अस्तु विश्वाः परति शुष्यतु यशो अस्य देवा यो नो दिवा दिप्सति यश्च नक्तम |||
verses.transliteration: paraḥ so astu tanvā tanā ca tisraḥ pṛthivīradho astu viśvāḥ prati śuṣyatu yaśo asya devā yo no divā dipsati yaśca naktam

translations.griffith: May he be swept away, himself and children: may all the three earths press him down beneath them.  May his fair glory, O ye Gods, be blighted, who in the day or night would fain destroy us.

verses.sanskrit: सुविज्ञानं चिकितुषे जनाय सच्चासच्च वचसी पस्प्र्धाते तयोर्यत सत्यं यतरद रजीयस्तदित सोमो.अवति हन्त्यासत |||
verses.transliteration: suvijñānaṃ cikituṣe janāya saccāsacca vacasī paspṛdhāte tayoryat satyaṃ yatarad ṛjīyastadit somo.avati hantyāsat

translations.griffith: The prudent finds it easy to distinguish the true and false: their words oppose each other.  Of these two that which is the true and honest, Soma protects, and brings the false to nothing.

verses.sanskrit: ना वा उ सोमो वर्जिनं हिनोति न कषत्रियं मिथुया धारयन्तम हन्ति रक्षो हन्त्यासद वदन्तमुभाविन्द्रस्य परसितौ शयाते |||
verses.transliteration: nā vā u somo vṛjinaṃ hinoti na kṣatriyaṃ mithuyā dhārayantam hanti rakṣo hantyāsad vadantamubhāvindrasya prasitau śayāte

translations.griffith: Never doth Soma aid and guide the wicked or him who falsely claims the Warrior's title.  He slays the fiend and him who speaks untruly: both lie entangled in the noose of Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यदि वाहमन्र्तदेव आस मोघं वा देवानप्यूहे अग्ने किमस्मभ्यं जातवेदो हर्णीषे दरोघवाचस्ते निरथं सचन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: yadi vāhamanṛtadeva āsa moghaṃ vā devānapyūhe aghne kimasmabhyaṃ jātavedo hṛṇīṣe droghavācaste nirthaṃ sacantām

translations.griffith: As if I worshipped deities of falsehood, or thought vain thoughts about the Gods, O Agni.  Why art thou angry with us, Jātavedas? Destruction fall on those who lie against thee!

verses.sanskrit: अद्या मुरीय यदि यातुधानो अस्मि यदि वायुस्ततप पूरुषस्य अधा स वीरैर्दशभिर्वि यूया यो मा मोघं यातुधानेत्याह |||
verses.transliteration: adyā murīya yadi yātudhāno asmi yadi vāyustatapa pūruṣasya adhā sa vīrairdaśabhirvi yūyā yo mā moghaṃ yātudhānetyāha

translations.griffith: So may I die this day if I have harassed any man's life or if I be a demon.  Yea, may he lose all his ten sons together who with false tongue hath called me Yātudhāna.

verses.sanskrit: यो मायातुं यातुधानेत्याह यो वा रक्षाः शुचिरस्मीत्याह इन्द्रस्तं हन्तु महता वधेन विश्वस्य जन्तोरधमस पदीष्ट |||
verses.transliteration: yo māyātuṃ yātudhānetyāha yo vā rakṣāḥ śucirasmītyāha indrastaṃ hantu mahatā vadhena viśvasya jantoradhamas padīṣṭa

translations.griffith: May Indra slay him with a mighty weapon, and let the vilest of all creatures perish,  The fiend who says that he is pure, who calls me a demon though devoid of demon nature.

verses.sanskrit: पर या जिगाति खर्गलेव नक्तमप दरुहा तन्वं गूहमाना वव्राननन्तानव सा पदीष्ट गरावाणो घनन्तु रक्षस उपब्दैः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yā jighāti kharghaleva naktamapa druhā tanvaṃ ghūhamānā vavrānanantānava sā padīṣṭa ghrāvāṇo ghnantu rakṣasa upabdaiḥ

translations.griffith: She too who wanders like an owl at night-time, hiding her body in her guile and malice,  May she fall downward into endless caverns. May press-stones with loud ring destroy the demons.

verses.sanskrit: वि तिष्ठध्वं मरुतो विक्ष्विछत गर्भायत रक्षसः सं पिनष्टन वयो ये भूत्वी पतयन्ति नक्तभिर्ये वा रिपो दधिरे देवे अध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: vi tiṣṭhadhvaṃ maruto vikṣvichata ghṛbhāyata rakṣasaḥ saṃ pinaṣṭana vayo ye bhūtvī patayanti naktabhirye vā ripo dadhire deve adhvare

translations.griffith: Spread out, ye Maruts, search among the people: seize ye and grind the Rākṣasas to pieces,  Who fly abroad, transformed to birds, at night-time, or sully and pollute our holy worship.

verses.sanskrit: पर वर्तय दिवो अश्मानमिन्द्र सोमशितं मघवन सं शिशाधि पराक्तादपाक्तादधरादुदक्तादभि जहि रक्षसःपर्वतेन |||
verses.transliteration: pra vartaya divo aśmānamindra somaśitaṃ maghavan saṃ śiśādhi prāktādapāktādadharādudaktādabhi jahi rakṣasaḥparvatena

translations.griffith: Hurl down from heaven thy bolt of stone, O Indra: sharpen it, Maghavan, made keen by Soma.  Forward, behind, and from above and under, smite down the demons with thy rocky weapon.

verses.sanskrit: एत उ तये पतयन्ति शवयातव इन्द्रं दिप्सन्ति दिप्सवो.अदाभ्यम शिशीते शक्रः पिशुनेभ्यो वधं नूनं सर्जदशनिं यातुमद्भ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: eta u tye patayanti śvayātava indraṃ dipsanti dipsavo.adābhyam śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyo vadhaṃ nūnaṃ sṛjadaśaniṃ yātumadbhyaḥ

translations.griffith: They fly, the demon dogs, and, bent on mischief, fain would they harm indomitable Indra.  Śakra makes sharp his weapon for the wicked: now, let him cast his bolt at fiendish wizards.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो यातूनामभवत पराशरो हविर्मथीनामभ्याविवासताम अभीदु शक्रः परशुर्यथा वनं पात्रेव भिन्दन सत एति रक्षसः |||
verses.transliteration: indro yātūnāmabhavat parāśaro havirmathīnāmabhyāvivāsatām abhīdu śakraḥ paraśuryathā vanaṃ pātreva bhindan sata eti rakṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra hath ever been the fiends’ destroyer who spoil oblations of the Gods’ invokers:  Yea, Śakra, like an axe that  splits  the timber, attacks and smashes them like earthen vessels.

verses.sanskrit: उलूकयातुं शुशुलूकयातुं जहि शवयातुमुत कोकयातुम सुपर्णयातुमुत गर्ध्रयातुं दर्षदेव पर मर्ण रक्ष इन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: ulūkayātuṃ śuśulūkayātuṃ jahi śvayātumuta kokayātum suparṇayātumuta ghṛdhrayātuṃ dṛṣadeva pra mṛṇa rakṣa indra

translations.griffith: Destroy the fiend shaped like an owl or owlet, destroy him in the form of dog or cuckoo.  Destroy him shaped as eagle or as vulture as with a stone, O Indra, crush the demon.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो रक्षो अभि नड यातुमावतामपोछतु मिथुना या किमीदिना पर्थिवी नः पार्थिवात पात्वंहसो.अन्तरिक्षं दिव्यात पात्वस्मान |||
verses.transliteration: mā no rakṣo abhi naḍ yātumāvatāmapochatu mithunā yā kimīdinā pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātvaṃhaso.antarikṣaṃ divyāt pātvasmān

translations.griffith: Let not the fiend of witchcraft-workers reach us: may Dawn drive off the couples of Kimīdins.  Earth keep us safe from earthly woe and trouble: from grief that comes from heaven mid-air preserve us.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र जहि पुमांसं यातुधानमुत सत्रियं मायया शाशदानाम विग्रीवासो मूरदेवा रदन्तु मा ते दर्शं सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: indra jahi pumāṃsaṃ yātudhānamuta striyaṃ māyayā śāśadānām vighrīvāso mūradevā ṛdantu mā te dṛśaṃ sūryamuccarantam

translations.griffith: Slay the male demon, Indra! slay the female, joying and triumphing in arts of magic.  Let the fools' gods with bent necks fall and perish, and see no more the Sun when he arises.

verses.sanskrit: परति चक्ष्व वि चक्ष्वेन्द्रश्च सोम जाग्र्तम रक्षोभ्यो वधमस्यतमशनिं यातुमद्भ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: prati cakṣva vi cakṣvendraśca soma jāghṛtam rakṣobhyo vadhamasyatamaśaniṃ yātumadbhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Look each one hither, look around Indra and Soma, watch ye well.
